jobDescription: Honeywell Building Technologies (HBT) Sales Rotational Program – Direct Sales The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Honeywell is actively changing how the world works through innovation across aerospace and defense, building technologies, safety and productivity solutions, and performance materials. Our 110,000 employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries in almost 1,000 locations around the world. Check out Honeywell.com/future to learn how we’re making the future, from quantum computing to flying taxis. Are you ready to help us make the future? Position Overview Have a voice in the global marketplace, with guidance and mentoring that will help you become a professional who delivers business results. In this 6-month sales rotational program, you will gain experience across multiple rotations including Customer Experience / Inside Sales, Customer Marketing, Offering Management and Outside Sales. The Sales Rotational Program will include training opportunities and the ability to network and learn from other program participants as well as sales leaders across the organization. You’ll gain a broad range of experience designed to fast track your leadership role. **This position is available in multiple locations across the United States** Training will be based in Atlanta, GA Final Sales Territory assignment will not be determined until month 3-6 You Must Have Actively pursuing a bachelor’s degree (preferably in Engineering, Professional Sales, Business, or other Technology Pursuit) at an accredited college or university Must attain bachelor’s degree between December 2022 and June 2023 Applicants for employment for this position must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Honeywell We Value Demonstrated leadership ability – able to work effectively with and influence others toward project goals Strong business acumen with historical customer experience. A competitive spirit Ability to take initiative and work with limited direction. A problem solver Strong interpersonal skills – able to successfully cooperate and influence those in other functions in a matrix organization Strong project management, communications, and presentation skills Ability to re-locate to Atlanta, GA (or another HBT hub location) for the rotations Some travel required Additional Information JOB ID: HRD902987 Category: Sales Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Sparta Systems, a Honeywell company, is a leading provider of TrackWise® enterprise QMS software and TrackWise Digital®, a next-generation, cloud and digital QMS SaaS platform. Sparta’s TrackWise Digital combined with Honeywell’s software solutions, batch automation, and data integration capabilities form an integrated life sciences manufacturing digital eco-system that enables greater efficiency and agility while helping achieve quality system compliance with reduced risk. The combination of Sparta Systems and Honeywell brings together Sparta Systems’ quality management leadership with over 100 years of software and industrial expertise from Honeywell. Together, Sparta and Honeywell will shape the future of digital quality and operational excellence for the life sciences industry. For more information, please visit https://www.spartasystems.com. Supporting efficiently complex situations Additional Information JOB ID: HRD173643 Category: Finance Location: 2000 Waterview Drive, Suite 300,Hamilton,New Jersey,08691,United States Nonexempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. jobTitle: Advanced Cyber Security Researcher (Defense & Space) - Penetration Testing (Hybrid)
jobDescription: Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Honeywell Global Security (HGS) business believes in integrating security into all aspects of our business to protect the people, processes, and assets by which Honeywell achieves its greater mission. Advancements in technology, contractual and regulatory requirements, emerging threats, and Honeywell's growth worldwide continue to challenge all of us to ensure everything we do in business is secure. The Advanced Cyber Security Researcher reports to the Product Security Assurance Leader and will be responsible for assessing and evaluating the security posture of a variety of Honeywell Products and partner technologies. This role will be responsible for security services delivery, which may include use of application, network, firmware, mobile, hardware security toolsets, detection of security defects, and remediation consultation of those weaknesses. Our services support the identification of potential attack techniques and serve as the foundation for continuously improving the product development lifecycle. In this key position, the Advanced Cyber Security Researcher will… Collaborate as an Individual Contributor with the Product Security Assurance Team Deliver Security / Penetration Testing across divers Honeywell products, solutions and services Assist in the development of modular, repeatable, effective Security Testing processes Partner with Tools and Technology Team to select, implement, develop, and automate testing with appropriate tools. Work with cross functional teams to develop remediation suggestions Report product security observations using the Honeywell standardized reporting structure YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors degree 3 years demonstrated experience in penetration testing, red teaming or offensive operations. Must be a US Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance. WE VALUE Exposure to security testing within the appropriate domain Understanding of application protocols, development, and common attack vectors. Good cybersecurity capabilities and strong software engineering skills Experience with pentest tools and frameworks such as: Burp Suite, IDA Pro, GHidra, Kali, OWASP, Metasploit. Scripting experience in Python, Powershell and Bash preferred. Experience working with other languages such as C, C++, Java, .NET or javascript. Basic understanding of security by design principles and architecture level security concepts Up to date knowledge of current and emerging security threats and techniques for exploiting security vulnerabilities Effective oral and written communication skills Good interpersonal skills Demonstrated project management skills. Relevant Cyber Security certifications: CEH, OSCP, GPEN Experience and knowledge of penetration testing methodologies and tools Additional Information JOB ID: HRD175482 Category: Engineering Location: 13350 US Hwy 19 N,Clearwater,Florida,33764,United States Exempt Engineering (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell is charging into the Industrial IoT revolution with the establishment of Honeywell Connected Enterprise (HCE), building on our heritage of invention and deep, on-the-ground industry expertise. HCE is the leading industrial disruptor, building and connecting software solutions to streamline and centralize the assets, people and processes that help our customers make smarter, more accurate business decisions. Moving at the speed of software, we are creating, innovating and delivering solutions fast, challenging the way things have always been done, piloting new ways for all of us to work, and expecting our successes to set new standards for our customers and for Honeywell. In this key position, the Advanced Data Engineer will… Build relationships with leadership and deliver contemporary analytics solutions for all Honeywell business groups and functions. Develop solutions on various platforms via Databricks, Hive, PostgreSQL, etc. Build products from the idea phase through launch and beyond Work with Big Data, IoT data, SQL, Azure, AWS, and are aware of exemplary acronyms Work with scrum masters, product owners, data architects, data engineers, data scientists and DevOps Identify and implement process improvements and automate processes where possible Keep an eye on scalability, optimization, and processes YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university 5 years of data engineering experience. 3 years of hands-on experience working with Data using tools like: Spark, Python, or Hive. 2 years of experience using cloud-based deployments on Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud. 2 years of experience in writing complex SQL statements Due to US export laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. WE VALUE Preferred experience working with Databricks. 6-8 years of data engineering experience Experience development and deployment of applications to process large amounts of data - structured and unstructured including streaming real-time data (Spark, Pyspark). Experience in building advanced analytics solutions with data from enterprise systems like ERPs (SAP, Oracle, etc.), RDBMS, CRMs, Marketing & Logistics tools etc. Knowledge working with at least one NoSQL system (Neo4J, MongoDB, etc.) and schema design Experience working with in Agile Methodologies and Scrum Experience using Databricks, Cloudera, Hortonworks and/or Cloud (AWS EMR, Azure Data Lake Storage: (ADLS Gen2) based Hadoop distributions. Experience with one or more visualization software such as Tableau and Power BI Experience working with remote and global teams and cross team collaboration Good understanding of branching, build, deployment, CI/CD methodologies such as Octopus and Bamboo Database performance management Understanding of best-in-class model and data configuration and development processes "Don’t meet every single requirement? Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The Future Is What You Make It. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. UOP, a Honeywell company headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a leading international licensor of processing technology and supplier of engineering services, catalysts and adsorbents, equipment, specialty materials and digital solutions for the global refining, gas processing and petrochemical industries. With more than a century of leadership in hydrocarbon processing technologies, UOP has led six revolutions in technology that transformed our industry. For more information visit www.uop.com. The Advanced Design Engineer - Heat Transfer will collaborate with a team that applies its expertise and knowledge across Honeywell UOP's broad portfolio of process technologies in refining, petrochemicals, gas, and renewables areas. This role will work as part of a multidiscipline team with process, equipment, service, project management, customers, contractors, and vendors to execute projects. The Advanced Design Engineer - Heat Transfer will generate designs, produce specifications, evaluate revamps, troubleshoot operations, and communicate results. This role will utilize their heat exchanger expertise to provide UOP and its customers knowledge of the design, specification, operation, and capabilities of heat exchangers. In addition, the role will develop the product designs necessary to drive product improvement and will be integral in securing present and future business by consistently meeting or exceeding Voice of Customer requirements. Key Responsibilities Provide heat exchanger equipment selection, design, and modeling expertise Create specifications, perform design optimizations, troubleshoot field operations, and present technical solutions. Contribute to internal design standards, calculation tools, and documentation to improve project execution efficiency Learn from industry leading experts and contribute to process and equipment advancements to enhance UOP’s world-leading process technology. Ability to travel up to 10% world-wide, typically of short duration (generally between a few days and two weeks). You Must Have Bachelors degree in Engineering 5+ years experience We Value Engineering degree in Mechanical or Chemical engineering Significant experience in the design and selection of heat exchangers including experience with HTRI or similar exchanger design software Strong desire to learn new technologies and further develop technical skills and expertise Experience in the design of equipment for refinery and petrochemical plants Working knowledge of relevant codes and standards (e.g. API, ASME, TEMA) Demonstrated ability to effectively apply technical expertise to a range of engineering and field support activities Demonstrated ability to multi-task effectively to manage priorities and deliver on multiple projects The ability to work both independently and as part of a team Experience working with diverse, global teams Strong verbal and written communication skills UOP102020 Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182533 Category: Engineering Location: 50 E Algonquin Rd,Des Plaines,Illinois,60017-5016,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

jobTitle: Advanced Electrical Engineer - Power Systems, Analog, Digital * SIGN ON BONUS AVAILABLE*
jobDescription: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. Honeywell Space is a worldwide leader in the development of momentum control products for satellites that enable cell phone, globe positioning and satellite earth imagery. If you want to be part of a high performing team where ultra-high reliability electromechanical devices are designed and manufactured, Honeywell Space is your destination. Honeywell has a 40-year heritage of successful Reaction Wheel Assemblies and Control Moment Gyroscopes that are the heart of the satellite stability and position control. Working at Honeywell isn't just about developing cool things. That's why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. We offer amazing opportunities for career growth with a world-class team of diverse experts. Our benefits are industry leading with a premier 401k match, parental leave, flexible 3/2 work from home schedule, unlimited PTO and more. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell Space is a worldwide leader in the development of momentum control products for satellites that enable cell phone, global positioning, and satellite earth imagery. If you want to be part of a high performing team where ultra-high reliability electromechanical devices are designed and manufactured, Honeywell Space is your destination. Honeywell has a 40 year heritage of successful Reaction Wheel Assemblies and Control Moment Gyroscopes that are the heart of satellite stability and position control. Key Responsibilities Design, modify, and test analog, digital, and power electronic circuits and author related technical documentation. Design and support hardware for space application, supporting ongoing production and new business activities related to Honeywell's Momentum Controls Systems. Collaborate with program management and key customers to explain technical approaches and project status. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The Future Is What You Make It. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Honeywell is a world leader in measuring and improving the flow of natural gas, electricity and water in more than 130 countries. With one of the most extensive installed revenue measurement bases in the world and more than 200 million metering modules deployed over the course of the last 10 years alone, Honeywell is enabling the vital connections between technology and Earth’s energy and resources for our global community. Our diverse portfolio of products and solutions is used to accurately and reliably measure gas, electricity and water consumption as well as enable energy efficiency and conservation. Our Smart Grid Solutions Division, located in Raleigh, NC engineers award-winning Smart Metering systems and Smart Grid system solutions that help utilities improve their revenue cycle services, customer service, delivery reliability, and enable efficient energy usage by utility consumers through demand response and in home networking capabilities. Honeywell’s EnergyAxis advanced metering infrastructure (AMI) system is deployed with more than 100 utilities around the world, with 4.5 million meters online in North America, Central America, Caribbean and the Pacific Rim. Key Responsibilities Will develop firmware for microcontrollers for solid-state electricity meters and AMI (Advanced Metering Infrastructure) and AGI (Advanced Grid Infrastructure) devices used in utility communication systems. Design and architect the product, evaluating and validating design alternatives to create optimum products/systems to maximize function/cost ratio in an agile environment. Document the design in a detailed product specification to describe the functionality and facilitate product verification testing Implement the product specifications by writing embedded firmware per coding standards Unit test the firmware to verify the functionality Use in-circuit emulators, oscilloscopes, logic analyzers and other test equipment Work with firmware and system verification teams to develop test plans to verify functional compliance of the design to its specification. Work with manufacturing to configure and test the product Carry the design from concept to manufacture according to the product development process. Modify existing embedded firmware to fit unique customer needs and configurations. Must Have 2+ years of experience in real-time embedded C/C++ programming We Value Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or Electrical Engineering. Assembly language is a plus Experience developing firmware for AMI network communications including RF mesh and cellular communications Knowledgeable about IoT communication protocols such as WiSUN, LTE-M, and NBIoT Experience with device drivers, interrupt handlers and multi-threaded / multi-tasking real-time operating systems (RTOS) Familiarity with object-orientated design concepts, revision control and bug tracking systems Experience using scripting languages such as Python Experience working in an Agile development environment and using Agile project tools, such as Rally, is preferred Experience using Test Driven Development in an embedded system is desired Additional Information JOB ID: HRD173217 Category: Engineering Location: 208 South Rogers Lane,Raleigh,North Carolina,27610,United States Exempt Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell Aerospace is a $10B+ SBG (Strategic Business Group) with 40,000 employees in over 125 domestic and international locations. We are a leading global aviation supplier designing, manufacturing, and distributing advanced electronic systems, products, and services to commercial, defense and space industries. This role will be based out Honeywell’s Phoenix NDE Lab. The NDE engineer will work with a team of engineers and technicians to support non-destructive test engineering inspection on a variety of Honeywell products both mechanical and electrical in nature. Beyond the primary lab responsibilities, you will work closely with the global NDE special process team to provide engineering support for Honeywell’s suppliers, develop inspection methods, advance NDE technologies and method automation, and provide documentation support for drawing and spec changes, among other things. Aspects of the job include planning, coordinating, and communicating (verbal and written) NDE results to a broad customer base ranging from raw material Suppliers to the Aftermarket partners that support maintenance activities on Honeywell’s various Aerospace product lines. Primary Responsibilities Develop and apply NDE techniques to existing and advanced Honeywell Aerospace products Hands on operation of Computed Tomography equipment and reconstruction/manipulation of CT data. Participate in externally funded NDE Development programs Provide support to Project and Design groups for new and existing programs Work with the applicable engine program to develop field inspection techniques and train personnel at aftermarket inspection facilities Responsible for Procedure and Report writing Involved in Specification and Standards writing Approving new equipment and maintaining current equipment Assist in training personnel for certification purposes Participate in industry committees to enhance Honeywell’s position with NDE Standards (SAE, AIA, ASTM, Nadcap, Etc…) Provide production, supplier, and field support as required MUST HAVE BS in Engineering (Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, Electrical Engineering or NDE) 4+ years’ experience working as a Non-Destructive Evaluation Engineer Proof of formal training, experience and certification as a Non-Destructive Engineer must be presented Certifiable as a Level 3 in Ultrasonic and Eddy Current in accordance with NAS410 / EN4179 Must be U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident due to contractual obligations WE VALUE Excellent written and verbal communication skills (including proposal, presentation, and reporting skills) Strong team working skills. Able to work in a variety of cross-functional team roles Motivated self starter NDT Level 2 certified in X-ray, Digital X-ray, Ultrasonic, and Eddy Current inspection methods Experience with Computed Tomography (CT) with knowledge of VG Studio Max software. Must be able to travel both domestically and international. (10% Travel) Additional Information JOB ID: req379794 Category: Engineering Location: 111 S 34th St.,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United States Exempt Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Are you ready to help us make the future? Be part of a team assessing and driving achievement of program specific performance within Honeywell Engineering Hardware Management Team (EHMT). You will partner with world class engineers, leaders and cross functional teams to manage the development hardware processes, develop program schedules and milestones, and drive improvements in engineering quality and productivity. You will help coordinate SAP demand entry, act as a liaison between engineering groups, new product sourcing, suppliers and manufacturing, and provide data reporting for both internal and external customers. Overall, you will help improve Project Engineering schedule fidelity and milestone compliance for development hardware. Reconcile actual program hardware expense with deliveries. Manages portfolio of orders on a program and SAP transactions. Provide material availability and status reports for material delivery Validate Engineering Project demand aligned with program budgets Work with the ISC to ensure all NPD demand is maintained in project stock Work with ISC to ensure plant stock orders are moved plant inventory Schedule and Milestone development/mgmt. Customer relationships Estimation development and analysis Cost development Budget analysis Metric development/reporting Risk/OPP development and management Vendor interface Project Performance YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree in Aerospace, Aeronautical or Mechanical Engineering Min 5+ years’ experience in Engineering or Project Management Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident, or have protected status WE VALUE Experience in Project or Systems Engineering Experience with SAP and EBP or other Enterprise procurement software Proficient in Microsoft Office tools (MS Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint) Passion for Winning and Bias for Action Create specific action plans Enhance customer relationships Understand technology Program management skills Individuals who are self-motivated and able to work with little supervision, who consistently take the initiative to get things done, do things before being asked by others or forced to by events. Ability to convey subtle or complex messages clearly, as appropriate for the topic and audience. Demonstrated Earned Value Management skills Good communications skills and can work well in a team environment Project creation and management ‐ Project scheduling and financial reporting. Database Mgmt. ‐ Ad hoc reporting (excel, access, PowerPoint). Visual Basic in Microsoft Excel Teamcenter, ECR/ECO Process, EBOM, SCS/ASL Experience in working cross‐functionally with a larger Engineering Organization and multiple sites highly desired Adept at SAP problem solving; effective decision making and innovation Driven to product improvement; responsive; has a service mentality; achieves quality results Promote customer satisfaction with capability to establish strong business and interpersonal relationships with customers and suppliers including internal Honeywell Aerospace centers of excellence (COE) Able to prioritize and resolve conflicting due dates Prioritizes time and resources effectively Ability to execute to cost, schedule and technical requirements EPET.02.2022 Additional Information JOB ID: HRD179608 Category: Engineering Location: 111 S 34th St.,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United States Exempt Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings intelligent and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Why Honeywell? Honeywell changes the way the world works. For more than 130 years, we’ve solved the toughest customer challenges through a rare combination of our industrial expertise and our innovations in ground breaking software and technology, and industry-leading automation. This perfection is built on a foundation of inclusion, diversity and driving a performance culture that values integrity and ethics. Are you ready to help us make the future? Be part of a team that performs development, qualification and production tests of gas turbine engines. On the E&PS T55 Growth Test team you will participate in the development and certification of Honeywell’s largest shaft gas turbine engines. You will have the opportunity to work in some of the most complex test environments within Honeywell. You will help maintain and develop component and engine test capabilities. You specifically own the project management of industry standard waterbrake dynamometers for baselevel and altitude test facilities. This role entails working with a supplier to ensure the design and procurement meet requirements and program schedule needs. You will be expected to actively participate on a high performing team while driving continuous improvements and exceeding your customer’s expectations. You will lead by example through your work ethic and application of a broad range of engineering skills. You will help drive a positive, inclusive culture. Your knowledge and hands on skills will be used in rewarding work that ensures millions of humans continue to safely travel the open skies. Position Responsibilities Part time project engineering support of test equipment requirements, design and procurement Part time gas turbine engine test engineer. Role will become full time test engineer once test equipment is all procured and transferred to the facility team Engine test requirements and compliance ownership Plan, manage, and execute development, safety of flight, and qualification engine builds & tests. Workflow management via the Work Request System (WRS) – includes coordination with all Test Services functions, other Honeywell partners and outside suppliers at times Development and execution of Continuous Improvement initiatives in response to internal suggestions as well as Lessons Learned and the Voice of the Customer Support estimates for new engine tests/programs Build and leverage a strong network. Have a bias for following, improving and developing standard processes and best practices Demonstrate a strong mechanical aptitude and a working knowledge of turbine engine systems, test facilities, engine assembly instructions, and engine test planning and management Communicate effectively with peers, customers, suppliers and leadership Demonstrate strong project management skills (plan – execute – escalate) You Must Have Must be US Citizen, due to ITAR and Export Control restrictions Bachelor of Science in Engineering Minimum of 4 years of experience in a mechanical test environment We Value Hands on mechanical system or sub-system test experience Mechanical tinkerer Automotive or other mechanical system experience Bachelors degree in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering preferred Gas turbine engine and/or engine component test experience desired Working knowledge of IPDS and the Test Lead and Project Engineer roles Working knowledge of instrumentation and measurement systems desired Demonstrated comfort working with complex systems (mechanical, fluid flow, hydraulics, pneumatics, data and automation) Demonstrated ability to work well with a team while being able to make decisions, balancing risks and rewards EPET.02.2022 Additional Information JOB ID: HRD180524 Category: Engineering Location: 111 S 34th St.,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Advanced Materials is a global supplier of fluorine products, fine chemicals, additives, metals, films and fibers for products including pharmaceuticals, refrigeration, semiconductors and military protection. Advanced Materials is making the world safer, cleaner and enabling the modernization of a growing middle class by enhancing our customer offerings through a differentiated portfolio of chemistries, materials, value-added solutions and superior customer service. Our mission is to attract, retain and develop diverse and highly motivated, entrepreneurial employees striving to flawlessly deliver superior value to our customers every day. Key Responsibilities Support research and development analytical characterization of the next-generation advanced materials especially lithium-ion battery electrolyte materials, battery salts etc. Serve as the local expert for analytical characterization, novel capability built to understand electrochemistry taking place within lithium-ion battery electrolytes, salts, work closely with cross-functional R&D teams to develop core capabilities, technologies, measurement, and data analysis to identify critical capability, characterization data needed to develop, process, and scale up battery chemicals. Design of advanced electrolyte characterization methodologies for various cathodes material to support discovery of novel formulations. Citizenship/Immigration Status: Due to U.S. export control laws applicable at this site, must be a U.S. citizen, permanent resident (Green Card holder), or have protected status as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3). Are you ready to help us make the future? The Law Department at Honeywell is seeking an experienced Assistant General Counsel - Government Contracts to be based in Washington D.C. or Charlotte, NC. Your practice area will be focused on government contract and cybersecurity compliance. You will serve the interests of the corporation and may be called upon to provide advice in the area of government and cybersecurity compliance to all five uniquely diverse businesses across Honeywell that are engaged in various government contracting types. You will receive requests for legal advice from business leaders and other functions and be responsible for deciding on the most appropriate responses to make to these requests. Key Responsibilities Interpret laws and regulations Analyze legal documents Perform due diligence Mitigate potential legal and compliance issues Consult Support business legal matters JOB ACTIVITIES Create and maintain self-service tools, templates, process and procedure to streamline sales and supply chain government contracting Analyze, interpret and communicate impact of new and/or changing government laws and regulations (e.g. FAR/DFARS), including related to cybersecurity Perform due diligence and assist in scoping and implementing compliance plans corporate-wide based on applicable impact Mitigate potential legal issues related to government contracting, procurement and cybersecurity; act as escalation point for questions related to key government compliance risk areas (e.g. BAA, DPAS, SCA, FCA, etc.) Consult business partners on government contract terms, conditions, certifications and other compliance obligations Assist with investigations related to government disclosure obligations You Must Have Juris Doctor (JD) 5-7 years’ experience with contracts and the understanding of FAR, DFARS and/or cybersecurity We Value Some experience in law, government or regulatory focus preferred Ability to set priorities Strong sense of integrity and ethics Good judgment and decision-making skills An inclusive working environment Strong business acumen Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Use your knowledge of customers, the industry and competition to identify and pursue opportunities for growth for Honeywell's Aerospace business. You will develop strategies to gain new customers in current markets and identify ways to penetrate new markets and channels. You will influence and partner with other Honeywell business leaders, marketing, sales, product development and various functions to define a long-term roadmap for reaching and securing new customers. You will build strategic customer relationships, identify potential mergers or acquisitions, joint ventures, and other strategic alliances. Key Responsibilities Lead AT’s Research Technology Centers to win external technology development funding aligned to our roadmaps and technology procurement plans. Understand the technology funding market and new technology trends, uncover non-obvious opportunities and customers for Honeywell to provide value through new technologies, and help provide technology differentiation for future Honeywell products. Lead regular engagement with government organizations, universities, and OEMs. Investigate, recommend, and facilitate the formation of strong relationships with strategic customers. Work with RTCs, GBEs, and other internal organizations to formulate effective business development strategies for external technology funding. Lead Advanced Technology to help shape customer requirements and objectives for future R&D opportunities. Ensure Honeywell has sufficient insight to prepare for upcoming opportunities before requests for proposals, BAAs etc. are posted. Manage the pursuit process from initial concept and customer engagement through to contract award. Lead Honeywell to develop customer presentations, white papers, and proposals. Lead an effective business development MOS for sections within the RTC, and drive prioritization of business opportunities and available internal resources. MUST HAVE Minimum 10 years professional engineering Minimum 5 years in Technology Development through TRL6 Demonstrated success at cultivating low TRL funded programs Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. WE VALUE PhD or Masters Degree in a technical field 10 years of professional engineering/science-related experience with demonstrated competency in advanced engineering and/or research, and leading engineering/research technology development teams and programs. Proven capability to cultivate and capture advanced technology funding in electronic system technologies from or within science and technology customer agencies such as DARPA, AFRL, ONR, MDA, NASA, or FAA. Advanced degree in an engineering or science-related discipline. Experience in electronic systems, communications, RF sensors, in the aerospace industry. Demonstrated ability to influence business leaders, drive technical improvements, and influence change in the engineering and technology environment. Strong judgment and decision-making abilities. Demonstrated product/systems vision and experience driving a focused team with the ability to inspire innovation. Effective written, verbal and listening skills at all levels of the organization. Strong and active professional network of relationships at government science & technology agencies, universities, national labs, and private sector research organizations. Ability to articulate strategies in clear, concise, and decisive manner Additional Information JOB ID: req375042 Category: Business Development Location: 12001 State Highway 55,Plymouth,Minnesota,55441,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization We are looking for a Business Development Sales Manager for the Midstream Industry to generate new business opportunities. Your role will be to seek new opportunities through a combination of market research, networking, and outreach to strategically identify and contact qualified leads. Business development representatives book meetings, moving leads into the sales pipeline from first contact until you close the deal. Your job is to ensure that the business grows by bringing in new clients and generating revenue by utilizing a technical sales team and/or collaborate with other sales related departments. Key Responsibilities Qualify leads from marketing campaigns as sales opportunities Contact potential clients through cold calls and emails and in person networking Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) clients Identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services Build long-term trusting relationships with clients Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market Report to the Business Development Director on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) sales results YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree, or equivalent. Some experience in the field. WE VALUE A proficient understanding of key sales principles and best practices Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization An ability to influence customers, while maintaining healthy relationships Significant experience in selling (industrial) products Deep technical expertise Understanding of the Honeywell value proposition as well as the competitive landscape Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182167 Category: Sales Location: 13509 South Point Blvd., S. Point Business Park,Suite 100,Charlotte,North Carolina,28273,United States Exempt Sales (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be located in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Of Duties Responsible for managing the elicitation, collection, analysis, documentation and communication of business and users requirements, as well as driving the business towards optimal technical solutions This position will support the Digital Transformation working with various FM&T sub-teams Participates in ad-hoc consulting with one or more subject matter experts and leverages technical knowledge and experience to improve one or more business processes within an organization, generally involving use and improvement of information systems Occasionally leads small to medium work packages Leads investigation and development of recommendation on buy vs build decisions on medium complexity projects Serves as a liaison across organizations for process improvement, business processes and systems integration Consults with and actively engaged with customers to ensure optimal utilization of existing information technologies Assists more senior personnel and/or management in resolving conflict and removing barriers to ensure successful resolution Assesses customer needs on medium complexity projects utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to prioritize immediate business needs and recommends options, risks and cost vs benefits Leads the development and communication of business requirements to the IT community for the design and implementation of business solutions. Ensures traceability of requirements throughout projects lifecycle including Statement Of Work (SOWs) with suppliers Reviews quality acceptance test plan and monitors the testing process to ensure that expected business results are adequately tested/achieved and the remaining risks are acceptable Establishes relationships across business function by being proactive, displaying a high level of knowledge of the business and by providing innovative business solutions You Must Have Bachelor's degree in a business or technical discipline with a minimum of 2 years of experience in business analysis, process modeling / improvements Two or more years in a technical execution role, and 2 years of experience supporting IT projects Demonstrates excellent interpersonal, analytical, organizational, and communication skills (both oral and written) Must be able to obtain and maintain security clearance. We Value Knowledge Skills iiBA Certification a plus Relevant business analysis experience across multiple functional disciplines Knowledge of business analysis practices, principles, and tools, including prior experience with IT projects Ability to work in a matrixed environment Highly effective/demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req351883 Category: Information Technology Location: 9221 Ward Parkway,Kansas City,Missouri,64114,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Honeywell FM&T Overview Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The Future Is What You Make It. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. UOP, a Honeywell company headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a leading international licensor of processing technology and supplier of engineering services, catalysts and adsorbents, equipment, specialty materials and digital solutions for the global refining, gas processing, petrochemical and sustainable technologies industries. With more than a century of leadership in hydrocarbon processing technologies, UOP has led six revolutions in technology that transformed our industry. For more information visit www.uop.com. An excellent career opportunity is currently available for a Catalysis Research Specialist, a scientist or engineer within Honeywell UOP's R&D Catalysis Fundamentals and Applications Research Group located in Des Plaines, IL. This position provides a unique opportunity to discover the catalyst and process technologies that enable UOP’s future market leadership and growth and innovate to solve the world's most important challenges. The Research Specialist will bring enthusiasm, creativity, and expertise to identify catalyst and process technology based solutions to research problems. Key Responsibilities Maintain research project portfolio in the areas of catalysis, catalytic materials, and or chemical transformations of hydrocarbon and renewable fuels. Propose and implement experimental plans including establishing and conducting laboratory work. Build fundamental understanding of catalytic systems and innovate to identify key opportunities for Honeywell-UOP catalyst technology. Stay current on patent and open literature as they relate to research programs. Document all results and innovative concepts, and assist in the generation of intellectual property. Interface with other UOP departments including to ensure robust catalysis research and development programs and alignment with business objectives. Communicate important project results to cross-functional program teams. Participate in all departmental safety activities and conduct all work with a high degree of attention to safety. YOU MUST HAVE Ph.D. in Chemistry or Chemical Engineering OR Bachelors Degree in Chemistry or Chemical Engineering with 5+ years of experience with experimental chemistry or engineering. WE VALUE Scientific curiosity, creativity and innovation. Willingness to learn new technology An open, honest and team-oriented personality. Experience in hands-on laboratory work. Some experience in catalyst or process related research. Some experience in industrial technology development. Ability to occasionally meet virtually with team members and project stakeholders across time zones. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181959 Category: Engineering Location: 50 E Algonquin Rd,Des Plaines,Illinois,60017-5016,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. UOP, a Honeywell company headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a leading international licensor of processing technology and supplier of engineering services, catalysts and adsorbents, equipment, specialty materials and digital solutions for the global refining, gas processing and petrochemical industries. With more than a century of leadership in hydrocarbon processing technologies, UOP has led six revolutions in technology that transformed our industry. For more information visit www.uop.com. This is an exciting opportunity for a Chemical Design Engineer I in our Des Plaines IL office. Key Responsibilities Perform refinery/petrochemical/gas processing process design work to produce various design packages (eg. Schedule A). Work in a team environment to develop heat and material balances, PFDs and P&IDs, size/specify large scale plant equipment including reactors, vessels, columns, fired heaters, pumps, compressors, heat exchangers, piping and related equipment. Run process simulation tools for design and alternate cases, size process piping, run hydraulics and develop project specifications including for all major equipment. Participate in the maintenance and development of related design tools and documentation. YOU MUST HAVE B.S. Start your career with a company that recognizes and rewards top graduates! At Honeywell, our people are driven by a desire to contribute, be challenged and grow. Our people make Honeywell a special company and are a key competitive advantage. Honeywell International is a $34.4 billion diversified Fortune 100 leader with more than 100,000 employees in 100 countries around the world. We invent and manufacture technologies that address some of the world’s toughest challenges linked to global macro trends like energy efficiency, clean energy generation, safety and security, globalization and customer productivity. We are building a world that’s safer and more secure, more comfortable and energy efficient, more innovative and productive. For more information, please visit Honeywell.com or follow us @HoneywellNow. Performance Materials and Technologies is a high-performing, global business with an array of technologies that are changing the world for the better. We develop and manufacture advanced materials and process technologies used in a wide range of industries and applications, from petroleum refining to environmentally-friendlier refrigerants to bullet-resistant vests. Our advanced materials are critical in the manufacture of products ranging from nylon to computer chips to pharmaceutical packaging. Performance Materials and Technologies holds more than 14,500 active and pending patents globally and has more than 5,500 engineering employees. Performance Materials and Technologies comprises three businesses, each of which succeeds on the strength of its technology portfolio, complimented with expertise in engineering, sales, marketing and supply chain. Honeywell UOP is the recognized leader in developing and licensing process technology that convert oil, natural gas and renewable feeds into transportation fuels, energy and petrochemicals. It also develops and sells catalysts, adsorbents, equipment, process plants and technical services. UOP continues to innovate to create flexible, future-forward and sustainable solutions that address the challenges of our everchanging world. We’re striving to create cleaner fuels by developing processes that reduce emissions and produce renewable fuel sources. Our Honeywell Green Diesel™ and Honeywell Green Jet Fuel™ require no changes to engines or fuel infrastructure and reduce greenhouse gas emissions by more than two-thirds. Our process technologies, equipment and lifecycle solutions are helping customers generate the most value from every drop of oil, every cubic foot of natural gas and every ton of coal. And through connected software, UOP is helping customers become more efficient and profitable through digital tools that ensure plants are running at the peak of their capability. Position Overview/Responsibilities Honeywell/UOP will only consider candidates who are authorized to work in the United States on a full-time and permanent basis (does not include practical training). This is an exciting and unique opportunity to work in the U.S. and around the world as part of a Field Operating Service (FOS) team, supported by technology experts from Honeywell UOP’s Technical Service Group. FOS advisors are on-site prior, during, and after the initial start-up of UOP technologies. They help to insure that the technology and customer operators are ready for commissioning. Advisors are also involved in the start-up and test runs that demonstrate guarantees and are accountable for process, equipment, refining and petrochemical insight and assist customers in resolving engineering and operating issues. UOP advisors may remain at a site for a few days to several months before moving to the next assignment. For each start-up, advisors may work with a number of UOP-licensed processes and a variety of individuals within and outside of UOP. The experience gained from each assignment, and the subsequent interaction with other UOP employees, provide a solid background for assessing and solving problems encountered in each situation in various locations around the world. As advisors gain experience they have opportunities to advance to positions of increased accountability within the FOS organization. MUST be able to commit to travelling international and domestically and reside onsite for long uninterrupted periods of time (Typical assignments are four to six months but one day to one year possible). Begin your career with 12 months at UOP headquarters in Des Plaines, Illinois and/or at UOP’s Riverside, Illinois facilities (both in the Chicago suburbs). In the Early Career Program you will be exposed to a variety of functions including Research and Process Development, Process Engineering and/ or Technical Service. You will gain experience in one or more of UOP’s key refining and petrochemical technologies with a variety of activities that may include operating pilot plants, defining experiments, designing, troubleshooting and/ or servicing UOP process units, and performing other challenging assignments. Following these 12 months of training Engineers will transfer to Field Operating Service (FOS). In FOS they will travel full time for 3-5 years on assignments to multiple locations around the world supporting UOP customers in operating plants as a process engineer and advisor. Accountabilities Of This Position Include Completion of a 12 month training program designed to develop the skills needed to be FOS technical advisor. This includes: Independent learning as well as structured classroom and hands-on training Training focused on safety and UOP technology, processes and procedures by which UOP delivers technology to our customers On the job training and value-added work in 3-4 rotational work assignments in Operations, Engineering, Technical Service, Regional Service, or Business groups Soft skills training, including cultural awareness, conflict management, and communication courses Transfer to Field Operating Service for a duration of at least 3-5 years. In Field Operating Service you will be on international and domestic assignments. Some of the accountabilities are: 2-6 months of field training Following all required safety procedures and adhering to FOS, UOP and Honeywell policies Setting and meeting customer expectations Completing a detailed checkout of new UOP process units prior to initial start up in order to assure that the completed unit conforms to UOP specifications as contained in the Schedule A design package Providing field technical assistance and field support for development activities in commercial units Providing feedback including suggested improvements on UOP process designs Troubleshooting and recommending innovative solutions Coordinating commissioning activities Transferring technology to customers operating and engineering staff Reviewing emergency and normal operating procedures with customer personnel Advising customer personnel on the establishment and maintenance of the various process variables necessary to achieve safe and efficient operations Collecting and effective analysis of unit operating data and laboratory results Monitoring and advising on process operating conditions Advising customer personnel on the long term routine activities for effective operation of a UOP process unit Advising customers on scheduling, procedures, normal operating variables and response to emergency situations and unscheduled process changes, under the guidance of the Chief Technical Advisor if available Basic Qualifications B.S. Chemical Engineering Must have graduated, from an accredited college or university in Dec 2022 Additional Qualifications: Ability and willingness to travel internationally and domestically and reside onsite for long uninterrupted periods of time. (Typical assignments are four to six months but durations of one day to one year or more are possible.) Flexibility to work hours that are dictated by customer requirements and assignment scope Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills Strong customer focus, and the ability to work as part of a team Ability

Summary Honeywell Federal Manufacturing and Technologies is seeking candidates for multiple entry level positions to perform a variety of advanced chemical tests, processes, and procedures to support production and research and development on a wide variety of materials from metals to polymers in our Science and Engineering Laboratory – Materials (SEL-M). The primary responsibility of this position is to support future and current production by designing and executing studies on polymeric, ceramic or metallic materials The candidate will lead and participate in studies that may include designing, synthesizing, characterizing, and developing materials of interest to defense research and development The candidate will be expected to leverage their understanding of chemistry, materials science, and analytical testing techniques to predict manufacturing behavior of complex materials This candidate will be expected to lead teams of researchers to identify problems and solutions, draft test plans, obtain funding, and execute work in alignment with the company’s commitments and strategic objectives The successful candidate will enhance the capabilities of an ongoing research and development program, within a multi-disciplinary organization dedicated to advanced materials studies by leveraging an in-depth understanding of materials science The successful candidate will have a strong customer-service focus, and the ability to communicate effectively with customers who have limited knowledge of chemistry or materials science You Must Haves US citizenship, needed to obtain and maintain required US Dept. of Energy """"Q""""-level security clearance Bachelor of Science Degree (B.S.) or Master’s Degree (M.S.) in Chemical Engineering, Metallurgy, Materials Science, Physical Science from an accredited institution with 2- 4 years’ experience or PhD with 0 years’ experience We Value Process automation, mod sim integration or machine learning Large scale and continuous synthesis background Experience with in-line data capture Background in polymer and organics is preferable BS or PhD in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Materials Engineering or equivalent Working knowledge of polymeric or metallic materials An understanding of advanced manufacturing techniques, including microfluidics, additive manufacturing, elastomeric compounding, and polymer or metal processing Experience with polymer or metal test methods and mechanical responses Experience with various materials synthesis, processing, and characterization techniques. These include familiarity with wet chemistry, bench chemistry, analytical testing methods (FTIR, melt flow, mechanical testing, etc.), compounding, additive manufacturing, and aging Experience in a production support role Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems Ability to work independently with little to no supervision on all job responsibilities Ability to manage multiple assignments and responsibilities concurrently Ability to generate accurate and precise analytical data that may be used in formal reports or presentations or for quality acceptance of components utilized in national defense Excellent written and oral communication skills All employees must work in a safe manner in accordance with the Laboratory Health and Safety Program A willingness to work either as an independent investigator or as a member of a multi-disciplinary cross-functional team, depending on the nature of the situation FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req381131 Category: Engineering Location: 14520 Botts Road,Kansas City,Missouri,64147,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Requisition is for AIChE 2021 Conference This is an exciting and unique opportunity to work around the world as part of a Field Operating Service (FOS) team, supported by technology experts from UOP’s Operating Technical Service. FOS advisors are on-site prior, during and after the initial start-up of UOP technologies. They help to ensure that the plant and operators are ready for commissioning. Advisors are also involved in the start-up and test runs that demonstrate guarantees and are accountable for process, equipment, refining and petrochemical insight and assist customers in resolving engineering and operating issues. UOP advisors may remain at a site for a few days to several months for each assignment. For each start-up, advisors work with a number of UOP-licensed processes and a variety of individuals within and outside of UOP. The experience gained from each assignment, and the subsequent interaction with other UOP employees, provide a solid background for assessing and solving problems encountered in each situation in various locations around the world. As advisors gain experience they have opportunities to advance to positions of increased accountability within the FOS organization. MUST be able to Commit to travelling internationally and domestically and reside onsite for long uninterrupted periods of time. (Typical assignments are four to six months but one day to one year possible.) Providing field technical assistance on new and/or revamped refinery unit checkout and startups. Providing field technical assistance and field support for development activities in commercial refinery units. Following required safety procedures. Providing feedback including suggested improvements on UOP process designs. Troubleshooting and recommending solutions while also addressing improvement and innovative problem solving. Familiar with controls communications networks. Coordinating commissioning activities. Transferring technology to customers operating and engineering staff. Reviewing emergency and normal operating procedures with customer shift operating personnel. Advising customer operating personnel on the establishment and maintenance of the various process variables necessary to achieve safe and efficient operations. Collecting and working up unit operating data and laboratory results. Monitoring and advising on process operating conditions, during test runs. Build effective and productive relationships with customer counterparts. Conduct unit audits to support refinery wide expansion projects as well as new multi-unit complex startups. Advising customer personnel during the performance of various activities routine to the long term operations of a UOP process unit. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors Degree in Chemical Engineering WE VALUE Commitment to travel internationally and domestically and reside onsite for long uninterrupted periods of time. (Typical assignments are four to six months but one day to one year possible.) Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and Word. Flexibility to work hours that are dictated by customer requirements and assignment scope. Ability to work in a physically challenging environment. Ability to interact with customers on a global basis. Experience with at least one of the following UOP technologies (Catalytic Reforming, Gas Processing, Hydrocracking, Hydrotreating, FCC, Merox Treating, HF Alkylation, Paraffin Isomerization, Adsorptive Separations. (Parex and Molex), Xylene Isomerization and other Aromatics processing, (Cumene and Ethyl Benzene) is preferred. Description "Honeywell McCook, IL facility has immediate opportunities for a Chemical Operator in our chemical manufacturing plant UOP, a Honeywell Company, is an international supplier of process technology, products, engineered systems and technical services to the petroleum refining, petrochemical, gas processing and energy industries and is a leader in the research and development of petroleum and petrochemical processing. Key Responsibilities Responsible for following standard work to operate a station in a catalyst process unit. Expected to certify on multiple stations and stay current with improvements on how to operate each station. Write end of shift report and do shift exchange at beginning and end of shift. Attend and contribute to a beginning of shift production meeting. Participate in the Structured Safety Process (SSP), which will require specific safety precautions/activities to be completed every month. Participate in Rapid Problem Solving to help quickly identify ways to get back to standard if production falls short. Participate in and drive Continuous Improvement activities or suggestions to help make improvements on quality, cost and delivery. The Operator is ultimately responsible to ensure that work being done in the immediate area is safe and follows all safety procedures. Follow work instructions from leadership and Team Lead, attend all meetings as necessary and any other duties assigned in course of shift. This will be a 12 hour rotating shift, 365 days a year position. 5AM - 5PM Tuesday, Wednesday, Saturday, Sunday, Monday, Thursday, Friday. Switches nights/days after each one of those cycles. You Must Have High School Diploma or GED. 1 year experience in a manufacturing/industrial or service industry environment. We Value 3 years experience in chemical manufacturing environment. Basic working Knowledge of Microsoft package. Basic working Knowledge SAP experience. 2 years of experience of troubleshooting Special Considerations: Lifting will exceed 30 Lbs. and/or repetitions of this or lesser weights will be significant. Exposure to substantial machine, chemical, or other physical risks are anticipated." Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it! When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Description The Chemical Operator will be responsible for mastering processes for multiple stations to result in quality of end product. Interested individuals should be able to work independently and as a team. Safety is of the highest priority and each individual is responsible for their work area to be maintained and follow all safety regulations. The Chemical Operator position is a rotating 12-hour shift position. This position involves routine and lengthy exposure to the elements. The position requires regular walking for the majority of the shift as well as climbing ladders and stairs. The position will also may occasionally drive a fork truck. Additionally, the position entails monitoring certain processes and regularly requires turning valves that require torque of up to 50 lbs and lifting up to 50lbs with assistance. The incumbent must be able to use proper PPE which may include but is not limited to: full respirator, dust masks, hard hats, hearing protection, gloves, safety glasses or goggles, long sleeves, and steel toe shoes or boots. Key Responsibilities Responsible for following standard work to operate one station (at a given time) in a continuous flow catalyst process unit. Expected to certify on multiple stations and stay current with improvements on how to operate each station. Write end of shift report and do shift exchange at beginning and end of shift. Attend and contribute to a beginning of shift production meeting. Participate in the Structured Safety Process (SSP), which will require specific safety precautions/activities to be completed every month. Participate in Rapid Problem Solving to help quickly identify ways to get back to standard if production falls short. Participate in and drive Continuous Improvement activities or suggestions to help make improvements on quality, cost and delivery. Responsible for any Life Critical permitting needed when work is performed at assigned station. This includes: LOTO, Line Break, Hot Works and Confined Space. The Chemical Operator is ultimately responsible to ensure that work being done in the immediate area is safe and follows all safety procedures. Follow work instructions from Team Supervisor, attend all meetings as necessary and any other duties assigned in course of shift. This will be a 12 hour rotating shift, 365 days a year position. You Must Have High School Diploma or GED 2 years of experience in an industrial/ manufacturing environment or a Honeywell contingent worker. We Value 2 years of experience of troubleshooting. Basic working knowledge of Microsoft package 3 years of experience in a chemical manufacturing environment Experience with SAP Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That's why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? You will be part of a group of highly committed professionals who provide expertise and ensure the success of engineering projects and programs. jobTitle: Chief Intellectual Property Counsel – Performance Materials and Technologies
jobDescription: Honeywell Performance Materials & Technologies (PMT) is a $11B SBG (Strategic Business Group) with business in over 125 domestic and international locations. We are a world leader in diverse businesses, ranging from specialty chemicals, refrigerants and propellants, advanced materials, electronics, software, life sciences, oil and gas process technologies, and more (https://pmt.honeywell.com/us/en/about-pmt/about-us). We are heavily invested in sustainability technologies, and Honeywell PMT is using science and technology to make the world a better place! In this role, you will serve as Chief Intellectual Property Counsel – Performance Materials & Technologies, based in Houston, Texas and lead all intellectual property (IP) matters for Honeywell PMT globally. Key Responsibilities Define and execute our intellectual property strategy as the lead legal advisor for all IP matters. Manage our IP function leading a global team and defining and deploying a robust execution model with transparency through operational KPIs and metrics. Nurture a robust pipeline of innovative and differentiated ideas that can be converted into IP through training, IP workouts/brainstorming, integration into the product development process and rewards and recognition programs. Develop and maintain a high quality and relevant IP portfolio (patents and trade secrets) to protect our technology differentiation across all of our business units. Execute complex global commercial IP transactions including deal structuring, drafting and negotiation across a range of areas including software, hardware, services, strategic partnerships, JVs and M&A (including IP diligence and integration of acquisition targets). Deploy and manage our trade secret protection program including source code protection and 3rd party information sharing and protection. Manage IP disputes and litigation. Drive revenue generating opportunities through IP assertation opportunities and licensing. Must Have Education - BS degree and JD degree Registered to practice before at least one state bar and the USPTO Minimum 2 years of patent prosecution experience as a patent attorney Minimum of 7 years legal experience directed to patent prosecution, intellectual property transactions, and/or IP litigation Must be a US citizen due to handling export control information. We Value Business acumen - capacity to learn business rapidly and become a business partner Ability to influence and lead at all levels Strong customer focus Proactive mindset Proven ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of variables Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Must be able to work flexible hours if required to meet the demands of the position Integrity and good judgment are extremely important A self-starter who is very productive and has the motivation to assume significant responsibility Consistently make complex, timely decisions Highly creative and Innovative Convey information with clarity across diverse global teams Additional Information JOB ID: req370970 Category: Legal Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.
