Design solutions to drive safe living and quality of life The future is what you make it! When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Compliance Assurance program will involve monitoring export-related activity both within the Export Compliance team and by business and functional personnel throughout Honeywell’s business operations. While the Compliance Assurance program will have a major focus initially on ITAR-regulated activity at Honeywell, its scope will include all export-related activity within the company. The Compliance Assurance Analyst will be responsible for: ongoing risk and control assessment mapping; helping the Director steer the Compliance Assurance program toward standardized, automated, assessments across countries, businesses, and legal entities; defining creative and effective methods to measure the compliance risk associated with numerous compliance obligations; performing transaction testing and business data analysis; developing metrics that are useful for measuring and reporting on the effectiveness of compliance controls. Key Responsibilities Support the Director’s efforts to develop and implement a sustainable export compliance assurance program for Honeywell’s global operations, based from within the Export Compliance Center of Excellence Develop and maintain a comprehensive mapping of export controls risks and existing control measures to be tested under the program Designing and implementing testing methods to measure the effectiveness of compliance controls Designing and communicating a risk assessment framework to illustrate the nature and severity of vulnerabilities, consistent with firmwide enterprise risk management frameworks Actively participating in developing and implementing sustainable corrective actions arising from Compliance Assurance exercises, as well as other investigations and audits Proactively identifying, evaluating, and managing export risks in a way that enables Honeywell to deliver sustainable business growth YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree 4+ years of compliance, risk assessment or internal audit experience in-house at a multinational company, at a law firm, or within the U.S. government, with primary or substantial focus on Compliance Assurance, Compliance Monitoring, and Program Testing responsibilities in export controls or similar regulatory areas such as sanctions, AML, anti-corruption, data privacy and SOX Due to U.S. export control laws, must be a U.S. Person WE VALUE Ability and interest in building a sustainable, best-in-class export compliance assurance program Excellent skills in risk measurement and data analytics Experience with enterprise risk management terminology and methods Excellent skills in problem-solving Ability to navigate complex situations Excellent communication skills and credibility Ability to work independently once tasks are assigned and to drive key initiatives Experience with digital trade compliance solutions, such as SAP GTS and OCR EASE Proactive, well-organized, highly motivated Experience working in a compliance-related role, especially one involving export compliance Detailed knowledge of the export regulations (ITAR and EAR and non-US equivalents) is a plus Experience with ERP, finance, and procurement systems Additional Information JOB ID: req379987 Category: Legal Location: 101 Constitution Ave NW Ste 500W,Washington DC,District of Columbia,20001,United States Exempt Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity Reporting to the VP GM for General Merchandise, this position is responsible for the identification, management and implementation of projects and pursuits linked with the continued expansion of business activities. This position is to support the improvement in the overall business performance and growth initiatives with a variety of customers, as well as collecting and disseminating relevant data to leadership to drive decision speed and execution for results. This role will lead a cross-functional team of Sales and Customer Support Managers to create and achieve the Annual Operating Plan and long-term Strategic Action Plan for the customer portfolio. They will be accountable for growth activities by coordinating pursuit support from the sales team, and for customer satisfaction by ensuring that all products and services are supported in an efficient and effective manner. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity Reporting to the VP GM for General Merchandise, this position is responsible for the identification, management and implementation of projects and pursuits linked with the continued expansion of business activities. This position is to support the improvement in the overall business performance and growth initiatives with a variety of customers, as well as collecting and disseminating relevant data to leadership to drive decision speed and execution for results. This role will lead a cross-functional team of Sales and Customer Support Managers to create and achieve the Annual Operating Plan and long-term Strategic Action Plan for the customer portfolio. They will be accountable for growth activities by coordinating pursuit support from the sales team, and for customer satisfaction by ensuring that all products and services are supported in an efficient and effective manner. Key Responsibilities Influence and reinforce strategic vision to Customer Business Managers and Directors, Area Sales Managers and Directors, Credit, Supply Chain and Customer Support teams to ensure cross functional objectives are prioritized and executed to meet goals, objectives and AOP targets Identify and lead specific process improvement opportunities, ensuring actions taken to achieve visible increases in performance metrics Responsible for defining and executing a customer business and support strategy for assigned accounts that serves a diverse and complex customer base, in a proactive manner, anticipating customer needs and competitor actions and driving results through their direct actions and through matrix leadership. Manage the internal and external element of the LOB MOS to achieve all financial and customer satisfaction goals for their account portfolio and ensuring tools in place for application/use by the broader team Ability and willingness to learn how the customer and their systems manage procurement and sourcing activities and processes, leveraging that knowledge into successful sales/growth pursuits for Honeywell Support sales pipeline, sand chart, won-not-booked analytics and MOS to ensure proactive management of metrics Review and prepare regional STRAP input for assigned customer Briefing up to and including President/CFO level Lead development of tools, dashboards, and automation workflows to allow for KPI monitoring of business performance and delivery of insights to facilitate quicker, better decision making and business results. Work with IT, finance, etc. to drive release of tools. Travel up to 50% to project sites. MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree 5 years’ experience in Material Handling 5 years Project management/leadership experience Direct interaction with external customer relationships WE VALUE Leadership: Experience to overcome obstacles, succeed in the face of adversity, and deal with ambiguity. Must know how to effectively influence and lead others across functions to get things done. Business Acumen: Mature business and financial acumen to discern risks/opportunities of key strategic programs at customers and Honeywell. Customer Knowledge: Knowledge of the customers, key players in the organization, strategic priorities. Product Knowledge: Breadth and depth of product knowledge, for both Avionics and Mechanical Commercial Transport products. Sales Expertise: ability to understand, identify and clearly articulate specific value propositions relative to the competition. Ability to construct multiple product proposals, indicating potential system and services integration concepts and benefits. Program Management: Ability to manage multiple projects on time, report out on action status, and provide clear verbal, and written customer status. Experience in using customer relationship management tool (e.g. SFDC) to manage accounts Communication skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Knows when and how to communicate to optimize potential for success with customers and internal to Honeywell. Must be a good listener. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD180831 Category: Business Development Location: 7901 Innovation Way,Mason,Ohio,45040,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Manage the internal and external element of the LOB MOS to achieve all financial and customer satisfaction goals for their account portfolio and ensuring tools in place for application/use by the broader team Ability and willingness to learn how the customer and their systems manage procurement and sourcing activities and processes, leveraging that knowledge into successful sales/growth pursuits for Honeywell Support sales pipeline, sand chart, won-not-booked analytics and MOS to ensure proactive management of metrics Review and prepare regional STRAP input for assigned customer Briefing up to and including President/CFO level Lead development of tools, dashboards, and automation workflows to allow for KPI monitoring of business performance and delivery of insights to facilitate quicker, better decision making and business results. Work with IT, finance, etc. to drive release of tools. Travel up to 50% to project sites. MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree 5 years’ experience in Material Handling 5 years Project management/leadership experience Direct interaction with external customer relationships WE VALUE Leadership: Experience to overcome obstacles, succeed in the face of adversity, and deal with ambiguity. Customer Knowledge: Knowledge of the customers, key players in the organization, strategic priorities. Ability to construct multiple product proposals, indicating potential system and services integration concepts and benefits. Program Management: Ability to manage multiple projects on time, report out on action status, and provide clear verbal, and written customer status. Experience in using customer relationship management tool (e.g. SFDC) to manage accounts Communication skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Knows when and how to communicate to optimize potential for success with customers and internal to Honeywell. Must be a good listener. jobTitle: Cyber Security Analyst II - Network Security
jobDescription: Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Prepares and assures the implementation of cyber security policies and procedures, conducts investigations of unusual incidents involving cyber security issues Plans and coordinates the access controls to allow authorized personnel or visitor access to restricted electronic records, materials, or areas Plans, develops, coordinates, and presents cyber security awareness training and education for cyber security operations, evaluates training program effectiveness, conducts job task analysis, security audits, surveys, and special studies Develops written documentation of Cyber Security, Telecommunications Security, and local procedures Coordinates with DOE to obtain rulings, interpretations, and acceptable deviations for compliance with regulations and orders Represents team in meetings with internal/external customer base Recommends and/or implements policies and procedures in support of management objectives Develops and facilitates internal communications which may include processing and distribution of information through communications services May perform other duties as required You Must Have Three or more years of related experience in cyber security, networking, hardware, operating systems, or a similar role Bachelor's degree in Cyber Security, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, a related discipline, or two additional years of direct work experience in lieu of bachelor's degree US citizenship in order to obtain US Dept of Energy ""Q"" level security clearance We Value Demonstrated experience with email filtering technologies Demonstrated experience managing a network IDS/IPS Demonstrated experience with firewall technologies Demonstrated experience with Linux system administration Additional Information JOB ID: req377588 Category: Engineering Location: 14520 Botts Road,Kansas City,Missouri,64147,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Honeywell FM&T Overview Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. jobTitle: Cyber Security Researcher II - Penetration Testing (Hybrid)
jobDescription: Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Honeywell Global Security (HGS) business believes in integrating security into all aspects of our business to protect the people, processes, and assets by which Honeywell achieves its greater mission. Advancements in technology, contractual and regulatory requirements, emerging threats, and Honeywell's growth worldwide continue to challenge all of us to ensure everything we do in business is secure. The Cyber Security Researcher II - Penetration Testing reports to the Product Security Assurance Leader and will be responsible for assessing and evaluating the security posture of a variety of Honeywell Products and partner technologies. This role will be responsible for security services delivery, which may include use of application/network/firmware/hardware security toolsets, detection of security defects, and remediation consultation of those weaknesses. Our services support the identification of potential attack techniques and serve as the foundation for continuously improving the product development lifecycle. Responsibilities Individual Contributor with Product Security Assurance Team Deliver Security / Penetration Testing across diverse Honeywell products, solutions and services Assist in the development of modular, repeatable, effective Security Testing processes Partner with Tools and Technology Team to select, implement, develop, and automate testing with appropriate tools. Work with cross functional teams to develop remediation suggestions Report observations using our standardized reporting structure YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors degree 2 years demonstrated experience in penetration testing, red teaming or offensive operations. Must be a US Citizen due to contractual obligations. WE VALUE Exposure to security testing within the appropriate domain Understanding of application protocols, development, and common attack vectors. Good cybersecurity capabilities and strong software engineering skills Experience with pentest tools and frameworks such as: Burp Suite, IDA Pro, GHidra, Kali, OWASP, Metasploit. Scripting experience in Python, Powershell and Bash preferred. Experience working with other languages such as C, C++, Java, .NET or javascript. Basic understanding of security by design principles and architecture level security concepts Up to date knowledge of current and emerging security threats and techniques for exploiting security vulnerabilities Effective oral and written communication skills Good interpersonal skills Experience in security testing within the appropriate domain Demonstrated project management skills. Relevant Cyber Security certifications: CEH, OSCP, GPEN Experience and knowledge of penetration testing methodologies and tools Public speaking at Technical Conferences 2+ years of application development Familiarity with reverse engineering tools, debuggers, and dynamic analysis techniques. HGS2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req358166 Category: Engineering Location: 1985 Douglas Drive North, Suite Corp ACST,Golden Valley,Minnesota,55422,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Engineering (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Honeywell Global Security (HGS) business believes in integrating security into all aspects of our business to protect the people, processes, and assets by which Honeywell achieves its greater mission. Advancements in technology, contractual and regulatory requirements, emerging threats, and Honeywell's growth worldwide continue to challenge all of us to ensure everything we do in business is secure. The Cyber Security Researcher - Penetration Testing reports to the Product Security Assurance Leader and will be responsible for assessing and evaluating the security posture of a variety of Honeywell Products and partner technologies. This role will be responsible for security services delivery, which may include use of application/network/firmware/hardware security toolsets, detection of security defects, and remediation consultation of those weaknesses. Our services support the identification of potential attack techniques and serve as the foundation for continuously improving the product development lifecycle. Responsibilities Individual Contributor with Product Security Assurance Team Deliver Security / Penetration Testing across diverse Honeywell products, solutions and services Assist in the development of modular, repeatable, effective Security Testing processes Partner with Tools and Technology Team to select, implement, develop, and automate testing with appropriate tools. Work with cross functional teams to develop remediation suggestions Report observations using our standardized reporting structure YOU MUST HAVE 1 year demonstrated experience in penetration testing, red teaming or offensive operations. Must be a US Citizen due to contractual obligations. WE VALUE Bachelors degree Understanding of application protocols, development, and common attack vectors. Good cybersecurity capabilities and strong software engineering skills Experience with pentest tools and frameworks such as: Burp Suite, IDA Pro, GHidra, Kali, OWASP, Metasploit. Scripting experience in Python, Powershell and Bash preferred. Experience working with other languages such as C, C++, Java, .NET or javascript. Basic understanding of security by design principles and architecture level security concepts Up to date knowledge of current and emerging security threats and techniques for exploiting security vulnerabilities Effective oral and written communication skills Relevant Cyber Security certifications: CEH, OSCP, GPEN Experience and knowledge of penetration testing methodologies and tools Familiarity with reverse engineering tools, debuggers, and dynamic analysis techniques. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD179805 Category: Engineering Location: 1985 Douglas Drive North, Suite Corp ACST,Golden Valley,Minnesota,55422,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Engineering (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing, and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** Summary The EIM Governance Analyst works closely with business teams to develop and drive governance maturity across the organization. This position helps to facilitate assessment activities in the governance program and contributes to the development of policies and standards. The data governance analyst works closely with data stewards and data ambassadors to improve data quality and ensure data is managed effectively. Duties And Responsibilities Drive data governance strategy and policies within assigned areas of the enterprise Develop and maintain a collaborative relationship with data stewards and ambassadors in assigned business units. Develop and maintain strong understanding of the data landscape in the assigned areas of the enterprise Identify, understand, and document data usage characteristics to drive alignment of data standards Reviewing and proposing changes to data governance policies and strategies Chairing and facilitating working sessions with business leaders, stakeholders, and data consumers. Tracking, managing, and reporting on data governance initiatives and progress towards goals and objectives Help drive the implementation and integration of a new, integrated data model You Must Have A bachelor's degree in MIS, IT, Business, or 6 years of equivalent experience At least 2 years of related work experience in data governance, data management, GRC (Governance, Risk & Compliance) or similar areas US citizenship to obtain US Dept. of Energy ""Q"" level security clearance We Value Hands-on experience in data management and technologies Understanding of data quality management Deep understanding of information and process integration management Policy and standards drafting experience Ability to implement change by motivating others, driving consensus, and executing through others Experience working in sensitive/classified data environments Experience working with a US government contractor Strong working knowledge of engineering, manufacturing, program management, and/or financial data operations Strong organizational skills: managing several complex initiatives simultaneously in a fast-paced, demanding environment FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req381342 Category: Finance Location: 9221 Ward Parkway,Kansas City,Missouri,64114,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Honeywell FM&T Overview Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

IC Digital and Standard Product Design Engineer Plymouth, MN The future is what you make it. Join a team that designs, verifies, integrates and tests complex [industry] products within Honeywell [SBG]. You will develop new products and processes in support of the organization's business strategies. main activities are to define and develop IP blocks as well as SoC integration. This work includes the design and verification of custom DSP blocks, control and interface blocks, complex state machines and various chip interfaces, as well as selecting and integrating third party IP for various functions. You will work closely with world class hardware and software engineers during planning, requirements and architecture, design, test and integration phases. Key Responsibilities Specification, design and integration of digital blocks and digital IC architecture with particular emphasis on radiation hardened design Block, system and chip level verification of digital and mixed signal systems Block, system and chip level synthesis and DFT Supporting bring-up and validation of digital systems on silicon Support of digital designs through the back-end flow Third party IP evaluation and selection Technical reporting both written and oral YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree in Engineering Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements WE VALUE Industrial experience of HDL design in ASIC/SOC environment Self-motivated, flexible, individual contributor with strong problem-solving skills while also being a good team player. Experience in ASIC/FPGA development Knowledge of DO-254 Airborne Electronic Hardware development lifecycle VHDL or Verilog working knowledge Knowledge of design tools: simulators, STA tools, synthesis, etc. Good communication skills (verbal and written) Self – starter, motivated and takes initiative and able to lead a small team Additional Information JOB ID: HRD183099 Category: Engineering Location: 12001 State Highway 55,Plymouth,Minnesota,55441,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. jobDescription: Key Responsibilities Protect/defend current business and identify/capture new business opportunities within the targeted USAF organizations through research, networking, and teaming/partnerships Prospect, target, and build pipeline. Develop, identify resources, brief and execute focused and actionable defense customer account plans to the business Engage with USAF flag officers, SES and senior defense officials who lead meaningful programs. Analyze contract documentation and government spending to understand Service/agency program trends Expand upon existing relationships with government and technology vendors/system integrators to further build a brand for Honeywell in the federal marketplace Develop credibility and relationships with Federal Government clients through fluency in the service areas as it relates to Honeywell capabilities within the Service/agencies Conduct all activities leading to opportunity identification, qualification including probability of success, develop pursuit strategy, drive the proposal opportunity to successful completion and achieving the Strategic Plan Serve as a principal liaison with all key USAF or Air Force related defense customers Perform ongoing assessments of customer requirements, determine market trends and develop strategies that align the customer’s needs/opportunities with HON capabilities and discriminators Participate in bid decisions, development of cost strategies and phase reviews. alternatively, 15+ years of Federal, DoD business development, capture, and/or operational experience) with a proven track record of success in developing a robust pipeline and generating new business opportunities Understanding insight and influence at the Air Force Materiel Command and its six specialized centers (AF Sustainment Command, AF Lifecycle Management Center, AF Installation and Mission Support Center, AF Nuclear Weapons Center, AF Research Laboratory, AF Test Center) Ability to access and maintain customer relationships with Senior Government officials: Officer and Civilian Leadership, Colonel (O-6), Flag Officer and Senior Executive Service Knowledge of operations, sustainment and mission support across the defense domain including aviation, ground vehicles, unmanned platforms Knowledge of Multi-Domain Operations, ABMS, JADC2, cyber operational mission requirements Deep understanding of DOD requirements, acquisition (JCIDS, DAS, PPBES), sustainment funding and budgeting process and demonstrated ability to shape requirements Ability to navigate non-traditional acquisition strategies to include RCO, SCO, IDIQ and OTAs Strong understanding of federal acquisition regulations, policies and contract vehicles Experience working with DoD prime system contractors/integrators Active TS and ability to achieve TS/SCI Excellent oral and written communication skills Strong strategic and tactical analysis experience Strong leadership, negotiation, and influencing skills Deliver on complex problems without guidance Create and deliver presentations with ease to senior leaders in the government and industry Additional Information JOB ID: req382070 Category: Business Development Location: 550 State Rte 55 PO Box 247,Urbana,Ohio,43078,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. This role acts as the liaison between Customer Experience and the Business. The Leader will use data to drive decisions, lead project work, create solutions and meaningful outcomes in cross collaboration with Customer Service, Technical Support and Learning & Enablement. Key Responsibilities Global Business Enterprise Responsibilities: Single Point of Contact related to all aspects of the Customer Experience (CX) organization (Technical Support, Customer Service, and Learning & Enablement) for the region assigned for Global Business Enterprise (GBE) and managing/following up on all projects/initiatives to ensure full awareness in GBE. Direct engagement and participation in the GBE management operating system, included but not limited to: Monthly Operating Reviews, Weekly Staff Meetings, Management Resource Reviews, and Customer Facing Events. Responsible for managing a holistic GBE CX Scorecard and Point of View related to all CX financial and key metric commitments, driving CX improvements cross-functionally across all GBE customer touchpoints. Seen as the single point of contact for the NPI CX related work. Will assist in the deployment of large projects to customers to help with adoption included but not limited to: Mergers and acquisition, ecommerce, Entitlement Strategy/Channel Partner Programs. Customer Experience & Functional Alignment Responsibilities Serve as the CX spokesperson and representative in cascading and presenting the Honeywell Building Technologies (HBT) CX Strategic Plan throughout the region assigned for GBE. Connected to GBE strategies and annual operating plan (AOP) relating to Technical Support, Customer Service, Learning & Enablement, Integrated Supply Chain, Product Marketing, and Sales. Direct involvement and influence of the CX functions assisting in normal MOS touchpoints with large customers established, standardization efforts, keeping the CX functions on track with the GBE strategic priorities and timelines for CX. Ensure CX performance is being delivered and clearly aligned between HBT CX and GBE in order to exceed customer expectations. Drive Customer Portal adoption in line with the CX Balanced Scorecard. Manage and facilitate a GBE CX Monthly Operating Review with key stakeholders from Technical Support, Customer Service, and Learning & Enablement. While partnering with key stakeholders, will manage, maintain, and execute on all VoC Rolling Action Items Lists (RAIL) relative to the customers overall experience for their assigned region. Ability to operate collaboratively Strong project management skills Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Driving Infinite Possibilities Within a Diversified, Global Organization Honeywell’s Building Technologies (HBT) business is seeking a passionate and energetic global PR leader to drive impactful external communications programs. The Director of External Communications is responsible for creating the communications strategy and program execution aligned to the business’ strategy and goals to position HBT as the leader in the building technologies industry across its global markets. This individual will manage global PR agency relationships and budgets to meet media relations objectives in top tier business and B2B outlets in key regions to maintain and exceed share of voice goals. The ideal candidate will have the ability to counsel senior executives in mission-critical moments, be a purpose-driven storyteller, have strong judgement and a calm demeanor, and manage multiple concurrent high-profile projects. This high visibility, high-profile position is based in Atlanta and will report to Honeywell’s Vice President of External Communications. Honeywell Building Technologies is transforming the way every building operates to help improve the quality of life. We are a leading building controls company with operations in more than 75 countries supported by a global channel partner network. Commercial building owners and operators use our hardware, software and analytics to help create safe, efficient and productive facilities. Our solutions and services are used in more than 10 million buildings worldwide. Roles & Responsibilities Lead global public relations activities (PR) for Honeywell Building Technologies, including support of key organizational initiatives and business needs Partner with HBT’s Global Customer Marketing team to increase brand awareness and support integrated marketing communications campaigns and new product launches with effective public relations strategies Lead public relations (PR) activities, including developing PR strategies, writing press releases, key messages, media statements, Q&A documents, briefing materials, etc. Own and manage HBT’s messaging architecture and brand story across key stakeholders, verticals and businesses and act as a brand steward for the organization Lead executive thought leadership programs and partner with the digital team to create content that can be used across multiple channels, such as social media and company websites Manage industry media relations and support industry events Support efforts to drive top tier media coverage with powerful and creative storytelling Manage agency resources and coordinate with global teams across key geographic regions, including North America, Europe, Middle East, India and Asia Handle crisis communications, issues management and customer communications that could negatively impact the business Measure and analyze the effectiveness of PR efforts and report results to key internal stakeholders, including reach, volume, sentiment, key message delivery and share of voice Manage one direct report 10-15% travel may be required. You Must Have Bachelor’s degree in communications, journalism, public relations or related field 10+ years’ experience in communications or public relations developing and managing global communications plans and programs; agency experience is a plus 3+ years’ experience in managing people A proven record of executing high-impact communications projects and strong media relations expertise We Value Experience working in large, complex organization with diverse products Exceptional attention to detail Exceptional writing and editing skills grounded in AP Style standards, as evidenced by experience and writing samples Strong verbal communications skills, as well as excellent presentation skills Strong business acumen and the ability to strategically interface with and influence key stakeholders, particularly at the executive level Ability to identify, assess, understand and make appropriate recommendations to meet business needs Experience creating effective messaging for a range of audiences Excellent project management skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously Problem solving skills, with specific focus on developing new, creative ways to drive communications in a changing business environment Outstanding interpersonal skills and ability to build teamwork and trust at various levels and teams within the organization Demonstrated leadership skills to lead work groups and teams, as well as working across functions and disciplines Positive attitude and willingness to embrace change Ability to travel 10-15% of the time as needed Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182131 Category: Communications Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

You Must Have Bachelor’s degree in communications, journalism, public relations or related field 10+ years’ experience in communications or public relations developing and managing global communications plans and programs; agency experience is a plus 3+ years’ experience in managing people A proven record of executing high-impact communications projects and strong media relations expertise We Value Experience working in large, complex organization with diverse products Exceptional attention to detail Exceptional writing and editing skills grounded in AP Style standards, as evidenced by experience and writing samples Strong verbal communications skills, as well as excellent presentation skills Strong business acumen and the ability to strategically interface with and influence key stakeholders, particularly at the executive level Ability to identify, assess, understand and make appropriate recommendations to meet business needs Experience creating effective messaging for a range of audiences Excellent project management skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously Problem solving skills, with specific focus on developing new, creative ways to drive communications in a changing business environment Outstanding interpersonal skills and ability to build teamwork and trust at various levels and teams within the organization Demonstrated leadership skills to lead work groups and teams, as well as working across functions and disciplines Positive attitude and willingness to embrace change Ability to travel 10-15% of the time as needed Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182131 Category: Communications Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity Honeywell is a Fortune 100 technology company that delivers industry specific solutions that include aerospace products and services; control technologies for buildings and industry; and performance materials globally. Our technologies help everything from aircraft, buildings, manufacturing plants, supply chains, and workers become more connected to make our world smarter, safer, and more sustainable. The Future Is What You Make It…. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. PMT is a global leader in providing customers with high-performance specialty materials, including fluorine products; specialty films and additives; advanced fibers and composites; intermediates; specialty chemicals; electronic materials and chemicals; and technologies and materials for petroleum refining. Honeywell Performance Materials and Technologies employs approximately 27,000 people at more than 80 manufacturing and sales facilities worldwide. An experienced HR leader who develops and own HR strategy for the business encompassing multiple geographies. You will partner closely with business leaders to develop HR strategy in order to fuel the business growth as well as focusing towards building business capabilities to pivot towards growth & productivity. The HR Leader will actively engage in and lead Business transformation, organization effectiveness and productivity improvement measures for business agility, organizational development & talent management. You will build upon and rely on your HR functional expertise and effectiveness to align critical human resources principles with business objectives. You will align organizational transformations and staffing strategies to promote talent and growth. Your focus will be to help the business to become a customer centric organization and achieve its strategic growth objectives through resource realignment and top grading the talent. You will be responsible to increase the overall performance of the organization by creating strong interactive partnerships with client groups by - Build a workforce that creates a competitive advantage by recruiting, developing and retaining top talent Drive continuous improvement and lead change in a premiere Human Resources organization Partner with senior business & functional leaders to continually drive the effectiveness of the business through developing organization design and leadership changes as appropriate to ensure maximum business success Ensure an ongoing and proactive focus on driving change within the business, linking change management needs, communications, tools and processes with overall business cultural and change direction, in order that the business culture and mindset evolves as required to ensure success Assess the current org. and partner with stakeholders to create a strategy and vision around the development of future state process flows, to identify needed organizational and workflow changes Lead key transition & integration projects in partnership with global and local stakeholders Own and drive talent strategy towards building talent capabilities, strengthening succession, diversity and inclusion. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree required with emphasis in Business, HR, Employment Relations or Organizational Development or related discipline. 10 years progressive professional Human Resources experience 5+ years’ experience in Human Resources leadership/management roles within a global organization WE VALUE Extensive HR experience including strong HR functional expertise and track record of implementing large scale change projects Demonstrated ability in setting strategy, driving performance, consistently producing superior results, cultivating ownership while enforcing company policies and applicable law. Knowledgeable on employment law matters, employment legislation, and compliance Strong communicator with the ability to artfully influence, persuade and drive action. A collaborative management style Proven ability to work effectively cross-functionally with senior levels in the organization Comfortable as a "hands-on" manager and willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills while exercising sound judgement Honesty, integrity, and trust building behaviors in all dealings is essential and required Ability to find the correct balance between demand and capacity when establishing priorities for the organization Ability to artfully convey even subtle or complex messages clearly, as appropriate for the topic and audience Ability to handle multiple priorities and navigate in a highly matrixed environment Previously demonstrated leadership skills Act as a coach and confidant Additional Information JOB ID: req377921 Category: Human Resources Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Human Resources (CORPORATE HR) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges This is a leadership role within the Aerospace ISC Customer Operations (CO) organization. Our organization is a vital link between our external customers and our extended Supply Chain to ensure high quality and delivery performance. This role is one of the most exciting and challenging roles within Integrated Supply Chain, enabling the candidate to interface with all levels of Honeywell Aerospace across the various functions [Customer & Product Support, Customer Business teams, Procurement, Planning & Quality] to drive systemic solutions to support execution of customer requirements. In this role, you will have frequent exposure to our customers and internal HON Leadership. You will be responsible for the interface between the Customer Business Teams and Customer Support teams with our Production and Aftermarket Operations sites and Production Return Order [PRO] sites. You will directly manage your site’s delivery ensuring performance across the extended value stream, including internal and external suppliers, in support of OE customer's deliveries and consolidation of the customer experience. You will lead the site delivery leads to support functions and proactively identify, mitigate, and ultimately prevent issues/risks that impact our ability to meet our customer commitments. Key Responsibilities Build effective teams Ensuring On Time product delivery to meet customer requirements Serving as the escalation point for critical supplier and customer issues Leading internal and customer meetings to present recovery plans, improvement projects, and long-term solutions to meet customer needs Managing long-term part health (supply and demand alignment) and demand flow down Ensuring key ISC communications are delivered to customer business team (CBT) VPs and program management teams Effective communications and coordination between customers, CBTs, and Hon functions Developing & executing improvement projects to improve customer facing performance metrics and surveys With suppliers & sites develop and execute customer ramp up plans (Internal rate readiness) staffing, training, tooling, and capital Carrying out the ISC strategy for sustainment program rate readiness Partnering with ISC Operations Teams, ISC Materials Management, ISC Sourcing, AME, E&T, CSO and other functional groups to ensure ability to address systemic customer issues and to achieve target performance levels across extended value stream Work tactical issues on assigned OE customers in the space of PRO’s and aftermarket support relative to delivery and quality issues Escalate as required to the site tiered accountability meetings to share VOC and help drive site level delivery and quality improvement plans WE VALUE Lean expert or Black belt Six Sigma Greenbelt certified Diverse background including engineering, operations, quality, planning & Customer-facing roles Highly resourceful and results-oriented with a strong bias for action and a keen sense of urgency Strong leadership and influencing skills to drive results in a highly matrixed organization Strong analytical and financial skills Ability to think strategically and scope tasks and influence goal achievement Experience in developing and executing strategy and growth plans for new or modified products or applications Effective coaching, mentoring, and influence skills High energy level with a can-do attitude, enjoy leading a high-performing team Demonstrate ability to communicate and build relationships with employees at all levels Strong written/verbal communication skills in English Demonstrated usage of change management techniques in a business environment Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181758 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 1300 W Warner Rd.,Tempe,Arizona,85284,United States Exempt Engineering (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? At Honeywell, we look for people driven by a desire to contribute, be challenged and grow. Our people make Honeywell a special company and are a key competitive advantage. Honeywell International is a $37 billion diversified technology and manufacturing global leader. Honeywell has more than 113,000 employees in 120 countries around the world and has a demonstrated heritage of innovation and achievement. You will report to the PMT ISC Planning & Logistics VP and not only will you learn from the best, but you will also carve out a space for yourself to show your leadership skills and play an instrumental role in the success of the company. If you enjoy developing innovative supply chain solutions to solve difficult business challenges, this position is for you. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing a team of professionals building & executing the strategic roadmap to improve PMT’s capability in the areas of S&OP, demand planning, supply planning, delivery fulfillment and inventory management. The product portfolio is very diverse and requires different supply chain design models to ensure customer expectations are met. The PMT Business Unit also has several manufacturing models that require different planning frameworks like Engineer to Order, Make to Order, Assemble to Order and Make to Stock. The role will be dedicated to developing and implementing Best Practices within the Business Units (BU’s), including the development and adoption of Rapid Response for Supply and Inventory Planning. Must be capable of translating objectives into a deliverable strategy to achieve business goals and create a competitive advantage for Honeywell to bet the competition. Focusing on building a world-class team, utilizing and deploying Lean Six Sigma techniques, driving continuous improvement activities and achievement of superior performance across all KPIs (Key Performance Initiatives) & metrics. Key Responsibilities Experience developing a strategic roadmap that builds capability in People, Process and Tools Partner with the Corp Planning COE to design and implement World Class Supply and Inventory planning methodologies across Honeywell that meets the different business models Serve as the Supply and Inventory Planning Subject Matter Expert Lead a team of professionals to build organizational capability Continuously develop and improve Supply and Inventory planning methods to improve business results Find standardized leading and lagging indicators across disparate lines of business to improve predictive accuracy Implement standard operating processes across all products and functions that seamlessly work together to deliver exceptional service to the field Coach and mentor planners to increase their skills and capability in preparation for promotion within Honeywell YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's Degree Engineering or Supply Chain 10+ years Management experience leading a team in a complex, matrixed organization 10+ years Inventory & Supply Planning WE VALUE Extensive knowledge of Supply Planning, MRP, Inventory Optimization, PFEP Ability to translate statistical data across the end-to-end planning History of success utilizing multi-echelon inventory optimization Advanced knowledge of SAP/MRP/ERP and Advance Planning tools, i.e. Kinaxis Manufacturing environment Strong understanding and use of KPI and metrics Knowledge of Lean Methodology Industry relevant certifications (i.e. LEAN, CPIM, APICS, Six Sigma) Advanced Degree (MBA or MS) Ability to influence cross-functionally Strong organization and relationship management skills Excellent written & verbal communication Works well in a matrix environment Additional Information JOB ID: req383148 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Supply Chain (CHINA) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. The PMT Business Unit also has several manufacturing models that require different planning frameworks like Engineer to Order, Make to Order, Assemble to Order and Make to Stock. The role will be dedicated to developing and implementing Best Practices within the Business Units (BU’s), including the development and adoption of Rapid Response for Supply and Inventory Planning. Must be capable of translating objectives into a deliverable strategy to achieve business goals and create a competitive advantage for Honeywell to bet the competition. Focusing on building a world-class team, utilizing and deploying Lean Six Sigma techniques, driving continuous improvement activities and achievement of superior performance across all KPIs (Key Performance Initiatives) & metrics. Key Responsibilities Experience developing a strategic roadmap that builds capability in People, Process and Tools Partner with the Corp Planning COE to design and implement World Class Supply and Inventory planning methodologies across Honeywell that meets the different business models Serve as the Supply and Inventory Planning Subject Matter Expert Lead a team of professionals to build organizational capability Continuously develop and improve Supply and Inventory planning methods to improve business results Find standardized leading and lagging indicators across disparate lines of business to improve predictive accuracy Implement standard operating processes across all products and functions that seamlessly work together to deliver exceptional service to the field Coach and mentor planners to increase their skills and capability in preparation for promotion within Honeywell YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's Degree Engineering or Supply Chain 10+ years Management experience leading a team in a complex, matrixed organization 10+ years Inventory & Supply Planning WE VALUE Extensive knowledge of Supply Planning, MRP, Inventory Optimization, PFEP Ability to translate statistical data across the end-to-end planning History of success utilizing multi-echelon inventory optimization Advanced knowledge of SAP/MRP/ERP and Advance Planning tools, i.e. Kinaxis Manufacturing environment Strong understanding and use of KPI and metrics Knowledge of Lean Methodology Industry relevant certifications (i.e. LEAN, CPIM, APICS, Six Sigma) Advanced Degree (MBA or MS) Ability to influence cross-functionally Strong organization and relationship management skills Excellent written & verbal communication Works well in a matrix environment Additional Information JOB ID: req383148 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Supply Chain (CHINA) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. As Supplier Readiness NPD Director you will be integral leader within the Global Supplier Quality Engineering organization creating and executing new product development (NPD) and new supplier strategies that improve quality, delivery and productivity to build world class supply chain. Be a part of team of innovative problem solvers that: Champion operation excellence strategies to systemically improve quality and delivery early in development and transition process. Drive rapid Root Cause Corrective Action (RCCA) investigations to prevent defects and report to senior leadership. Support Customer communication to facilitate and improve Product Quality and delivery. Provide technical leadership to coordinate implementation of advanced quality processes including statistically based variation reduction, risk mitigation, control planning and mistake proofing. Enhance supplier and organization quality culture through coaching and technical engagement. Instill supplier accountability through zero defect plans (ZDP), mistake proofing and advanced product quality planning (APQP) Key Responsibilities Develop and execute NPD and New Supplier strategies through advanced product quality planning (APQP) and supplier development to ensure complete supplier and part readiness which achieves highest quality and uninterrupted supply Coach and lead team of SQE’s and APQP engineers to leverage quality best practices to reduce delivery disruptions, eliminate customer escapes and improve producibility of our products. Sr leadership & customer communications related to supplier quality initiatives and issues. Create cross functional partnerships to enhance supplier quality on NPD & Transitions programs. Drive improvements utilizing Lean methodologies, digitization, analytics and supplier assessments to create world class supply base. Ensure supplier compliance to global QA /FAA standards while driving systematic problem solving and process improvement plans to deliver high performance. Provide technical expertise and leadership to sourcing and development of suppliers with respect to capabilities, performance, quality, cost, and delivery. Develop strong technical capability and growth plans for each team member. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Quality or Manufacturing 10+ years experience in a Quality, Engineering, Manufacturing/Operations 4+ years of people leading Comprehensive knowledge of advanced Quality engineering practices / APQP US Citizen or permanent resident is required due to government contracts. WE VALUE Six Sigma Black Belt or Lean Expert Certification. Knowledge or experience with regulatory requirements and ISO 9000:2000, AS9100 Quality Systems preferred Able to read technical drawings and documentation (GD&T) Willingness to travel Strong communication skills both verbal and written. Experience with project management and Kaizen facilitation. Ability to interface effectively with all levels of leadership. Proven problem-solving skills, including ability to interpret business performance and financial data, define actions, and implement solutions. Excellent team building skills, creating constructive and open environments for sharing ideas. Experience in managing global virtual work groups. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182781 Category: Procurement Location: 21111 N. 19th Ave (Deer Valley),Phoenix,Arizona,85027,United States Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Reporting to the Senior Director Global ISC Logistics, the Director of Global Logistics is a key role in the logistics organization, and one that sets out the vision for the function, the strategy for achieving the vision, and accountability for ensuring its delivery. This role may operate with indirect reporting relationships to regional and/or local logistics operations. As well as determining the vision and direction, it is required to influence and negotiate with other parts of the business, particularly finance and commercial to adopt and support center led logistics recommendations. Key Responsibilities Set out, establish and oversee the logistics strategy and best practices for global logistics processes that enables the physical distribution of products as well as the administrative control and information flow. Own and lead the innovation and continuous improvement agenda for logistics including digital initiatives. Facilitate an environment for the identification of best practices for logistics execution that may be standardized at a global level and uniformly applied at a regional level for the physical distribution of products encompassing warehousing and local distribution. Sponsor for partnerships and sourcing programs with global 3PLs that can be used by the business to deliver outsourced services for warehousing, transport and international logistics. Direct the tactical and operational activities of warehousing and internal freight; or external freight processes. For clarity internal freight is defined as activities relating to preparing and managing freight and freight related productivity within the distribution centers and/or plants and managing to associated KPIs and targets. Whereas external freight is the management and productivity of freight related activities once the shipment has left the distribution center and/or plant, and management of associated KPIs and targets. The two are intrinsically connected. Accountable for management of escalation, through Control Tower or other methods, of issues requiring cross-functional involvement for resolution. Accountable as contributor for requests for proposal in either warehousing or freight related sourcing decisions. Partner with global trade compliance to align on structure and organizational definition and implementation of processes and technology investments. Work with external advisers and internal senior owners of global trade compliance to ensure ongoing governance. Represent and contribute on behalf of the logistics function when the organization engages in strategic projects, business ventures or seeks to expand into emerging and new markets as well as key initiatives surrounding EH&S, and Customer Services. Represent and contribute on behalf of the logistics function when the organization seeks to rationalize, review or invest in technology platforms that affect the logistics organization directly or indirectly. Set out a succession and development plan for the entire logistics organization that encourages investment in skills, the evolution of capabilities and harvesting of the right competencies and talent for the function. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree Supply Chain or Logistics Focused degrees are desirable, or equivalent work experience. Professional memberships such as CILT a plus. Prior experience with TMS deployment required (TMC, BlueJay, Manhattan, Kuebix) Ten+ years' operational logistics experience in relevant industries. Ten+ years' 3PL services provider or freight forwarding industry experience. Excellent level of written and spoken English Ability to travel at short notice and/or work overseas for extended periods of time WE VALUE Ability to articulate the vision and roadmap for logistics development, including prioritization of tasks, allocation of resources and discouraging activities that are not aligned with the vision. Excellent interpersonal and presentation skills in order to communicate effectively across all levels within the organization and multiple cultures. Excellent knowledge of the logistics environment, encompassing global trade compliance, domestic distribution and international logistics. Excellent knowledge of the end-to-end supply chain, with a clarity for understanding the importance and interdependencies associated with each stage of the process — Plan, Source, Make, Deliver. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182889 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity About The Business UOP, a Honeywell company headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a leading international licensor of processing technology and supplier of engineering services, catalysts and adsorbents, equipment, specialty materials and digital solutions for the global refining, gas processing and petrochemical industries. With more than a century of leadership in hydrocarbon processing technologies, UOP has led six revolutions in technology that transformed our industry. UOP is part of Honeywell’s Performance, Materials, Technology Group (PMT). For more information visit www.uop.com. Position Overview As the Director of Global Pricing, you will work closely with marketing and product management, engineering, field sales organization, key business partners and the senior management team, to maximize the profitability of the business. You will manage the pricing strategies and pricing execution as well as serve as the leader and subject matter expert in revamping and implementing existing and new company pricing processes, systems, and tools to better leverage statistical models and sophisticated analytics across our business segments. Key Pricing Focus Products including Catalysts and adsorbents and related services Projects including licensing, engineering and equipment Position Location - Des Plaines, Illinois or Houston, Tx. Relocation may be provided for the right candidate Key Responsibilities As the Director, Global Pricing your responsibilities will include: Pricing Strategy - Analyze market trends and corresponding value-based price strategies with market strategy teams to understand competitive threats and refine approaches for price capture. Pricing Decisions - Partner with Sales leaders to implement pricing strategies including pricing tiers and thresholds to optimize margins. Pricing Execution - Streamline and improve the price delivery, price change and pricing process Pricing Performance Monitoring and Evaluation - Develop comprehensive methodologies using analytical tools and drive robust pricing reporting to provide guidance to senior leadership to enable better decision making (both pre- and post-price changes). Field and Local Pricing collaboration - Lead the Sr Pricing Managers to closely collaborate with field Sales and Customer Service team members in making pricing decisions at the local level that drive margin expansion and maintain competitiveness. Identify Pricing Process Improvement Opportunities - Evaluate ideas, model impact, gain alignment and implement pricing process changes that drive operational efficiencies. Pricing Analytics & Reporting - Develop both strategic reporting analytics and appropriate audit and governance reporting to help drive process improvement and a visual management lens to ensure pricing effectiveness. Pricing System - Ensure the current and future pricing system needs and enhancements are delivered. Strong leadership - Directly lead and manage the pricing group, as well as drive change across the business to help the company culture accelerate pricing acumen and execution YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree 10+ years commercial experience with Sales, Marketing or Finance WE VALUE People Management Experience Experience in petrochemicals, catalysts and adsorbents, O&G Extensive experience in similar pricing leadership role Executive presence in working with senior leaders Technical experience in ERP (SAP) MBA is highly desirable Transactional pricing toolkit and value toolkit experience A proven track record of leading cross-functional teams Demonstrated results in large, complex, matrix organizations Excellent planning, execution and project-management skills Integrative thinker Ability to deliver on complex situations or problems Ability to convey information with clarity and directness Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181956 Category: Marketing Location: 50 E Algonquin Rd,Des Plaines,Illinois,60017-5016,United States Exempt Business Services Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Deliver business value through Right and Fast partnership Intelligrated is a ~$2.5B global business and part of the ~$8B Safety and Productivity Solutions (SPS) Strategic Business Group of Honeywell. Honeywell Intelligrated (IGS) designs, manufactures, integrates and installs complete material handling automation solutions, including conveyor, IntelliSort® sortation, Alvey® palletizers, Honeywell Robotics, automated storage and retrieval systems, and voice- and light-directed picking technologies — all managed by advanced machine controls and our best-in-class Momentum™ warehouse execution system. By drawing on an ever-expanding portfolio and deep industry expertise, we provide best-fit, scalable solutions to help businesses optimize and manage their entire fulfillment processes, from receiving to shipping — and everything in between. The Connected Distribution Center from Honeywell Intelligrated is designed to help companies make the digital transformation from manual to automated processes and keep up with the rapidly escalating pace of modern commerce demands. Through the seamless integration of sensors, controls, automation and labor, we’re providing the real-time business intelligence to help our customers make informed business decisions, ensure worker safety, and maximize equipment uptime and lifecycles. From concept and integration to industry-leading lifecycle support services, Honeywell Intelligrated is committed to our customers’ successes — delivering sustained distribution and fulfillment productivity and continual performance improvements through increased flexibility, efficiency and accuracy. We back every project with 24X7 multilingual technical support and access to lifecycle support services through a network of national, regional and local service centers. Drive a continuous improvement culture through Six Sigma methodology. Drive Technical Resource review and planning. Talent Development and Ownership of Training for new Project Engineers to scale their capabilities faster. Ability to forge solid relationships and manage across a broad and geographically dispersed business Proven capacity to be effective in a complex global business environment. Experience in setting standards Organized and able to manage multiple priorities effectively. Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills. Demonstrated analytical, business planning and problem-solving skills. Ability to identify issues, requirements, and opportunities for improvement. Honeywell Process Solutions (HPS) is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. Honeywell Process Solutions (HPS) plays a critical role across the entire lifecycle of an industrial facility, including Project design and engineering, Technology licensing, Technical services, Ongoing operations, Cybersecurity, and Continuous modernization. As leader in digitization. Our comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. The Sales Excellence team in HPS has a mission to drive sales functional excellence by providing the sales organization with processes, training, tools and information to achieve top performance in their respective roles and differentiate ourselves in the process industry market. In line with the above, the Director of Sales Excellence manages the sales excellence organization for the Project & Automation Solutions, and Lifecycle Solution & Services of the Honeywell Process Solutions Business Unit to drive profitable revenue growth through enablement of sales teams with skills and knowledge, data, insights, tools, behaviors, processes and incentives which lead to higher sales productivity. The position also leads coordinating efforts between stakeholders and other functional groups to ensure alignment and profitable business growth. Key Responsibilities The Sales Excellence Director directly supports the Sales organization and act as liaison between sales and other functional groups such as offering management, customer marketing, finance, HR, IT and service with focus on: Lead and continue to build a strong Sales Excellence team for HPS Systems businesses, PAS and LSS, attracting, developing and retaining strong talent and developing strong succession planning. Coach, mentor, and ensure training and development plans are in place for people under his/her responsibility. Plan for succession, manage team performance. Lead and continuously improve the HPS System Management Operating System (MOS), including short-term and long-term focus on key metrics, including but not limited to pipeline growth and quality, in-person and customer meetings, attracting and retaining top Sales talent. Promote simplification and automation of the sale’s operational tools, sales processes, and metrics across HPS System, facilitating adoption and understanding by sellers and sales leaders. Drive insights via data and analytics that inform leadership at multiple levels on how to drive sales performance, gain new accounts and expand existing customer pocket share. Plan strategies, programs, budget (AOP), workshops and other activities to enable sales organization to achieve top performance and win more. Improve sales processes, tools, competencies, behaviors and incentives with standards that align across the larger business group(s) Drive pipeline and lead-to-revenue management resulting in faster sales velocity and higher win rates. Analyze, identify opportunities for improvement, and communicate Pipeline, Forecasts and Sales Behavior Index metrics. Provide reliable data, scorecards and insights for Sales Management, Senior Management and other requesting departments. Promote simplification and automation of the sale’s operational tools and metrics across HPS, facilitating option and understanding by seller and sales leaders. Partner with PMT and HPS enablement leaders and partner to drive the “hire to retire” sales development planning, including sales onboarding process, sales skills and technical training, and career development. Promote specific training certifications, such as solution and enterprise selling, based on business requirements. Build competencies for account planning, demand generation, pipeline management, and winning ratio Work with Sales Leadership to maximize effectiveness of the Sales Incentive Program by defining quota metrics and implementation criteria. Coordinate quota deployment with HPS Sales Operations Manager YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s degree 10+ years of experience in customer facing roles (e.g. sales, business development, marketing), including leadership experience in sales management and / or business development 3+ years in Sales Excellence or Sales Operation 5+ years of experience in Matrix organizations covering multiple business lines 5+ year Functional and cross-functional team leadership experience WE VALUE Cultural awareness and can work across geographies within a diverse team. Experience in positions with global scope Extensive Sales Support experience especially in sales operations or sales excellence Ability to work in a fast-paced, highly matrixed environment Excellent communication skills at executive levels Strong influencing skills to gain alignment and achieve results. Strong change management experience Good interpersonal and presentation skills Ability to direct, lead and motivate others Significant Management/Supervisory experience MBA with a strong understanding of business drivers Six Sigma certification. The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. Experience in discrete (electronics, etc.) manufacturing AND process (chemical) manufacturing industries.
