jobDescription: Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Connect with us and design the world's most advanced avionics within the Electronic Solutions Platform Organization where we have an immediate need for a top-performing Advanced Electrical Engineer to join our elite team that will innovate and create the hardware electronics that Aerospace runs on. We are seeking someone who brings the right experience leading hardware avionics-based designs within the Anthem / Thunderbolt Team. This position is in Phoenix Deer Valley, Arizona. Key Responsibilities Supports one or more complex Product / Module development assignments, including supporting system trades, and negotiating module requirements derived from system requirements, developing architectures, completing design, analysis, and testing in an engineering laboratory setting. Collaborates with a global, multi-disciplinary team of systems, software, IC/FPGA design, and mechanical engineers. Partners to reach effective solutions to medium to low complexity electrical engineering problems. Develop and improve work practices - tailor best design practices and guidelines to ensure efficiency on given project task while ensuring design compliance and producibility. Assist product / process certification and ensure project and product compliance YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor of Science Degree in Engineering Minimum of 4 years’ experience in hardware electrical / product design and / or test WE VALUE Bachelor of Science in Electrical, Aerospace or Computer Science Engineering. Experience with modern processing technologies and architectures including micro-processors, FPGAs, memories, and high-speed IO and / or with product level analog / linear circuits including signal conditioning, data conversion (analog-to-digital and digital-to-analog). Experience designing, simulating, analyzing, and verifying design performance to requirements. Experience with Mentor Graphics X-petition Enterprise Design Flow, Mathcad, MS Excel, and LT-Spice is a plus. Experience performing Product / LRU and Printed Board Assembly (PBA) design verification and qualification. Knowledge of DO-254, Design Assurance Guidance for Airborne Electronic Hardware and RTCA DO-160 Qualification Guidelines is a plus. Knowledgeable in project estimation and planning. Ability to influence cross-functional teams to deliver optimal solutions. Additional Information JOB ID: req379642 Category: Engineering Location: 21111 N. 19th Ave (Deer Valley),Phoenix,Arizona,85027,United States Exempt Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. Engineering (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell Intelligrated is a ~$2.5B global business and part of the ~$8B Safety and Productivity Solutions (SPS) Strategic Business Group of Honeywell. Honeywell Intelligrated (IGS) designs, manufactures, integrates and installs complete intelligent automated material handling solutions that drive fulfillment productivity for retailers, manufacturers and logistics providers around the world. By drawing on an ever-expanding portfolio and deep industry expertise, we provide best-fit, scalable solutions to give businesses a competitive edge and optimize and manage their entire fulfillment processes, from receiving to shipping — and everything in between. Provide reliable technical assistance to internal and external customers. You will provide professional coverage of Technical Support Helpdesk with a specific focus on PLC-controlled machines and subsystems. You will support focus on accuracy, timely feedback, and customer satisfaction. You will drive timely identification, investigation, resolution, root cause analysis and replication of technical issues. You will build internal relationships to expedite complicated cases. You will develop broad understanding of customer needs. You will support the knowledge-sharing mindset, methodology, and tools. You will help develop Technical Support processes. You will ensure proper documenting and recording of all activity and communication. You will address systemic coordination issues. Key Responsibilities Be part of a team that is solving complex technical problems for the customer Provide highly complex engineering technical support to internal and external clients Learn to apply highest standards of customer support Build business acumen while learning to address customer's technical needs Willingness to travel less than 10% YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors Degree in Engineering WE VALUE At least 1 year of experience with PLCs At least 1 year of experience troubleshooting electrical issues At least 1 year of experience reading, reviewing, interpreting electrical schematics Customer facing experience Experience in the industry is preferred Ability to mentor/Educate younger engineers Ability to focus on relevant information and identify and execute on key details Capability to apply broad knowledge of one professional discipline or advanced knowledge of specific technical/operational practices Ambitious and able to work with little supervision by consistently taking the initiative to get things done Experience with C programming languages Experience with VFDs, electric motors, and sensing devices Ability to consistently make and execute timely decisions even in the face of complexity Dexterity to evaluate, recommend, and implement technical solutions based on standard or accepted technical practices Ability to quickly analyze, incorporate, and apply new information and concepts Experience programming and installing Allen-Bradley PLCs, Siemens PLCs, Panel View (HMI), and/or Lenze PLCs Experience with SQL, creating queries, and data analysis Excellent interpersonal and verbal & written communication skills Strong continuous improvement mindset, strong leadership impact Demonstrated experience with Knowledge Management & Call Center This position will fulfill a role performing emissions and bleed air testing of Honeywell gas turbine engine and auxiliary power units. You will work closely with the emissions and bleed team and internal Honeywell customer to execute testing under direct supervision. Aspects of the job include preparation and installation of emissions analyzers into mobile test facilities, coordination and execution of testing, and communicating (verbal and written) the results to the internal Honeywell customer. Responsibilities will also require active participation in and support of the Lab group's activities, goal execution, and maintaining high performance metrics. This role may also support activities in other areas of the Chemistry lab when workload allows. A highly task-oriented individual with a high tolerance for rapidly changing priorities Contributes to technical and process improvement initiatives. Able to efficiently resolve ambiguous project objectives where significant complexity exists. Honeywell Performance Materials and Technologies (PMT) is a global leader in providing customers with high-performance specialty materials, including fluorine products; specialty films and additives; advanced fibers and composites; intermediates; specialty chemicals; electronic materials and chemicals; and technologies and materials for petroleum refining. PMT employs approximately 27,000 people at more than 80 manufacturing and sales facilities worldwide. The Engineering/Maintenance Manager is responsible for directly overseeing and providing technical support for plant engineering and maintenance activities for the Fombell, PA site. This position will interface with production supervisors, process/project engineers, HSE Leadership, and maintenance employees in addition to Honeywell Corporate resources. They will also be responsible for management and oversite of the Fombell site capital project program. The Engineering/Maintenance manager will also supervise the Fombell engineers and maintenance team. Position Responsibilities: Supervise Fombell engineers and maintenance employees, providing leadership, coaching, and developing the team. Provide feedback, including midyear and annual reviews for the Fombell maintenance team. Provide leadership in capital planning, annual operating plans, and capital projects. Work with and provide leadership to maintenance teams in establishing and maintaining a robust Preventive Maintenance Optimization program. Track and report out site OEE performance by month. Direct, review and approve temporary repairs and modifications to equipment - (e.g., piping repairs, rotating equipment, MOC's, etc.). Develop and improve proactive equipment reliability strategies (Reliability Control Plans). Develop, maintain, and update maintenance documentation (e.g., repair reports, bill of materials, upgrade recommendations) for critical plant equipment. Manage Capital appropriation process, including report-out and metrics tracking. Work with engineers and supervisors to ensure that process improvements and capital work are done correctly. Assist with rotating equipment vibration analysis and condition monitoring data interpretation, recommend actions based on these analyses. Using Root Cause Analysis, 5-Y, Failure Mode Effects Analysis, and other tools, provide analysis of failed equipment to determine and eliminate cause(s). Actively identify and eliminate waste in plant processes, procedures, and normal work activities. Actively participate in helping to improve the work environment through cleanliness, good housekeeping, and adherence to all environmental, health and safety policies. YOU MUST HAVE BS in Mechanical, Chemical, or Electrical Engineering (or related engineering field). Minimum 8 years of manufacturing engineering experience. Minimum 3 years of managing direct reports. WE VALUE Mechanical machinery design selection, repair techniques & performance assessment experience. Six Sigma Green Belt Certified preferred. Experience in Total Productive Maintenance (TPM). Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Excellent organizational, planning and verbal/written communication skills. Self-motivated and goal-oriented individual with proven success working independently and in a multi-functional team environment. Proficient use of MS Office Suite of software products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.). Knowledge of engineering materials chemical compatibility and application as relates to plant equipment reliability. Knowledge and practical experience in the application of various welding practices. Hands-on experience using SAP work management system or similar. Practical experience facilitating Root Cause Failure Analysis and Failure Mode and Effects Analysis utilizing a selection of industry standard tools. Working knowledge of project management including Front End Loading (FEL), drafting, and project planning software (e.g., AutoCAD, Visio, MS Project, Primavera, etc.).

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Lead, develop and motivate a talented engineering team responsible for the development of Honeywell's intelligrated products. You will leverage your technical experience and skills to guide your team in the investigation and solution of challenging technical problems. You will use your leadership abilities to motivate and energize teams that are designing new or modifying existing products, parts, or processes while using advanced standards, methodologies, and tools. By collaborating with customers and broader engineering teams, you will balance team workload and drive exceptional team performance with high impact for the business. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors Degree in Engineering WE VALUE Significant experience in the field or in a related area Some demonstrated leadership experience in coordinating and overseeing entry to senior level professionals Proven track of leading teams to successful project delivery Track record of improving team performance and work practice through team coaching Competence to convey subtle or complex messages clearly, as appropriate for the topic and audience Ability to consistently make timely decisions and balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness, even in the face of complexity Solid knowledge of specific product and process technologies or broad knowledge of multiple product and process technologies Individuals who are self-motivated and able to work with little supervision, who consistently take the initiative to get things done Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181943 Category: Engineering Location: 7901 Innovation Way,Mason,Ohio,45040,United States Exempt Business Services Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing, and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Of Duties Supervises the activities of engineering/laboratory technologists and/or highly skilled production and inspection employees engaged in various phases of conducting and evaluating environmental or nondestructive tests, calibrating and maintaining environmental and nondestructive testing equipment, and/or conducting precision measurement utilizing coordinate measuring machines, and in calibrating and maintaining environmental and nondestructive testing equipment May supervise employees in one or more fabrication or material production functions or Precision Measurement / X-Ray Trains or provides training for laboratory employees Sets appropriate schedules and priorities and controls quality and costs Suggests and effects changes, improvements and new laboratory technologies, methods, and equipment in accordance with quality objectives Coordinates activities with, product process, metrology and gage engineer, production control, inspection supervision, and design agencies and others to improve testing services Promotes and supports continuous improvement and employee involvement activities Directly supervises employees and performs other managerial responsibilities including interviewing, hiring, and training associates; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining associates; addressing complaints and resolving problems May perform other duties as required You Must Have Must have or be able to obtain a DOE security clearance US Citizenship required for obtaining and maintaining a government security clearance Bachelor's degree in engineering, engineering technology, science, manufacturing operations, supply chain or related technical/business field Two or more years’ experience in engineering, manufacturing, or a quality function Two or more years’ experience leading a staff and/or project team We Value Experience reflective of ability to read complex laboratory, precision measurement, X-ray, and related instructions Working knowledge of production planning methods, quality operations, and laboratory protocol Experience with measurement equipment and interpretation of measurement error Experience with manufacturing X-ray equipment and operation Experience with Coordinate Measuring Machines (CMM) Strong computer aptitude including ability to manage and interpret technical data Strong organizational and project planning and project management skills Evidence of ability to communicate on multiple levels, including upper management and design agency stakeholders Familiarity working with bargaining unit staff and contract FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req382301 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 14520 Botts Road,Kansas City,Missouri,64147,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Professional and courteous communication Strong organizational skills Excellent computer literacy in a variety of Microsoft and web based programs Highly dependable and trustworthy and able to manage conflicting priorities and deadlines Some administrative assistant experience Associate's degree preferred Additional Information JOB ID: req382199 Category: Business Management Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Nonexempt Customer Experience (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Honeywell Process Solutions is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. A leader in digitization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. Support the development of on-site installation, servicing and repair processes of complex equipment and systems. You will provide technical presentations to an audience of customers, other industry peers and competitors. You will support revision and correction of work instructions and customer-facing training guides used by field installation specialists. You will drive continuous improvement initiatives in the processes related to field services and product development. You will support cross-functional groups to quickly fix any administrative difficulties relating to delivery and installation of proper equipment. You will act as an escalation point for Field Service Specialists, Service Engineers, and other stakeholders. Key Responsibilities Validate customer request Educate customer and field technicians Write documentation used by field technicians Ensure Right and Fast Delivery YOU MUST HAVE High school diploma with experience in the field WE VALUE Previous industry experience Previous technical/installation experience Previous customer service experience Good written and oral communication Advanced Degree Good presentation skills Job Location: Demopolis, AL HPS202020 hwllLSS2022 Additional Information JOB ID: req367889 Category: Customer Experience Location: HON LOC NOT AVAIL IN STATE,Alabama,Alabama,99999,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Honeywell Process Solutions is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. A leader in digitization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. Responsible for providing Field Service Support for Honeywell HPS applications and products at customer locations. You will perform maintenance, audits, configuration, programming, installation/commissioning, upgrades, and migration of complex/advanced Honeywell control systems (EXPERION PKS, TPS/TDC300). You will be the primary face of Honeywell for the customer in this role responsible for the daily implementation, administration and troubleshooting of the Honeywell HPS products installed at the customer location. You will be required to develop and maintain strong interpersonal relationships with customer representative as well as provide first response technical support. You will work with the Field Services Manager and LSS business functions to maintain and grow the business by identifying customer needs and provided solutions based on the HPS suite of products and services. Key Responsibilities DCS Maintenance including Hardware Components Software Components Field Troubleshooting of common IO and Loop Problems Field Troubleshooting of End Devices Adding and Deletion of TAGS/Points Adding and Modifying Logic as per standard Working with voltages up to 110VAC and 40VDC Configure, maintain, and solve Honeywell hardware and software issues including: Experion PKS, other DCS hardware / software such as LCN, TPS. Learn the end-to-end product/solution development and delivery/execution of Honeywell products and solutions Troubleshooting Network Connections of Ethernet and Coaxial Cabling Modifying and editing HMI Graphics Focal Point for Honeywell with the customer on providing technical solutions You Must Have Associates Degree in a Technical/Engineering Field 1-3 years of experience We Value Experience with Experion PKS Hardware & Software, in addition to Hiway, TDC, & TPS system experience including LCN, UCN, and Hiway equipment along with PC/Networking experience. 3rd Party controls experience Experience in Virtualization hardware/software, setup and network configuration Knowledge of Open Systems such as Microcomputers and Networking Technologies Strong written and verbal communication skills. Must be able to clearly articulate messages both technical and non-technical. Experience & Training in Honeywell Applications such as: TPS / PMIO. EPKS / Series C. Advanced Applications (PHD etc.). Safety Systems (FSC/SM). HMI. SCADA (PLCSs, Ladder Logic etc.). Be self-motivated and willing to work in demanding environments with little or no supervision and take initiative to be proactive. hwllLSS2022 Additional Information JOB ID: HRD177417 Category: Customer Experience Location: 350 Pine St Ste250,Beaumont,Texas,77701,United States Nonexempt Customer Experience (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity Intelligrated is a ~$2.5B global business and part of the ~$8B Safety and Productivity Solutions (SPS) Strategic Business Group of Honeywell. Honeywell Intelligrated (IGS) designs, manufactures, integrates and installs complete material handling automation solutions, including conveyor, IntelliSort® sortation, Alvey® palletizers, Honeywell Robotics, automated storage and retrieval systems, and voice- and light-directed picking technologies — all managed by advanced machine controls and our best-in-class Momentum™ warehouse execution system. By drawing on an ever-expanding portfolio and deep industry expertise, we provide best-fit, scalable solutions to help businesses optimize and manage their entire fulfillment processes, from receiving to shipping — and everything in between. The Connected Distribution Center from Honeywell Intelligrated is designed to help companies make the digital transformation from manual to automated processes and keep up with the rapidly escalating pace of modern commerce demands. Through the seamless integration of sensors, controls, automation and labor, we’re providing the real-time business intelligence to help our customers make informed business decisions, ensure worker safety, and maximize equipment uptime and lifecycles. From concept and integration to industry-leading lifecycle support services, Honeywell Intelligrated is committed to our customers’ successes — delivering sustained distribution and fulfillment productivity and continual performance improvements through increased flexibility, efficiency and accuracy. We back every project with 24X7 multilingual technical support and access to lifecycle support services through a network of national, regional and local service centers. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell Intelligrated is a leading North American-based, single-source provider of intelligent automated material handling solutions that drive fulfillment productivity for retailers, manufacturers and logistics providers around the world. Through a broad portfolio of automation equipment, software, service and support, Intelligrated solutions give businesses a competitive edge and optimize operational performance through increased flexibility, efficiency and accuracy. Role is 100% travel. Willing to work overtime as needed, nights and weekends. Key Responsibilities Adjust, repair, and replace components like belts, cables, wheels, pulleys, gearboxes, sprockets, chains, bearings, guide rollers, hydraulic and pneumatic systems, and AC/DC electrical motors, drives and other related equipment. Maintain and perform troubleshooting on electrical and mechanical conveyor systems, sorters, cranes, printer applicators, motors, photo eyes, relays, proximity sensors, solenoids, VFD’s, motor starters, control panels, tachometers, encoders, etc. with a focus on safety, quality, and efficiency using tools such as multi-meters, infrared thermometers, and a laptop. Follow appropriate job plans, procedures, and manuals. Utilize handheld devices and asset management system mobile apps to create and close Work Orders with appropriate data (labor hours, downtime, problem/cause/remedy, and parts used). Follow appropriate safety procedures and use Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) while maintaining equipment (Lock Out/Tag Out, Arc Flash, etc.) and ensure a safe work environment by eliminating potential equipment safety hazards. Basic PC competency and ability to use mobile apps on handheld devices. Familiar with simple wiring diagrams, symbols, and electrical measuring. Mechanical work with gearboxes, sprockets, chains, bearings, guide rollers, hydraulic and pneumatic systems, and AC/DC electrical motors, drives and other related equipment. Physical Demands (must be able to perform with or without reasonable accommodation): Regular bending, lifting, stretching, and reaching both below the waist and above the head. Walking within and around the site with great frequency. Able to work at heights and ability to climb ladders safely and without limitations. Full manual dexterity in both hands and wrists, eye/hand coordination and feet motion. Ability to stand/walk for up to 10-12 hours. Flexibility in covering multiple shifts and holiday hours as required. The FSE I will have primary focus on mechanical and electro-mechanical assignments once deemed qualified to make stand-alone service calls. The FSE I will work toward supporting PLC and HMI programming assignments, network set up and troubleshooting. The FSE I will work independently on I/O commissioning and moderate logic modifications. YOU MUST HAVE High School Valid Driver's License WE VALUE Degree from a vocational school or college with a focus in the Mechanical or Electrical field. 4 years apprenticeship or equivalent experience in the Mechanical or Electrical field. Understand basic electrical and electronic schematics. Experience with automated conveyor systems and controls. Experience with Programmable Logic Control (PLC) programs, Servo drives, PC controllers, VFD’s, dc power supplies, optical devices (i.e., encoders, photo eyes, etc.). Ability to troubleshoot basic Input/Output functions. #CB #Intelligrated #INDENG Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181395 Category: Customer Experience Location: Indiana,United States Exempt Early Career (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Must be able to clearly articulate messages both technical and non-technical. Experience & Training in Honeywell Applications such as: TPS / PMIO. EPKS / Series C. Advanced Applications (PHD etc.). Safety Systems (FSC/SM). HMI. SCADA (PLCSs, Ladder Logic etc.). Be self-motivated and willing to work in demanding environments with little or no supervision and take initiative to be proactive. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Honeywell Process Solutions is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. A leader in digitization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. We are searching for top candidates for our Field Service Engineer I position located in Southwest,WA. Key Responsibilities Provide customer with technical and consulting support; understand customers key processes and economic drivers and translate those into business opportunities. Understand Honeywell’s technical product line and provide customer with guidance on application, life cycle management, best practices, benefits, savings / cost and other factors influencing business direction. Perform process analysis and optimization Performs technical planning, system integration, verification, cost and risk, and supportability and effectiveness analyses for total systems. Analyses are performed at all levels of total system product to include: concept, design, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance, and disposal. Troubleshoot, repair, system problems using standard test equipment and hand tools Support client server architecture Perform upgrades both hardware and software Assist clients with third party vendor communication to our systems Observe functionality of installed equipment or system to detect hazards Repair and troubleshoot control and signal circuits and Identify discrepancies Support and troubleshoot LAN / WAN communications, including Honeywell FTE Perform audits and baselines of installed systems as a deliverable as well as for migrations Be able to respond to emergency calls and resolve them within the guidelines that meet or exceed our contract customer expectations and requirements. Team Player, comfortable with being the lead or support person on site. The ability to accurately document work performed. Demonstrate excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills. Perform preventative and corrective maintenance of system hardware/software Provide technical support to customers and serve as customer contact for service-related issues Willing to travel within the local region when called upon for remote customers. You Must Have High School Diploma or GED Equivalent Dependable Transportation Ability to learn - On the Job Training 2 years’ experience in a mill environment or equivalent of process manufacturing We Value Experience working in industrial manufacturing and processing facilities Bachelors or AA degree in an Engineering field preferred PC & Networking Skills Strong understanding of real-time industrial process control If you are a dynamic, successful, driven professional, Honeywell is the company that will further your experience and career growth. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell International is a $40 billion diversified technology and manufacturing global leader. Honeywell has more than 130,000 employees in 70 countries around the world and has a demonstrated heritage of both innovation and achievement. UOP, a Honeywell Company, designs, licenses, and services process technology for the petroleum refining, gas processing and petrochemical industries worldwide. UOP also develops and manufactures catalysts, molecular sieves, adsorbents, specialty materials, and performance equipment. This Finance Director position (located in Des Plaines, IL or Houston, TX) will be the key finance partner supporting the Integrated Supply Chain (ISC) business within UOP. The Finance Director will play a critical role in supporting this business via providing financial oversight, analysis and support with an operational and strategic growth mindset. This individual’s key work partner will be the ISC business VP and he will have significant exposure across the UOP leadership team. This position is viewed as the CFO/COO of the ISC business and will report to the VP Finance for Performance Materials & Technologies (PMT). Responsibilities Include Develop various financial reporting and analysis, forecasts, budgets, and variance analysis Complete ad-hoc analysis as requested to support ISC Perform finance functions in support of UOP business which may include broader financial reporting, budget reporting and management, and cost savings actions tracking Financial modeling of proposed new offers, business models, and go-to-market strategies Perform valuation modeling for potential M&A activity Be a global strategic finance leader actively working with the leadership team to achieve desired financial metrics across the organization. Lead month end close and forecasting processes Interface with UOP staff to ensure proper controls and compliance with GAAP Prepare and present Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and 5-Year Strategic Plan (STRAP) summary; operationalize targets into an action-oriented plan Review relevant industry and market information to form an understanding of current and future operating environment to provide key insight on decision-making Develop and provide key business metrics, indicators, and financial interpretations Identify pricing opportunities and work with business to execute This role can be based in either Des Plaines, IL or Houston, TX (Relocation assistance may be offered for qualified candidates) You Must Have BS in Finance or Accounting 10+ years finance and accounting experience Plant experience Cost Accounting We Value MBA or CPA preferred Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong business-partnering skills “Start-Up” business mindset Strong business and financial acumen Ability to think outside the box and create structure, processes, financial reporting from scratch Comfort working with and partnering with executive management to collectively drive business decisions Excellent communication and coordination skills Knowledge of SAP modules and Hyperion Financial Management (HFM) system preferred Microsoft Office Suite knowledge (PowerPoint and strong Excel Skills) P&L/Balance Sheet Budgeting and Forecasting experience Ability to manage several projects at once, and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment High sense of urgency and ability to juggle multiple assignments and meet tight deadlines Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181732 Category: Finance Location: 50 E Algonquin Rd,Des Plaines,Illinois,60017-5016,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Are you ready to become a futureshaper? Honeywell International, Inc. is seeking a Finance Manager role for our El Paso location. As a result, several transition projects into El Paso over the last 12 – 24 months, this site location has grown over 30% in capacity and is considered a strategic location. This role is an integral part of the HBT ISC Team and supports multiple GBE’s with a combined annual revenue through El Paso facility of over $600M+ (BMS 300M, Fire $182M & Security $124M). This position will report directly info Global Fire & Security and dotted line to BMS Leadership Teams. Key Responsibilities Supporting the financial landscape, speed, quality, and cost efficiency of business operations through budgeting, forecasting, financial analysis, and reporting. Consolidating HBT ISC – El Paso financial results, preparing month-end reporting for Corporate and the HBT Leadership team, serving as liaison with HBT ISC BAP, and supporting core FP&A processes including annual operating plan, STRAP, and formal forecast. Develop forecasting tools to drive visibility and mitigate risks with a key focus on Volume/Mix forecasting accuracy, Standard Margin erosion, and Working Capital reduction. Support key business growth and commercial initiatives across HBT (Fire, BMS, Security). Assist HBT ISC business leaders with driving financial performance and designing and implementing financial strategies to achieve committed business performance. Develop integrated revenue and expense analyses, projections, reports, and presentations. Serve as part of a team that creates and analyzes monthly, quarterly, and annual reports to ensure financial information has been recorded accurately. Drive working capital improvement across the sites via robust project pipelines and execution of key activities to reduce inventory. Support transition projects of factories/distribution centers, handle the financials, and partner with operations to ensure execution of the project within the allocated budget and deliver savings to the organization. Complete annual standard costing activities of manufacturing and distribution operations Manage fixed assets and annual verification process as required by company policy Actively engage in inventory management to optimize inventory levels, including the review of proper physical location within facility, slow moving analysis, and quarterly inactive, obsolete surplus review Approximately 10% of domestic/international travel is required. Position Purpose As a mid-level Professional in Program Accounting, the successful candidate will partner closely with customer business teams, program management and accounting to forecast and manage long-term engineering contracts. This includes supporting financial forecasts (short range outlooks, formal forecasts, annual plan) and periodic program reviews (EACs). Working in a team environment, the individual will develop the knowledge and experience to advise Engineering Program Teams on proper accounting for long-term projects and the related financial implications. The team continually evaluates our standard processes, so there are many opportunities to contribute to improvements and demonstrate technical skills. Position Responsibilities Track budget and program financial data, analyze program risk Learn the principles of Accounting for long-term engineering contracts. Work with program teams to ensure proper project set-up Coordinate monthly process of updating project Estimate to Complete in SAP Communicate with Program Teams to guide and resolve issues related to Program Accounting Support external and internal audits and Balance Sheet Reviews Implement and manage change when necessary to meet team goals Conduct financial due diligence and apply accounting procedures while also gathering and analyzing data Seek methods to enhance overall efficiency and performance Think Globally, work closely with support teams, and other regions Share knowledge and ensure consistency as we bring additional site support under the Phoenix RFC. Review, analyze, streamline and standardize department processes, work instructions, business practices You Must Have Bachelor degree in Accounting or Finance 3+ years of directly related accounting/financial analysis experience Due to defense contract related work, must be a U.S. Citizen We Value Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles and business processes Strong written and verbal communications skills, with ability to quickly and positively influence others Ability to deal tactfully and confidently with customers/personnel at all organizational levels in independent and often stressful and ambiguous situations Project management skills; ability to effectively participate and/or lead projects/teams Effective listening skills, and flexibility in approach to solutions Strong analytical, problem solving, decision making and organization skills Innovative; focus on process improvement Ability to work flexible hours to meet monthly/quarterly closing requirements Experience in Excel and Access SAP Experience preferred Additional Information JOB ID: req369383 Category: Finance Location: 1944 E Sky Harbor Circle,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United States Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who create the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe, and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. We offer amazing opportunities for career growth with a world-class team of diverse experts. Our benefits are industry leading with a premier 401k match, parental leave, flexible 3/2 work from home schedule, unlimited PTO and more. “Climb to Flight Level 350,” the first officer replies to Air Traffic Control as they reach up to change the altitude on the mode control panel. As they turn the knob, signals are sent to digital brains called Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGA) or Application-Specific Integrated Circuit (ASIC) inside the panel. These FPGAs/ASICs interpret the commands from the panel and are part of a larger complex system that will command the engines and flight controls to climb the aircraft to Flight Level 350. Our front-end FPGA/ASIC team provides the brains behind these brains. Be part of a team that designs, verifies, integrates, and tests complex avionics products within Honeywell Aerospace. You will work on new products in support of the organization's business strategies. You will be responsible for coding, running simulations, synthesis, and creating test benches and documentation. Are you ready to help us make the future? Key Responsibilities Design and Simulation Conduct Code Synthesis Integration and Test Support Prepare Documentation YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree in Engineering Must be a U.S. Citizen due to contractual requirements - no dual citizenship WE VALUE University level experience in ASIC/FPGA development Working knowledge of digital design is an advantage Working knowledge of VHDL or Verilog, both are desirable Ability to use Linux or Unix workstations Basic knowledge of the ASIC/FPGA design tools: simulators, STA tools, synthesis, etc. Good communication skills (verbal and written) Computer and web navigation skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Internet Explorer) Self-starter, motivated and takes initiative and able to work independently Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181982 Category: Engineering Location: 21111 N. 19th Ave (Deer Valley),Phoenix,Arizona,85027,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Early Career (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity Honeywell’s Future HR Leaders program enables participants to grow their careers in HR through a variety of focused rotational & learning experiences and global exposure making them Future HR Leaders at Honeywell. You will utilize your HR functional expertise to support critical human resources objectives. Gain Hands-on experience solving real current business challenges. During our summer internship you will lead impactful initiatives designed around our HR priorities, own defined projects end-to-end, make significant contributions, and be afforded the opportunity to present results to leadership. Key Responsibilities Promote and advance teamwork and continuous process improvements to achieve business unit's objectives and goals Take a leadership role in organizational design, transformation, and change management Lead efforts to drive and increase in diversity and inclusive through various projects and initiatives Build relationships cross-functionally Increase the overall performance of the organization by creating strong interactive partnerships with client groups. Drive and provide data driven insights and actions to improve organizational effectiveness Build a workforce that creates a competitive advantage by recruiting, developing, and retaining top talent Drive continuous improvement and effects change in a premiere HR organization Resolves moderately complex issues related to the development and implementation of HR processes, ensuring compliance with state and federal laws and regulations Administrative support Locations available across the US including: Charlotte, NC; Houston, TX, Phoenix, AZ, Atlanta, GA, Des Plaines, IL, Morris Plaines, NJ; Clearwater, FL; Minneapolis, MN HoneywellURNAM YOU MUST HAVE Currently pursuing a Master's degree at an accredited college or university in Human Resources or Labor & Employee Relations degree Anticipated Graduation Date between December 2023 and August 2024 and ready to start full-time work between Jan 2024-August 2024. Applicants for employment for this position must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Honeywell. Due to contractual obligations some roles may require US Citizenship. WE VALUE Clear and concise communication Be comfortable with data and can tell a story with it Ability to influence at varying levels across the organization Have a Digital mindset Ability to handle multiple priorities and navigate in a highly matrixed environment Demonstrated project management skills Work independently and as a team Individuals who are self-motivated and able to work with little supervision, who consistently take the initiative to get things done proactively Ability to artfully convey even subtle or complex messages clearly, as appropriate for the topic and audience. Additional Information JOB ID: req369389 Category: Human Resources Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Nonexempt Early Career (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. jobTitle: Future Integrated Supply Chain Leaders - Summer 2023 Internship
jobDescription: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Honeywell is actively changing how the world works through innovation across aerospace and defense, building technologies, safety and productivity solutions, and performance materials. Our 110,000 employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries in almost 1,000 locations around the world. Check out Honeywell.com/future to learn how we’re making the future, from quantum computing to flying taxis. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell Future Integrated Supply Chain Leaders Intern Program (Masters Level) The Honeywell Future ISC Leaders program offers future leaders the opportunity to gain practical knowledge and hands on experience in many aspects of Supply Chain functions. Honeywell is seeking interns for our summer program designed to set the groundwork to join our accelerate development program to set the groundwork and provide a foundation for future Supply Chain opportunities. This internship will consist of assignments intended to develop Supply Chain leadership skills in the Supply Chain organization. Participants will participate in a project assignment with diverse experiences across Honeywell’s Supply Chain. Upon successful completion of the program, you will be positioned for possible future roles within Honeywell’s Future ISC Leaders full-time program. ***This position is available in multiple locations across the United States*** Primary Honeywell HQ locations and Manufacturing Site Assignments HoneywellURNAM You Must Have A current student, attending an accredited university/college earning a Master’s degree in a supply chain related emphasis, such as: Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Procurement, Manufacturing Systems, Manufacturing, Operations or Manufacturing Technology or MBA with Supply Chain Concentration Must be able to relocate for successive rotations Must be able to participate in an internship prior to completing current degree program Must attain Master's degree between December 2023 and June 2024 Applicants for employment for this position must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Honeywell WE VALUE Fundamental knowledge of Supply Chain/Engineering/Operations/Technology Guru’s Excellent verbal and written communication skills Inquisitive/Quick Learner Dream to change the world through extraordinary Supply Chain Leadership Curiosity, Risk Taking, Flexibility, Real passion for growth, Drive to Succeed Passion to Improve Daily and Win Additional Information JOB ID: req369353 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Nonexempt Early Career (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. In the role of IT Business Systems Analyst Intern, in our Future IT Leaders program you will be fully integrated into day-to-day operations of a team focused on the area of IT that aligns with your knowledge, skills, interests, goals, and overall career objectives. You will be working assignments with real business impact, learning how to leverage contemporary technologies to attain business results, gaining relevant work experience, interacting with multiple IT stakeholders including IT leadership, and building your knowledge of how to be successful in Honeywell’s complex work environment. Additionally, you will join our community of diverse, early-career, IT professionals and former interns who will share their experiences, offer guidance, and provide mentorship throughout the summer. jobTitle: General Manager (Sr. Director/VP) - Lifecycle Solutions and Technology (LST) Services
jobDescription: Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Honeywell UOP is actively recruiting for a General Manager (Senior Director/VP) for our Lifecycle Solutions and Technology (LST) Services business. We are creating, innovating, and delivering solutions fast, challenging the way things have always been done, piloting new ways for all of us to work, and expecting our successes to set new standards for our customers and for Honeywell. We are looking for a visionary, innovative thinker who will develop the strategic plan, solutions, and management of our LST Services solutions portfolio. We are looking for a strong leader with an entrepreneurial mindset, who is customer obsessed and will provide leadership to a cross functional team of direct and matrix reporting employees. In this position, the Senior Director/VP will be responsible for developing the business strategy and execution of that strategy with full P/L responsibility. This role will develop market opportunities, drive a paradigm shift in LST Services Offerings, manage internal processes, and form strategic relationships with key customers ranging from multinational companies to regional companies. This position requires an ability to effectively communicate and influence key stakeholders across the organization. In this high impact role, you will work autonomously as a senior member of our leadership team to achieve organizational objectives. You will assist in the development of medium to long term planning: Annual Operation Plan (AOP) or Strategic Planning (STRAP). Key Responsibilities Lead the development and execution of the strategy and services solutions portfolio for the LST business segment Own the segment P/L; provide oversight to ensure high level of customer satisfaction in meeting their services needs by ensuring flawless execution to customers. Lead the transformation of LST services from advisory services into a portfolio of services offerings that optimize our customers reliability while driving top line growth for LST. Drive pricing and contracting discipline to grow margins and overall profitability of the segment Define the Strategic Plan and business roadmap, services portfolio optimization, and competitive landscape. Identify and develop paths to alternative service revenue streams Manage and hold team accountable for innovation in services pipeline and adjacency growth ideas. Oversight of contract negotiations and close deals Represent HON at industry events and associations, conduct customer events and training workshops Acts as an advisor/consultant to understand customers unmet needs. Build and launch new services offerings, innovative solutions and products with customer segmentation and strategic pricing to upsell customer base Attract and develop a top talent pool that drives the growth of this business. Partner with HR to build the talent roadmap, develop the organizational structure and create capability. Responsible for motivating others; providing strategic vision for growth in services while driving self and others for positive business results for Honeywell and the customer. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors degree from an accredited university in sustainability, engineering or related field. 10+ years of experience in global Sales, Services and/or Operations and P&L management roles Experience managing complex transformation initiatives. Ability to connect the dots and handle project plans, timelines and risks effectively to enhance organizational value. Proven track record of customer engagement at senior levels; building long-term strategic and executive relationships Strong customer focus and commitment to value creation. Understand what creates value for customers. Develop a customer centric organization that has a deep understanding of customers’ needs. Deep knowledge of service offerings and alternative business models, combined with the commercial skills to develop new programs and services that have a positive impact on the bottom line WE VALUE Masters degree from an accredited university 10+ years of experience in the Renewable Energy industry Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills with cross functional teams of all levels in a matrix organization Strong leadership to create, adapt and drive change Ability to anticipate future trends accurately; learn quickly and align business strategy accordingly Experience with new product/services launch and scaling a business Ambitious, self-motivated, hardworking, results orientated, problem solver with a positive outlook and a clear focus on driving profit Prior turnkey project management experience is preferred Additional Information JOB ID: req373677 Category: General Management Location: 50 E Algonquin Rd,Des Plaines,Illinois,60017-5016,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn't just about developing cool things. That is why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Advanced Materials (AM) is a $3.5B technology focused, globally integrated, growing business that makes the world more sustainable, healthier, and safer every day. It’s one of Honeywell’s strategic business units within the Performance Materials and Technology (PMT) strategic business group. The Global FP&A Director for Advanced Materials (AM) is a critical member of the business’s finance and operational leadership teams and will oversee global performance management, the business’ short & long term strategic planning cycles, our company’s quarterly MOS (management operating system), and play an important role telling our story externally – both at the segment level (PMT) and via IR (investor relations). The Global FP&A Director also has responsibility for directing AM’s monthly & quarterly closing cycles, reporting, and analytical processes for both income and free cash flow. Key Responsibilities Responsibility for the design and execution of AM’s short and long range MOS (management operating systems). Directly control the financial cadence of the business; including KPI’s (key performance indicators), performance management, and operating focus areas & control points. A critical leader across the global AM finance team – working with all team members to seamlessly direct the monthly and quarterly closing & financial reporting processes for the company. A part of the global AM operating leadership team – as a direct partner with the company’s CFO, the Global FP&A Director is included in all leadership level dialogues, strategy sessions, and performance reviews. Team leadership – the Global FP&A Director will be responsible for leading a team of managers & analysts who control various aspects of our company’s operations – including fixed costs, reporting & analytics, supply chain financials, and cash. Work independently – the Global FP&A Director will be expected to work on his/her own, with guidance for the business CFO, to implement the company’s strategies and action plans – and identify key metrics & rigorous control points to ensure operational accountability. Manage numerous priorities – an important aspect of this role is being responsible for changing priority sets, and being nimble and creative to ensure those are resourced effectively. The ability to prioritize is key. Lead complex initiatives – the Global FP&A Director will be responsible for independently leading & driving AM’s operating levers that link to our overall business story – so being able to link desired outcomes to their operational inputs is critical. Business partnership – the Global FP&A Director will be an important business partner to the CFO & Business President – and interface with PMT’s leadership team. The ability to be a clear communicator and being comfortable in executive settings is a key success vector for the role. You Must Have Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration 10+ years experience in operating finance and/or accounting roles; prior FP&A experience is preferred but not required Exceptional leadership skills, a spirit of optimism, curiosity, and drive to win. Well developed communication skills, & the ability to distill the complex into the simple to drive actions & influence others. We Value Extensive financial systems and reporting experience Experience developing forecasts and operating plans Exceptional analytical skills (linking results to drivers) Direct communication with clarity at all levels Demonstrated leadership and influencing skills Self-motivated, results-oriented and assertive individual The ability to make consistent and timely decisions The ability to quickly identify subtle patterns among issues Proficiency in Hyperion, Oracle and SAP systems Additional Information JOB ID: HRD183595 Category: Finance Location: 115 Tabor Road,Morris Plains,New Jersey,07950,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation, and diversity When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Global FP&A Manager supports the $7B Safety & Productivity Solutions (SPS) segment of Honeywell. Primary responsibilities for this position include but are not limited to development of monthly and quarterly financial forecasts, data modelling, variance analysis, process improvement, creation of standard work, and best practice sharing. This position will play a critical role in the day-to-day execution of the Management Operating System (MOS) and provide the SPS leadership team with meaningful performance analysis, insights, and recommendations. This position will report directly to the Vice President, Business Analysis & Planning (BAP) and will be based out of Honeywell’s headquarters in Charlotte, NC – with frequent exposure to the SPS leadership team. Key Responsibilities Partner with the VP, BAP and business finance teams to drive profitable and predictable growth through sensitivity/variance analysis, margin optimization, customer profitability, and cost controls Facilitate operational execution through robust analytical support of & participation in the businesses weekly/monthly/quarterly Management Operating System (MOS) process. Support the forecasting and reporting of all core FP&A processes including short range outlooks, formal forecasts, Annual Operating Plan (AOP), Long Range Plan (LRP) and Monthly Business Review (MBR). Enhance reporting, forecasting, and planning process through continuous improvement partnership. Assist in preparation of senior management financial reviews, including preparation of presentation materials, consolidation templates, and other ad-hoc requests. Partner with Working Capital team to ensure to expand ROI through efficient deployment of capital investments, working capital and resources. Partner with Global Finance Center (GFC) to standardize reporting & improve speed of decision-making. You Must Have Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration 5+ years of progressive finance experience We Value Thought leadership, intellectual curiosity and willingness to challenge the status quo Bias for action and courage to identify, define and execute transformational improvements Passion for excellence & demonstrated drive to meet commitments and deadlines Global mindset and ability to work with remote teams Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Excellent problem solving and analytical skills Strong business partnering and team building skills Assertive, facilitative and positive – a self-starter with a “get things done” attitude Ability to apply sound judgment to strategic planning and annual planning processes Strong financial modelling skills to support wide range of interesting ad-hoc requests Experience with Hyperion Financial Management reporting system Experience with SAP Additional Information JOB ID: HRD183412 Category: Finance Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity About The Business Honeywell Process Solutions is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. A leader in digitization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. To learn more about Honeywell Process Solutions, please visit https://www.honeywellprocess.com. Position locations: Houston, Tx. & Charlotte, NC. Travel Requirements: Up to 25% Global Marketing Director (Life Sciences) Honeywell is seeking a Global Marketing Director for the Pharmaceutical, Specialty Chemicals, and Food & Beverage Market to be located within the United States. The successful candidate will work closely with the Executive Leadership Team and report to the Vice President of Life Sciences for Honeywell Process Solutions. The successful candidate will have a strong technical background, strategic mindset, as well as bring thought leadership to Honeywell’s Global Presence. Position Overview The Global Marketing Director will focus on strategic growth, identify new opportunities, and support direct customer engagement with Honeywell’s unique portfolio of offerings. In addition, the Global Marketing Director should also be able to continually assess the portfolio and provide input into the required technology required to enhance our portfolio specific to end-user needs. Key Responsibilities Included Planning, development, and implementation of effective business development strategies and policies. The Global Market Leader will support each geography and designing strategies to capitalize on market opportunities Developing and leading pricing strategy for Life Sciences industry. Develop and maintain data to successfully implement pricing targets to increase win rate in competitive situations globally. Leading Research and analysis of market trends, customer needs, and competitive conditions. Coordinating with Product Managers to develop solutions that will drive profitable growth. Provide the market insights and business case justification that will guide and prioritize the product manager’s research and development plans. Identifying and developing supplier/partner alliances and customer relationships to further expand business development opportunities at all levels. Linking up with Sales to provide them with specific value propositions and offerings for the targeted customer segments that are consistent with the sales regional business plans. Contribute to training sales on new solutions and value propositions and are crisp and actionable and clearly articulate how Honeywell’s offering differentiates from the next best alternatives. Working with sales to meet quarterly and annual orders targets broken out by region. Develop strategies and contingency plans to achieve these AOP targets. Networking with industry leaders and builds relationships to facilitate expanded sales opportunities. Preparing appropriate marketing campaigns and supporting plans and collateral specific to the downstream market to meet business goals Working with Customer Marketing to drive results. Help define and articulate the Honeywell ‘Brand” as it relates to the Life Sciences markets and develop an effective strategy for ensuring this message is broadcast across the target regions. Develop and support pipeline of press releases and case studies that can effectively demonstrate Honeywell’s capability. Ensure that marketing activities are cost effective, efficient, and within established budget constraints. Ensuring that Business and Marketing plans, goals, and policies are consistent with established Company-wide goals. Maintaining, documenting and disseminating knowledge about industry trends, opportunities, channels and competitors to support business development opportunities. Requires frequent interaction with other sales and marketing members, operations, and functional support such as contracts, pricing, human resources, legal, and safety. Expected to brief senior level executives within the target customer community. You Must Have Bachelor's degree in Engineering / other technical degree A minimum of 15 years’ experience in the Pharmaceutical or Specialty Chemicals field (Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Strategic Marketing, etc.) Demonstrated knowledge of business impact of process control automation. Thorough knowledge of market penetration strategies and market development strategies and techniques Ability to develop and implement effective communication plans for internal/external customers We Value Ability to communicate and frame complex issues in a concise manner. Self-starter capable of leading, coordinating, & influencing cross-functional teams. Strong analytical skills (Microsoft Excel, Finance Principles) Masters Degree / MBA preferred. Ability to work effectively in a fast paced, rapidly evolving growth environment against tight deadlines Previous Fortune 500 job experience or consulting background is a plus Previous experience in large, complex organizations Significant experience in marketing analysis or business development. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD183697 Category: Business Development Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

jobTitle: Health, Safety and Environment Engineer I
jobDescription: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Honeywell Aerospace Development Program is designed to provide you with job rotations through various locations and teams to gain a deep understanding of Aerospace's end-to-end integrated supply chain and health, safety, environmental and facilities (HSEF) programs. These rotations will be in the HSEF & Business Resilience career paths and will expose you to the importance of a proactive HSE management system, strong leadership and employee engagement, and continuous improvement of processes and programs. You will be a key professional within the Honeywell Aerospace manufacturing and repair and overhaul plants, driving sustainable health, safety, industrial hygiene and environmental programs through incorporation of impactful operating processes. You will establish strong working relationships with the site leadership team and the employees. You will report directly to the HSEF Process Excellence Director, with a matrix reporting relationship to the site HSEF Managers. Key Responsibilities Support programs which promote employee health and safety and prevent work-related injuries and disease Support programs which ensure regulatory compliance and environmental protection including air pollution, wastewater and hazardous waste management, and sustainability projects Conduct hazard analyses and implement controls to reduce risk and integrate safe and compliant work practices into manufacturing operations Provide technical assistance and coach employees on HSEF requirements Integrate and support onsite contractors and ensure their success Collaborate across the businesses and departments to develop unique solutions for a variety of customers Identify continuous improvement opportunities and work with cross-functional teams to execute projects Conduct inspections and assessments to ensure compliance to regulations and Honeywell standards Obtain Six Sigma Green Belt certification YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's or Master's degree from an accredited college or university in Engineering, Manufacturing, Safety, Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering, Facilities, Occupational Health, Industrial Hygiene, Chemistry, or a related Health, Safety & Environmental field Due to export control restrictions, must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident Must have attained or will attain your degree between May 2022-August 2023 WE VALUE Demonstrated academic excellence Willingness to relocate Excellent communication and presentation skills Project management skills Ability to analyze data to drive decision-making Computer Aided Design experience Experience in aerospace, manufacturing, machining, metal fabrication, or electronics Additional Information JOB ID: HRD902769 Category: Health, Safety & Environment Location: 1944 E Sky Harbor Circle, Phoenix, Arizona 85034 United States Exempt Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD902769 Category: Health, Safety & Environment Location: 1944 E Sky Harbor Circle,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.
