Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell Aerospace’s University Relations Development program provides internship and rotational engineering experiences to enable participants to grow their careers and be future HSEF leaders at Honeywell. This summer internship will allow you to gain an understanding of Honeywell Aerospace's manufacturing operations and health, safety, environmental and facilities (HSEF) programs. You will be embedded with the HSEF team at one of our Phoenix-area locations where you will learn the importance of a proactive HSE management system, strong leadership and employee engagement, and continuous improvement of processes and programs. You will lead impactful projects, gain hands-on experience solving challenges, and have an opportunity to present results to leadership. Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell Global Security (HGS) is focused on integrating security into all aspects of our business to protect the people, processes, and assets by which Honeywell achieves its greater mission. Join a team that is focused on identifying and protecting the information, processes, formulas, techniques, methods, and know-how critical to Honeywell’s competitive capability. The primary purpose of this role is to help Honeywell defend the organization’s cyber interests. Taking part in this role will provide you invaluable professional and intercultural skills that prepare you to excel academically and professionally in Honeywell’s increasingly globalized world. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity Honeywell is hiring for a HR Director, Global Sales position that will support the Sales Organization for the $3B and 8,500 global employee business of Honeywell Building Solutions. The Director will act as HR Business partner to the senior sales executive and the global sales leadership. This role reports to VP HR for Honeywell Building Solutions. We are looking for an Atlanta, GA based HR Director to support dynamic and transforming part of the business of a global technology company. The successful candidate will be able to collaborate effectively with multi-business management team and will play an essential role in the continuous strategic transformation of the business unit. Are you ready to be strategic HR leader, who isn’t afraid to go into the details? Key Responsibilities Partners with the leadership to build a strategic talent plan, aligned to the client organization’s strategy. Acts as a trusted advisor and coach to the senior client leadership team while building deep client understanding and relationships, resulting in strategic alignment with the organization as well as organizational trust in, and partnership with, the HR function. Align organizational workforce plans with Talent Acquisition planning processes and Financial deliverables Assesses the talent needs of the client group through internal evaluations and external environmental scans to identify current and anticipated talent related issues. Uses comprehensive data and insights to inform business cases for changes to talent strategies or practices. Decisions and recommendations are informed by data, leading to improved outcomes and buy in. Talent implications are evaluated as part of the senior leadership team’s decision-making process. Facilitates large-scale talent-related change management activities. Evaluates the impact of proposed changes on employees; advises the client groups on alternatives and change management. Partners with senior client group leaders to design organizational structure, job roles, and talent management processes to drive business unit performance. Lead succession planning & talent development strategies for the client group, identifying critical roles & preparing potential talent and pipelines for mentoring, training, etc. Drive performance driven culture across heavily matrixed, sophisticated org structure Maintain deep business acumen and understanding of the organization’s financial status, product and service offerings, customer segments, and revenue-generation models. Provide business leaders and managers with an HR perspective on business decisions by leveraging strong knowledge of all HR functions. Evaluate the impact of proposed changes on employees and manage change to minimize disruption to the business. You Must Have Bachelor’s Degree in HR or related areas 7+ years of progressive HR experience, ideally in a multinational environment Experience leading HR for commercial / global sales structures Proven track record of implementing and driving initiatives around Sales Incentive plans, Commercial teams engagement and org development Job requires high level of analytical skills and ability to comprehend large number of data points to define a strategy Experience leading in an environment of transformation and change Ability to collaborate with and influence peers in a highly matrixed organization Additional Information JOB ID: HRD177008 Category: Human Resources Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing, and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. jobTitle: HSE/EM, Fire or Emergency Management Intern
jobDescription: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity Join an organization that demonstrates a proactive health and safety management system, combined a continuous improvement environment. You will contribute to the success of the KCNSC Mission by working to ensure regulatory compliance and assisting in implementing risk controls in the field of Health, Safety, and Environmental [HSE] and Equipment Maintenance [EM] at our Kansas City, Missouri facility. You will work directly with HSE & EM Staff and Managers to actively participate in actionable HSE & EM projects at the Kansas City location. You will support the execution and implementation of the site HSE & EM strategic plan, applying risk management tools, supporting the risk assessment process, and assisting in the implementation of effective physical and/or behavioral control measures associated with the fields of safety, occupational health, environmental, industrial hygiene, emergency management, equipment maintenance, and/or fire protection specialties. Key Responsibilities Support HSE/EM Staff in the execution, implementation, and tracking of the strategic HSE & EM annual objectives Support Process Excellence Reviews for Key HSE & EM Initiatives Perform Risk Assessments for HSE & EM related programs Participate in root cause analysis and the development of corrective action plans Depending on the candidate’s individual background/experience, customizable opportunity to work on special projects within the fields of safety, occupational health, environmental, industrial hygiene, emergency management, equipment maintenance, and/or fire protection specialties [as appropriate]. YOU MUST HAVE Working towards a Bachelor's degree in Occupational Safety/Health, Safety, Environmental, Fire Science, Industrial/Occupational Hygiene, Industrial Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, other Safety/Equipment Maintenance related discipline Must have graduated, from an accredited college or university since May 2022, or will graduate by August 2023 Must have obtained degree within 12 months of the date of hire FM&T - you must be a US Citizen and be able to obtain a Security Clearance WE VALUE Expertise with Microsoft Office including Excel, Access and SharePoint. Knowledge of Maximo and Cority systems preferred (Safety, Environmental, or Industrial Hygiene modules). Strong written and oral communication skills, particularly in cross-functional collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation. Ability to work on multiple projects and effectively manage priorities Improving performance, meeting commitments, and getting results Exceeding internal and external customer expectations Communication skills sufficient to deal with customer and trades people Additional Information JOB ID: req374681 Category: Health, Safety & Environment Location: 14520 Botts Road,Kansas City,Missouri,64147,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. An excellent career opportunity is currently available for a Human Resources Manager in the Honeywell’s Advanced Materials business located in Louisiana area. This role provides multiple site HR support for the AM ISC, while partnering with cross-functional teams and leaders to broker HR services. You will actively engage in staffing, organizational development and talent management. You will utilize your HR functional expertise to align critical human resources principles with business objectives. Increase the overall performance of the organization by creating strong interactive partnerships with client groups KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Drive organizational effectiveness Lead change Manage talent Build relationships and broker services Act as a coach and confidant Administrative support Lead training and development MUST HAVE: Bachelor's Degree 5+ years HR experience in a matrix global environment Labor relations experience (supporting multi-site and union-site) ​ WE VALUE: 10+ years HR experience Manufacturing site HR Leadership Chemical site experience Ability to influence at varying levels across the organization Ability to handle multiple priorities and navigate in a highly matrixed environment Individuals who are self-motivated and able to work with little supervision, who consistently take the initiative to get things done, do things before being asked by others or forced to by events Ability to artfully convey even subtle or complex messages clearly, as appropriate for the topic and audience Manage talent (Employee Relations and Talent Acquisition)

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing, and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Performs and analyzes routine to moderately complex Industrial Engineering functions to achieve efficient, cost effective and reliable manufacturing processes, applying mathematical, physical science, and engineering technologies. Duties And Responsibilities Assists in the project management of new and current projects, under technical guidance of higher-level engineers or departmental management Coordinates and administers the work measurement system in manufacturing and inspection departments including the development and application of standard time values using time study, standard time data, and predetermined time systems Conducts/coordinates the analysis of production and inspection operations to determine optimum methods and sequence of performing necessary work considering tools, materials, specifications, equipment, and environment Prepares evaluation reports, analyzes data, and makes recommendations for and initiates improvements for product, test equipment, procedures and manufacturing processes that improve productivity and reduce flow time Develops and recommends implementation of new layouts as well as layouts for major rearrangements of manufacturing and inspection departments to optimize the utilization of resources and facilities considering workloads, processes, product flow, and relationship with other operating groups Develops base cost data (direct labor and direct material requirements) for product cost estimates Estimates set-up times, operating times, and flowtimes Conducts audits to anticipate, identify, and correct problems and to measure production levels and trends May perform other duties as required Conducts activities in a safe and healthy manner and works in accordance with established HS&E requirements You Must Have Bachelor of Science degree from an ABET accredited Engineering program or Bachelor of Science degree in Physics from and accredited program Two or more years of relevant experience in Engineering or related technical activities. US Citizen (capable of obtaining and maintaining a DOE Q level security clearance) We Value Experience with commercial simulation software, Six Sigma Black Belt certification, Lean Expert certification, PMP certification, experience with ERP/MRP systems Demonstrated application to advanced design, development, evaluation, and quality control techniques to complex engineering projects Demonstrated working under minimal supervision, with latitude for independent action and decision making Demonstrated experience in project leadership FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req381905 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 14520 Botts Road,Kansas City,Missouri,64147,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Honeywell FM&T Overview Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Honeywell Process Solutions is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. A leader in digitization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. The Successful Candidate Will Preferably Have a Strong Automation Sales Background In Several Of The Following Industries The Business Development Manager will be responsible for driving and developing new Honeywell Process Solutions (HPS) business in Canada & the US East markets. Chemicals Power and Energy Mining, Metals and Materials Oil & Gas, Midstream Use your knowledge of customers, the industry and competition to identify and pursue opportunities for growth for Honeywell's Process Solutions business. You will contribute to the broader regional strategies to gain new customers in current markets and to identify ways to penetrate new markets. You will lead a team of Account Managers to develop a long term roadmap in securing those new customers by building strategic customer relationships, partnering with the line of business and being involved in the complete sales cycle. Key Responsibilities Achieve regional sales targets and track opportunities from discovery to close. Effective communication of the company’s value proposition with key decision-makers. Prospecting, evaluating opportunities, presenting our products, strong negotiation skills, cold calling, product selection, and supporting the customer's purchase to land new business. Researching organizations and individuals online (especially on social media) to identify new leads and potential new markets. Researching the needs of other companies and learning who makes decisions about purchasing. Formulate growth plans Build customer relationships Design value proposition Contribute to growth pipeline Coach & Manage team of Account Managers Customer negotiations Recommend Go-To-Market plan Collaborate in developing the sales forecast Drives metrics & reporting against strategic plan and measure success specifically for the BD region. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor Degree 5 years’ experience in management 7 years’ experience in business development in pertinent industry Proven track within some of the identified industries Ability to effectively interact with high level decision makers Focus on achieving goals and great aspiration to grow WE VALUE Proven sales experience Demonstrated analytical, planning and problem solving skills Proven effectiveness working across multiple geographies MBA or Advanced Business Degree is preferred Prior leadership role with management of distributed teams Builds strong business relationships Cross functional career path within production, supply chain, regulatory departments is valuable Highly organized, strong project management and follow-through skills Executive presence and credibility, including having a strong partner financial acumen Excellent intellectual and analytical skills - ability to structure problem statements and be the catalyst for uncovering new and creative ways to solve problems. Prior business development or strategy & planning experiences are a plus. Proven ability to work closely with and advise senior executives (VP+) Demonstrated ability to think creatively and push the envelope on new ideas to transform our business Strong and proven success in developing partnership, relationships within the identified industries, with the ability to research, evaluate and create proposals Additional Information JOB ID: HRD178371 Category: Sales Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Sales (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

A leader in digitization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. The Successful Candidate Will Preferably Have a Strong Automation Sales Background In Several Of The Following Industries The Business Development Manager will be responsible for driving and developing new Honeywell Process Solutions (HPS) business in Canada & the US East markets. Chemicals Power and Energy Mining, Metals and Materials Oil & Gas, Midstream Use your knowledge of customers, the industry and competition to identify and pursue opportunities for growth for Honeywell's Process Solutions business. You will contribute to the broader regional strategies to gain new customers in current markets and to identify ways to penetrate new markets. You will lead a team of Account Managers to develop a long term roadmap in securing those new customers by building strategic customer relationships, partnering with the line of business and being involved in the complete sales cycle. Key Responsibilities Achieve regional sales targets and track opportunities from discovery to close. Effective communication of the company’s value proposition with key decision-makers. Prospecting, evaluating opportunities, presenting our products, strong negotiation skills, cold calling, product selection, and supporting the customer's purchase to land new business. Researching organizations and individuals online (especially on social media) to identify new leads and potential new markets. Researching the needs of other companies and learning who makes decisions about purchasing. Formulate growth plans Build customer relationships Design value proposition Contribute to growth pipeline Coach & Manage team of Account Managers Customer negotiations Recommend Go-To-Market plan Collaborate in developing the sales forecast Drives metrics & reporting against strategic plan and measure success specifically for the BD region. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor Degree 5 years’ experience in management 7 years’ experience in business development in pertinent industry Proven track within some of the identified industries Ability to effectively interact with high level decision makers Focus on achieving goals and great aspiration to grow WE VALUE Proven sales experience Demonstrated analytical, planning and problem solving skills Proven effectiveness working across multiple geographies MBA or Advanced Business Degree is preferred Prior leadership role with management of distributed teams Builds strong business relationships Cross functional career path within production, supply chain, regulatory departments is valuable Highly organized, strong project management and follow-through skills Executive presence and credibility, including having a strong partner financial acumen Excellent intellectual and analytical skills - ability to structure problem statements and be the catalyst for uncovering new and creative ways to solve problems. Prior business development or strategy & planning experiences are a plus. Proven ability to work closely with and advise senior executives (VP+) Demonstrated ability to think creatively and push the envelope on new ideas to transform our business Strong and proven success in developing partnership, relationships within the identified industries, with the ability to research, evaluate and create proposals Additional Information JOB ID: HRD178371 Category: Sales Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Sales (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? You will be responsible for developing and optimizing an offering portfolio strategy based on customer insights, competitive and market intelligence, and executing that strategy to optimize the offerings, market position, organic growth, and financial return of the product portfolio across the product lifecycle. You work closely with manufacturing and sourcing, engineering and R&D, Honeywell senior executives, internal sales and field sales to maximize the growth, development and return on investment of the organization’s product portfolio today and in the future. This is an entry level professional and early career role that supports the Business Line Offering Manager in successfully managing the Business Line’s offerings. They will actively manage a well-defined, simple offering or set of offerings within this Business Line. You will be expected to perform primary responsibilities with support from their manager and experienced team members and become more autonomous based on demonstrated skills and abilities. Primary Responsibilities Market Research & Competitive Landscape. Understand big-picture market drivers, challenges, competitors, and overall business environment. Identify critical gaps and execute primary and/or secondary research to address or leverage the Strategic Marketing Team to do so. Understand key competitors and how the Honeywell offering compares. Calculate the maximum potential market size (Total Addressable Market – TAM) with help of the Strategic Marketing Team, evaluate the solution for commercial viability, and calculate Share of Demand (SOD). Continually assess market traction and competitiveness to re-evaluate New Product Introductions (NPI), pricing, or end-of-life (EOL) actions. Voice of Customer & Segmentation. Know the types of Voice of the Customer (VOC) and apply VOC and Observational VOC (OVOC) by spending time with customers. Perform continuous discovery to understand the high value problems customers have, and the linkage of those problems to how customers make money. Connect key customer stakeholders and what our offerings do for them, and which needs drive purchase decisions. Evaluate sources of disruption and understand the customer decision journey and how to utilize key personas to transition to each step. Perform customer market segmentation analysis. Value Proposition & Competitive Positioning. Succinctly write and communicate a quantified value proposition. Perform competitive analysis of Honeywell products and services vs. the Next Best Alternatives. Identify and state the target segment and problem to be solved in value propositions. Understand the value drivers and quantify them relative to the Next Best Alternative in value propositions. Coach others working with Customer Marketing (CM) & Commercial Excellence Teams (CE) (i.e. Sales and Service) to communicate value propositions and their monetary values to the customer. New Offering Management. Translate customer and business needs into actionable product requirements. Provide customer marketing with appropriate information on offering, target segments and value propositions for effective sales collateral and campaigns. Ensure requirements of each participating function are accurately represented in the product plan. Business Models & Pricing. Define the appropriate value capture model (one-time sale, subscription, service, outcome-based, etc.), establish pricing strategy based on appropriate value share relative to Next Best Alterative, and ensure implementation by the commercial excellence team. Leverage various business models and establish a pricing strategy and structure for the commercial teams. Develop financial models for new offering business plans, quantifying and balancing expected revenue against initial investment and ongoing fixed and variable costs to estimate internal rate of return (IRR) and projected margin, operating income and revenue. Develop a negotiation walk to close a sale for/with sales. Utilize a management operating system (MOS) to track pricing – PVA (price-volume analysis), etc. Demonstrate VCM understanding and the linkage pricing has to VCM performance. Portfolio Lifecycle Management. Understand, articulate, and own the financial impact for portfolio decisions (both P&L & balance sheet) and ensure alignment with business strategy. Generate and manage pipeline of new offering ideas beyond incremental product enhancements. Build and maintain a multi-year roadmap which includes a detailed 1-year plan and take action relative to changing market conditions, competitor actions, and new entrants. Effectively manage products across their lifecycle from demand planning of new offerings through SIOP on ongoing basis through including managing End of Life (EoL). Apply 80/20 to portfolio to define offerings that should be sunset and appropriate pricing during sun setting and address sourcing factory utilization impacts. Early Career/New college graduate pursuing Master's Degree in one of the following disciplines: Engineering, Marketing, Software Development, Sustainability Background in Marketing, strategic planning and/or management Graduation after June 2023 We Value Business background complemented by internship experience Industry experience in a related field a plus. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD902133 Category: Business Management Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be located in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Of Duties Acquire in-depth knowledge of various COTS software packages in order to perform minor configuration changes like adding to select value lists, screen changes, and simple workflow updates Analyzes existing information systems and applications to identify weaknesses and develop opportunities for improvements and may evaluate and provide recommendations for new application packages Assesses customer needs utilizing a structured requirements process (gathering, analyzing, documenting, and managing changes) to assist in identifying business priorities and advice on options Participates in short-term planning sessions with a customer to implement process improvements within an assigned customer area Evaluates and makes recommendations regarding hardware, software, process and services that will improve overall IT support for customers Assist with testing and duplicating unknown software and hardware problems reported from the customer-base and troubleshoots the issue(s) at hand. May escalate hardware problems to appropriate IT team and software bugs to software vendor Plans, schedules, and coordinates a variety of projects related to customer support activities with minimal supervisory guidance Notifies customers when problems have been resolved and closes log entries Follows the IT change management process for executing production changes on assigned applications Coordinates application lifecycle with various application vendors to keep software up to the latest version Develops documentation for assigned applications which may include a Configuration Management Plan, System Requirements Document, Software Quality Assurance Plan, Knowledge Base Articles, and Statements of Work to procure vendor services You Must Have US citizenship in order to obtain and maintain US Dept of Energy “Q” level security clearance. Bachelors degree, certification or two additional years of direct work exp in lieu of Bachelors degree or certification We Value Experience with SQL (ability to develop, modify, and troubleshoot queries) Ability to use software knowledge and experience to assess, diagnose, and correct problems for customers Excellent interpersonal and customer-service skills FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req359402 Category: Information Technology Location: 9221 Ward Parkway,Kansas City,Missouri,64114,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Honeywell FM&T Overview Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Of Duties Provides technical leadership and functional guidance to assure compliance to technical and cyber security guidelines Plans, organizes, coordinates, and supervises IT resources and technical support personnel engaged in establishing, implementing, and maintaining computerized information systems and/or in designing and implementing procedures to prevent inadvertent or deliberate disclosure, alteration or destruction of unclassified, sensitive, or classified information Provides business perspective to department personnel, coordinates department activities with other information technology FM&T, corporate, and NSE organizations, and assures a high quality of customer service Develops operational policies and controls that are designed to measure and improve divisional metrics Develops operational plans, budgets, goals, and priorities for the department, fosters innovation and coordinates the allocation of required resources Affects changes in resources, plans, and procedures to facilitate achieving goals Identifies training requirements of personnel, develops appropriate training plans, and coordinates personnel development Encourages and facilitates internal and external teamwork of assigned personnel Develops processes, practices, and procedures to assure the maximum possible quality of the products and services Supervises employees and performs other managerial responsibilities including interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems May perform other duties as required You Must Have U.S. Citizen At least 8 years of computing systems deployment, project management, or computer related technical activities Bachelor’s degree in computer science We Value Demonstrates excellent interpersonal, analytical, organizational, and communication skills (both oral and written) PMP Certification a plus ACP Certification a plus IIBA Certification a plus Advanced application of project management practices, principles, and tools including prior experience in managing IT Projects through a formalized process FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req353473 Category: Information Technology Location: 9221 Ward Parkway,Kansas City,Missouri,64114,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Honeywell FM&T Overview Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

jobTitle: IT Project Management Manager - Digital Sales
jobDescription: The Future Is What You Make It. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that shape the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn't just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell Process Solutions is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. A leader in digitization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. Honeywell is seeking a Project Management Assistant Manager and Scrum Master with an IT background in Digital Sales to support the company’s Digital Transformation. You will join a team of passionate customer experience and commercial excellence professionals and be a major player in business improvement projects and in Honeywell’s digital evolution. This is a professional position with opportunities to grow into more senior positions within product management/marketing, applications engineering, and sales. You will work on a variety of different projects, across many different areas of the business, and with colleagues from all different functions. This role is a great opportunity to learn about how an industrial B2B business works from end to end. Projects include supporting eCommerce, website, digital sales transformation, improving customer experience, business process improvement initiatives, and building collateral for NPI and campaigns. The successful candidate will have a strong technical background to be able to collaborate with our engineering team, our technical product management team, and our sales engineers to ensure product details are accurate on marketing collateral; and understand how our customers use our products so we can create effective collateral, site content, and campaigns. If this is your dream role, then we'd love to hear from you. Responsibilities Support eCommerce & website development activities including, but not limited to: People leadership and management of a globally distributed team Work with Product Managers to ensure accurate product data information, photos and literature. Work with IT to make sure supporting data and back-end systems are working correctly. Work with Customer Marketing & Sales to support customer campaigns. Collaborate with multiple teams and stakeholders across the business, spanning multiple regions and languages. Provide regular reporting on project progress with recommendations for areas of improvement. Query data from multiple sources including SalesForce, and SAP. Ensure timely delivery of assignments while ensuring best in class quality and Understanding and applying technical skills to the marketing aspects of the product Facilitate efficient and effective deployment of new business systems to improve Honeywell business results. You will help define and document customer requirements for deployment of new business applications. You will assist with process redesign to ensure optimization of the functionalities enabled through advanced business applications. You will provide support to users to facilitate rapid adoption of the application, to speed time to value of the new solution capabilities You Must Have Bachelor’s Degree Engineering or another technical field. Experience using Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Basic data analysis skills. The ability to work independently and self-motivated. Experience with SAP, Hybris, eCommerce, Salesforce, Adobe Experience Manager, and PIM systems Strong Project Management experience and using JIRA application SAFe Agile and Scrum Master We Value An advanced degree such as an MBA Strong initiative, motivation, and drive Experience working in and leading cross-functional project teams Advanced Excel capabilities Excellent presentation and public speaking skills Ability to work under tight deadlines Ability to quickly shift focus if priorities change Excellent verbal and written skills. Excellent time management and organizational skills Additional Information JOB ID: HRD179825 Category: Information Technology Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Job Description The Gas Processing and STS (Sustainable Technology Solutions) Process Specialist will support development, innovation, commercialization, and project execution of the technologies. This role will continue to develop and improve design practices, tools, and infrastructure for Gas Processing and STS technologies with focus on solvent technologies for CO2 removal to ensure the technology is competitively positioned in the marketplace. The Process Specialist will support development of technical bench strength across the technology family to ensure that there is sufficient global experience to meet the expected project load. Launch innovations in nearly every commercial and defense aircraft platform The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation, and diversity. Be part of a team that designs, develops, and integrates highly complex aircraft engine controls systems within Honeywell Aerospace Engines & Power Systems. You will partner and lead world class engineering to implement technical solutions, develop program schedules, provide ideas for improvements in engineering, quality, and productivity, and drive overall program performance. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? As a Lead Engineer/Scientist you will work closely with a diverse team of scientists, engineers, technicians and business development leaders to develop and commercialize high-performance fuel cell power generation technologies for remote and autonomous applications. The ideal candidate has demonstrated capability to design, build, validate test capability and develop innovative approaches and test plans to mature differentiating technologies for integration into manufacturable products that delight customers and end users. Technical curiosity, problem-solving, application of process safety management, design-for-manufacturing, and a lead-by-doing approach are highly sought-after traits for this position. You will lead infrastructure, component and system technology and process development projects, coordinate across multiple sites and functions, and build deep technical knowledge to analyze, scale, and predict component and system performance for future product platforms. You will participate in developing new concepts and writing proposals to government funding agencies to secure project funding. You will work in an Agile (Scrum) environment to solve complex problems with speed and creativity. This role reports to the Advanced Alternative Power section within Honeywell Aerospace Advanced Technology. Responsibilities Act as a technology leader within Honeywell Advanced and Applied Technology, championing technologies from initial concept through product launch Integrate with existing project teams to drive development of key technologies and processes from conceptual designs through multiple prototyping cycles Be adept at recognizing potential process and system safety hazards, implementing best practices to mitigate and sharing lessons learned across working teams Understand elements of robust process and technology definition and development for translation to manufacturing Work directly with stakeholders and customers to understand and formulate technical requirements and business needs into achievable technology and product roadmaps Support the transformation of evolving customer requirements into innovative prototypes based on creative design and fabrication techniques Work on assignments that are complex in nature where judgment, initiative, and ability to iterate and continuously improve are required Solve complex problems through analysis and innovation; solutions may become part of standard operating procedure Work collaboratively and lead, mentor, and support knowledge-sharing with project team members Be available for travel up to 10% YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s degree in engineering, material science, or related degree program Minimum ten (10) years of engineering experience in an R&D environment with relevant experience in technology and process development Minimum five (5) years of project leadership experience U.S. citizenship or permanent resident (green card) WE VALUE Experience designing, building, and validating rapid-prototype, research hardware test systems for technology maturation of critical component technologies as well as prototype system integration Experience in systems engineering, chemical process development, manufacturing and HSE process safety management Demonstrated capability in the practical application of science to troubleshoot issues, take appropriate corrective actions, and continuously improve processes and designs Strong analytical skills and proficiency in analyzing experimental data using standard software tools Strong self-motivation/direction, entrepreneurial mind-set, and teaming skills with aptitude to lead and mentor others Track record of successful contributions to projects, continuous improvement, and products Clear and concise written and verbal communication skills. Strong project management skills to create and maintain programmatic and technical documentation. Track record of successful contributions to projects, continuous improvement, and products Experience working in an Agile environment on cross-site and functional teams Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181667 Category: Engineering Location: 50 E Algonquin Rd,Des Plaines,Illinois,60017-5016,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Lead R&D Engineer/ Scientist Lead R&D Engineer/ Scientist for Honeywell International, Inc. (Buffalo, NY) Responsibilities Responsible for performing both experimental and simulation tasks in the laboratory, and to apply them in the development of new refrigerants for Air conditioning and Refrigeration applications. Effectively communicate technical information to industry and customers to assist their transition to new environmentally safer refrigerant substitutes. Assists in the development of new products, applications, and services to support the growth of the Refrigerants business. Responsible for research and development of new environmentally safer, more energy-efficient refrigerants to replace current high Global Warming Potential (GWP) fluids in air conditioning applications. Develop intellectual property materials of the new refrigerant and its application. Conduct experiment and simulation of the proprietary new refrigerants to evaluate its performance, durability, etc. Work with external institutions and labs on avant-garde research projects. Support business functions for commercialization of the new refrigerants. Communicate and support major air-conditioning equipment manufacturers to approve and promote the new refrigerants. Maintain awareness of relevant patents, state-of-art scientific literature, conferences and research programs and deliver technical seminars in major conferences. Additional Information Job Site: Buffalo, NY 40 hours/week Eligible for Employee Referral Program: $1500 If offered employment must have legal right to work in U.S. EOE. req383244 You Must Have Qualified applicants must have a Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or related field and 3 years of experience with the job offered or acceptable alternate occupation. Full term of experience must include: HAVC; advanced topics and research aptitude in area of thermodynamics, heat and mass transfer processes; and knowledge of vapor compression systems. Must have 2 years of experience evaluating new refrigerant and refrigerant blends. Telecommuting permitted up to two times per week. Up to 10% international and domestic travel required. Lead R&D Engineer/Scientist – Composite Formulations Advanced Materials is a global supplier of fluorine products, fine chemicals, additives, metals, films, and fibers for products including pharmaceuticals, refrigeration, semiconductors, and military protection. Advanced Materials is making the world safer, cleaner, and enabling the modernization of a growing middle class by enhancing our customer offerings through a differentiated portfolio of chemistries, materials, value-added solutions, and superior customer service. Our mission is to attract, retain and develop diverse and highly motivated, entrepreneurial employees striving to flawlessly deliver superior value to our customers every day. Be part of a team responsible for providing technical expertise and knowledge to new product development and technology projects, finding innovative, cost-effective means to improve research, processes, products, and technologies for Honeywell’s Spectra Fiber business. You will lead development efforts for processing and formulation of polymer fibers, coatings, and related breakthrough programs as you develop the next generation of high-performance products within Spectra’s fiber and ballistics composite portfolio, helping Honeywell maintain its technology advantage over the competition. Key Responsibilities Lead new fiber/composite product development projects (lab and pilot scale) Contribute to intellectual property developments for high performance fiber/polymer processes used in ballistic/medical applications. Interact with customers on product application development Design of Experiment (DOE) development and execution Project management and intellectual property research Design analysis and prototyping Strong verbal and written communication skills Research and Development on ultrafine fibers for medical applications, sustainability, and chemical formulations. YOU MUST HAVE Advanced Degree in Polymer Science, Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Material Science, or similar discipline. 10+ years of industry experience in fiber, polymer, and/or process/product development applications that require chemical formulations such as coatings and process auxiliaries. WE VALUE Hands on experience with UHMWPE fiber, chemical formulations (coatings, process auxiliaries), or energy absorbing composites Ph.D. or master’s degree in relevant field preferred Knowledge of polymer and/or fiber processing design. Experience with armor end article fabrication, textiles, medical devices, and/or ballistic testing. Significant experience working in cross-functional teams to develop new products and technology in highly regulated environments. Experience in design of experiments, product design, and customer applications support. Team oriented with excellent interpersonal skills – ability to lead, motivate, develop, and mentor others. Self-starter, with the ability to analyze and solve complex problems. Individuals who can work without guidance or supervision and have demonstrated knowledge of engineering techniques to optimize design processes Track record of successful contributions to products/projects in a matrix organization. jobTitle: Lead Supply Chain Project Management Specialist
jobDescription: The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. In the role, you will oversee and direct operations for our Space industry manufacturing group for world-class integrated supply chain projects. You will assess project issues and develop enhanced resolutions to meet or exceed productivity, quality, and customer satisfaction goals and objectives. You will develop mechanisms for monitoring project progress and for intervention and problem solving with key stakeholders. Key Responsibilities Drive and execute new initiatives Influence functional stakeholders Build robust MOS toward execution Process optimization and improvement Support Integrated Supply Chain sites Work with the factory team Support to manage risk YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree 5+ years of materials management experience WE VALUE Some project management or Integrated Supply Chain experience Global company working experience Professional in Microsoft Office Experience in managing multiple projects Lead/drive change, and influence/mentor others

Launch innovations in nearly every commercial and defense aircraft platform Join a team that designs, develops, and integrates highly complex systems within Honeywell. You will be integral in creating system solutions that meet the evolving needs of our customers. You will have ownership of systems at every aspect of the systems life cycle; from the front end of business development through the product end of life. You will work across disciplines within the Engines and Power Systems business to drive growth and reach critical business milestones. In this role, you will be responsible for leading the development and qualification of prime propulsion turbine engine control units (ECUs). These ECUs will serve as the central component of full authority digital engine control (FADEC) systems. You will serve as a technical focal point and a mentor to other engineers. You will be responsible for leading the integration of hardware and software into a functioning ECU. The propulsion control systems organization will rely on you to ensure the ECUs meet the needs of internal and external customers, are designed to known best practices, and maximizes product value. The successful candidate (you) will Key Responsibilities Disciplined requirements-based engineering of the electronic control unit, including: Requirement’s analysis Requirement’s decomposition Requirement’s validation and verification Change management Effective coordination and communication with: Multi-disciplinary design teams Systems engineering teams Project management organizations Internal and external customers Technical leadership and oversight of: Electronic design and verification Mechanical systems design and verification Hardware/software integration Platform software design and verification Platform software/application software integration YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering 8+ years of engineering experience WE VALUE Background in electrical engineering, electronic design, and circuit analysis Background in hardware/software integration of microcontroller-based embedded systems Knowledge of software architectures and capabilities Knowledge of airborne software development processes, including DO-178 Experience in integrating sensors, actuators, and other components with an electronic control unit Knowledge of the product development lifecycle Individuals that quickly analyze and apply new information and concepts Leading a diverse and global team Individuals who are self-motivated, able to work with little supervision, and who consistently take the initiative to get things done Ability to manage a variety of complicated tasks, situations, and people Making autonomous decisions Additional Information JOB ID: HRD184413 Category: Engineering Location: 111 S 34th St.,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United States Exempt Engineering (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity THE BUSINESS Honeywell (www.honeywell.com) is a Fortune 100 technology company that delivers industry-specific solutions that include aerospace products and services; control technologies for buildings and industry; and performance materials globally. Our technologies help aircraft, buildings, manufacturing plants, supply chains, and workers become more connected to make our world smarter, safer, and more sustainable. Honeywell Aerospace products and services are found on virtually every commercial, defense and space aircraft in the world. With an unmatched heritage of innovation that spans more than a century, our aim is to solve the greatest challenges CEOs, pilots, operators, passengers, finance, maintenance and cabin crews face -- and transform the way we all fly. We deliver improved fuel-efficiency, more direct and on-time flights, safer and more comfortable travel and better flight planning and traffic management. We do this through one of the industry’s broadest and most advanced portfolios including world-class engines, cockpits, cabin design, wireless connectivity and enterprise performance management services – even for emerging market segments like flying taxies, while providing world-class customer service, repairs and technical support. At Honeywell Aerospace Advanced Connected Sustainability Technologies (ACST), our outstanding team of scientists, engineers, and professionals develop groundbreaking technology by applying their expertise in complex hardware and software control systems, atomic physics, ultra-high vacuum environments, cryogenics, cyber security, and more. THE POSITION We’re hiring a Learning Senior Manager for our Aerospace ACST business. This person can work on a hybrid schedule (3 days in office, 2 days working from home) if interested and can sit in located in Broomfield, CO or Golden Valley, MN. The successful candidate (you) will partner with organizational leaders to understand learning needs and priorities of the business, develop strategies, implement, and evaluate programs and achieve overall organizational objectives. Provides organization support of employee talent development in specified areas against specific planned timelines. Key Responsibilities Conduct assessment of the learning needs and priorities of the business Create current programs and establish ongoing system for evaluation Work with subject matter experts to develop effective, efficient solutions to meet learning requirements Ensure effective delivery methods whether leveraging technology, outside or inside talent or facilitating Manage programs that are determined as business priorities Effectively lead the learning management process and system Drive a process for improvements to programs once programs are established Develop, communicate, and market learning strategies and programs to the enterprise Evaluates reports, decisions, and results of human resources programs in relation to established goals. Recommend new approaches, policies, and procedures to effect continual improvements in efficiency of services provided. Directly or indirectly supervises associates and performs other managerial responsibilities including interviewing, hiring, and training associates; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining associates; addressing complaints and resolving problems. May perform other duties as required. Performance Materials and Technologies (PMT) is a multi-billion dollar Strategic Business Group of Honeywell with over 20,000 employees, serving over 125 countries. PMT has a tremendous opportunity for a Logistics Manager in its Process Solutions Strategic Business Unit. Honeywell Process Solutions provides leading automation control, instrumentation, advanced software, and related services for the oil and gas, refining, pulp and paper, industrial power generation, chemicals and petrochemicals, biofuels, life sciences, and metals, minerals, and mining industries. Through its smart energy products, Process Solutions enables utilities and distribution companies to deploy advanced capabilities to improve operations, reliability, and environmental sustainability. Our mission is to attract, retain and develop diverse and highly motivated, entrepreneurial employees striving to flawlessly deliver superior value to our customers every day. You’ll flourish in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment where success is rewarded. The successful candidate must be a self-starter, detail and data-oriented, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. You will lead cross-functional teams and projects through implementation and demonstrate a track record of achieving results and operational excellence. In addition, the candidate must be able to operate in a highly matrixed environment, communicate with all levels of the organization, influence, and gain commitment. ROLE PURPOSE The Americas Logistics Leader will be dedicated to leading all logistics activities within the region for Honeywell Process Solutions, including indirect oversight of site-level logistics personnel and 3PL warehousing teams to ensure flawless performance from order entry to shipment. They will drive improvements and productivity for logistics/warehousing aspects via major KPIs such as inbound/outbound logistics performance, cost, safety compliance, and on-time delivery. This position will partner with Manufacturing, Sourcing, IT, SIOP, Finance, and Sales to manage the distribution and transport strategy put in place to meet the needs of manufacturing and sales (internal customers). They will provide input for the development of the annual AOP for Logistics and be responsible for reporting on key metrics (Financial Results, Carrier Performance, Productivity Opportunity, etc.) for monthly reporting around logistics metrics. This position will partner with key stakeholders to ensure the OTP/OTD goals and internal customer delivery requirements are met for all products shipped to/from the site and accelerate innovation and process improvement while leading a team of talented workforce and influencing and driving a continuous improvement culture on the logistics process to achieve 5-7% productivity annually. Key Responsibilities Oversee a network of 21 Honeywell manufacturing and warehousing sites Create logistics strategy and lead the implementation Implementation of TMS regionally, including all modes of transportation Analyze distribution network for efficiency opportunities Manage overall operational targets of On Time to First Promise (OTFP) Partner with internal customers to ensure constant communication and relationship building Achieve annual budget targets of $35M in freight spend Evaluate material flow for total landed costs on a project basis Team with trade compliance to ensure timely execution of customs clearance Motivate, organize, and encourage teamwork Drive team excellence and talent retention Lead to drive continuous improvement of culture Improve freight audit and payment process YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree A minimum of five years of global logistics, transportation, and/or distribution experience Three years of direct management or supervisory experience WE VALUE Experience in Supervision/Managerial/Project Management role Significant experience in logistics, distribution, and warehousing Some experience in planning, materials management, and inventory control Bilingual in Spanish, a plus SAP knowledge and experience is a significant advantage Power user in Excel APICS or Lean Six Sigma Certified preferred Excellent collaboration and influence with management and cross-function teams Independent work initiative, sound judgment, diplomacy, analytical ability, and professional demeanor Ability to lead and influence people/team and engage/mentor staff Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills Excellent oral and written communication skills Additional Information JOB ID: HRD173295 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Innovate high-purity, high-performance chemicals and materials Honeywell Performance Materials and Technologies (PMT) is a global leader in providing customers with high-performance specialty materials, including fluorine products; specialty films and additives; advanced fibers and composites; intermediates; specialty chemicals; electronic materials and chemicals; and technologies and materials for petroleum refining. PMT employs approximately 27,000 people at more than 80 manufacturing and sales facilities worldwide. The Engineering/Maintenance Manager is responsible for directly overseeing and providing technical support for plant engineering and maintenance activities for the Fombell, PA site. This position will interface with production supervisors, process/project engineers, HSE Leadership, and maintenance employees in addition to Honeywell Corporate resources. They will also be responsible for management and oversite of the Fombell site capital project program. The Engineering/Maintenance manager will also supervise the Fombell engineers and maintenance team. Position Responsibilities Supervise Fombell engineers and maintenance employees, providing leadership, coaching, and developing the team. Provide feedback, including midyear and annual reviews for the Fombell maintenance team. Provide leadership in capital planning, annual operating plans, and capital projects. Work with and provide leadership to maintenance teams in establishing and maintaining a robust Preventive Maintenance Optimization program. Track and report out site OEE performance by month. Direct, review and approve temporary repairs and modifications to equipment - (e.g., piping repairs, rotating equipment, MOC's, etc.). Develop and improve proactive equipment reliability strategies (Reliability Control Plans). Develop, maintain, and update maintenance documentation (e.g., repair reports, bill of materials, upgrade recommendations) for critical plant equipment. Manage Capital appropriation process, including report-out and metrics tracking. Work with engineers and supervisors to ensure that process improvements and capital work are done correctly. Assist with rotating equipment vibration analysis and condition monitoring data interpretation, recommend actions based on these analyses. Using Root Cause Analysis, 5-Y, Failure Mode Effects Analysis, and other tools, provide analysis of failed equipment to determine and eliminate cause(s). Actively identify and eliminate waste in plant processes, procedures, and normal work activities. Actively participate in helping to improve the work environment through cleanliness, good housekeeping, and adherence to all environmental, health and safety policies. You Must Have BS in Mechanical, Chemical, or Electrical Engineering (or related engineering field). Minimum 8 years of manufacturing engineering experience. Minimum 3 years of managing direct reports. We Value Mechanical machinery design selection, repair techniques & performance assessment experience. Six Sigma Green Belt Certified preferred. Experience in Total Productive Maintenance (TPM). Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Excellent organizational, planning and verbal/written communication skills. Self-motivated and goal-oriented individual with proven success working independently and in a multi-functional team environment. Proficient use of MS Office Suite of software products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.). Knowledge of engineering materials chemical compatibility and application as relates to plant equipment reliability. Knowledge and practical experience in the application of various welding practices. Hands-on experience using SAP work management system or similar. Practical experience facilitating Root Cause Failure Analysis and Failure Mode and Effects Analysis utilizing a selection of industry standard tools. Working knowledge of project management including Front End Loading (FEL), drafting, and project planning software (e.g., AutoCAD, Visio, MS Project, Primavera, etc.). Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Honeywell Aerospace Materials Engineering (MatEng) is seeking an experienced materials and process engineer. This position is at the Engineer II level and will be based at the Deer Valley (Phoenix, AZ) site. The successful candidate will function as a growing technical leader and resource in providing specialized engineering expertise to support site-focused and cross-site program design activity, including material and process selection, customer reviews, specification writing, and contract deliverables. The successful candidate will also be expected to have an immediate impact to support electronics processes, including technical problem solving, project leadership, and special process supplier audits. Key Responsibilities Ability to provide technical expertise to solve materials and processes problems for both design and manufacturing. Ability to provide direct support to program design activity, including material and process selection, completing customer deliverables (i.e., material and process analysis and test reports), and technical problem-solving during development, qualification, and production phases. Ability to review customer- and Honeywell-generated requirements to ensure cost effective approaches and to verify performance and environmental requirements are met. Ability to develop and execute material and process evaluation test plans (e.g., flammability, fungus, hazardous materials). Ability to provide program / customer interface and communications to assure clarity and confidence for all projects, actions, and deliverables. Ability to function as the primary technical interface for materials and process-related issues for specific programs, and the ability to engage other technical materials and process experts for problem solving where assistance may be needed. Ability to provide technical expertise to support Aero special process teams and team activities, including supplier technical process audits and technical problem solving. Ability to deploy technical expertise in generation, review and maintenance of site, Aero, and industry specifications. Ability to perform failure analysis, determine root cause and appropriate corrective actions, and implement corrective actions, including application of six sigma tools. Ability to provide technical support and leadership of special projects related to materials obsolescence, product / process improvement, technology development, etc. Ability to perform trade studies to evaluate suitability, reliability, and failure characteristics of materials and assemblies. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Applied Science, or Science. Minimum 3 years of engineering experience working directly in materials and process design and applications roles. Direct experience with electronics manufacturing processes (e.g., soldering, conformal coating, cable/wire harness assembly, electronic box assembly). WE VALUE Aerospace industry experience. Direct experience with non-metallic materials and processes (e.g., adhesives, elastomers, sealants, molding, potting, bonding, paint, etc.). Direct experience with metallic materials and processes (e.g., welding, brazing, heat treatment, casting, forging, stainless steel, aluminum, etc.). Direct experience with industry, military, and aerospace specifications. Direct experience in auditing systems, processes, and procedures. Strong focus on task completion and exceeding expectations Strong focus on problem solving Strong technical writing skills Strong communication skills to enable interface with programs and their customers Strong computer skills, especially Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and with respect to generating reports, charts, graphs, etc. Ability to work as task leader Ability to work in a team environment Ability to quickly assimilate new concepts and information Ability to multi-task work assignments Ability to work in a dynamic and changing environment Ability to work independently with minimal work direction Ability to make timely decisions even in the face of complexity Additional Information JOB ID: HRD183823 Category: Engineering Location: 21111 N. 19th Ave (Deer Valley),Phoenix,Arizona,85027,United States Exempt Engineering (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Customer interface Class II Design Authority for Phase 6 ECNs Estimation development and analysis Cost development Budget analysis Metric development/reporting Vendor interface Project Performance metrics YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering Must be U.S. Citizen due to contractual obligations WE VALUE Product design experience Aerospace engineering experience Ability to work independently Willingness to learn new technologies Understand heat exchanger, generator, valve and turbine engine technology An open, honest and team-oriented personality Individuals who are self-motivated and able to work with little supervision, who consistently take the initiative to get things done. Some experience developing products or sustaining existing products Experience in a highly regulated and safety critical domain Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182439 Category: Engineering Location: 1944 E Sky Harbor Circle,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements.
