The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? A co-op in the Honeywell Intelligrated Product Development group experiences many job functions including mechanical design, product testing and evaluation, drawing production and revisions, bill of material creation and maintenance, and field inspection of installed systems. Co-ops are introduced to the process of developing designs from conception through product launch. In this position, you will provide engineering support on design projects with other Product Development team members. The team regularly works cross-functionally and interfaces with customers, vendors, manufacturing, and quality to improve and develop new parts. jobDescription: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. As a mechanical engineering co-op in the Reliability & Test engineering organization, you will be responsible for installation and operation of test equipment used for verification and validation of both new and existing designs and components. You will work closely with more senior engineers to specify and commission automated test cells, collect data, perform analysis, and reporting and presenting test results. This is a hands-on role that may include mechanical and electrical assembly, troubleshooting and implementation of control systems. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Advanced Materials is a global supplier of fluorine products, fine chemicals, additives, metals, films and fibers for products including pharmaceuticals, refrigeration, semiconductors and military protection. Advanced Materials is making the world safer, cleaner and enabling the modernization of a growing middle class by enhancing our customer offerings through a differentiated portfolio of chemistries, materials, value-added solutions and superior customer service. Our mission is to attract, retain and develop diverse and highly motivated, entrepreneurial employees striving to flawlessly deliver superior value to our customers every day. The Operational Technologies (OT) Network Team within Performance Materials and Technologies (PMT) IT designs, implements and operates state-of-the-art networks and infrastructure for the operations and security of plant control networks for our integrated supply chain. We work with the latest and emerging technologies to deliver scalable, high-performing, always available infrastructure services for our chemical plants. We deliver services that connect, host, virtualize, store, collaborate, integrate, compute, and transact business information utilizing local, edge and cloud technologies. The Network Administrator will be a US Citizen located in Geismar LA, Houston TX, or Des Plaines IL and be responsible for operational support of the network infrastructure for PMT ISC Plant Control Networks (PCNs). The candidate will be required to travel up to 25% of their time for infrastructure related projects to our plants. REMOTE SCHEDULE OFFERED 15-20% Travel Required Position located in Geismar, LA, Houston, TX or Des Plaines, IL Must be able to drive in for as needed onsite meetings Summary This position is responsible for collaborating with ISC (integrated supply chain) project managers, OT teams and Enterprise IT to provide network infrastructure that is available, stable, and secure for PMT process plants globally. This includes the evaluation, design, selection, purchase, installation, configuration and maintenance of network systems, hardware, and software. This position is responsible for leading small projects for network design, development, integration and/or enhancements. Duties And Responsibilities Configure, manage, and monitor network operations and increase network effectiveness Troubleshoot network related issues Maintain and operate complex firewall configurations and policies Works with cyber security to maintain and monitor system security measures as well as assisting with computer security plans and documentation Remain aware of cyber security issues relevant to industrial control systems by monitoring cisa.gov and implementing innovative technical solutions. Proactively identify and help resolve issues before they become critical Utilize SIEM tools to search log data and perform analysis on events Creates and maintains scripts in the support of maintaining network infrastructure Evaluate and recommends networking processes, tools and/or software to be used in satisfying business and IT operational needs Utilize established processes for leading the planning and execution of small infrastructure projects Create and/or update network systems and cable plant documentation in various systems per established processes and standards Participates in incident management, asset management, change management and continuous improvement of network systems Conducts activities in a safe and healthy manner and works in accordance with established HS&E requirements to ensure the protection of employees, the public and the environment. Takes actions necessary to stop work when an unsafe condition or action is identified as every employee has the right and responsibility to stop work when unsafe conditions or actions are identified You Must Have 2+ years of demonstrated experience with configuration, installation, and operational support of firewalls, switches, routers, and wireless access points 2+ years of demonstrated experience with Ethernet, VPN (IPSec and SSL), wireless, TCP/IP and network traffic analysis via packet capture tools 2+ years of demonstrated experience with network management troubleshooting and monitoring tools 1+ years of demonstrated experience planning and executing small infrastructure projects including the design, testing, installation, and documentation of network systems 1+ years of demonstrated experience developing and maintaining network diagrams/documentation. 1+ years of demonstrated experience scripting or knowledge of programming fundamentals We Value Experience with configuring Checkpoint and/or Juniper firewalls Experience with interfacing to the networking of VMWare systems Basic knowledge of the Purdue Model, ISA 95 & ISA 99 Basic knowledge of the entire OSI network model with an emphasis on layers 1-3 Basic knowledge of routing protocols, IEEE 802.11 Wi-Fi Standards, controller-based Wi-Fi systems, NAC, RADIUS, DHCP, DNS and internet VPNs (IPSEC and SSL) Basic knowledge of scripting in the support of automating services and infrastructure maintenance Demonstrate strong verbal, written, analytical and problem-solving skill AM202020 Additional Information JOB ID: req373966 Category: Information Technology Location: 5525 Hwy 3115,Geismar,Louisiana,70734,United States Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. The Network Administrator will be a US Citizen located in Geismar LA, Houston TX, or Des Plaines IL and be responsible for operational support of the network infrastructure for PMT ISC Plant Control Networks (PCNs). The candidate will be required to travel up to 25% of their time for infrastructure related projects to our plants. REMOTE SCHEDULE OFFERED 15-20% Travel Required Position located in Geismar, LA, Houston, TX or Des Plaines, IL Must be able to drive in for as needed onsite meetings Summary This position is responsible for collaborating with ISC (integrated supply chain) project managers, OT teams and Enterprise IT to provide network infrastructure that is available, stable, and secure for PMT process plants globally. This includes the evaluation, design, selection, purchase, installation, configuration and maintenance of network systems, hardware, and software. This position is responsible for leading small projects for network design, development, integration and/or enhancements. Duties And Responsibilities Configure, manage, and monitor network operations and increase network effectiveness Troubleshoot network related issues Maintain and operate complex firewall configurations and policies Works with cyber security to maintain and monitor system security measures as well as assisting with computer security plans and documentation Remain aware of cyber security issues relevant to industrial control systems by monitoring cisa.gov and implementing innovative technical solutions. Proactively identify and help resolve issues before they become critical Utilize SIEM tools to search log data and perform analysis on events Creates and maintains scripts in the support of maintaining network infrastructure Evaluate and recommends networking processes, tools and/or software to be used in satisfying business and IT operational needs Utilize established processes for leading the planning and execution of small infrastructure projects Create and/or update network systems and cable plant documentation in various systems per established processes and standards Participates in incident management, asset management, change management and continuous improvement of network systems Conducts activities in a safe and healthy manner and works in accordance with established HS&E requirements to ensure the protection of employees, the public and the environment. Takes actions necessary to stop work when an unsafe condition or action is identified as every employee has the right and responsibility to stop work when unsafe conditions or actions are identified You Must Have 2+ years of demonstrated experience with configuration, installation, and operational support of firewalls, switches, routers, and wireless access points 2+ years of demonstrated experience with Ethernet, VPN (IPSec and SSL), wireless, TCP/IP and network traffic analysis via packet capture tools 2+ years of demonstrated experience with network management troubleshooting and monitoring tools 1+ years of demonstrated experience planning and executing small infrastructure projects including the design, testing, installation, and documentation of network systems 1+ years of demonstrated experience developing and maintaining network diagrams/documentation. 1+ years of demonstrated experience scripting or knowledge of programming fundamentals We Value Experience with configuring Checkpoint and/or Juniper firewalls Experience with interfacing to the networking of VMWare systems Basic knowledge of the Purdue Model, ISA 95 & ISA 99 Basic knowledge of the entire OSI network model with an emphasis on layers 1-3 Basic knowledge of routing protocols, IEEE 802.11 Wi-Fi Standards, controller-based Wi-Fi systems, NAC, RADIUS, DHCP, DNS and internet VPNs (IPSEC and SSL) Basic knowledge of scripting in the support of automating services and infrastructure maintenance Demonstrate strong verbal, written, analytical and problem-solving skill AM202020 Additional Information JOB ID: req373966 Category: Information Technology Location: 5525 Hwy 3115,Geismar,Louisiana,70734,United States Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Plant Controller will be responsible for all account transactions reviewing, month-end / year-end closing. Manage overall finance activities in the department to ensure financial statement accuracy. Maintain a robust controls and compliance environment for site. Responsible for site internal controls and compliance, including income statement and balance sheet reporting, fixed assets, inventory, journal entries, and plant controllership. Support and complete Annual Balance Sheet Review and any applicable financial audits. Ensure that the accounting entries are in compliance with local tax regulation and Honeywell policies. Develop productivity plans with site and drive accountability to annual targets. Partner with site leadership team to drive financial discipline for site. FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Directs the execution of all financial, accounting, and data processing activities, improves cost controls, reporting and general accounting procedures; prepares periodic operation and budget reports. Manage the company’s closing accounting entries, provide preliminary reviews and make appropriate adjustments to the company’s financial statements to ensure that they are accurate, reliable and in compliance with accounting policies, standards, related tax laws and regulations and are timely submitted. Liaises with the Revenue Department in regard to all local tax and regulations and corporate income tax return. Ensure internal controls are adequate to safeguard company assets and the integrity of financial records. Liaises with external auditors in concluding year-end entries adjustments. Liaise with both internal and external auditors to meet information and reporting requirement Review all accounts reconciliation and coordinate with related Honeywell companies. Monitor stock transactions in terms of stock receipt, stock adjust, stock level, physical count and related inventory account. Monitor capital expenditure and maintain Fix Assets register book Assist in the annual operating plan process and other financial analysis or special projects. As a member of the management team, support the Plant Managers in the day-to-day management of the business as well as provide advice and support on all commercial issues Provide day-to-day financial support focused upon achievement of the financial objectives of the business Ensure accounting financial and operating are reported accurately to reflect the condition of the business and provide reliable information for control and arrangement purposes Maintain standard cost of materials Prepares reports and analysis of results, including investigation of variances and their interpretation Annual operating plan - lead process for site including presentation to leadership team as needed. Partner with other disciplines at site. Create and update annual standard setting process for site, including ownership of standard cost results/ target setting on full plant P&L 5-Year STRAP (Strategic Plan) - provide and lead support role for site ISC team, including analysis of cost needed to support STRAP demand plan Monthly / weekly forecasting process for ISC spending, production credits, and variances. Ad hoc forecasting and reporting as needed. Ad hoc Financial Planning & Analysis projects as needed to support the plant Finance team Annual Standard Cost Rolls You Must Have: ​3+ years of Accounting and Finance experience Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance 2+ years of SAP experience 3+ years GAAP accounting Role will be on-site at Pottsville, PA plant (Generous relocation assistance package offered to eligible candidates!) ​We Value: ​Prior experience in a plant-based role Experience working in a Manufacturing environment Integrated Supply Chain finance skills (Standard Cost, Absorption, Yield) Ability to interact effectively with all levels of the business and influence with data. Work with large data sets, simplify up-level and prepare for senior leadership consumption Strong verbal and written communication skills, able to effectively communicate financial information to non-financial people Strong work ethic - ability to management multiple, critical projects simultaneously and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment Highly proficient in information technology financial applications particularly SAP and Excel

UOP, a Honeywell company headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a leading international licensor of processing technology and supplier of engineering services, catalysts and adsorbents, equipment, specialty materials and digital solutions for the global refining, gas processing and petrochemical industries. With more than a century of leadership in hydrocarbon processing technologies, UOP has led six revolutions in technology that transformed our industry. For more information visit www.uop.com. Join a team of specialists that provide program analysis, project controls, process improvement, and metrics for Honeywell. You will partner with Integrated program team to develop program plans and create cost and schedule baselines. You will prepare and publish metrics and reports. You will analyze variances and review compliance to corporate guidelines across multiple teams. Your findings will drive decisions to improve the program performance impacting one or more site locations. Key Responsibilities Enter Data Prepare and publish metrics and reports Analyze program performance Maintain schedule and track milestones Identify route cause Improve processes Analyze cost and schedule integration Track budget and program financial data Recommend corrective actions YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree 3+ years of experience in project controls related activities WE VALUE Degree in Business, Science or Engineering, Finance or Accounting or related field. Experience in business/finance analyst position. Ability to influence at varying levels across the organization. Ability to work in a large, remote and diverse team in a matrix work environment. User experience of SAP system, scheduling tools ie Primavera or MS Project Proficient Microsoft Office package skills e.g. Excel, Project, Outlook, PowerPoint etc. Experience in financial data compilation, analysis and metrics management. Experience in usage of Earned value metrics, Estimate at completion growth and Milestone Fidelity. Are you ready to help us make the future? We are seeking a Technical Lead for the development of computer vision, artificial intelligence (AI) and autonomy technologies for aerial vehicle platforms. This dynamic role will be responsible for crafting and implementing multi-year research plans ($5+Million / year), developing, and supporting technologies for automatic and autonomous vehicle operations, including navigation and position estimation, obstacle detection, etc. The role includes pursuit of both government and internal funding for technology development, as well as leading the execution of the work with our global team of talented scientists and engineers. This includes the development and implementation on prototypes of both classical and deep learning-based systems for visual navigation, position estimation, object detection, classification, etc. The Technical Lead will work with customers to define autonomy features and functions, and then drive our technology development teams to develop the best set of sensors, algorithms, and computational architectures to implement those autonomy functions, leading all aspects of their development. You will lead both internal and external customer projects. You’ll conduct regular interface meetings with customers, peer groups, business leaders, flight test groups and product engineers to define robust technology roadmaps, defining key milestones, capability demonstrations, transition plans, and funding requirements. Key Responsibilities Co-Lead Autonomy technology strategy development and deployment Define and lead perception, navigation, controls, and related technologies supporting autonomous and unmanned aerial vehicles, and alternative navigation solutions Lead Voice of Customer (VOC) activities with key external and internal customers to define differentiated product solutions. Drive technology transitions and productization of key computer vision technologies to develop hardware, software, edge solution and integrate it onto key Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAV) and Urban air Mobility (UAM) platforms YOU MUST HAVE Master’s Degree Minimum 8 years’ experience developing autonomy and autonomous guidance solutions utilizing perception, navigation, Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning Minimum 5 years’ experience leading complex technical R&D programs for internal customers and external government customers such as DARPA, NASA, or AFRL Minimum 3 years’ experience pursuing, winning, and executing government funded programs (several programs in excess of $0.5M) WE VALUE Master’s Degree Ph. D in Robotics, Computer Science, or Electrical Engineering Experience deploying complex computer vision solutions on unmanned systems for autonomy applications such as automatic landing/takeoff, landmark navigation, visual odometry, optical flow, target tracking or detect and avoid Several recent publications or organizing committee participation in top international conferences and journals in the area of robotics, computer vision and/or machine learning New methods of computer vision including machine learning Lead technical teams to integrate sensors (e.g., FLIR Blackfly Camera or Ouster LIDAR) and algorithms on embedded platforms (e.g., NVidia Jetson or Xavier embedded GPUs) Writing and winning government funded proposals, especially for autonomy, or autonomous guidance solutions Team player who can both lead and contribute as the various projects require

Deliver business value through Right and Fast partnership We’re hiring a Procurement Manager for our Performance Materials & Technology (PMT) business located in Nebraska City, NE. The successful candidate (you) will support annual and year over year productivity goals, on time delivery, accounts payables, payment terms, spend on contract, and contributing to LTA strategic supply base. Leveraging your procurement expertise and significant leadership experience (especially in a matrixed multinational), you’ll be a key member of the Smart Energy (SME) business within Performance Materials and Technologies (PMT) leadership team. An expert at managing supplier relationship and performance, you’ll be front and center for a variety of motivational supply chain initiatives around the world. You will be involved in supplier lead-time, material consignment, deployment of eSourcing tools, and supplier consolidation. You’ll have a strong eye for details, impeccable timing, communication skills, and an innovative, strategic mindset. Key Responsibilities Management of Tactical buyers to deliver key Buyer Metrics including; Requisitions to PO placement, PO confirmations, Past Due POs, Return/repair execution, Efficiency of MRP actions to successful and timely PO placement, Expedites / Delays / Cancels, Past Due POs & Requisitions, Escalations. Lead weekly operational governance for gas meters sites, work to improve with agreed Lean tools, RCCM’s and others for on time delivery of direct material. Drive accountability at buyer level – Implement buyer governance to improve daily/ weekly metrics Actively drive CCA supply chain. Collaborate with ISC/ commodity managers to reduce inventory, increase flexibility and availability of CCAs; E&O and capacity management in line with strategies. Maintain and improve where possible daily MOS structure for the procurement process. Additionally strengthen & document escalation process. Contribute to Develop and implement plans to meet Annual Operation Plan (AOP) goals which includes productivity, lead-time reductions, working capital improvement, quality, supplier rationalization and delivery performance. Provide inputs to Global Commodities on the respective product/ business strategies and ensure Site Sourcing Strategies and Global Commodity Strategies are coordinated and linked with the business Through the analysis of current spend, processes and practices, develop and deploy direct material sourcing strategy for a product line that supports the goals of the business units including product cost competitiveness, productivity, lean supply chain, material replenishment, supplier consolidation, process standardization, transaction cost removal, and process digitization that meets the annual operating plan. Implement multiple tools to drive cost competitiveness. Actively promote eSourcing tools to drive incremental performance and efficiencies Coordinate with CoE, Supplier Quality, NPI Sourcing and Project sourcing to support sourcing goals for the site Collaborate with NPI Sourcing for launch of new products assigned to the site and actively lead launch of new supplier based on milestones Ensure material availability from supplies based on demand. Provide future outlook on supply and take lead in resolving critical delivery issues with suppliers. Play active role in resolving critical quality with Supplier Quality and Suppliers Review of supplier performance as per agreed site sourcing metrics Collaborate with ISC to establish a lean and flexible supply chain based to reduce order fulfillment cycle times and improve delivery. Establish advanced material replenishment strategies. Mentor and establish a strong and high performing team with an emphasis on talent recruitment, retention, competence development and organizational effectiveness Actively promote deployment of six sigma tools and methods Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree 3+ years of global experience in Procurement and Strategic Sourcing 2+ years of experience in Procurement Supplier Relationship Preferred Master's degree preferred. Leadership experience in Supply Management/Sourcing/Procurement. SAP ERP, highly preferred Die Casting Supplier Experience CIPS and/or CPM or equivalent certification desired. Six Sigma Green Belt or Black Belt certification preferred. Previous experience in global high-mix manufacturing business, highly preferred. Experience building and leading global procurement teams with an emphasis on emerging region Demonstrated ability to manage / lead multiple projects and changing priorities Ability to work with, manage and influence all levels of Leadership. Ability to make data-driven decisions. Successful use of decision-making and analytical skills. Excellent communication skills. Honeywell Intelligrated’s Product Management team is currently recruiting for a Product Management Co-op to support our Electromechanical Product Management Team! The Product Management Co-op will have primary responsibility of gathering, organizing and evaluating industry, corporate, customer and competitor data. The ability to assist with the preparation of product roadmaps and providing support on product development projects is also an important piece of this position's skill set. The Product Management co-op will work closely with Product Marketing Managers and Product Development, they will also have the opportunity work cross-functionally throughout the organization. Mine product data (sales, cost, usage, etc.) for current products and research technical product / solution information as requested by Product Managers Create trend reports and presentations based on this data Support potential and active Product Development Projects with value proposition development, market strategy and business case action items as needed Assist in updating and maintaining Product Roadmaps and Product Development plans Help review Product Manuals, cut sheets and other marketing and technical documentation YOU MUST HAVE Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Marketing or Business major Must be able to participate in a co-op prior to completing current degree program WE VALUE Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal. Strong attention to detail and follow-through skills. Skilled in MS Excel, MS Word and PowerPoint. Oracle and SharePoint experience a plus. Proven problem-solving abilities and analytical skills. The ability to work independently. Effective organizational and interpersonal skills. Honeywell Intelligrated is a leading, single-source provider of automated material handling solutions and intelligent software that drive fulfillment productivity for retailers, manufacturers and logistics providers around the world. Through a broad portfolio of automation equipment, warehouse execution system software, services and support, our solutions give businesses a competitive edge in increasingly complex commerce and fulfillment environments. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is charging into the Industrial IoT revolution with the establishment of Honeywell Connected Enterprise (HCE), building on our heritage of invention and deep, on-the-ground industry expertise. HCE is the leading industrial disruptor, building and connecting software solutions to streamline and centralize the assets, people and processes that help our customers make smarter, more accurate business decisions. Moving at the speed of software, we are creating, innovating and delivering solutions fast, challenging the way things have always been done, piloting new ways for all of us to work, and expecting our successes to set new standards for our customers and for Honeywell. About This Role This position is for an experienced SaaS-oriented Product Manager to steward our next generation Site and Space management services. These services include web-based UIs and back-end capabilities so that Honeywell Forge customers can manage Site and Space provisioning for their users as well as for their enterprise systems that integrate to Forge EPM applications. You will be the go-to person to interface with our domain-based product and development teams in Buildings, Industrial Plants and Warehouse, as well as HCE Security, DevOps, and Customer Ops to understand, coordinate, define, and deliver for these common platform solutions. Key Responsibilities Regularly analyze customer / market / technical requirements. In Forge cloud services, we have to solve for our internal and external customers but also our customers’ customers Closely monitor gaps in offerings and introduce new capabilities Create Product Roadmaps based on detailed understanding of core competencies, technology strategy and ongoing commitments Drive build-buy decisions within the organization and conduct licensing negotiations with third party vendors Ensure alignment across teams to ensure secure, compliant and continuous delivery of the product capabilities in cloud environment Conduct cross-team coordination for building Marketing Plans, Pricing, Product Deployment and Operations Planning, Project Planning, etc. Conduct strategic sessions, drive POC efforts, etc., and build long-term relationships with customers and partners YOU MUST HAVE 5+ years of experience in Product Management Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university WE VALUE Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline Customer Centricity: energized by spending time with customers to understand defined and latent needs. Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing, and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Of Duties The production scheduling position is critical to maintaining short range planning capabilities throughout the plant The production scheduler is focused on a 0-3 month planning window and manage all PID releases, material shortages and ship requirements during that time frame Performs a variety of complex activities (Critical Path Analysis, SIOP forecasting, inventory tracking through complex Bill of Material) They are crucial to ensuring that the production floor is successfully set up for daily, weekly & monthly execution of requirements Manages production schedule (PIDS/production IDs) - on time release of jobs, verification/expediting of material shortages, monitoring & driving results towards aged work orders, managing point of consumption, managing appropriate activity IDs to ensure costing accuracy Influences and develops weekly production schedule by evaluating/analyzing, approving, and applying complex planning messages generated from the planning system based on a master production schedule, shop load, and inventory requirements Identifies impact to the schedule and negotiates with Operations Managers, Sr Production Schedulers, and other Production Schedulers May lead cross functional projects with minimal oversight Negotiates with internal and external stakeholders to plan, prepare, issue, and control production schedules and material requirements based on analysis and interpretation of data from complex, integrated computer software programs to ensure a controlled flow of approved materials timed to meet production requirements across a three-shift operation You Must Have Bachelor’s degree and 2 YOE in supply chain or 4 or more years of total experience in supply chain in lieu of a degree Ability to solve problems utilizing analytical skills, demonstrated leadership & written/oral communication skills We Value Preferred: Previous experience in production planning/manufacturing, commercial software experience (ERP/MRP), APICS certification Understanding of SIOP, Inventory Management, MRP, MPS, Procurement, Logistics, and Manufacturing Knowledge of advanced planning tools a strong plus Ability to influence up, down and across the organization Process oriented with a track record of getting results standing of SIOP, Inventory Management, MRP, MPS, Procurement, Logistics, and Manufacturing Strong clerical/data entry background Knowledge of advanced planning tools a strong plus Ability to influence up, down and across the organization Process oriented with a track record of getting result FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req382677 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 14520 Botts Road,Kansas City,Missouri,64147,United States Nonexempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Project Manager coordinates and delivers the implementation of Honeywell Advanced Meter Infrastructure (AMI) to our utility clients across all market sectors. You will serve as the primary point of contact and representative of Honeywell for AMI projects and will be responsible for ensuring the successful delivery of the project per the terms of each contract while keeping customer satisfaction and our business in mind. You will review status of projects and manage budgets. You will coordinate schedules and deliver status reports to both the customer and internal stakeholders. You will assess project issues, and develop resolutions to meet productivity, quality, and customers satisfaction goals and objectives. Honeywell is building smarter, safer, and more sustainable world. Honeywell invents and manufactures technologies that address some of the world’s most critical challenges around energy, safety, security, productivity and global urbanization. Our core businesses – Aerospace, Home and Building Technologies, Safety and Productivity Solutions, and Performance Materials and Technologies – are leaders in their respective industries, driving solutions that make people’s lives better every day. Chances are that there are Honeywell products all around you right now! As our sales maturity continuously improve, we have the need to recruit proven Sales Excellence (SE) experts who can further accelerate our adoption and deployment of the right tools, processes and metrics that drive sustainable organic growth faster than the market. We are currently seeking a proven leader who can leverage their experiences to directly impact the commercial effectiveness and sales performance attainment of our global Productivity Solutions and Services (PSS) sales organization. This position will be located at the Honeywell global headquarters in Charlotte, NC. Sales Excellence Sr. Director, Honeywell Productivity Solutions (PSS) As the Sales Excellence (SE) Senior Director, you will be responsible for driving common cross-enterprise standards, in how we deploy the annual growth plan strategy into actionable sales activities by developing and maintaining a continuously improving ‘playbook’ of common sales processes, commercial organizational structures, tools and metrics that deliver accelerated growth and measurable customer adoption. This key position in our organization collaborates regularly with global, cross-functional teams including Sales, Marketing, Information Technology, Finance, HR and Compensation & Benefits to deliver comprehensive and profitable outcomes for Honeywell. Reporting To The SPS Vice President Sales Excellence And Marketing And Working With Other SE Leaders For The Business Entities And Regions You Will Champion The Enablement Of Go-To-Market models, sales and channel structures and functional support necessary to sell complex solutions and demonstrate tangible proof of value to the decision maker. Create and execute a rigorous sales management operating system (MOS) that integrates the coordinated review and execution of the sales pipeline, account opportunities and leads across the entire enterprise with routine engagement with each business and region at the sales manager and sales contributor level. Inspect, coach and enforce the practical utilization of the standard sales metrics and utilize interactive analytics dashboards to generate actionable insights and training that Business Leaders and Sales Managers can use to improve selling behaviors and exceed overall performance goals versus the annual targets. Be accountable for driving the initiatives that improve seller performance and productivity measurably and sustainably; develop programs and metrics that increase the adoption of the right sales behaviors and outcomes around account and call planning, pipeline forecasting, win rate, deal velocity, customer retention and forecast accuracy. Drive the routine self-assessment of the businesses’ SE maturity and sales manager / individual seller competencies; identify common needs and prioritize the next step improvements by highest economic impact; work in coordination with other SPS corporate staff responsible for sales training, sales automation and analytics to leverage our combined resources and best practices In collaboration with our HR Partners and Business/Sales Leaders, be accountable for driving the global coordination of the Seller recruitment processes, tools and onboarding & training methods to improve the new employee experience, accelerate their ramp-up and increase the acquisition and retention of top sales talent. Coordinate with Marketing to generate best in class practices to translate the strategic growth plans into practical quota setting, effective demand generation activities, lead to revenue conversion process, pricing models, offering launches and value selling content focused on differentiation and long- term business value for the customer Generate a proactive communication and education strategy to the global salesforce regarding benchmarking, best practices, news on tools, training and productivity enhancements. The Measures Of Success Will Include Driving significant year-on-year improvements in seller productivity, quota attainment and customer acquisitions while maintaining a robust and integrated functional excellence in sales operations across the enterprise. Aligning the sales force where the business is growing (emerging regions and new end markets)– expanding portfolio, more software recurring revenue Drive a consistent approach to sales operations process around pipeline opportunity, territory and key accounts management across all geographies and lines of business Drive best practice in digital enablement to give sellers more qualified leads to pursue stronger value propositions and tools and training that increase their personal productivity Drive a highly efficient and effective channel operations model leveraging point of sale (POS) data and channel insights to understand growth in the market and Continue to drive the talent acquisitions, create career development opportunity, manage/optimize the core sales team in terms of performance and behaviors vs expectations, attract and retain top talent. Qualifications You Will Need For This Role Bachelor’s Degree, preferably with an additional, relevant post-graduate business/commercial qualification. 7+ years’ experience including a combination of sales operation, sales leadership/management, and/or Commercial Excellence roles. Experience working in influence-based roles within large, matrixed organizations and working cross functionally with other functions. Experiences And Skills, We Value MBA degree and a financial background strongly preferred. Demonstrated capability to translate growth strategies into practical sales plans, best practices and operational structures with a broad portfolio of business model and industry vertical commercial experiences. Excellent business acumen, strategic planning, analytical, communication, project management, and change management skills. Customer success obsession and a bold passion for working towards results and customer satisfaction. Leadership impact and ability to consult with and challenge business leaders at multiple levels within the organization regarding their needs, gaps and operational plans. Superior communicator able to assemble and clearly articulate key strategies, plans and reports aligned to drive tangible business impact. Strong listening and facilitation skills. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD163286 Category: Sales Excellence and Support Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Of Duties Participates or leads teams to provide quality input for the development, manufacture, procurement, and acceptance of a variety of products and assemblies Develops methods and writes detailed instructions for inspection processes Coordinates the design of product acceptance equipment and the ordering of testers, gages, and equipment to support product acceptance Provides technical assistance to inspection areas Develops and monitors quality metrics, levels, and trends Analyzes and makes recommendations regarding product discrepancies Evaluates opportunities for defect prevention and implements specific and preventative corrective actions Develops test procedures and performs evaluation tests, capability studies, quality audits, data reviews, and other engineering evaluations utilizing Six Sigma methodology Interacts with customers, suppliers, designers, and others to assist in resolving design, development, production, and acceptance issues Provides technical consultation to management and others and leads technical project teams. Conducts activities in a safe and healthy manner and works in accordance with established ES&H requirements to ensure the protection of associates, the public, and the environment. Takes actions necessary to stop work when an unsafe condition or action is identified. Every associate has the right and responsibility to stop work when unsafe conditions or actions are identified Some travel (approximately 15%) is required You Must Have U.S. citizenship to obtain and maintain US Dept of Energy Q-level security clearance Bachelor of Science degree from an ABET accredited Engineering program or Bachelor of Science degree in Physics from and accredited program Two or more years of relevant experience in Engineering or related technical activities We Value Existing DOE Q-Clearance desirable Ability to analyze engineering drawings and specifications to develop effective acceptance processes and improve existing processes Demonstrated ability to lead quality improvement projects Familiarity with Six Sigma tools and methodology; Six Sigma certification preferred. Effective verbal, written, and presentation skills Ability to work effectively in a team environment and to influence others to accomplish complex tasks and solve complex technical problems Ability and willingness to drive change and challenge / improve existing processes Demonstrated project management/leadership skills; ability to evaluate situations, determine corrective measures, plan, and lead other employees and suppliers to execute plans to meet customer deliverables FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req382303 Category: Engineering Location: 6700 W 115th St,Overland Park,Kansas,66211,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is charging into the Industrial IoT revolution with the establishment of Honeywell Connected Enterprise (HCE), building on our heritage of invention and deep, on-the-ground industry expertise. HCE is the leading industrial disruptor, building and connecting software solutions to streamline and centralize the assets, people and processes that help our customers make smarter, more accurate business decisions. Moving at the speed of software, we are creating, innovating, and delivering solutions fast, challenging the way things have always been done, piloting new ways for all of us to work, and expecting our successes to set new standards for our customers and for Honeywell. We are looking for a Senior Quality Engineer to join the Sparta TrackWise Digital Quality Engineering team. You will partner with product management, development, architecture, customer support, and professional services stakeholders to deliver quality features that enhance the experience of our customers. You will utilize approaches that bring quality further upstream and share actionable data that keeps quality top of mind. We need someone who is technically strong, energetic, highly collaborative, and passionate about the product and our customers. This is a key role executing on Quality Engineering initiatives such as advancing test automation, increasing test coverage, and reducing escaped defects. Key Responsibilities Involved in QE activities associated with TrackWise Digital releases. Work with a team of TrackWise Digital quality engineers to ensure the highest quality product delivery and monitor metrics to gauge progress against quality goals. Understand how all components and interfaces of the product work together and develop QE approaches to fit the overall product architecture. Support product teams in ensuring high product quality through exploratory and functional testing techniques Develop software test strategies and test scenarios, analyze test results, and maintain test suites. Develop automation scripts for validating the product User Interface (UI) and web services (API). Participate in defect reviews during the release process to ensure resolution and systemic root cause removal and support other root-cause analysis exercises. Act as a change agent within the Sparta organization to improve quality and agility. YOU MUST HAVE 2+ years of software testing and quality assurance experience of SaaS solutions, in an Agile development environment 1+ year of experience defining test strategies and test scenarios for multi-tiered web-facing applications, and testing web services, especially REST services 1+ year of hands-on experience maintaining test automation frameworks and scripts with Selenium WebDriver, including creating automation scripts beyond record and playback using languages like Java WE VALUE Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Computer/Electrical engineering or similar Practical experience in all types of testing including exploratory, functional, and non-functional testing such as performance and reliability Knowledge of database concepts, with SQL/Oracle experience Practical experience with mobile application testing Familiarity with build and continuous integration tools like Jenkins Familiarity with the Salesforce platform Don’t meet every single requirement? The desired candidate will work a rotating 12-hour shift schedule, alternating between day and night shift every two weeks. Work shifts are 6am to 6pm for days, 6pm to 6am for nights, and include holidays and weekends. Provide pilot plant support for R&D customers, Manufacturing, and Sales Support. Your work will include conducting pilot plant startups and shutdowns, monitoring and adjusting process conditions, troubleshooting, and preparing and collecting samples while promoting safety excellence. Become proficient in the Honeywell Operating System (HOS) and contribute to continuous improvement efforts on area work processes to improve the group’s effectiveness in supporting the development of the latest catalysts, adsorbents, and process technologies. Collect, organize, interpret, and compare data against expected performance. Be part of the R&D team in Orange, Texas, for developing new processes and products, or improving existing commercial processes for Honeywell’s Advanced Materials Specialty Additives business. Perform analytical tests to acquire product properties. Key Responsibilities Be flexible to work rotating shifts and overtime per shift schedule. Prepare and clean up pilot plant equipment before and after experiments. Operate pilot equipment such as compressor, reactor, and vessel via DCS system. Monitor process conditions, document experiments, and collect experimental data Operate the lab instruments and perform analytical tests such as viscosity, acid value, melting point, hardness, molecule weight, etc. Collect, analyze, store, or ship samples. Able to lift up to 35 lbs, handle gas cylinders, and climb ladders. Perform light-duty preventive maintenance on equipment to replace defective parts using mechanics tools. Support procurement and administration tasks as instructed. Be fully compliant with the HSE program and training, and actively participate 5S. Oversee and support material availability to Honeywell Aerospace R&O (Repair & Overhaul) through management of Honeywell Interdivision Orders (IDO) for the Sky Harbor R&O facility. Site focal for stock transfer orders (STOs) from a variety of sister Honeywell sites, responsible to overcome near and long-term material availability obstacles, ensuring adequate supply of materials for site repair and overhaul operations. Measure and maintain Honeywell IDO performance by regularly reporting Sky Harbor R&O material availability metrics and drive opportunities for improvement. Clearly communicate committed delivery dates to leadership and the R&O site teams, ensuring that delays and parts at risk are quickly identified and escalated appropriately. Work with Planners/Buyers to expedite urgent orders when needed to meet customer delivery commitments, hold owners accountable for missed commitments, and help to identify appropriate recovery plans when necessary. Build strong relationships to help promote effective communication and support. Understand the needs of our repair shops, our customers, understand Honeywell IDO delivery commits, evaluate plant stock opportunity for interdivisional movement using SAP, and effectively communicate need and associated expectations for material availability to the R&O sites. Key Responsibilities Ensure material availability for Honeywell’s Repair & Overhaul sites through Honeywell interdivisional order creation, order management, and delivery coordination Prioritize, negotiate, allocate, and communicate delivery dates, identifying critical shortages and delays that may require escalation Work with site expeditors, schedulers, and Global Planning Network to overcome near term part constraints Support and/or host allocation calls to ensure proper material allocation for needed available material Provide the team, sites, or leadership with daily status on part shortages issues, resolution, or help needed Review and help address supplier issues when necessary, ensure delivery to site and customer needs Develop strong relationships with fellow buyers, encourage effective communication Provide daily status on critical items to internal stakeholders Small-scale project management in support of R&O YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain, Business, or related discipline Fluent in English, any other language a plus Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements WE VALUE Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written) Knowledge of and relevant experiences in SAP and/or other Procurement-related tools Good at handling multiple tasks and assignments simultaneously, ability to prioritize, and problem solving Self-motivated with excellent organizational skills A team player Additional Information JOB ID: req375923 Category: Procurement Location: 1944 E Sky Harbor Circle,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. UOP, a Honeywell company headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a leading international licensor of processing technology and supplier of engineering services, catalysts and adsorbents, equipment, specialty materials and digital solutions for the global refining, gas processing and petrochemical industries. With more than a century of leadership in hydrocarbon processing technologies, UOP has led six revolutions in technology that transformed our industry. For more information visit www.uop.com. An excellent career opportunity is currently available for an Engineer/Scientist 2 in the Process Modeling and Optimization Development group within UOP's Research and Development organization located in Des Plaines, IL. This position affords a unique and visible opportunity to develop reactor and process models which are critical to the development and support of new process technologies from their inception in R&D through the commercialization stage. Key Responsibilities Apply process modeling expertise to support R&D project teams throughout the technology development process: Deliver kinetic and empirical model solutions for early-stage research to establish fundamental understanding Utilize state-of-the-art modeling techniques and simulation software to support process design and optimization, scaling up our technologies from R&D into production Engage with sales to build tools representing our UOP technologies, ensuring that our offerings are competitive and maximizing value delivered to clients Find creative solutions to technical problems, both working individually and within diverse cross-functional teams Maintain and grow our technical knowledge base for reactor modeling, data analytics, and advanced parameter estimation methods, sharing knowledge with a focused team of subject matter experts Be part of a team that applies its expertise and knowledge to technical projects, finding innovative, cost-effective means to improve research, techniques, procedures, and products and technologies. You will develop, conduct and evaluate new approaches to meet project objectives faster and more efficiently and you develop and commercialize products & technologies. YOU MUST HAVE PhD in Chemical Engineering with 2 years’ experience in modeling, process simulation, process development or reaction engineering. WE VALUE Experience and capability in statistics, experimental design, data analytics, and advanced parameter estimation and numerical methods. Familiarity with machine learning, data science tools and algorithms Excellent computer programming skills. Strong interpersonal skills and the capability to work effectively across multiple functional departments. Knowledge of chemical engineering fundamentals including fluid flow, heat transfer, mass transfer and reaction engineering. Knowledge of UOP technologies: Refining/Petrochemicals/Gas Processing applications. Knowledge of Six-Sigma principles and their use in managing risk and uncertainty. The ability to travel both domestic and internationally approximately 10% annually. jobTitle: Sales Development Program - Expression of Interest
jobDescription: Job Requirements Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity We don’t just sell things. We offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges. Our sales approach begins by identifying customer demands before they become challenges. We’re committed to delivering customer success through our comprehensive expertise in software and technology. Overview Have a voice in the global marketplace, with guidance and mentoring that will help you become a professional who delivers business results. Start in inside sales with a project leading to revenue or pipeline management. After six months, you’ll move into job shadowing our field sales team, where you’ll have responsibility for account penetration and channel management. And finally, you’ll be accountable for business results. You’ll gain a broad range of experience designed to fast track your leadership role. Applicants for employment for this position must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Honeywell This is an expression of interest – we will inform you when opportunities become available **This position is available in multiple locations across the United States** Will you be attending the NBMBAA, SHPE or SWE annual conferences? Honeywell will be there interviewing top talent! After you’ve completed your formal application here, please use the links below to submit interest in opportunities during conference. NBMBAA in Houston SHPE in Phoenix SWE in Anaheim Work Experience You Must Have Actively pursuing a Bachelor’s degree at an accredited college or university Must attain bachelor’s degree between December 2019 and June 2020 We Value Bachelor's degree preferably in Professional Sales, Business, Engineering or Computer Science Demonstrated leadership ability – able to work effectively with and influence others toward project goals Strong business acumen Ability to take initiative and work with limited direction Strong interpersonal skills – able to successfully cooperate and influence with those in other functions in a matrix organization Strong project management and presentation skills Results-oriented Capable of some travel required

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The newly created Sensing & Safety Technologies (SST) is a $2B division within Honeywell formed by the combination of the former Advanced Sensing Technologies and Gas Analysis and Safety divisions. Primary verticals include Healthcare, Transportation (including Aerospace & Defense), Industrial Manufacturing, Logistics Sensing, Industrial Process and Safety, and Electrical and Fire Safety. SST offers one of the broadest switching and sensing portfolios available in the industry. With products ranging from snap action, limit, toggle and pressure switches to pressure, position, speed and airflow sensors, we have a product to meet basic and complex design challenges. We provide global engineering and service support, value-added capabilities and custom-engineered solutions that offer enhanced precision and ruggedness. SST also manufactures a full and comprehensive range of gas detection products dedicated to all types of industrial facilities, from smaller boiler rooms to large petrochemical plants and oil refineries. Our wide range of technologies and devices – gas detectors, flame detectors, natural gas alarms – provide exceptional protection at every level, ensuring the most favorable coverage, detection, hazard mitigation and life protection. The Sales Development Program Fellow is designed to take a recent college graduate and train him/her to become a successful sales professional in our highly technical business. This person will start in an Inside Sales Role learning the necessary skillset to be an effective salesperson. This will ultimately lead to an Outside Sales Role managing a territory within a specific team. As the Inside Sales Representative, your most important role is to proactively sell to grow your territory’s business. Proactive selling is based upon effective account plan actions, remote sales visit preparation, and opportunity management. Daily activities will include lead management, lead qualification, account plan execution, remote sales visit preparation, collaboration with the outside sales teams, pipeline management, forecasting, qualification, and closing. Our expectation is that you will exceed your targets, take ownership of the success of the business, and learn how to be a more effective salesperson. These are technical products and the role will require you to research product information, recommend the best product for the customer’s application, and provide product quotes and lead times following internal consultation with design engineering, application engineering, product marketing and manufacturing, as necessary. Upon “graduation,” you will be promoted to an Outside Sales position within the United States. Please note that the required location for the initial Inside Sales Role is at one of our major SST facilities (Richardson, TX, or Charlotte, NC). Upon promotion, the candidate must be willing to relocated anywhere within the USA per the needs of the business. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors’ Degree WE VALUE Bachelors’ Degree in finance or in an engineering field, such as electrical or mechanical, is preferred Experience with a technology-based organization or technical sales experience Any previous sales experience Experience conducting cold calls to generate customer appointments Demonstrated ability to meet or exceed sales and activity quotas Demonstrated ability to influence at varying level across the organization Prior experience with Salesforce.com or similar CRM software Extensive experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Excellent customer relationship building skills Ability to work successfully in a multi-cultural, global business environment Excellent written and verbal communications skills Excellent organizational skills and the ability to interface with a variety of roles to accomplish objectives Additional Information JOB ID: HRD902720 Category: Sales Location: 830 E Arapaho Rd,Richardson,Texas,75081,United States Exempt Engineering (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates facilities for the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA), in Albuquerque, NM as well as the Kansas City National Security Campus. Honeywell FM&T - New Mexico Operations provide state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing, transportation technologies, emergency response and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. Summary Honeywell Federal Manufacturing and Technologies is seeking candidates for multiple entry level positions to perform a variety of advanced chemical tests, processes, and procedures to support production and research and development on a wide variety of materials from metals to polymers in our Science and Engineering Laboratory – Materials (SEL-M). The primary responsibility of this position is to support future and current production by designing and executing studies on polymeric, ceramic or metallic materials The candidate will lead and participate in studies that may include designing, synthesizing, characterizing, and developing materials of interest to defense research and development The candidate will be expected to leverage their understanding of chemistry, materials science, and analytical testing techniques to predict manufacturing behavior of complex materials This candidate will be expected to lead teams of researchers to identify problems and solutions, draft test plans, obtain funding, and execute work in alignment with the company’s commitments and strategic objectives The successful candidate will enhance the capabilities of an ongoing research and development program, within a multi-disciplinary organization dedicated to advanced materials studies by leveraging an in-depth understanding of materials science The successful candidate will have a strong customer-service focus, and the ability to communicate effectively with customers who have limited knowledge of chemistry or materials science You Must Haves US citizenship, needed to obtain and maintain required US Dept. of Energy """"Q""""-level security clearance Bachelor of Science Degree (B.S.) or Master’s Degree (M.S.) in Chemical Engineering, Metallurgy, Materials Science, Physical Science from an accredited institution with 2- 4 years’ experience or PhD with 0 years’ experience We Value Working knowledge of polymeric or metallic materials An understanding of advanced manufacturing techniques, including microfluidics, additive manufacturing, elastomeric compounding, and polymer or metal processing Experience with polymer or metal test methods and mechanical responses Experience with various materials synthesis, processing, and characterization techniques. These include familiarity with wet chemistry, bench chemistry, analytical testing methods (FTIR, melt flow, mechanical testing, etc.), compounding, additive manufacturing, and aging Experience in a production support role Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems Ability to work independently with little to no supervision on all job responsibilities Ability to manage multiple assignments and responsibilities concurrently Ability to generate accurate and precise analytical data that may be used in formal reports or presentations or for quality acceptance of components utilized in national defense Excellent written and oral communication skills All employees must work in a safe manner in accordance with the Laboratory Health and Safety Program A willingness to work either as an independent investigator or as a member of a multi-disciplinary cross-functional team, depending on the nature of the situation FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req380277 Category: Engineering Location: 14520 Botts Road,Kansas City,Missouri,64147,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. The Security Compliance Professional, a critical member of the Honeywell Security Compliance Organization, ensures compliance with the National Industrial Security Program (NISP), Special Compartmented Information (SCI) and Special Access Program/Special Access Required (SAP/SAR) government programs, and interfaces with Honeywell and government representatives to clarify and interpret requirements and resolve issues. The Security Compliance Professional may be assigned as the Facility Security Officer for a Honeywell cleared facility and is responsible for providing guidance to all levels of employees regarding the safeguarding of classified information by developing and maintaining procedures that will ensure classified information is treated appropriately. Key Responsibilities Coordinate personnel security clearance requirements with various government entities Develop and implement required security education for employees, to include initial security briefings and annual refresher training through an automated training system Process and maintain classified document accountability records and contracts (DD form 254, Contract Security Classification Specification) in a web-based application Coordinate receiving and shipping of classified materials Maintain Protect Compliance Management Systems databases used for contracts management, metrics, compliance data site profile(s), National Compliance Operations Center (NCOC) interface and training Maintain accurate personnel and site information in government databases, (NISS & DISS) Participate in government security reviews, conduct, and document government required self-inspections, and assist with any corrective actions required Assist with the coordination of the security aspects of construction and government approval for any open storage areas that are required by the business unit Assist with conducting and documenting investigations into compliance security violations, procedure violations, and compromise or suspected compromise of classified information Submit required reports to Honeywell management and the government Track foreign visitors and schedule debriefings Track cleared employee foreign travel, conduct debriefings Administer fingerprints/verify citizenship for new security clearances Participate on various Compliance standardization teams Assist with RFPs/PMs for new contracts COMSEC custodian, responsible for proper handling and disposition of cryptographic materials, NSA semi-annual audits in DIAS submit to NSA rep Responsible for maintaining and changing combinations to open storage areas or secure containers; update access lists in Protect and open storage areas Set up alarm systems, respond to room alarms Partner with Export Control Participate on NCMS chapter meetings Participate on Leadership team meetings/Engineering staff meetings Participate in Site Leadership council meetings Run Badging reports for HR investigations with a valid BCIR number Partner with Contracts and estimate working hours for FSO/SP program needs (AET) The creation and maintenance of site badges and compartmentalized access CARS approvals and badge distribution & Camera badges Support classified meetings and secure calls Must Have 2 years’ experience with security specialist experience in DOD Security specialist from Military/Law Enforcement Must be able to acquire and maintain a Top Secret security clearance/SCI Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements Additional Qualifications Associates Degree Completion of NSA COMSEC Manager Course Completion of a Government Industrial Security Course/ Facility Security Officer (FSO) Related professional roles with security, compliance and/or data protection related scope and responsibility In-depth knowledge of the DOD or other government security regulatory manual desired Educational background that includes a focus in security, compliance and/or criminal justice desired DSS Chapter 8 course or similar Automated Information System Security training Industrial Security Professional (ISP) certification (not required) Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181628 Category: Business Services Location: 2600 Ridgway Pkwy,Minneapolis,Minnesota,55413,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence.
