Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? We are looking for a Content Marketing Specialist who will develop content marketing strategies, messaging and assets in a way that positions Honeywell Safety and Productivity Solutions (SPS) as a thought leader and solution provider in key vertical market segments (transportation and logistics, healthcare, sustainability, etc.). The Content Marketing Specialist will write and/or direct the creation of executive presentations, blogs, web content and digital assets, infographics, white papers, case studies, and videos in partnership with agencies or local teams. The Content Marketing Specialist will be responsible for differentiating the Honeywell SPS brand story, helping generate leads via gated content, and driving increased awareness, engagement, and strong positioning in the market. Content marketing efforts will target end users, partners, investors, influencers, analysts, and the media. Key Responsibilities Develop and maintain messaging frameworks that differentiate Honeywell SPS software-industrial leadership and connected messaging in the market. Produce impactful content and assets that align industry trends with Honeywell SPS capabilities, position it as a thought leader, and drive digital engagement and inbound gated content marketing leads. Research, write, edit, and publish content across digital channels including blogs, website, social media, YouTube, LinkedIn, etc. Research industry trends in key industry verticals. Develop a content marketing strategy, messaging framework, and plan for content development and distribution. Support product marketing and integrated marketing teams in the creation of digital content and marketing assets. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s degree or 4 years Content Development Experience Business fluent in written and spoken English, other languages are a plus WE VALUE Significant experience in content creation, journalism, writing, storytelling and research Strong capabilities in identifying content opportunities and themes that will drive engagement and lead generation (gated content) Strong capability to understand complex markets, technology solutions and a range of business models Ability to manage and direct the work of content, creative and digital production agencies Basic knowledge of PR, social media and web content/SEO best practices Strong communication and storytelling skills Strong PowerPoint capabilities Curiosity to learn a wide range of topics and technologies General marketing and digital marketing disciplines Business oriented Targeted audiences profiling Multi-channel content management Media knowledge Ability to work in cross-functional teams and at different organizational levels, including interviewing and interacting with engineers, product managers and executives Additional Information JOB ID: req370013 Category: Marketing Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Exempt Marketing (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Senior Data Analyst Senior Data Analyst for Intelligrated Headquarters, LLC in Charlotte, NC Responsibilities Serve as the Lead to Revenue and Campaign Optimization Subject Matter Expert for the IGS Marketing Team. Define and implement key strategies for performance analysis that align to the business needs. Deliver in-depth analysis of business and campaign data to provide insights and an understanding into campaign and marketing performance. Work with Campaign Managers to plan, analyze ,and optimize campaigns. Analyze and articulate marketing funnel, actuals vs. forecast, campaign performance, successes and major KPIs. Work closely with Sales Data Analyst to identify and resolve gaps in reporting process. Review and improve existing analytics, collaborating with teams such as IT and Sales Excellence if necessary. Meet weekly and monthly deadlines for reporting needs. Ensure all data is communicated effectively with Stakeholders in an accurate, relevant, and easy to understand way. Additional Information Location: Charlotte, NC 40 hours/week Employee Referral Fee: $1500 If offered employment must have legal right to work in U.S. EOE. req381007 You Must Have Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent in Electronic Engineering, Business Management, Computer Science or a related field, and five (5) years of experience in the job offered or an acceptable alternate occupation. Must possess three (3) years of experience in the following: experience in Marketo and Salesforce; analyst experience in marketing and campaign analytics; analyzing marketing channels (SEO, Social, Email, Events, etc.) and implementing Campaign Optimizations; articulating data-driven insights to key stakeholders via visual presentation; statistical and econometric modeling; performing quantitative analysis; technological data mining and analysis techniques; data visualization tools like Tableau and Qlik; analytics tools like Datorama, Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics and Bizible; and modeling software such as Microsoft Visio or Erwin Data Modeler. Must possess the following certifications: Salesforce Admin Certified Expert; Google Analytics Certified Expert; and Google /Marketo/HubSpot Campaign Certified Expert. Up to 20% domestic/international travel required. Telecommuting permitted up to two (2) times per week. Additional Information JOB ID: req381007 Category: Information Technology Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Launch innovations in nearly every commercial and defense aircraft platform The Future Is What You Make It. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell is not just about developing cool things. That is why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The role is a highly important leadership position managing a large team of quality professionals across all our Aerospace Mechanical sites across the US, Canada, and Mexico. In addition, the successful candidate will play a key leadership role with our major Aerospace customers to develop and maintain a system to ensure that all products manufactured and serviced by the organization meet customer requirements while achieving superior quality and reliability levels. The Role Will Be Mainly Responsible For Applying creativity and problem-solving techniques to implement critical quality assurance strategies and processes. Serve as a role model in the areas of quality, safety, leadership, teamwork, customer focus, continuous improvement and environmental stewardship to ensure alignment with the company's vision and goals. Define quality control strategy and lead creative solutions through multiple and complex global projects. Drive continuous improvement and lead change within the Quality organization and Honeywell Operating System. Drive accountability for and lead multiple, highly complex global projects to guarantee customer satisfaction. Implement a world-class, customer focused strategy that enables their team to maintain competitive advantage. Develop and maintain a system to assure that all products manufactured and serviced by the organization meet customer requirements while achieving superior quality and reliability levels within Honeywell Aerospace. The role has a team of direct reports and is responsible to ensure full performance management process, succession planning, and development for the full organization. The role will also have all quality leaders in the Mechanical factories as matrix reports. Develop and implement a robust MOS covering all elements of the Mechanical Products quality requirements. Actively participate in the Supplier Quality performance with a zero-defect expectation. Participate in the Annual Operation Plan (AOP) and Strategic Planning cycle (STRAP). Take full ownership for targeted customer quality performance. jobTitle: Senior Director, Offering Management - Material Handling Equipment
jobDescription: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Develop and implement a business strategy (STRAP) for your region to grow the business at or greater than market rates by making the most of product technology, new product development, open innovation, voice of customer, current product portfolio, manufacturing assets and equipment engineering capabilities. You will also lead and execute daily commercial operations of your regional business, aligned to the Annual Operating Plan (AOP). This will be done through collaboration with the Product Line Director and cross-functional teams. Within the Safety and Productivity Solutions business, Honeywell Intelligrated is a leading North American-based, single-source provider of intelligent automated material handling solutions that drive fulfillment productivity for retailers, manufacturers, and logistics providers around the world. Through a broad portfolio of automation equipment, software, service and support, Intelligrated solutions give businesses a competitive edge and optimize operational performance through increased flexibility, efficiency, and accuracy. The Material Handling Equipment portfolio includes exciting products and solutions catering to the warehouse and manufacturing automation space that includes conveyance, sortation, palletizing and associated software and services products and offerings. Key Responsibilities Account for profit & loss within the Material Handling Equipment business Manage supplier relationships Partner with cross functions Lead and Build effective teams Accountable for AOP & Strategy Investigate market options Create and build new product pipelines, as well as continually researching the market Implement new processes YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors Degree 10 years experience in product management in engineered capital equipment space Prior experience lead teams across functions Strong analytical and financial acumen – with modeling capabilities WE VALUE Strong communication skills – verbal and written Comfortable with ambiguity and strong in problem solving Ability to fully leverage sales team. Honed customer facing and marketing skills. Strong tactical and strategic skills required. Ability to motivate and build high performing teams. Product sales driven through SIOP process. Use market dynamics to advantage AOP achievement experience Strong financial acumen Ability to influence and partner in a matrix organization. Extensive management experience with P&L accountability. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD142658 Category: Business Management Location: 7901 Innovation Way,Mason,Ohio,45040,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. jobTitle: Senior Director Product Management, Commercial Security
jobDescription: The Future Is What You Make It. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Product Management Leader, Commercial Security will drive the vison for Security offerings within Honeywell Building Technologies. This individual is responsible for driving the offering vision and leading a team of Offering Managers who drive the ideation and incubation, value propositions, offering launches, tracking & operationalization of Annual Operating Plan (AOP) – including Say/Do, vitality, revenue, gross margin. The role is in Atlanta, GA and will report to the Global VPGM of Commercial Security. Key Responsibilities Working with different Lines of Business of Security to develop & help in executing the clear Value Proposition. Ensuring to develop an MOS along with PMO to make sure we deliver the Say/Do, Vitality, Revenue and Margin. Defining and developing the product road map for Security Being accountable for roadmap, product lifecycle and product management processes. Managing product management activities and shared learnings, best practices and cross business synergies. New product innovation and delivery against an annual operating plan (AOP). Lead a team of professionals to build organizational capability Coach and mentor offering team The Ideal Candidate Will Have Product management and product life cycle expertise with a proven track record of delivering next generation solutions. Proven track record of new product launches, in market success, and scaling a business in both Hardware and Software. Strong technical competency and diversity, confident in contemporary software practices, open source, data management, analytics, platforms, IoT, and “as a service” solutions. General business, sales, and engineering acumen with a solid understanding of budgets, business models, and agile development. P&L or front office budget responsibility. Ability to lead and manage in a matrixed organization delivering on time, on budget, and on spec with a history of outpacing market performance. Familiarity with Customer Success and Recurring Revenue Model Businesses. Experience with MVP (Minimum Viable Product) approach – experience introducing basic features to the get the attention of the customer. Then releasing the final product/products to the market after getting sufficient feedback from these customers. Channel GTM-Go To Market experience with a new technology. Experience driving enterprise Cultural changes into Product and Engineering teams. Experience in developing the value propositions. Experience in developing the simple messaging and story to customers to communicate the key value of solutions and offerings. Strong entrepreneurial skills with a keen sense for problem solving and agility. High energy, passionate performer, that inspires and motivates others. Unquestionable ethics, integrity, diversity, and inclusion. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors Degree 10+ years’ experience of product management experience 3+ years’ people leadership experience within large matrixed organizations, with proven track record of innovation, delivery, and results. WE VALUE MBA preferred Lean six sigma or continuous improvement events Ability to apply critical thinking skills and disciplined approaches to help leaders and leadership teams resolve issues and define solutions. Knows how to effectively manage risk and uncertainty for self and team. Makes decisions with confidence when problems or solutions are not 100% defined. Demonstrated entrepreneurial style experience and leadership. High intellectual horsepower and strong technical knowledge of the product management lifecycle. Experience setting strategy and the vision and building, leading and motivating product management teams. Experience in interacting with customers and acting as an evangelist for the product vision among core customers and internal business units. Experience working with engineering, R&D, marketing, finance, and sales. Excellent communication skills with strong persuasion and influencing abilities. An excellent motivator who is charismatic, action-oriented, and confident with the ability to inspire confidence in others. Recognized a self-starter who enjoys a fast-paced environment and seeks the challenge of winning in a rapidly changing marketplace. World class executive who intuitively understands the unique rewards and challenges this opportunity represents, who possesses the deep technology abilities, strategic vision, tactical competencies as well as a pragmatic and open style in working with the senior leadership team to position the business to grow market share and enter new markets. Highly motivated to succeed with an approachable manner that stimulates your team as well as engenders trust and confidence at all levels of the organization. Integrity, Competency, and Ethics. Additional Information JOB ID: req364498 Category: Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Sr. Director, Propulsion Engineering serves as leader for all engineering activity supporting all Propulsion product lines including Turbofan, Turboshaft and Turboprop applications. This includes proposals, cost estimation, design and analysis, development, qualification, service introduction, factory support, and field support. This position is accountable for project management assuring that technical results are delivered on schedule and on budget. Further, this position develops and adjusts tactics, plans, product and technology roadmaps to align with Propulsion product strategy and needs. This can be very dynamic in an ever-evolving market landscape. Additional responsibilities include training, mentoring and development of technical leaders; working directly with the extended E&PS Engineering Leadership teams to execute the programs while creating and implementing a transformational burning platform strategy designed to dramatically reduce cycle time and cost, leveraging a pivot to Agile methodologies, to improve Honeywell’s competitiveness in the marketplace. Key Responsibilities Leads engineering activity internal to Honeywell through coordination with peer directors within Engines and Power Systems (E&PS), Mechanical Systems & Components (MS&C), Electronic Solutions (ES), with suppliers, with Organization Designation Authorization (ODA) unit members, and with customers including the FAA, US Army and aircraft OEMs. Responsible for relationships with customers, suppliers, internal resource providers, and E&PS leadership. Manages a team of engineers to achieve all technical deliverables, utilizing demonstrated experience in the design, development, support, and integration of turbine engine systems. This includes all system, hardware, and software aspects of turbine engine systems. Assure that appropriate knowledge management is exercised to maximize the transfer of knowledge to new team members and projects. And, where needed, develop new, emerging skills within the team to remain competitive in the turbine engine system market space. (ie. Cyber, Certification methods, Disruptive technologies, …) Responsible for all technical deliverables including technical achievement (performance, weight, reliability, etc.), development schedule, development cost, and fabrication cost. Annual portfolio costs exceed $350M. Continually reviews engineering projects, and the adequacy of plans, incentives and controls. Reports performance and results to leadership. Approves technical content, technical commitments, and associated cost and schedule for all proposals or change orders (internal or external). Responsible for technical decision making, including, without limitation, establishing requirements, coordinating technical interface with customers, and advising leadership and customers on all technical aspects and issues. Participates on E&PS leadership team to achieve business objectives. Creates environment where individual and team accomplishments are valued and rewarded. Intellectually challenges using innovation and creativity. Change Agent: Make measurable improvements in process maturity related to execution of Engine development and qualification/certification. Development and implementation of a Management Operating System to drive effective and efficient communication, interfacing, and execution of tasks & responsibilities between Propulsion Controls, Propulsion, ISC and the Customer & Product Support organizations. Coordination and appropriate influence over the E&PS GBE with the engine product line owners to ensure we have robust roadmaps, funding strategies and partnerships as needed. MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Science, or Management. 20 years Engineering/Business/Product Development experience 10 years of Management experience. Due to Export Control and ITAR regulations, candidate must be US Citizen. WE VALUE Skilled change agent with proven ability to drive transformational/cultural improvement. Program/Project Management experience. Large scale system development experience preferred. Detailed knowledge of commercial and military system qualification requirements. Leadership Skills - decision making, customer management, driving results, team building, and bias for action. Prioritizes time and resources effectively. Customer focused – Current relationships with major OEMs or Defense Customers is desired. Track record of building customer relationships. Demonstrated team building and process standardization skills. Demonstrated ability to maneuver in the face of conflict or politics. Skilled in creating order and structure in an uncertain or ambiguous environment. Mature leader: able to impose a management operating system which minimizes bureaucracy while still satisfying required procedures, program management principles, and contractual expectations. Ability to effectively influence others, strong delegation abilities, good mentoring skills. Strong bias for action, high energy level, detail oriented and analytical thinker. Comfortable working on many projects in parallel. Excellent leadership, interpersonal & communication skills are keys to success. Must be able to be a driver while maintaining strong collaborative relationships and clear roles and responsibilities with team members and stakeholders. Able to identify the critical few issues on any effort and drive them to resolution to assure overall success. Skilled in leading and communicating across multiple functions and organization levels. Able to communicate effectively from the individual contributor level to the Executive Leadership level. Able to travel up to 20% of the time. Additional Information JOB ID: req365075 Category: Engineering Location: 1944 E Sky Harbor Circle,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Honeywell is currently hiring for a Senior Director of Sales to drive the Channel sales business within Sustainable Building Technologies. This person will be a key and essential partner to the Direct Sales Business Leader. This key Leader will be responsible for driving sales in SBT channel business globally. You will work with the leadership team to set priorities for new business opportunities. You will own the sales results for assigned SBT channels. You will create the structure, processes, and incentives that will increase sales of the company's products and/or services. You will ensure education of Honeywell products. You will provide the strategic direction for customer interactions such as client visits, trade shows, and seminars. You will use data analysis of sales numbers, customer accounts, competitive intelligence, and market trends to make needed adjustments. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn't just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Honeywell Building Technologies (HBT) is a strategic business unit within Honeywell Buildings. HBT innovates to protect and save lives worldwide every day. It is a global leader in commercial fire systems and commercial security products. Its quality products, integrated system solutions, and services make life safer, more comfortable, more secure, and more productive in every corner of our world. You can find leading-edge HBT technology all around you, including at airports, hotels, healthcare institutions, business centers, stadiums, industries, and schools. Key Responsibilities Sell complex offerings through internal/channel partners to end customers. Manage multiple workstreams and simultaneous projects to launch offerings via channel organization. Navigate processes and people while articulating the value of our offerings and how we will add value to the reseller business. Lead and influence sales teams through a very highly matrixed organization driving independent seller contributions. Communicate complex problems at all levels of the organization. Influence the design and shape of the sales organization structure as SBT grows. This position will travel as required – approximately 50-75% during peak business but will fluctuate as needed. You Must Have Master's degree, or equivalent. Extensive experience in the Sales and/or Sales Operations field. Ability to lead through influence, navigate processes and people, and build strong relationships. Strong channel experience. Are you ready to help us shape the future? Become a #futureshaper! Honeywell Process Solutions is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. A leader in digitalization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. We have an opportunity for a Senior Director, Strategy to join Honeywell Process Solutions to drive our strategic transformation. In this role you will work closely with business leaders to drive our growth strategy across the multiple industries that HPS serves. The Senior Director, Strategy will lead a team of analysts to shape the HPS and business-level strategy informed by an understanding of market trends, competitive intelligence, and organic and inorganic growth strategies. This role will engage cross-functionally and with Honeywell Senior Leadership to develop the HPS strategy. This role will work with Industry Marketing and Sales teams to translate global strategy into market-based commercial strategies. This position reports into the Chief Commercial Officer. Responsibilities Develop and foster HPS’ 3 -5 Year Strategic Plans building on a strong foundation and with growth rates material greater than the market Translate 3-5 year strategy into executable operating plans Champion the development of strategic business unit growth strategies (organic and inorganic) and establish strong M&A target pipeline and support development of that pipeline. Work closely with VPGMs to expand their core businesses, grow into adjacent spaces and establish new business models to drive growth Drive the growth of critical initiatives that are designed to diversify the industries served and establish a long term growth path for the business Develop frameworks to support identification, incubation, and assessment of critical growth initiatives to align with business goals Proactively develop business opportunities, and lead investigation, design, and initial execution of those initiatives and other growth opportunities within the core business and key early stage startup opportunities Develop and maintain a strategic plan for business growth including: Portfolio analysis and assessment to identify revenue and growth plans by market and product segment. Identification and evaluation of organic growth strategies by product line, globally. Identification and evaluation of inorganic growth strategies including acquisitions, alliance, licensing, and partnership opportunities linked to the strategic plan. Fact-based analysis of market trends; competitive data; technology advancements; and customer needs assessment and new product developments. Creation of a prioritized strategic technology development plan for the business. Development of regional strategic plans to expand globally. Provide near term tactical support to develop and deliver monthly reporting on key initiatives and strategy. Must Have Bachelor’s degree in engineering, business, economics or other highly analytical field is required Advanced Degree in engineering, business, economics or other highly analytical field 10 years of Commercial & Marketing experience or Consulting experience in an Industrial setting We Value Demonstrated track record of growing businesses within complex, globally matrixed organizations Ability to communicate and execute across all levels in the organization - tailoring messages to C-Suite leaders Prior experience in strong technical fields such as energy, renewables, oil & gas and/or life sciences. Consulting background is a strong positive. Demonstrated strong business sense with the leadership and functional ability to define and implement growth strategies and translate into practical actions and metric driven operating systems Success leading marketing, business development, sales and new offering development teams and projects; preferably with prior P&L experience Strong team building and problem solving skills Significant experience leading multiple, complex projects with changing priorities Experience leading a global team through ambiguity and evolving market dynamics Ability to forge solid relationships and lead across a broad and geographically dispersed business Effectively demonstrates ability to deliver on complex situations or problems without guidance or supervision Consistently makes timely decisions even in the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness Excellent verbal and written communication Leadership Characteristics Strategic Marketing Skills: Deep understanding and experience with the ability to practically apply, as well as coach others to do so. Makes a strong link between strategy and functional results. Leadership: A confident, mature person with the ability to connect and inspire others. A proven track record of leading projects and teams that successfully achieve milestones and complete deliverables. Also, a proven track record of attracting, developing and leading a world class organization. Time Management: Ability to manage multi work streams concurrently with strong prioritization skills Results-Oriented: A driver who possesses the ability to take actions and implement effective solutions in a timely manner Problem Solver: A creative yet pragmatic problem solver. Methodical and hands-on as well as detail-oriented Analytical Thinking and Decision-Making: A “conceptualizer” of enterprise and market trends/issues who can then integrate that thinking into marketing and business strategies. Decisive and logical at thoroughly evaluating issues. Excellent planning, execution, and project-management skills. Teamwork and Interpersonal Skills: A team player and builder, receptive to ideas from others. Shares information and keeps team members and partners informed. Works effectively with others to identify and resolve issues. Excellent interpersonal skills and an ability to interact successfully with all levels of management as well as a diverse work force. Ethics: Highest level of professional integrity and honesty as well as personal credibility. The future is what WE make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Are you ready to help us make the future? Join a team that designs, develops, and integrates highly complex systems within Honeywell Aerospace Electronic Solutions business. As a Human Factors Systems Engineer, you will be working on cutting edge technology like futuristic cockpits applied to multiple aircrafts. You will be integral in creating system solutions that meet the evolving needs of our customers and helping the customers with human factors certification. You will be involved in every aspect of the systems life cycle, from the front end of business development through product end of life. This is a Human Factors Systems Staff Engineer position working in the Human Factors Center of Excellence leading HF excellence across current and future products. The HF COE performs human factors analysis and systems design & development for Air Transport, Regional, Business, General Aviation, and Defense & Space market segments. The qualities and attributes needed for this role include a 'big-picture' perspective of Human Factors as applied to aerospace, resulting in products which are easier to design, easier to certify, easier to install, easier to learn, easier to fly, easier to maintain, and easier to upgrade. Responsibilities include: • Providing technical expertise as a team leader or member on a variety of projects and programs. Use expert knowledge of Human Factors engineering discipline and Honeywell/Industry standards, processes and tools in order to complete and ensure compliance of various projects. • Supporting strategic planning and advanced technology efforts related to Human Factors • Contact with external customers for overall product status, standards, etc. (Candidate will be a key focal in development of new business opportunities and product lines_ • Coordinating and presenting regulatory subject matter as an expert to help lead challenging certification approaches • Leading end user acceptance evaluations for associated design implementations, to include coordination with various Systems Engineering and Applications (ESEA) teams, Centers of Excellence (COE) product teams and Test subjects (e.g. pilots, maintenance personnel) • Reviewing and approving Advanced Technology assessments to assist and ensure the smooth transition of prototype designs (pre-TRL6) into product COEs • Leading the development of Human Factors design guidelines and standard work across Honeywell Aerospace • Developing and supporting business development activities, to include creation and review of quotation estimates (QE) for programs • Managing and coordinating common Human Factors engineering efforts across multiple programs and managing multiple projects across an entire project lifecycle • Human Factors and CIMS evaluation You Must Have • Bachelor’s degree in Human Factors Engineering, Aeronautical Engineering, Systems Engineering or Psychology degree • 8+ years Human Factors experience • 5+ years Aerospace Human Factors Industry experience We Value • Strong knowledge of systems engineering, and Human Factors disciplines in product development • Pilots License with Instrument rating, ideally on multiple aircraft types preferred • Experience with aircraft avionics systems software and hardware, aircraft installation design, experiment design methodologies highly desired • Knowledge of regulatory and industry standards (FAA, RTCA, ARINC, SAE) • Knowledge of software development methods and practices as well as certification process and experience • Excellent communication skills with demonstrated ability to influence customers and leadership • Strong technical leadership capability including ability to lead, or lead by influence, cross functional project teams • Demonstrated capability in project planning/management, trade studies, requirements development/management, implementation reviews and verification activities • Ability to execute to a vision that is aligned with aerospace Human Factors goals & business needs; dedicated to success; inspires and motivates. • Dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of customers; applying first-hand customer information for improvements; establishing and maintaining effective customer relationships • Ability to effectively cope with change, act without having the total picture, achieve success despite ambiguity, comfortably handle risk and uncertainty • Six Sigma Green Belt, Orange Belt or Black Belt certified preferred ​ #LI-Hybrid

jobTitle: Senior Integrated Supply Chain (ISC) Project Management Specialist
jobDescription: The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe, and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell is not just about developing cool things. That is why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? In this position you will be responsible for Honeywell Aerospace’s US Government Supply Chain Data and Analytics research and reporting. The position will focus on improving all aspects of government procurement data analysis and reporting by leveraging big data. Key Responsibilities And Knowledge Experience in Excel, SAP, database query techniques and reporting tools. Capacity to communicate complex concepts in easy-to-understand terminology. Oversee data standards, ensuring we collect and report on key data fields in a consistent manner. Create ad-hoc reports for the Government Procurement organization. Create and deploy new reports supporting Government Procurement. Drive Supply Chain analytics training across Government Procurement. Support critical business initiatives with required Supply Chain data. Collaborate with end users, IT developers and leaders to define scope, requirements, and output for complex automation projects; act as project lead to track progress and design reports measuring results. Develop solutions to business needs, identify and implement process improvement, identify risks, issues and dependencies, partner cross functionally, ad hoc reporting. Work independently to manage multiple projects at once while ensuring deadlines are met and data output is accurate and appropriate for the requirement. Must also be able to deal with ambiguity and make independent decisions about what data and approach is best for the task at hand. Identify areas of opportunity and drive results partnering with cross functional partners. YOU MUST HAVE 3+ Experience in data mining, database reporting, project management or business analyst capacity. A minimum of an Associates Degree US Citizen WE VALUE Strong analytical and financial skills. Highly resourceful and results-oriented with a strong bias for action and keen sense of urgency. Ability to think strategically and to scope tasks and influence goal achievement. Works effectively both independently and as a member of a cross functional team. Demonstrate ability to communicate and build relationships with employees at all levels. Strong follow-through skills and acute attention to detail. Communicates complex analytical data clearly and persuasively via email and verbally. Proficient in PowerPoint and comfortable building and delivering presentations. Tableau experience. Good oral and written communication skills. Strong work ethic and initiative to learn processes. jobTitle: Senior Operations Manager, Integrated Supply Chain
jobDescription: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The Redmond Guidance & Navigations Systems (Aerospace, Defense, and Space) site is looking for a manufacturing manager to lead the $100M+ Accelerometer and Thermal Switch product lines. Direct reports include 6 production supervisors and a team of 235 direct labor employees including assemblers and technicians who are responsible for the manufacturing. This position reports to the Site Leader/ISC Director and is a member of the site leadership team. The successful candidate (you) will Key Responsibilities Establish, manage and control all Accelerometer and Thermal Switch product line strategies and actions driving unit product costs to include productivity, scrap reduction, yield improvements, cycle time, and inventory reduction Develop and drive a manufacturing strategy that meets Redmond Site business objectives Drive accountability to exceed objectives and reward results. Manage performance execution daily Effectively manage operations to meet/exceed Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and Honeywell Operating System (HOS) targets for Safety, Quality, Delivery, Inventory, and Productivity Work with Customer Business Managers and the Integrated Supply Chain (ISC) Director to ensure customer satisfaction Drive and continuously improve manufacturing processes using Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma tools. Ensure full employee involvement in improvement activities Challenge and develop a team; award accordingly and provide consistent communication and feedback to team members. Make performance management a priority Responsible for maintaining a safe, clean work environment consistent with health, safety, and environmental objectives Meet cost budgets and drive/lead projects to manage direct, indirect, and people costs Own product line Unit Product Costs (UPC) and drive reductions through product and process improvements YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Business or Supply Chain 5 years of engineering or plant operations experience 3 years of experience in a leadership role WE VALUE Advanced degree in manufacturing or business Significant manufacturing knowledge Significant leadership experience in large organizations Proven track record leading teams to successful product delivery Willingness to raise standards each year to drive organizational excellence Ability to make sound and timely judgments in an ambiguous environment Track record of improving team performance Lean expert cert. Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing, and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. areas of practice Clients include the U.S. Government, various internal business and functional division leaders, and internal executive leadership Receive, prioritize, and process inquiries and strategies related to community outreach events, and team-building events Vendor management, standard work reviews, continuous improvements, and responding to data calls Coordinating recurring, in-person and virtual meetings and events for the legal team, customers, and General Counsels across the NSE Approximately 10% of responsibilities include administrative support for Government Relations initiatives, and standard work You Must Have Associate's Degree in a related field of study AND a Paralegal Certification, or Bachelor’s Degree in a related field of study Minimum of 6 years' experience providing applicable, high-effort, technically complex support Strong understanding of technical legal terminology Demonstrated experience conducting advanced legal research US dynamic, fast paced environments, and can quickly pivot when priorities change Can assist the paralegal team in meeting critical team objectives by adding value, leading by example, and channeling positive energy to consistently meet or exceed expectations Can efficiently manage large workloads and react promptly to multiple deadlines while meeting personal and team key performance objectives You will provide security leadership, consulting, and education consistent with the Honeywell Global Security organization, policies and standards to the business, identifying opportunities for security to enable the business and integrating security into the business unit. You will serve as an advocate for the business but maintain a clear focus on risk and security, helping to identify and assess risks to the business unit. You will manage and co-ordinate all information security activities, programs and initiatives for the business unit as well as provide security incident support. Help leadership understand the potential risk impacts and possible controls in business terms. Key Responsibilities Serve as security subject matter expert throughout the contract life cycle, advising on security considerations during RFPs, award, extension, modification, and closeout phase Prepare investigative reports. Process and maintain records for classified contracts (DD Form 254, Contract Security Classification Specification), build on Government and Corporate guidance held or conducted at the facility. Coordinate personnel security clearance requirements with various government entities, from initial application to re-investigation and incident reporting. Coordinate required security education for cleared employees, to include initial security briefings, annual refresher, caveat and other specialized training both in person and through an automated training system. Shipping and packaging of classified materials in accordance with government regulations, to include document control, destruction, and accountability. Maintain Honeywell Protect Compliance Management System databases used for contracts management, facility metrics, and classified inventory. Collaborate with International National Compliance Operations Center (INCOC) to assist with security clearances/training/continuous vetting/visit requests. Maintain government systems of record on behalf of the facility, including NISS, DISS, DIAS, etc. Participate in various government security reviews, conduct, and document government-required self-inspections, customer inspections, physical security inspections and implement any corrective actions identified. The development, construction, and government approval of closed or restricted areas in support of classified contracts. Access control to closed and restricted areas through regular combination changes and maintenance of GSA-approved locks, security containers, and alarm systems. Conduct and assist in formal investigations into security violations, incidents, adverse information, and possible or suspected compromises of classified information. Track foreign visitors in SINE, issue pre-brief and debrief to the escort/host, report foreign visitors to government agencies (DCSA CISA) and schedule debriefings, as required. Conduct and support Security Intelligence Program (SIP) mission to meet government customer mandated insider threat and counterintelligence (CI) requirements prescribed by 32 CFR - PART 117 – NISPOM and other government rules. Conduct and support SIP analytical and education efforts providing ad hoc, scheduled, and requested production to Honeywell and D&S customers and leadership on insider threat and CI issues. Provide foreign travel briefings and debriefings, facilitate cleared employees with foreign travel reporting requirements. Participate in various compliance standardization teams throughout the Defense & Space Security (DSSE) organization. If required, serve as COMSEC Manager, responsible for inventory, audits and compliance with NSA regulations. Maintain a working knowledge on insider threat and CI fundamentals, and advise and train personnel, customers, and leadership. Support insider threat program activities to gather, integrate, and report relevant and available information indicative of a potential or actual insider threat through information integration, analytic and response capabilities. Serve as a member of professional security organization NCMS, represent Honeywell in local chapter meetings. Serve on Senior Leadership Council (SLT) for the facility. Attend engineering or staff department meetings. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree 3 years’ experience in a DOD/other industrial security program/security/compliance Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret/Top Secret security clearance (SCI w/Poly, is applicable) Must be a U.S. Citizen WE VALUE Completion of CDSE Facility Security Officer (FSO) Course. In-depth knowledge of DoD security regulations and/or 32 CFR Part 117 NISPOM Rule. Educational background that includes a focus in security, compliance and/or criminal justice desired. Industrial Security Professional (ISP) certification or Security Fundamentals Professional Certification. Ability to interact with all levels of leadership and customers. Partner with stakeholders and foster strong inter-departmental collaboration in a professional manner. Honeywell is an equal-opportunity employer. You will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status. UOP, a Honeywell company headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a leading international licensor of processing technology and supplier of engineering services, catalysts and adsorbents, equipment, specialty materials and digital solutions for the global refining, gas processing and petrochemical industries. With more than a century of leadership in hydrocarbon processing technologies, UOP has led six revolutions in technology that transformed our industry. For more information visit www.uop.com. Are you ready to help us make the future? Key Responsibilities The global Utilities & Offsites (U & O) Engineering Specialist will support the development, innovation, commercialization, and project execution for all U & O activities in UOP Engineering. This role will continue to develop and improve design practices, tools, and infrastructure for U & O in support of all technologies to ensure UOP’s offerings are competitively positioned in the marketplace. The global U & O Specialist role will serve as the SME for UOP Engineering globally, Client Senior Management, and Industry. This role will be expected to make substantial contributions to meet Engineering’s U & O projects requirements, support Engineering Agreements with utilities and emissions guarantees, and support sales and business teams in competitive growth opportunities. The U & O Specialist will also play a critical role in developing the technical bench strength across the U & O skill area to ensure that there is sufficient global experience to meet the expected project load. The U & O Specialist will be responsible for leading a Community of Practice for staffing critical Engineering assignments, knowledge sharing, maintaining infrastructure and ensuring work processes are performed consistently as one global team. Demonstrated ability to lead, motivate, develop, and mentor others. Ability to analyze and solve complex and challenging problems. Self-driven and always looking to improve on the current best practices for our technology offerings. Strong communication and presentation skills. Strong internal and external customer facing skills. Relevant experience using Process Simulation Software such as Unisim, Aspen, etc. Relevant experience leading a skill area. 8+ years of experience in the Utilities and Offsites skill area. jobTitle: Sign-On Bonus- Principal Mechanical Engineer - Gears Analysis
jobDescription: Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity Honeywell offers a sign-on bonus, unlimited PTO, tuition reimbursement, flex time/2 days weekly remote, and option of relocation assistance if needed with this position. The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? This team is responsible for the design, analysis, development test, and field support of gears, splines, bearings, oil-air seals, and lubrication systems on all Honeywell Aerospace propulsion engines, APUs, and advanced technology programs. We are looking for someone with significant experience designing and analyzing gears and splines. Additional experience in areas relevant to the team is a big advantage. You will solve complex problems and will help drive implementation of state-of-the-art software tools and methods. Typical responsibilities involve leading design, development, and test activities including operation, data collection, and analysis. You must be able to lead and mentor component design and analysis engineers while working effectively with design teams, project engineers, global support, chief engineers, and customers. EPET.02.2022 ENG0830 You Must Have Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical, Aerospace, or Civil Engineering 12+ years of gear design and analysis experience Must be US citizen due to contractual requirements We Value Advanced understanding and application of these disciplines: gears & power transmission, kinematics & mechanisms, strength of materials, fatigue lifting, gear manufacturing processes Extensive experience in gear and spline design analysis Aptitude for mechanical designs and system conceptualization Experience using advanced numerical simulation codes (for example, OSU Load Distribution Program, ANSYS, Romax, etc) Familiarity with mechanical component rig testing Motivated to drive improvements in a meaningful environment Passion for solving challenging problems Ambitious and able to work with little supervision, consistently take the initiative to get things done, do things before being asked by others or necessitated by events Possess a wide degree of curiosity, creativity, and flexibility Ability to work with other team members ensuring timely completion of assignments Ability to juggle many priorities and competing demands easily and effectively Good interpersonal skills both written and verbal Experience with gas turbines and gas turbine gearbox systems Knowledge of Six Sigma tools and application EPET.02.2022 Additional Information JOB ID: req380230 Category: Engineering Location: 111 S 34th St.,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing, and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. UOP, a Honeywell company headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a leading international licensor of processing technology and supplier of engineering services, catalysts and adsorbents, equipment, specialty materials and digital solutions for the global refining, gas processing and petrochemical industries. With more than a century of leadership in hydrocarbon processing technologies, UOP has led six revolutions in technology that transformed our industry. For more information visit www.uop.com. We are currently looking for an Experienced Field Advisor for our Chemical Engineer II position within UOP. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to work around the world as part of a Field Operating Service (FOS) team, supported by technology experts from UOP’s Operating Technical Service. FOS advisors are on-site prior, during and after the initial start-up of UOP technologies. They help to ensure that the plant and operators are ready for commissioning. Advisors are also involved in the start-up and test runs that demonstrate guarantees and are accountable for process, equipment, refining and petrochemical insight and assist customers in resolving engineering and operating issues. UOP advisors may remain at a site for a few days to several months for each assignment. For each start-up, advisors work with a number of UOP-licensed processes and a variety of individuals within and outside of UOP. The experience gained from each assignment, and the subsequent interaction with other UOP employees, provide a solid background for assessing and solving problems encountered in each situation in various locations around the world. As advisors gain experience, they have opportunities to advance to positions of increased accountability within the FOS organization. Key Responsibilities Providing field technical assistance on new and/or revamped refinery unit checkout and startups. Providing field technical assistance and field support for development activities in commercial refinery units. Following required safety procedures. Providing feedback including suggested improvements on UOP process designs. Troubleshooting and recommending solutions while also addressing improvement and innovative problem solving. Familiar with controls communications networks Coordinating commissioning activities. Transferring technology to customers operating and engineering staff. Reviewing emergency and normal operating procedures with customer shift operating personnel. Advising customer operating personnel on the establishment and maintenance of the various process variables necessary to achieve safe and efficient operations. Collecting and working up unit operating data and laboratory results. Monitoring and advising on process operating conditions, during test runs. Build effective and productive relationships with customer counterparts Conduct unit audits to support refinery wide expansion projects as well as new multi-unit complex startups. Advising customer personnel during the performance of various activities routine to the long-term operations of a UOP process unit. 100% Travel YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors Degree in Chemical Engineering. 5+ years of experience in the Petrochemical, Gas processing or Refining industry. 10+ years of directly applicable field experience may be considered in lieu of a Bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering. WE VALUE Experience with at least one of the following UOP technologies (Catalytic Reforming, Gas Processing, Hydrocracking, Hydrotreating, FCC, Merox Treating, HF Alkylation, Paraffin Isomerization, Adsorptive Separations (Parex and Molex), Xylene Isomerization and other Aromatics processing, (Cumene and Ethyl Benzene) is preferred. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and Word. Proficiency in written and verbal English. Flexibility to work hours that are dictated by customer requirements and assignment scope. Ability to work in a physically challenging environment. Ability to commit to fulltime travel for the duration of a project. Ability to interact with customers on a global basis. UOP102020 Additional Information JOB ID: HRD176264 Category: Engineering Location: FOS Group 50 E Algonquin Rd,Des Plaines,Illinois,60017,United States Exempt Engineering (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. jobTitle: Sr Advanced Cyber Security Researcher (Defense & Space) - Penetration Testing
jobDescription: The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Honeywell Global Security (HGS) business believes in integrating security into all aspects of our business to protect the people, processes, and assets by which Honeywell achieves its greater mission. Advancements in technology, contractual and regulatory requirements, emerging threats, and Honeywell's growth worldwide continue to challenge all of us to ensure everything we do in business is secure. The Sr Advanced Cyber Security Researcher reports to the Product Security Assurance Leader and will be responsible for assessing and evaluating the security posture of a variety of Honeywell Products and partner technologies. This role will be responsible for security services delivery, which may include use of application, network, firmware, mobile, hardware security toolsets, detection of security defects, and remediation consultation of those weaknesses. Our services support the identification of potential attack techniques and serve as the foundation for continuously improving the product development lifecycle. In this key position, the Advanced Cyber Security Researcher will… Collaborate as an Individual Contributor with the Product Security Assurance Team Deliver Security / Penetration Testing across divers Honeywell products, solutions and services Assist in the development of modular, repeatable, effective Security Testing processes Partner with Tools and Technology Team to select, implement, develop, and automate testing with appropriate tools. Work with cross functional teams to develop remediation suggestions Report product security observations using the Honeywell standardized reporting structure YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors degree 4 years demonstrated experience in penetration testing, red teaming or offensive operations. Must be a US Citizen due to contractual obligations. WE VALUE Exposure to security testing within the appropriate domain Understanding of application protocols, development, and common attack vectors. Good cybersecurity capabilities and strong software engineering skills Experience with pentest tools and frameworks such as: Burp Suite, IDA Pro, GHidra, Kali, OWASP, Metasploit. Scripting experience in Python, Powershell and Bash preferred. Experience working with other languages such as C, C++, Java, .NET or javascript. Basic understanding of security by design principles and architecture level security concepts Up to date knowledge of current and emerging security threats and techniques for exploiting security vulnerabilities Effective oral and written communication skills Good interpersonal skills Demonstrated project management skills. jobTitle: Sr Advanced Cyber Security Researcher - Penetration Testing
jobDescription: The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. The Honeywell Global Security (HGS) business believes in integrating security into all aspects of our business to protect the people, processes, and assets by which Honeywell achieves its greater mission. Advancements in technology, contractual and regulatory requirements, emerging threats, and Honeywell's growth worldwide continue to challenge all of us to ensure everything we do in business is secure. The Sr Advanced Cyber Security Researcher reports to the Product Security Assurance Leader and will be responsible for assessing and evaluating the security posture of a variety of Honeywell Products and partner technologies. This role will be responsible for security services delivery, which may include use of application, network, firmware, mobile, hardware security toolsets, detection of security defects, and remediation consultation of those weaknesses. Our services support the identification of potential attack techniques and serve as the foundation for continuously improving the product development lifecycle. In this key position, the Advanced Cyber Security Researcher will… Collaborate as an Individual Contributor with the Product Security Assurance Team Deliver Security / Penetration Testing across divers Honeywell products, solutions and services Assist in the development of modular, repeatable, effective Security Testing processes Partner with Tools and Technology Team to select, implement, develop, and automate testing with appropriate tools. Work with cross functional teams to develop remediation suggestions Report product security observations using the Honeywell standardized reporting structure YOU MUST HAVE Bachelors degree 4 years demonstrated experience in penetration testing, red teaming or offensive operations. Must be a US Citizen due to contractual obligations. WE VALUE Exposure to security testing within the appropriate domain Understanding of application protocols, development, and common attack vectors. Good cybersecurity capabilities and strong software engineering skills Experience with pentest tools and frameworks such as: Burp Suite, IDA Pro, GHidra, Kali, OWASP, Metasploit. Scripting experience in Python, Powershell and Bash preferred. Experience working with other languages such as C, C++, Java, .NET or javascript. Basic understanding of security by design principles and architecture level security concepts Up to date knowledge of current and emerging security threats and techniques for exploiting security vulnerabilities Effective oral and written communication skills Good interpersonal skills Demonstrated project management skills. Relevant Cyber Security certifications: CEH, OSCP, GPEN Experience and knowledge of penetration testing methodologies and tools

Senior Advanced Test Engineer work with a wide variety of stakeholders in all aspects of test facility design and maintenance, test equipment design, configuration and upkeep, test planning and test execution. The person, under moderate supervision, will leverage their knowledge of engineering processes, discipline, and tools to plan and execute tasks and projects related to the development and certification of Mechanical Systems and Components. Key Responsibilities Design, procure, fabricate and maintain test equipment and facilities in support of development, demonstration, certification, and qualification tests. Workflow management via the Work Request System (WRS) – includes coordination with all Mechanical Test functions, other Honeywell partners and outside suppliers. Being a steward of Mechanical Test facilities and equipment – including development and execution of initiatives designed to maximize the value that Mechanical test offers customers. Support estimates for new tests/programs. Build and leverage a strong network. Have a bias for following, improving and developing standard processes. Demonstrate a strong mechanical aptitude and a working knowledge of pneumatic controls, hydraulics, actuation and start systems and applications as well as control and data systems. Communicate effectively with peers, customers, suppliers and leadership. Demonstrate strong project management skills (plan – execute – escalate). You Must Have Bachelor of Science in Engineering Minimum of 7 years of experience in a Mechanical Test environment Must be US Citizen or Lawful Permanent Resident, due to ITAR and Export Control restrictions. We Value Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace or Mechanical Engineering preferred Aerospace component and systems test experience desired. Working knowledge of instrumentation and measurement systems desired. Demonstrated comfort working with complex systems (mechanical, fluid flow, hydraulics, pneumatics, data and automation). Demonstrated ability to work well with a team while being able to make decisions, balancing risks and rewards. Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing, and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO *** Summary Honeywell FM&T is seeking a Sr Application Developer that loves technology and demonstrates a strong passion for app development. This person will join a team that supports a database and reporting system that serves our engineering, quality, and partner laboratory customers. The successful candidate will work on the Enterprise Component Information System (eCIS) team to provide system integration and data integration using disciplined software development processes. We are seeking someone with a very high technical aptitude to learn. Honeywell FM&T offers a strong team atmosphere with a great work/life balance. Duties And Responsibilities Develop and enhance system and data integration for a COTS enterprise web app/db suite Evaluate and provide recommendations for new/expanded data sources, workflows, and software projects Lead or participate on cross functional teams to implement the improvements Provide application and customer support for the COTS software suite. Document functions and changes to new or modified features/modules, test activities/results and other areas such as error handling Enhance and monitor operation, performance, & security monitoring (including logging) Identify new tools, processes, and training to improve team efficiency Adhere to quality standards and procedures Maintain quality assurance for software modules, comply with application & team standards, and conduct unit testing of modules to ensure requirements are met Participate in planning sessions with team, customers, and design agency to implement process improvements Assess customer needs utilizing a structured requirements process to assist in identifying business priorities and advice on options Analyze existing information systems to identify weaknesses and develop opportunities for improvements Manage multiple tasks and projects with conflicting priorities in an organized manner to achieve results You Must Have US citizenship to obtain and maintain US Dept. of Energy ""Q"" level security clearance Five or more years of direct work experience Bachelor’s degree, certification or two additional years of direct work experience in lieu of a bachelor’s degree and certification Programming experience in various major programming languages (e.g. Java, C#, Python) Demonstrated experience in serving as a Technical Lead in support of projects We Value Supplier Relationship Management (SRM) LINUX / UNIX OS &/or Microsoft Windows knowledge Toad for Oracle or other database clients Proficiency in Microsoft Office and wiki tools Strong communication skills Web Services &/or ETL Agile, Jira, &/or Confluence applications Agile Business Process Platform (ABPP) XML, PGL, & XSLT Remote roles can be in any of the states where Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies, LLC is authorized to do business. ** Some roles, however, may have to be co-located with their teams in certain locations. Honeywell Federal Manufacturing is authorized to do business in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies is registered, you will not be eligible for employment. The Senior Manager of Processes for STS and will lead a team primarily consisting of technology and process specialists and will report directly to the Director of STS and Honeywell Separation and Purification(HSP). Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Would you like to join Honeywell and be a part of overseeing and directing operations for world-class integrated supply chain chemical manufacturing plants? If you answered positively, we at Honeywell have a career opportunity for you! We invite you to apply for the role of Sr. Chemical Plant Operations Manager! In this position, You will ensure the achievement of metrics (Safety, Quality, Inventory, Delivery, Cost, and so on) in the ISC manufacturing organization. You will manage a team that supports production, business, and other processes in a team-based chemical manufacturing environment. You will leverage your team's experience and skills to perform activities in a variety of cross-functional areas including production planning and control, total quality management, systems, manufacturing, equipment and facilities engineering, material management, and process reengineering. Key Responsibilities Ensures a safe work environment for all employees Strategic planning development and execution Own SQDIP and financials People management and resource planning Drive HOS activities Talent management Develop a capable team of Integrated Supply Chain leaders Drive chemical advances Cost improvement initiatives AOP and Capital planning YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a similar technical discipline WE VALUE Advanced Manufacturing or Business degree (Masters) Solid understanding of lean, six sigma tools and problem-solving methodology Significant chemical manufacturing experience in a fast-paced environment Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Fosters teamwork and diversity Improving performance, meeting commitments, and getting results Ability to lead/drive change, and influence/mentor others Able to develop networks and build relationships Additional Information JOB ID: HRD184106 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 4090 Azalea Dr,North Charleston,South Carolina,29405,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity Honeywell is hiring a Sr. Communications Manager for Integrated Supply Chain (ISC) in Performance Materials and Technologies. This Sr. Communications Manager will be primarily responsible for strategic communications and planning in support of ISC Leadership and organization priorities.
