Develop communications plans that meet business objectives and priorities Develop written materials (executive messages & presentations, announcements, newsletter articles, etc.) Plan and execute internal events, such as quarterly town halls, executive site visits, employee recognition activities and employee briefings Develop content and update web and online social collaboration tools as well as identify new or expand use of existing tools Coordinate and facilitate vendor relationships as appropriate in support of symposiums, special awards, recognition programs, etc. Collaborate cross-functionally within the global ISC organization on projects and other opportunities to improve communications support of the business Engage with Honeywell Performance Materials & Technologies business units, key leaders, and support functions as necessary Collaborate cross-functionally within the ISC organization on projects and other opportunities to improve communications support of the business You Must Have 5+ years of relevant corporate communications experience Bachelor’s Degree in Communications/Journalism or related degree Ability to get results and manage multiple projects Previous experience within a large, complex, and matrixed organization We Value Self-starter with strong writing and verbal communications skills Strong business acumen and the ability to strategically interface with and influence key stakeholders, particularly at the executive level Ability to translate technical information into coherent communications and to work with technical audiences effectively Ability to develop relationships at the highest level of the organization; connect with appropriate experts across the business as well as engage with employee groups as appropriate Outstanding communications skills, including effective writing skills for intranet, executive messaging, and presentations, and video shooting and editing Ability to drive the right outcomes and behaviors to accelerate results quickly and creatively Outstanding interpersonal skills and ability to build teamwork and trust Prior experience with large, technical, or engineering populations Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182438 Category: Communications Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Join a team that protects Honeywell against unjustifiable risks resulting from business transactions and providing support and guidance to Sales and Procurement professionals. You are part of a team of business impact partners located all around the world negotiating agreements with Honeywell customers. You ensure that final contractual documents drive growth and include all deal parameters approved in accordance with respective approval processes and Honeywell business is conducted with the highest ethical standards, internal company policies and local and international laws. This position can be located at the Honeywell Aerospace Clearwater or Phoenix locations Key Responsibilities Advises internal customer. Interprets terms. Negotiates contracts. Drafts agreements. Assists in resolving disputes. Settles claims. Identifies risk in agreements. Escalates non-standard terms. Focus on speed of contracting. Reduce inefficiencies. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s degree 3+ years of legal or contract management experience Must be US Citizen due to contractual requirements Must be able to obtain a US Security Clearance WE VALUE Superior communications skills (both oral and written). Ability to function as member of virtual team. Attention to detail and ability to work across functions. Integrity and strong focus on compliance. Solid analytical skills and strong business acumen. Sound business judgment and strong problem-solving skills. Ability to prioritize work within time constraints. Drive efficiencies and process improvements. Strong organization and project management skills. Additional Information JOB ID: req379717 Category: Legal Location: 13350 US Hwy 19 N,Clearwater,Florida,33764,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Human Resources (CORPORATE HR) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

The Service Operations Leader will drive operational excellence within the assigned territory customer group. The SOL will be accountable for ensuring, effective customer engagement from the local Lifecycle Solutions & Services (LSS) and broader Honeywell Process Solutions (HPS) team. The role will ensure all Contracts are renewed on time and drive growth across all LSS modes of service delivery. This will be achieved through effective Workforce planning, delivery coordination, and ensuring the delivery teams engaged with the customer base are competent to execute all committed deliveries in manner that ensure compliance to Honeywell and Customer Health, Safety and Environmental requirements in the most effective and efficient way compliant to LSS Global Service Methodologies (GSM Customer Engagement Understand our Customer base needs and identify growth opportunities to be passed to sales or pursued directly. Develop a clear understanding of assigned Customers’ business drivers, historical and present issues. Develop and deploy a prioritized Customer engagement plan (MOS) for assigned customers. Through consistent engagement, develop strong trust relationships with key contacts in the assigned accounts. As appropriate, develop and expand the customer network in all directions, particularly up and across their organization. Present deliverables reports to Customers and Honeywell leadership as required. Manage the day to day concerns of the Customer, including corrective actions, ensuring satisfactory completion for all parties. Become the primary escalation point for Customer issues and sales support needs. Renewal & Growth Based on customer understanding, identify Honeywell solutions to offer Customers. Consistently support the development of white space analysis for new opportunities and utilize to drive LSS business increases. Accountable for the contract renewal process from site data collection to PO receipt. Provide Sales support in the development of new accounts or significant service scope increase. Assis in identifying and communication cross-SBU/One Honeywell opportunities to the relevant SBU. Operational Support Drive the Honeywell safety culture through demonstrated understanding, commitment and action supporting the organization’s safety and environmental requirements/regulations. Ensure FSS’s observe and operate both Honeywell and customer safe systems of work, complying with all legislation. Use SFDC tools for coordinating field resources for all service execution and order to invoice management. This includes coaching the FSS to manage their work, capture service delivery according to the GSM process, and escalate deviations to FSM/SBM as required. Ensure the financial health of all agreements and spot activities, and ensure they are invoiced per the agreed schedule, milestones and with all collectibles on time. Ensure Spot and Parts orders are managed to meet customer and Honeywell delivery expectations. Own the NPS and manage the Customer satisfaction survey process as part of the regular reviews MOS established with the customer. Ensure adherence to existing global quality processes as well as continuously developing and implementing improvements. Build a strong network across the local/global HPS business teams to ensure customer delivery satisfaction. Ensure Service Management System and ERP system integrity such as correct account team assignment in Siebel/SFDC. Coordinate with the Back Office to review and correct Customer asset, account team, and contract information in Siebel or other software applications. Manage the preparation and ongoing maintenance of Customer site portals as required. Contribute to accurate forecasting for all financial aspects of LSS contracts, spot and parts Work Force Planning Using SFDC Labor SIOP Tools, schedule appropriate resources to provide sales support, contract, project & short cycle delivery in line with commitments and business needs Establish a relationship with GES for outsourcing packaged work. Manage leave & sick leave coverage, and after hours on-call rosters Ensure Work Execution planning is completed to understand the resource and skill requirements. Engage with Global Mobility Services to ensure correct visas, etc. are in place for foreign workers, in partnership with FSM. Work with other LSS, PAS and AS workforce planners as required. Provide SIOP labor planning in line with backlog and front log to ensure labor resourcing is optimized, where the front log information is provided by the FSM. Identify and maintain a pipeline to a flexible workforce to cover peaks in demand of labor resources. Training and Development Maintain and manage the skills database and certification records for the FSS’s in the assigned territories. Maintain and manage training on new offerings and products to support Spot and Parts opportunity growth. Drive scheduling and completion of the training plan (technical and soft skills) for the FSS’s in the assigned territories. When requested by FSM, provide feedback on individual employees to support the HPD process. Supports the SBD, Pole Service Operations Manager in the rollout of processes, tools and initiatives, including productivity and its tracking. Accountable for Safety Dashboard management of FSM team (tracking safety training) YOU MUST HAVE Recognized Industrial Automation & Control technical training 10 Years of process automation industry experience. 5 Years of experience supporting a services organization with exposure to periodic customer contracts. Sales and negotiation skills to enable contract and short cycle opportunity selling and order closure. WE VALUE Able to influence customer and internal contacts. Effective communicator with demonstrated success in team environments. Proven effectiveness in a highly matrixed organization. Ability to influence across functions & business groups to implement and drive change. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182910 Category: Customer Experience Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell Intelligrated is a leading North American-based, single-source provider of intelligent automated material handling solutions that drive fulfillment productivity for retailers, manufacturers and logistics providers around the world. Through a broad portfolio of automation equipment, software, service, and support, Intelligrated solutions give businesses a competitive edge and optimize operational performance through increased flexibility, efficiency and accuracy. As a Sr Customer Contract Specialist and member of the procurement Customer Change Control Team (CCT), you will be responsible for supporting a Project management team in the effective governance and administration of the prime contract between Honeywell and its customer. Execute a program to identify and prepare Change Order Request Intelligrated (CRINT) as they develop and direct the efforts to negotiate and resolve CRINTs; With the project team and legal, become an expert in assigned customer contract baseline, including terms and conditions, specifications, drawings, estimate, proposal, schedule and other documents incorporated in the contract. Execute The Contract Requirements Action List Identifying The Following Action the contractually required notices Execute the Customer Change Order Procedure and Customer identified changes, quantify the additional time and compensation due Honeywell, receive Intelligrated approvals and communicate changes to the Customer; Prepare change orders to the contract and, as directed, negotiate such change orders; Participate in project related meetings, work closely with Installation, Engineering, and Project Controls, and review project financial data to: Ensure awareness of all project activities that may affect the prime contract; Identify opportunities for revenue enhancement, schedule relief and claim avoidance; Recommend appropriate actions to protect Honeywell’s interest and/or improve project performance; Ensure compliance with prime contract terms and conditions; Contribute to the development and delivery of ongoing training to address prime contract management principles This position allows a hybrid schedule with three days working onsite and two days working remote each week. MUST HAVE Degree in Business, Engineering, Construction Management or Cost Engineering or equivalent experience. Courses or experience in pricing, contract law, contract drafting, administration and negotiation of change orders, effective correspondence, planning and scheduling. 2-5 years progressive work experience of sales/sourcing/engineering/construction industry contracting practices. WE VALUE Working and/or Leading in Site Team Environments Project Management and/or Contract Management Experience Professional Certifications in Project/Supply Chain/ Procurement/Contract Management Team Leader experience in Supply Management/Sourcing/Procurement/Business Demonstrated Business and financial acumen Experience with Salesforce.com, SAP, Oracle, or site relevant ERP systems, E Sourcing Platforms, Request for Quotation Tools, Project Management Tools Experience with Six Sigma and Lean Tools Masters Degree Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181752 Category: Procurement Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Exempt Supply Chain (CHINA) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Execute The Contract Requirements Action List Identifying The Following Action the contractually required notices Execute the Customer Change Order Procedure and Customer identified changes, quantify the additional time and compensation due Honeywell, receive Intelligrated approvals and communicate changes to the Customer; Prepare change orders to the contract and, as directed, negotiate such change orders; Participate in project related meetings, work closely with Installation, Engineering, and Project Controls, and review project financial data to: Ensure awareness of all project activities that may affect the prime contract; Identify opportunities for revenue enhancement, schedule relief and claim avoidance; Recommend appropriate actions to protect Honeywell’s interest and/or improve project performance; Ensure compliance with prime contract terms and conditions; Contribute to the development and delivery of ongoing training to address prime contract management principles This position allows a hybrid schedule with three days working onsite and two days working remote each week. MUST HAVE Degree in Business, Engineering, Construction Management or Cost Engineering or equivalent experience. Courses or experience in pricing, contract law, contract drafting, administration and negotiation of change orders, effective correspondence, planning and scheduling. 2-5 years progressive work experience of sales/sourcing/engineering/construction industry contracting practices. WE VALUE Working and/or Leading in Site Team Environments Project Management and/or Contract Management Experience Professional Certifications in Project/Supply Chain/ Procurement/Contract Management Team Leader experience in Supply Management/Sourcing/Procurement/Business Demonstrated Business and financial acumen Experience with Salesforce.com, SAP, Oracle, or site relevant ERP systems, E Sourcing Platforms, Request for Quotation Tools, Project Management Tools Experience with Six Sigma and Lean Tools Masters Degree A Job posting does not exist for this global job code, please work with your HRG to develop one Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181753 Category: Procurement Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Exempt Supply Chain (CHINA) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? In this position, you are an innovator, and you build for scale. You own, scope, and deliver on all capital and productivity programs across all factories within the Business Group. You lead factory design, capacity planning, and capacity expansion within the ISC Manufacturing Strategy Framework to achieve World Class status within each Business Enterprise. You lead dedicated engineering teams that span across multiple Business Enterprises within Safety and Productivity Solutions (SPS). You own factory performance in terms of value stream design (VSM), line design (inclusive of workplace safety), automation implementation, line standards, equipment standards, operational equipment effectiveness (OEE), process capability, and target cost per unit. You partner with site and multi-site leaders to execute to standards, identify gaps, and root cause problems solve to achieve performance targets. You own the capital program funnel to capture productivity improvement opportunities, refine problem statements, develop business cases, scope implementation plans, and prioritize/re-prioritize with the Business Enterprises on a recurring basis. Your team owns process technologies (i.e., formulation, testing protocols, etc.), standard work, and road mapping to improve safety, quality, delivery, inventory, and cost. You partner with Lean and Six Sigma experts to support organic productivity improvements through Lean deployment and structured problem solving, as well as partner with Automation Development teams to scope and deploy scalable systems to capture productivity savings. You own equipment commissioning (FAT/SAT), and Total Productive Maintenance (TPM) within existing factories. You partner with NPI Engineering teams to assure new products and processes are designed for manufacturing excellence and automation (DFM/DFA) effectiveness. You are measured by safety incident rates, capital management to plan, total productivity savings achieved within the business group, and achievement of factory performance standards. Key Responsibilities Partner with ISC Transformation teams to define/refine manufacturing strategy and support strategic initiatives. Develop and implement World Class factory and manufacturing line designs to achieve strategic goals. Lead and own capital expense planning, prioritization, and execution to achieve strategic outcomes and defined productivity savings. Define standard work and process standards for all lines and factories across SPS. Partner with Operations teams to achieve standards. This includes safety standards, labor standards (takt, cycle times), Lean flow (end-to-end cadence), process capability (Cpk), equipment productivity, yield, uptime (OEE), change overs, and Total Productive Maintenance (TPM). Manage bill of material (BOM), ERP routing definition, and standard cost. Lead factory safety assessment and improvements in partnership with Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) Engineering, including compliance to machine guarding international standards. Drive process technology improvement and road mapping. Leverage existing technologies and systems, innovate within Honeywell, and collaborate within ISC Engineering to deploy scalable automation solutions. Lead factory engineering teams to ensure plants continue to operate within defined MTBF, MTTR, maintenance, and calibration standards and schedules. Define scalable engineering service and support model and service level agreements (SLA) across SPS. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s degree in a technical field required 5+ years of experience in supply chain, manufacturing, or logistics environment  5+ years of Lean or Six Sigma experience required; Black Belt or Lean Expert training 5+ years as a leader of leaders WE VALUE Master’s degree in engineering discipline preferred, MBA a plus. 5+ years of demonstrated success building world class manufacturing operations in high-mix low-volume, and low-mix high-volume settings. Demonstrated success evaluating, developing, and implementing scalable automation solutions within an operational setting such as manufacturing, warehouse, or chemical processing environments. 5+ years progressive leadership experience demonstrating strong business acumen and influencing stakeholder. Solid understanding of the end-to-end business processes from customer order to cash collection with experience in value stream mapping, lean methodologies, material planning, pull systems, etc. Demonstrated ability to root cause problems solve, lead change initiatives, and drive consistent process . Demonstrated project management experience and ability to manage multiple priorities in a highly matrixed organization. Track record of achieving results in challenging assignments and in a global environment . Demonstrated strong coaching, mentoring, and influencing skills. Demonstrated ability to build, manage, energize, and motivate high performing teams. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present up to and including the Executive level. Experience with Toyota Production System or similar operating system. Lean Expert/SSBB Certification preferred. Additional Information JOB ID: req382699 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 830 E Arapaho Rd,Richardson,Texas,75081,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

jobTitle: Sr Director Finance ISC Advanced Materials
jobDescription: Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization Honeywell (www.honeywell.com) is a Fortune 100 technology company that delivers industry-specific solutions that include aerospace products and services; control technologies for buildings and industry; and performance materials globally. Our technologies help aircraft, buildings, manufacturing plants, supply chains, and workers become more connected to make our world smarter, safer, and more sustainable. With over $34 billion in sales in 2021 and 108% total shareowner return over the last five years, Honeywell has established a track record of strong financial performance over time. In just over a decade and a half, Honeywell has transformed itself into a top performer. Since 2003, the company’s stock has risen from $24 to $195 this year. In that same time frame, the company has remade itself, acquiring more than 70 businesses. Today the company is focused on growth, technology and innovation and is known as having a culture that balances accountability and results-orientation with a high value on its people. Executives joining Honeywell from the outside marvel at its leadership’s intellectual horsepower, humility, and ability to focus on the “right stuff”. These factors have combined to make Honeywell a great place to work. THE BUSINESS This is a fantastic opportunity to join one of the most successful businesses within Honeywell with a unique and differentiated underlying technology set and exposure to attractive end markets. Our Advanced Materials (AM), Business is headquartered in Morris Plains, New Jersey and is a global supplier of fluorine products, fine chemicals, additives, metals, films and fibers for products including pharmaceuticals, refrigeration, semiconductors and military protection. With over 3100 employees and holding over 5100 active patents and applications, AM is the industry innovator in fluorine products, the technology leader in life sciences, protective and industrial solutions as well as the quality and applications leader in electronics and chemicals. THE POSITION This Finance Senior Director position, located in either Houston, TX or Morris Plains, NJ will be the key finance partner supporting the Integrated Supply Chain (ISC) business within AM. The Finance Senior Director will play a critical role in supporting this business via providing financial oversight, analysis, and support with an operational and strategic growth mindset. This is truly a tremendous way to join the company. Key Responsibilities Develop various financial reporting and analysis, forecasts, budgets, and variance analysis Provide financial guidance to the plant leadership team and ISC leadership through financial metrics, capital investment economic analysis, productivity analysis, and manufacturing cost analysis. Digitize and automate financial reporting and analytics. Complete ad-hoc analysis as requested to support ISC Perform finance functions in support of AM business which may include broader financial reporting, budget reporting and management, and cost savings actions tracking Financial modeling of proposed new offers, business models, and go-to-market strategies Perform valuation modeling for potential M&A activity Be a global strategic finance leader actively working with the leadership team to achieve desired financial metrics across the organization. Lead month-end close and forecasting processes Interface with AM staff to ensure proper controls and compliance with GAAP Prepare and present Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and 5-Year Strategic Plan (STRAP) summary; operationalize targets into an action-oriented plan Review relevant industry and market information to form an understanding of current and future operating environment to provide key insight on decision-making Develop and provide key business metrics, indicators, and financial interpretations Identify pricing opportunities and work with business to execute Strong leadership experience with focus on team development and succession planning Preferred Qualifications BS in Finance or Accounting 10+ years finance and accounting experience 5+ years leading complex multi-site manufacturing financials Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong business-partnering skills M&A And FP&A Experience Preferred Strong business and financial acumen Ability to think outside the box and create structure, processes, financial reporting from scratch Comfort working with and partnering with executive management to collectively drive business decisions Excellent communication and coordination skills Knowledge of SAP modules and Hyperion Financial Management (HFM) system preferred Microsoft Office Suite knowledge (PowerPoint and strong Excel Skills) P&L/Balance Sheet Budgeting and Forecasting experience Ability to manage several projects at once, and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment High sense of urgency and ability to juggle multiple assignments and meet tight deadlines EDUCATION Undergraduate Degree Is Required. MBA And/or CPA Is Preferred. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181985 Category: Finance Location: 115 Tabor Road,Morris Plains,New Jersey,07950,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

jobTitle: Sr Director Global Demand & Supply Planning
jobDescription: The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings intelligent and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Why Honeywell? Honeywell changes the way the world works. For more than 130 years, we’ve solved the toughest customer challenges through a rare combination of our industrial expertise and our innovations in ground-breaking software and technology, and industry-leading automation. This perfection is built on a foundation of inclusion, diversity and driving a performance culture that values integrity and ethics. Are you ready to help us make the future? Advanced Materials (AM) is a global supplier of fluorine products, fine chemicals, research chemicals, additives, metals, films, and fibers for products including pharmaceuticals, refrigeration, semiconductors, and military protection. Advanced Materials is making the world safer, cleaner, and enabling the modernization of a growing middle class by enhancing our customer offerings through a differentiated portfolio of chemistries, materials, value-added solutions, and superior customer service. Our mission is to attract, retain and develop diverse and highly motivated, entrepreneurial employees striving to flawlessly deliver superior value to our customers every day. Lead the activities related to the demand planning, production planning, inventory control, material planning, within Honeywell AM. You will have significant authority in Strategic Planning, work cross-functionally to achieve organizational objectives and drive functional excellence and continuous improvement. You are a proven leader of senior leaders inspiring teams to deliver best in class results. You are accountable for and lead multiple, highly complex global projects. Lead Planning strategy & vision and drive execution to enable business value and productivity. Continuously improve planning processes to drive better business results. Build a world-class workforce that creates competitive advantage by hiring the right people, developing, coaching, and retaining top talent. Ensure the SIOP/S&OP/IBP processes are delivering at world-class levels to maximize revenue, reduce costs & inventory, and achieve top tier delivery performance for our customers. Key Responsibilities Lead team to meet metrics Develop and optimize planning processes Facilitate the AM Executive SIOP/S&OP/IBP process Improve Honeywell Operating System maturity Oversee Health, Safety and Environment procedure Monitor demand, supply, and material requirement plans Ensure delivery of inventory targets, PFEP, and reduction of aged inventory Develop capability of your team Streamline work through digital transformation The preferred location for this position is Morris Plains, NJ. Other locations such as Houston, TX may be considered. You Must Have Bachelor Degree in Engineering, Supply Chain or related field Proven S&OP experience leading Supply Chain organizations to deliver delivery, cost, and inventory performance We Value Experience in broad managerial role leading multiple functions Strong project management and problem-solving skills Proven results delivering innovative solutions to complex organizational problems Extensive influencing and collaboration skills with commercial business leaders Expertise on leading / driving change, and mentoring teams & peers Extensive experience in S&OP, Demand Planning, Supply Planning and Inventory Management and Materials Management Passion for driving continuous improvement/lean six sigma Passion for developing and coaching teams Additional Information JOB ID: req381524 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 115 Tabor Road,Morris Plains,New Jersey,07950,United States Exempt Supply Chain (CHINA) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Let Your Career Takeoff with Honeywell Aerospace. These are exciting times at Honeywell Aerospace. Right now, we’re working on flying taxis, hybrid-electric engines, microsatellites, missions to Mars, autonomous flight, advanced data analytics and hundreds of other innovations that are changing flying in fundamental ways. We have what it takes to win in the new-transportation economy of the 2020s and beyond. Nobody matches Honeywell’s record of innovation, achievement and success. With more than a century of peak performance under our belts, we have the technology, know-how and will-to- win. Now all we need is you. We’re looking for a few overachievers to build a startup business in one of the most promising high-growth segments of aviation – Urban Air Mobility. This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new business that is supported by all the resources of one of the world’s largest and most admired companies, but will have the DNA and agile entrepreneurial spirit of a Silicon Valley startup. We’re looking for strategic thinkers who are predisposed to act and with the ability to build high- performing teams, create new markets and achieve breakthrough performance. If that sounds like you, we want to hear from you today. In this role, you will drive global business development and strategy, seeking new avenues of growth within the Urban Air Mobility and Unmanned Aerial Systems sectors. You will be responsible for seeing the world through our customers’ eyes and developing strategic recommendations to identify and scale growth opportunities, build high-leverage strategic alliances and establish and sustain competitive advantage and improve profitability. Key Responsibilities Mobilize the organization around key must-win opportunities Challenge the status quo and stay attuned to the dynamics of the complex AAM marketplace. Inform technology and product strategy development with market insights Build high-leverage strategic alliances Develop and implement strategic marketing plans Identify and assess potential M&A candidates to strengthen our portfolio Lead cross-functional strategic business planning and business case development Work with industry partners to co-create the AAM and UAM industry Represent the business and Honeywell as a thought leader at public and industry forums YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing or engineering Minimum 5 years of experience in strategic marketing, strategic planning or related role Minimum 5 years in a business operational role, such as engineering, sales, offering management, or general management Must be a US person (US citizen, US permanent resident or individual with protected status i.e. asylum/refugee) due to US export control laws and regulations WE VALUE An advanced engineering degree in aerospace engineering, computer science or related field MBA from a top-tier university Ability to work in agile environment Proven success in a highly matrixed organization Ability to lead cross functional collaboration, communications and influence Experience in M&A Dealing with ambiguity Aerospace or defense experience Experience in risk management identification and mitigation Additional Information JOB ID: req379044 Category: Business Development Location: 1944 E Sky Harbor Circle,Phoenix,Arizona,85034,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

jobTitle: Sr. Director of Global Quality - Supply Chain
jobDescription: The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell is not just about developing cool things. That is why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The role is a highly important leadership position managing a large team of quality professionals across all our Aerospace Mechanical sites across the US, Canada, and Mexico. In addition, the successful candidate will play a key leadership role with our major Aerospace customers to develop and maintain a system to ensure that all products manufactured and serviced by the organization meet customer requirements while achieving superior quality and reliability levels. The role will be mainly responsible for: Applying creativity and problem-solving techniques to implement critical quality assurance strategies and processes. Serve as a role model in the areas of quality, safety, leadership, teamwork, customer focus, continuous improvement and environmental stewardship to ensure alignment with the company's vision and goals. Define quality control strategy and lead creative solutions through multiple and complex global projects. Drive continuous improvement and lead change within the Quality organization and Honeywell Operating System. Drive accountability for and lead multiple, highly complex global projects to guarantee customer satisfaction. Implement a world-class, customer focused strategy that enables their team to maintain competitive advantage. Develop and maintain a system to assure that all products manufactured and serviced by the organization meet customer requirements while achieving superior quality and reliability levels within Honeywell Aerospace. The role has a team of direct reports and is responsible to ensure full performance management process, succession planning, and development for the full organization. The role will also have all quality leaders in the Mechanical factories as matrix reports. Develop and implement a robust MOS covering all elements of the Mechanical Products quality requirements. Actively participate in the Supplier Quality performance with a zero-defect expectation. Participate in the Annual Operation Plan (AOP) and Strategic Planning cycle (STRAP). Take full ownership for targeted customer quality performance. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance, Engineering or Supply Chain Minimum of 7 years of Supply Chain, Engineering or Manufacturing experience Due to contract requirements, must be a US Citizen WE VALUE Extensive experience in quality or associated supply chain skills Experience in a leadership/managerial role in quality assurance/supply chain People management experience Strong project management and problem-solving skill Lead and solve complex organizational problems Extensive influencing and collaboration skills Expertise on leading / driving change, and mentor for new leaders or peers Six Sigma or Lean Certification preferred Master's Degree preferred

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges At Honeywell, we look for people driven by a desire to contribute, be challenged and grow. Our people make Honeywell a special company and are a key competitive advantage. Honeywell International is a $37 billion diversified technology and manufacturing global leader. Honeywell has more than 113,000 employees in 120 countries around the world and has a demonstrated heritage of innovation and achievement. In the Corporate Integrated Supply Chain function, we are looking for an ambitious and driven Inventory Optimization Planning Leader. This role will report to the HON ISC VP of Planning & Inventory as part of the Corporate Planning Center of Excellence with broad opportunity to develop and demonstrate your planning knowledge & leadership skills, playing an instrumental role in the success of the company. As the Senior Director of Supply Planning, you will have ownership of the Material Master Supply Planning strategy and execution across the entire Honeywell ecosystem, with extra focus on the Finished Goods network and reducing inventory. You will be responsible for driving the vision, goals, & results for Supply Planning and indirectly manage the people and processes to achieve those goals and objectives. You will partner with the SBG COE and SMEs to deploy the Honeywell Global Design Model (GDM) along with the RapidResponse advanced planning tool across the globe for Master Data Accuracy, 12 Block MDM Strategy, MRP Audit & Adherence, & driving initiatives to minimize the physical and digital planned lead time and volatility (MOQ’s, Order Frequency, etc.) to ultimately improve flexibility, reduce inventory, and improve OTTR. In addition, you will have direct leadership over On Time to First Promise, our most critical customer delivery metric. This requires you to lead business transformation across the planning process, influencing Commercial teams, Customer Excellence, Demand Planning, Inventory Planning, Production Planning, Materials Planning, Procurement & Logistics to drive change management to sustain the GDM process and expected results. You will oversee the monthly Supply Planning MOS, this includes process discipline and rigor, and consistent reviews of all planning metrics and KPIs while ensuring planner knowledge and skills continue to grow and improve. This role will be critical in the technology deployment and adoption of our Advanced Planning System and its integration with our global Supplier Collaboration Portal beginning deployment in 2022. You will create and drive a positive working environment and culture of continuous improvement throughout your organization to achieve the best possible outcome from your resources. You will lead the development of your teams to increase their skills and capability in readiness for internal progression and succession. The successful candidate must be capable of translating objectives into a deliverable strategy to achieve business goals and create a competitive advantage of the product portfolio. Focusing on building a world-class team, utilizing and deploying Lean Six Sigma techniques, driving continuous improvement activities, and achievement of superior performance across all KPIs (Key Performance Initiatives). Key Responsibilities Defining the Vision & Driving Strategy for Network Supply Planning and execution, specifically focused on Master Data adherence to Plan for Every Part & the harmonization across multi-nodal networks Build and deploy the Global Design Model for our On Time to First Promise metric, including all master data & processes that create First Promise Driving Transformation initiative and deployment of the Honeywell GDM and RR adoption Build and deploy automated reporting and action-oriented alerts to facilitate planners’ daily work (Order Management, Rebalance Alerts, Lead Time Accuracy, etc.) Driving and establishing a culture of continuous improvement and process excellence Build a network of highly skilled and talented professionals for progression within Honeywell Setting Policies around Service Level Strategies with the Business, gaining commercial and financial alignment, including integration within the Free Cash Flow financial plans Actively manage relationships with regional distributions center & planning team Monitor supply and demand imbalances and communication/escalate Close involvement with Prod Marketing for NPI/EOL/Promotion/Projects/PLC Detailed involvement in transition execution, PFEP, & SKU Rationalization YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in a related operations management or supply chain management or equivalent Min 10+ years of experience in Supply, Production Planning, Materials Management, or other Sales Inventory & Operations Planning related functional area Deep expertise with SAP ERP/MRP systems and Material Master Data that control MRP Planning results S&OP Knowledge Excellent interpersonal skills with strong verbal & written communication skills. Six Sigma Green Belt WE VALUE APICS, CPIM, CPSM, or CPF certification preferred Proficient in Microsoft applications Excellent interpersonal skills with strong verbal & written communication skills Strong organizational skills and ability to efficiently multi-task, prioritize, and delegate Ability to collaborate with both internal and external customers Additional Information JOB ID: req381094 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The Future Is What We Make It. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Reporting to the Vice President, Defense Americas, Defense & Space, the incumbent will be responsible for business unit leadership across a variety of product, process and systems development programs. This position is responsible for a $650M+ business, consisting of all U.S. Army DOD and select OEMs. Key customers include AMCOM, TACOM, CECOM, SOCOM, Defense Logistics Agency, PEO Aviation, PEO Ground Combat Systems, General Dynamics Land Systems. This position is responsible for all financial, organizational, personnel, portfolio growth and strategic planning objectives to achieve annual operating plan for Americas defense aftermarket business. Ideal candidate will have relevant and current experience in the Aerospace defense industry leading sales, business development and program management at a senior level for a broad array of products across air, ground, cyber and maritime domains. The successful leader must be able to drive financial results to achieve or exceed revenue and contribution margins. Location: preferably either Huntsville, AL or Detroit, MI. Acceptable: Phoenix, AZ or Washington DC Key Attributes Intimately familiar with the US Army customer. Familiar with major commands like AMCOM, TACOM etc. Prefer former Acquisition Corps officer and or Sustainment officer who served in AMCOM, TACOM, CECOM or SOCOM. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges At Honeywell, we look for people driven by a desire to contribute, be challenged and grow. Our people make Honeywell a special company and are a key competitive advantage. Honeywell International is a $37 billion diversified technology and manufacturing global leader. Honeywell has more than 113,000 employees in 120 countries around the world and has a demonstrated heritage of innovation and achievement. In the Corporate Integrated Supply Chain function, we are looking for an ambitious and driven Inventory Optimization Planning Leader. This role will report to the HON ISC VP of Planning & Inventory as part of the Corporate Planning Center of Excellence with broad opportunity to develop and demonstrate your planning knowledge & leadership skills, playing an instrumental role in the success of the company. As the Senior Director of Supply Planning, you will have ownership of the Material Master Supply Planning strategy and execution across the entire Honeywell ecosystem, with extra focus on the Finished Goods network and reducing inventory. You will be responsible for driving the vision, goals, & results for Supply Planning and indirectly manage the people and processes to achieve those goals and objectives. You will partner with the SBG COE and SMEs to deploy the Honeywell Global Design Model (GDM) along with the RapidResponse advanced planning tool across the globe for Master Data Accuracy, 12 Block MDM Strategy, MRP Audit & Adherence, & driving initiatives to minimize the physical and digital planned lead time and volatility (MOQ’s, Order Frequency, etc.) to ultimately improve flexibility, reduce inventory, and improve OTTR. In addition, you will have direct leadership over On Time to First Promise, our most critical customer delivery metric. This requires you to lead business transformation across the planning process, influencing Commercial teams, Customer Excellence, Demand Planning, Inventory Planning, Production Planning, Materials Planning, Procurement & Logistics to drive change management to sustain the GDM process and expected results. You will oversee the monthly Supply Planning MOS, this includes process discipline and rigor, and consistent reviews of all planning metrics and KPIs while ensuring planner knowledge and skills continue to grow and improve. This role will be critical in the technology deployment and adoption of our Advanced Planning System and its integration with our global Supplier Collaboration Portal beginning deployment in 2022. You will create and drive a positive working environment and culture of continuous improvement throughout your organization to achieve the best possible outcome from your resources. You will lead the development of your teams to increase their skills and capability in readiness for internal progression and succession. The successful candidate must be capable of translating objectives into a deliverable strategy to achieve business goals and create a competitive advantage of the product portfolio. Focusing on building a world-class team, utilizing and deploying Lean Six Sigma techniques, driving continuous improvement activities, and achievement of superior performance across all KPIs (Key Performance Initiatives). Key Responsibilities Defining the Vision & Driving Strategy for Network Supply Planning and execution, specifically focused on Master Data adherence to Plan for Every Part & the harmonization across multi-nodal networks Build and deploy the Global Design Model for our On Time to First Promise metric, including all master data & processes that create First Promise Driving Transformation initiative and deployment of the Honeywell GDM and RR adoption Build and deploy automated reporting and action-oriented alerts to facilitate planners’ daily work (Order Management, Rebalance Alerts, Lead Time Accuracy, etc.) Driving and establishing a culture of continuous improvement and process excellence Build a network of highly skilled and talented professionals for progression within Honeywell Setting Policies around Service Level Strategies with the Business, gaining commercial and financial alignment, including integration within the Free Cash Flow financial plans Actively manage relationships with regional distributions center & planning team Monitor supply and demand imbalances and communication/escalate Close involvement with Prod Marketing for NPI/EOL/Promotion/Projects/PLC Detailed involvement in transition execution, PFEP, & SKU Rationalization YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in a related operations management or supply chain management or equivalent Min 10+ years of experience in Supply, Production Planning, Materials Management, or other Sales Inventory & Operations Planning related functional area Deep expertise with SAP ERP/MRP systems and Material Master Data that control MRP Planning results S&OP Knowledge Excellent interpersonal skills with strong verbal & written communication skills Six Sigma Green Belt WE VALUE APICS, CPIM, CPSM, or CPF certification preferred Proficient in Microsoft applications Excellent interpersonal skills with strong verbal & written communication skills Strong organizational skills and ability to efficiently multi-task, prioritize, and delegate Ability to collaborate with both internal and external customers Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182890 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges At Honeywell, we look for people driven by a desire to contribute, be challenged and grow. Our people make Honeywell a special company and are a key competitive advantage. Honeywell International is a $37 billion diversified technology and manufacturing global leader. Honeywell has more than 113,000 employees in 120 countries around the world and has a demonstrated heritage of innovation and achievement. In the Corporate Integrated Supply Chain function, we are looking for an ambitious and driven Inventory Optimization Planning Leader. This role will report to the HON ISC VP of Planning & Inventory as part of the Corporate Planning Center of Excellence with broad opportunity to develop and demonstrate your planning knowledge & leadership skills, playing an instrumental role in the success of the company. As the Senior Director of Supply Planning, you will have ownership of the Material Master Supply Planning strategy and execution across the entire Honeywell ecosystem, with extra focus on the Finished Goods network and reducing inventory. You will be responsible for driving the vision, goals, & results for Supply Planning and indirectly manage the people and processes to achieve those goals and objectives. You will partner with the SBG COE and SMEs to deploy the Honeywell Global Design Model (GDM) along with the RapidResponse advanced planning tool across the globe for Master Data Accuracy, 12 Block MDM Strategy, MRP Audit & Adherence, & driving initiatives to minimize the physical and digital planned lead time and volatility (MOQ’s, Order Frequency, etc.) to ultimately improve flexibility, reduce inventory, and improve OTTR. In addition, you will have direct leadership over On Time to First Promise, our most critical customer delivery metric. This requires you to lead business transformation across the planning process, influencing Commercial teams, Customer Excellence, Demand Planning, Inventory Planning, Production Planning, Materials Planning, Procurement & Logistics to drive change management to sustain the GDM process and expected results. You will oversee the monthly Supply Planning MOS, this includes process discipline and rigor, and consistent reviews of all planning metrics and KPIs while ensuring planner knowledge and skills continue to grow and improve. This role will be critical in the technology deployment and adoption of our Advanced Planning System and its integration with our global Supplier Collaboration Portal beginning deployment in 2022. You will create and drive a positive working environment and culture of continuous improvement throughout your organization to achieve the best possible outcome from your resources. You will lead the development of your teams to increase their skills and capability in readiness for internal progression and succession. The successful candidate must be capable of translating objectives into a deliverable strategy to achieve business goals and create a competitive advantage of the product portfolio. Focusing on building a world-class team, utilizing and deploying Lean Six Sigma techniques, driving continuous improvement activities, and achievement of superior performance across all KPIs (Key Performance Initiatives). and deployment of the Honeywell GDM and RR adoption Build and deploy automated reporting and action-oriented alerts to facilitate planners’ daily work (Order Management, Rebalance Alerts, Lead Time Accuracy, etc.) Driving and establishing a culture of continuous improvement and process excellence Build a network of highly skilled and talented professionals for progression within Honeywell Summary of Duties: Provides engineering support of highly technical and advanced manufacturing processes typically requiring specialized qualifications, knowledge and/or skill Applies (CSmathematical, physical science, and advanced engineering technologies in accomplishing engineering objectives Exercises considerable latitude in determining technical objectives of assignments Recognized authority within area of embedded systems with a wide versatility of experience and capability Conducts research and development experiments to resolve complex engineering and quality problems involving highly technical, scientific methods Writes technical reports on results and conclusions drawn from experiments and incorporates findings in formal specifications Translates design concepts into production items by coordinating the activities of engineering, quality, manufacturing, and related organization Estimates set-up times, flowtimes, costs of production and acceptance equipment, and recommendations for management review Participates in establishing operating procedures on new products and components Defines and recommends new designs, design changes, and alternate designs of product, instruments, and test equipment Plans and performs engineering testing and uses advanced statistical and scientific methods to address and resolve critical engineering and production problems to assure product manufacturability Originates, refines, and releases complex manufacturing, testing, and inspection work directions. Determines acceptability of product and processes in conjunction with customers, design agency, and other affected organizations Interacts with customers, design agency, and/or supplier counterparts to resolve moderate to complex design, development, production, and acceptance issues Evaluates and implements technological advances that improve quality, reduce flowtime, improve productivity, and enhance operational surety You Must Have: Bachelor of Science Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science or equivalent 4-year engineering degree from an ABET accredited program/institution Six or more years of experience in engineering or related technical activities US Citizenship needed to obtain and maintain required US Dept of Energy ""Q"" level security clearance and SCI access We Value: Experience in Engineering or related technical activities, such as manufacturing, inspection processing or tool design, to include experience with microcontrollers and design of embedded digital electronics Background with data processing software programming languages including Python, C, and Assembly. Training/experience with Excel, MATLAB, .NET, C++, and C#. Current DOE ""Q"" or DOD TS clearance Maturity in analog and/or digital circuit design and reverse engineering methods. Practice with Linux operating systems Skills in analyzing product with IDA Pro and/ Ghidra Experience developing software test plans and procedures for product qualification Experience in testing, data acquisition, and data analytics Understanding of algorithmic conceptualization and implementation Competence with any PCB design studio (ORCAD, Mentor, Altium) and simulation software (P-Spice, LTSpice, Ansoft etc. Capability with engineering tools such as multimeters, oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, etc. Proficiency with field programmable gate array (FPGA) design, programming, and troubleshooting Familiarity with digital signal processing Outstanding interpersonal verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to communicate ideas to other team members and customer representatives of various technical backgrounds Ability to work well in an inclusive, diverse organization, partnering with a variety of internal and external customers Proactive and dedicated, able to prioritize multiple tasks and changing priorities

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs The future is what you make it! When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our team of problem solvers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell’s Federal Manufacturing & Technologies business manages the U. S. Department of Energy’s Kansas City National Security Campus in Missouri and New Mexico, manufacturing sophisticated mechanical, electronic and engineered-material components for our nation's defense system. Honeywell is on the leading edge of supplying engineering and manufacturing expertise for our nation's defense and national security. Visit kcnsc.doe.gov for more information about working for Honeywell at the Kansas City National Security Campus. ***This position will be located in Kansas City, MO*** Summary The selected candidate will join our Data Integrations team of Data Architects and ETL Developers within the IT division at the Kansas City National Security Campus. The team is responsible for working with internal business customers to identify business requirements and supporting/developing on our ETL, Data Virtualization, and Data Warehouse environments. Job Duties Design, translate business requirements, develop, document, test, optimize, monitor, troubleshoot and administrate our data environment using our ETL tools / data platforms Lead maintenance and upgrade efforts for our data platforms and tools Contribute to the support and resolution of incidents which involve all data platforms which includes a weekly on-call rotation Maintain knowledge of new technologies and methods for area of expertise and have knowledge sharing sessions with the team Communicate and accurately document all architectural decisions, plans, goals, functional requirements, and open items and issues to key stakeholders, including management, development teams, and business areas Build and maintain strong peer relationships within the team and across the organization Participates in short- and long-term planning sessions with customers to improve business processes and works closely with Technical Review Board and architects to assure all systems are in line with IT long-term strategy Proactively analyzes existing data platforms to identify weaknesses, develop opportunities for improvements, and may lead the evaluation and selection process for new data platforms Helps manage customer's priorities of projects and requests You Must Have U.S. Citizen in order to obtain and maintain US Dept. of Energy “Q” level security clearance Bachelor's degree Minimum 5 years of experience developing with ETL tools (for example Talend, Informatica, SSIS, Qlik Data Integration Platform) Minimum 5 years of SQL experience with the ability to develop, modify, optimize, and troubleshoot complex queries Minimum 2 years of experience with multi-dimensional data modeling for a data warehouse and data marts We Value Experience or knowledge of a scripting language (e.g. Linux shell, Windows batch, Perl, VBS) Experience working in a Red Hat Enterprise Linux and/or Windows environment Java experience FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req363755 Category: Information Technology Location: 9221 Ward Parkway,Kansas City,Missouri,64114,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe, and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Overview Honeywell International Inc. is seeking candidates for an opportunity as a Senior Export Compliance Officer, who will report directly to a Director on the corporate Export Compliance Leadership Team. The Senior Export Compliance Officer will be responsible for a range of export compliance responsibilities related to: supporting external export compliance audits, obtaining U.S. export authorizations (both Department of Commerce and Department of State) for hardware, software, technology, and services; providing guidance to Honeywell personnel in business and functional roles on complying with U.S. export laws and regulations; and enhancing the function’s overall export compliance program. Specific areas of focus include: Supporting external export compliance audits by responding to requests for information submitting information to the auditors driving corrective actions Supporting business goals and objectives through timely drafting, submitting and obtaining all necessary export licenses, permits, certifications, and technology release determinations Ensuring that all limitations to export approvals are communicated to and understood by business partners Providing export advice to Honeywell’s business teams – both strategic and tactical Developing, reviewing, updating, and implementing comprehensive export compliance procedures and forms to drive the Company’s overall compliance with export laws and regulations Working with the functions and businesses to ensure export compliance requirements are published in and adopted by business and/or functional processes Communicating procedural changes via email, through training, and other communication vehicles Supporting the Export Compliance investigations team in investigating and resolving compliance problems, questions, or complaints Performing or supporting export related audits including facilitation of data gathering requests Key Responsibilities Support audits Draft and obtain export authorizations Conduct post-approval reviews for export authorizations Develop, edit, communicate procedures and related forms Assist with training and training development Provide guidance on export regulations Maintain record keeping Compliance resolution Communicate clearly with business and functional personnel on export-related matters YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree or a minimum of one year export compliance experience 2 years of experience working for a multinational company or a U.S. defense contractor Basic knowledge of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and/or Export Administration Regulations (EAR) U.S. Person status as defined by the ITAR WE VALUE One (1) year of export compliance experience Experience with audits Strong writing skills Experience in drafting procedures, forms, reports, contracts, agreements, licenses, or presentations Proactive, well-organized, highly motivated Ability to work independently once tasks are assigned Aptitude for compliance Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills a plus Experience working in a compliance-related role, especially one involving export compliance Detailed knowledge of the export regulations (ITAR and EAR), is plus Experience with MS Office Experience with SAP / GTS or other ERP systems and related export compliance modules Experience with developing or using digital tools Master’s degree or juris doctorate a plus Additional Information JOB ID: HRD184031 Category: Legal Location: 21111 N. 19th Ave (Deer Valley),Phoenix,Arizona,85027,United States Exempt Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. The Senior Export Compliance Officer will be responsible for a range of export compliance responsibilities related to: supporting external export compliance audits, obtaining U.S. export authorizations (both Department of Commerce and Department of State) for hardware, software, technology, and services; providing guidance to Honeywell personnel in business and functional roles on complying with U.S. export laws and regulations; and enhancing the function’s overall export compliance program. Specific areas of focus include: Supporting external export compliance audits by responding to requests for information submitting information to the auditors driving corrective actions Supporting business goals and objectives through timely drafting, submitting and obtaining all necessary export licenses, permits, certifications, and technology release determinations Ensuring that all limitations to export approvals are communicated to and understood by business partners Providing export advice to Honeywell’s business teams – both strategic and tactical Developing, reviewing, updating, and implementing comprehensive export compliance procedures and forms to drive the Company’s overall compliance with export laws and regulations Working with the functions and businesses to ensure export compliance requirements are published in and adopted by business and/or functional processes Communicating procedural changes via email, through training, and other communication vehicles Supporting the Export Compliance investigations team in investigating and resolving compliance problems, questions, or complaints Performing or supporting export related audits including facilitation of data gathering requests Key Responsibilities Support audits Draft and obtain export authorizations Conduct post-approval reviews for export authorizations Develop, edit, communicate procedures and related forms Assist with training and training development Provide guidance on export regulations Maintain record keeping Compliance resolution Communicate clearly with business and functional personnel on export-related matters YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree or a minimum of one year export compliance experience 2 years of experience working for a multinational company or a U.S. defense contractor Basic knowledge of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) and/or Export Administration Regulations (EAR) U.S. Person status as defined by the ITAR WE VALUE One (1) year of export compliance experience Experience with audits Strong writing skills Experience in drafting procedures, forms, reports, contracts, agreements, licenses, or presentations Proactive, well-organized, highly motivated Ability to work independently once tasks are assigned Aptitude for compliance Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills a plus Experience working in a compliance-related role, especially one involving export compliance Detailed knowledge of the export regulations (ITAR and EAR), is plus Experience with MS Office Experience with SAP / GTS or other ERP systems and related export compliance modules Experience with developing or using digital tools Master’s degree or juris doctorate a plus Additional Information JOB ID: HRD184031 Category: Legal Location: 21111 N. 19th Ave (Deer Valley),Phoenix,Arizona,85027,United States Exempt Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. Honeywell Process Solutions is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. A leader in digitization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. This position is responsible for selling the full suite of Honeywell offerings into the assigned territory. If you are experienced selling a broad range of solutions including Automation, Operations Optimization Software Solutions, Instrumentation and ongoing Service and Support, we would like to speak with you! Key Responsibilities Develop and demonstrate strong understanding of the customer’s business. Identify where Honeywell can add value through technology and solutions. Penetrate new market or accounts, identify and develop relationships with the key decision makers, uncover new business opportunities, recommend differentiated solutions, negotiate, and win the business. Identify opportunities for replacing competitive solutions with Honeywell solutions, qualify the opportunities, progress and close. Effectively leverage and marshal internal Honeywell resources to maximize win rate. Represent Honeywell with our customers in a cheerful, responsive, professional, proactive, and ethical manner that reflects well on our company and core values. Engage at multiple levels in target customers Coordinate customer facing and internal efforts to produce winning value propositions and proposals that win orders and achieve or exceed Target. Leverage best in class sales methodology for maximizing sales potential. Follow the details of the Sales Operating System (SOS) with an emphasis on disciplined usage of our CRM, Siebel, and accurate weekly forecasting, monthly pipeline reviews and quarterly walk to plan. Ability to travel 25-30% YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's/Technical Degree or 10+ years of Sales experience 5+ years experience selling Automation Technology and/or Software WE VALUE Preferred Degree in: Engineering, Automation, Technology or Business (or equivalent knowledge / experience in these fields) Demonstrate a track record of taking a new account, breaking in at upper level management levels, and creating a pipeline of opportunities that turn in to orders. Candidate has a very good understanding of the industry value chain and understands well the client requirements. This results into the ability to present clearly our value proposition and our specific solution portfolio. In order to present to our client base the ability to communicate with various levels in the customers’ organization including executive management, manufacturing leaders, QA and regulatory compliance staff as well as automation technology management. Demonstrated knowledge of business impact of process control and automation, specifically in the area of continuous and batch operations Thorough knowledge of market penetration strategies and market development strategies Ability to develop and implement an effective communication plan for internal and external customers Proven effectiveness in a highly matrixed environment Strong commercial acumen, results driven Provides market feedback to product development making our portfolio stronger Experience planning, developing and executing sales campaigns or programs in specific markets or for specific products Excellent communication skills and relationship building skills, at all levels of the organization Track record of developing, executing and achieving tactical and strategic initiatives through active leadership that positively impact global business plans, operating profits, practices, policies and procedures. Proven ability to meet or exceed quota in a complex sales environment. Polished professional with excellent organizational, communication negotiations, and interpersonal skills. Familiarity with Honeywell portfolio and service solutions a plus Formal sales training and experience working with one or more complex sales methodologies Proven leadership skills Additional Information JOB ID: req374150 Category: Sales Location: Building No. 5, Hillsdale Business Park, 6826 and 6828A,Hillsdale Court,Indianapolis,Indiana,46250,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer.
