jobTitle: Sr. Finance Director, Working Capital and Cash
jobDescription: Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Working Capital Finance Leader supports the $11B PMT P&L and will be responsible for leading efforts to maximize Working Capital efficiency across Performance Materials and Technologies (PMT). These responsibilities include but are not limited to development of monthly and quarterly financial forecasts, variance analysis, process improvement, creation of standard work, and best practice sharing. In addition, this position will play a critical role in the day-to-day execution of the Management Operating System (MOS) and provide the PMT leadership team with meaningful performance analysis, insights, and recommendations. This position will report directly to the VP & CFO of PMT and will be based out of the Houston, TX with frequent exposure to the Performance Materials and Technologies (PMT) leadership team. Key Responsibilities Business Group Global Working Capital leadership, capital efficiency strategies and influence and oversight - driving improvement initiatives and robust analysis in Customer to Cash Cycles (Account Receivables), Past Dues, Inventory, Unbilled, Payables, and Advances. Cross-functional coordination and project management that includes developing both long-term and daily execution timelines, driving outstanding actions / deliverables and managing effective communication and executive influence on business group leadership. Enhance cash flow forecasting process and reporting mechanisms to improve accuracy. Lead cash digitization efforts and implementing supporting tools to drive accountability. Lead efforts to identify, quantify and validate opportunities to improve business group level working capital processes and results. Develop and innovate sustainable solutions and action plans to ensure realization of identified working capital opportunities. Conceptualize and deploy value-added reporting and metrics for all components of Working Capital. Driving sustained and continuous improvement in business unit Working Capital Turns metric. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree in Business / Finance. 10+ years of finance/business experience. Minimum of 5 years’ experience managing a team WE VALUE Solution-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving and skills Passion for excellence and drive to meet commitments/deadlines Strong understanding of Supply Chain, Accounts Receivable, and Accounts Payable “Hands on” working knowledge of data analytics using business warehouse, Excel, etc Executive communication and cross organizational influencing skills useful in transformational initiatives Prior Lean Six Sigma experience and a continuous improvement mindset Demonstrated track record of successful project management execution Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal) Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181656 Category: Finance Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity THE BUSINESS Honeywell (www.honeywell.com) is a Fortune 100 technology company that delivers industry-specific solutions that include aerospace products and services; control technologies for buildings and industry; and performance materials globally. Our technologies help aircraft, buildings, manufacturing plants, supply chains, and workers become more connected to make our world smarter, safer, and more sustainable. Buildings affect people every moment of every day. And at Honeywell Building Technologies (HBT), we’re transforming the way every building operates, because better buildings make our lives better. Over 23,000 HBT global employees support buildings of every type, from commercial offices, stores and schools to hospitals, airports, and arenas. Our diverse technologies and brands enable us to create holistic solutions, improving virtually every aspect of your building’s environment and experience. We believe buildings should be efficient and sustainable — and that building data can guide business decisions. Honeywell Building Management Systems (BMS) is a part of Honeywell Building Technologies (HBT) and is a global business with more than 3,000 employees worldwide. Commercial building owners and occupants use HBT's technologies to ensure their facilities are safe, energy-efficient, sustainable, and productive. THE POSITION Honeywell has an exciting opening for a Senior Human Resources Manager supporting our Building Management Systems (BMS) North America organization based in Atlanta, GA. Reporting to the Sr. Director Human Resources – BMS, you will have an outstanding chance to join a team of highly engaged professionals and have responsibility to drive talent and business transformation. This role will partner with the BMS North America Leadership team to support the objectives of the business and drive HR initiatives. Key Responsibilities Establish HR Strategies to meet objectives of the business. Drive and improve HR processes across all client groups. Own, monitor and improve HR Metrics and KPI’s Drive a culture of performance, results, and positive employee relations. Coach leaders on talent management, and performance differentiation. Partner with the HR COE leaders to execute staffing processes, develop staffing strategies to ensure a robust pipeline of quality candidates, and drive talent management programs. Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree 5+ years progressive Human Resource Generalist experience 2+ HR business partner skills in a large matrix organization Preferred Master's degree or MBA in Human Resources Strong data analytical skills and solid experience working with Microsoft Excel (generating and interpreting pivot tables, graphs and V-lookups) Demonstration of ability to positively influence others, particularly leadership development and coaching. Strong business sense and acumen. Ability to deal tactfully and confidently with internal and external customers. Strong bias for action, a keen sense of urgency and the ability to drive impactful results in a highly matrixed organization. Strong written/verbal communication skills. Solid knowledge of employment laws and regulations. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD183354 Category: Human Resources Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Exempt Human Resources (CORPORATE HR) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Leads the Site HSE Program for the Honeywell. Provides leadership and technical support to drive continual improvement of all aspects of site HSE program and performance. Key Responsibilities Identifies areas for improvement, defines effective strategies for change, and drives actions to performance-based closure. May be responsible to create processes and plans with little oversight. Develops and implements site-level HSE programs, procedures, and training to ensure beyond-compliance performance with all regulatory and Honeywell HSE requirements. Develop an HSE improvement strategy/goals including capital projects, waste reduction, HSE management system implementation, and other continuous improvement projects. Interfaces directly with outside government agencies and other external stakeholders. Implements and maintains an HSE Management System which is driving toward third-party OSHA VPP certification and is integrated into daily operations. Drives continual injury and incident reduction by establishing proactive HSE programs (utilizing six-sigma tools, behavior-based methods, etc.). Direct the risk-based evaluation of occupational exposures, define appropriate monitoring strategies, and maintain effective controls. Works collaboratively with the site Occupational Health Nurse on worker's compensation issues and workplace ergonomics. Maintains robust management-of-change processes and effectively anticipates future HSE trends & requirements. Interpret new and existing regulations, develop plans and drive actions to ensure compliance with regulatory (Federal, State, County, Local) and Honeywell requirements. This includes EPA, OSHA, etc. Monitor plant operations to ensure the capture of relevant data for monthly, quarterly, semi-annual and annual reports as required by site permits for water, solid waste, etc. Develop an environmental improvement strategy including capital projects, waste reduction, HSE management system implementation, and other continuous improvement projects. Investigate any unsafe behaviors/ conditions. Utilize best practices and innovative processes with short completion times. Plays a key role in assuring function is accurately included in contingency plans for local HSE issues. Functional lead to recommend strategy on compliance issues or assure timely analysis of HSE issues. Identify cost-saving initiatives/ processes with regard to health, safety, environmental, and/or facility focus. Determines sequence and timing of multiple executions of tasks with mutual dependencies. Have an advanced level of verbal and written communication skills, conflict resolution abilities, and group facilitation skills. You, as a leader, will be accountable for documenting, distributing, and following-up on project information to senior leadership (Directors, Site Leadership Team, and corporate officers). Defines HSE vision in terms of strategic initiatives and outcomes. Translates strategy into functional or process goals. Broad understanding of the business and how functional areas affect the achievement of business goals. Leads/ influences the Business Continuity Planning for HSEF and the site. Ability to work in an ever-changing environment and drive to continuously improve work practices aligned with HOS maturity. Prioritizes work activities and secures resources to meet goals. Interacts with facility workforce to execute HSE programs. HSE site lead is accountable for assuring programs are in place providing timely and accurate communication to key stakeholders on HSE issues. Directs/ allocation of resources to create workable plans in support of strategic directions and initiatives. Responsible to develop and maintain the HSE Budget for the site. Management of up to 10 direct reports. Other responsibilities include planning, auditing, emergency preparedness, loss prevention, and HSE information systems. Reports to SBU HSE Director YOU MUST HAVE Degree in HSE-related technical discipline 5-10 years of progressive HSE experience (industrial / site-level) Certifications: CSP, CIH, CHMM, etc. (preferred / not required) Broad OSHA & EPA regulatory knowledge and experience Strong HSE Management Systems experience and skills Strong bias for excellence, execution, and closure Strong communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work well with all organizational levels Ability to work effectively within a matrix organization Ability to influence and drive positive culture change Additional Information JOB ID: HRD179588 Category: Health, Safety & Environment Location: 2525 W 190th St.,Torrance,California,90504-6099,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. The future is what you make it! When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell Corporate is looking for a Senior Manager, Technical Accounting in Charlotte NC. In this role, you will leverage your in-depth accounting knowledge and research capabilities to provide solutions to complex and challenging business problems. This person will report to the Director of Accounting Policy and Internal Controls, lead a team of 4 individuals, and partner with the Senior Manager of Internal Controls. In addition, this individual will collaborate with team members across business functions to solve our most complex accounting issues and lead controllership’s role in key finance strategic objectives. The ideal candidate possesses the ability to lead teams, anticipate the needs of our customers, communicate effectively (including senior leadership and those with non-accounting backgrounds), and think holistically about the impact of accounting issues to our operations. Key Responsibilities: Technical Accounting (90% of responsibilities): Perform accounting research to assess the impact of proposed transactions, providing guidance to our business partners and senior leadership to impact decision making. Periodically review and update accounting and reporting policies, proactively monitoring proposed and enacted updates from the FASB, SAB, and SEC. Lead global implementation efforts for accounting and reporting standards, drafting policies to reflect current guidance. Lead cross-strategic business group (SBG) and cross-functional discussions to socialize updates and changes to the accounting and reporting policies, partnering with SBGs to assess impact of proposals and support comment letter efforts. Assist Sr. Manager of Internal Controls with internal controls projects and programs, providing guidance and expertise to ensure continuous improvement of the internal control environment. Lead global Controllership Learning efforts to provide a high quality training program for the Finance organization, partnering with the business groups to develop relevant and tailored training materials. External Reporting (10% of responsibilities): Assess new accounting standards for their impact to financial statement disclosures and preparing the associated disclosures. Lead external benchmarking projects to assess comparability of HON’s SEC filings with its peers, particularly in support of new business transactions, changes in guidance, and new accounting standards. Independently complete areas of the Form 10-Q and 10-K filings, as assigned. Review data submitted for reasonableness, assessing for consistency and reliability and leading follow-up discussions as needed. YOU MUST HAVE: Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or Finance. CPA Minimum 7 years total working in a large enterprise environment. Experience in a top 10 public accounting firm with service to mid or large cap public companies or technical accounting experience in the controllership function of a Fortune 1000 Company. WE VALUE: At least 2 years in a lead or managerial capacity Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to view complex/conflicting perspectives, identify issues and propose solutions/alternatives. Ability to manage multiple priorities and drive process improvement. Demonstrate key Honeywell behaviors: Have a Passion for Winning, Be Courageous, Act with Urgency, Be a Zealot for Growth, Think Big…Then Make It Happen, Be Committed, Build Exceptional Talent, Become your Best

The Successful Candidate Will Be Responsible For Develop, configure and optimize manufacturing and industrial processes from inception through to start up and certification by studying product requirements. Improve manufacturing efficiency by analyzing and deploying process flow, space requirements, equipment and work cell layouts. Provide training and guidelines to factory teams coupled with process documentation and operating instructions. Assess and established equipment critical spare parts and preventative maintenance schedules. Collect process, quality and yield/Cpk data across factory and analyze the data to drive improvements. Persuade colleagues at all levels to embrace and support the implementation of process modifications and new manufacturing approaches you devise. Be familiar with the work processes, safety/HSE and quality policy and apply as appropriate to each project. Lead Manufacturing Readiness assessments and conduct Trial Runs to ensure flawless introduction of improved and new processes into the factory. Writing and optimizing standard operating instructions for manufacturing and testing Must Have Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical, Manufacturing, Electrical, Industrial Engineering Minimum 3 years’ experience in Manufacturing Engineer We Value Six Sigma Green Belt certification (Black Belt preferred) Strong Statistical Analysis Capability Knowledge in Automation (experience deploying Automation preferred) Proven history in improving manufacturing process efficiency Must be comfortable with integrating new technology into an existing business environment Excellent computer skills; Process simulation and manufacturing layout software, Excel, MS Project, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, MiniTab, CAD and SAP. Strong program management skills with solid ability to influence others and drive improvements in a high paced environment. Experience with electronics and/or cabinet assembly Experience with Experian and/or Safety Manager software Experience with Digital Control Systems (DCS) Travel ~10-25% HPS202020 Additional Information JOB ID: req383252 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 11201 Greens Crossing Blvd,Houston,Texas,77067,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Our mission is to attract, retain and develop diverse and highly motivated, entrepreneurial employees striving to flawlessly deliver superior value to our customers every day. If you are a self-led, energetic marketing professional, Honeywell currently has an exciting opportunity for you to develop and execute marketing campaigns as a Senior Marketing Specialist. As a Senior Marketing Specialist II at Honeywell, you will be a part of the Smart Energy global business which supports the growing demand for energy efficiency solutions. The Honeywell marketing team provides full-service marketing for our utility clients to deliver integrated, multichannel outreach campaigns. Our marketing team has designed and deployed hundreds of successful utility marketing campaigns and engaged millions of utility customers to learn about energy usage and participate in utility-sponsored programs. Our innovative approaches enable us to drive measurable, cost-effective results and deliver high customer satisfaction. We are looking for someone in this client-facing role with a broad range of experience to manage marketing, from strategy to execution, for our utility clients. This person will build yearly marketing plans, manage budgets, and execute on those plans in a collaborative and fast-paced environment. Be part of a team that is responsible for the coordination and completion of a variety of marketing projects. You will oversee all aspects of projects, set deadlines, assigns responsibilities, and monitor and summarize progress of project. You will utilize a high degree of creativity and latitude in this role. You will prepare reports for upper management regarding status of project and will lead and direct the work of others. Hybrid Schedule. Position is located at our Baltimore, Maryland office or Raleigh, North Carolina. Up to 10% travel. Key Responsibilities Managing integrated marketing campaigns, from concept to launch, including strategic development, creative briefs, creative development, and securing approvals; experience with email, digital, and direct mail. Analyzing campaign and customer data, as well as analytics to identify best prospects, marketing strategies, and tactics to inform future marketing plans. Developing and presenting marketing campaign results to the client during monthly, quarterly and annual reviews. Ability to work independently, proactively, and with ambiguity leading multiple projects and prioritizing marketing efforts while ensuring processes are followed and projects are completed on time and within budget. Managing multiple external vendors and holding them accountable for quality delivery (creative agencies, digital, website designers, printers, etc.). Approaching business challenges from a strategic perspective that includes thinking outside the box, problem-solving skills, resourcefulness and attention-to-detail. Effectively partnering and collaborating with internal teams to meet goals and client objectives in a matrix environment. Providing thought leadership and knowledge sharing to both internal teams and clients. Ability to provide direction and oversight on work deliverables, coaching and mentoring to junior level team members. Building and maintaining strong client relationships. High level for attention to detail and be able to identify process improvements. Complete projects Set deadlines Prepare status reports Coordinate project planning YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s degree Marketing or Communications Minimum 3 years of experience in marketing Minimum 3 years using MS Office including Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Outlook WE VALUE Excellent communication skills - writing and presentation skills Demonstrated financial acumen and ability to successfully manage budgets Experience in project management and executing marketing campaigns such as direct mail, email and online advertising 3+ years of project management in a fast-paced environment Advertising agency or client-facing experience Energy marketing experience Experience working in B2C and B2B channels Google Analytics experience Experience deploying campaigns through a marketing automation platform like Constant Contact, Eloqua, Adobe Campaign, Salesforce Marketing Cloud or Marketo Some experience with project management Both corporate and agency leadership experience a plus Familiar with the field's practices and procedures Excellent organizational and project planning skills Strong communication and presentation skills. Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** The Kansas City Plant is a U. S. Department of Energy, National Nuclear Security Administration facility managed and operated by Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T). Our primary business is to manufacture sophisticated mechanical, electronic and engineered-material components for our nation's defense system. Our goal is to seek innovative solutions that surpass our customers' expectations. To accomplish this, we research, develop and deploy some of the most advanced design and manufacturing technologies in use in the United States today. This position requires performing engineering functions on assigned projects or sub-projects by applying standard mathematical, physical science, and/or electrical/ chemical/ mechanical engineering technologies. In addition, the position may require solving challenging problems, managing complex projects, using schematics and product drawings to pinpoint problems, building strong customer relationships, utilizing six sigma or lean tools, and knowledge of low level and high-level software languages. Honeywell FM&T is on the leading edge of supplying engineering and manufacturing expertise for our nation's defense and national security. This highly visible role will provide you with an opportunity to showcase your technical background and experience. Summary Of Duties Completes assignments and provides detailed instructions in the design and/or project management of new and current projects, products, programs, components, tools and acceptance equipment under technical guidance of higher-level engineers or departmental management Participates in establishing operating procedures on new products and components Assists in the development of test procedures and performance of routine to moderately complex engineering evaluation tests, product, and process capability studies Willingness to travel on occasion YOU MUST HAVE US citizenship in order to obtain and maintain US Department of Energy ""Q"" level security clearance Bachelor of Science Degree in Mechanical Engineering or Chemical, Electrical, Industrial or Software Engineering from an ABET accredited institution, or BS Physics from an accredited institution 6 years of experience in engineering or technical activities WE VALUE Hands-on experience with 3D design software like Pro-E or SolidWorks Effective verbal, written and presentation skills Knowledge of continuous improvement methodologies including Six Sigma Previous experience in a manufacturing environment Experience in engineering related administrative activities such as configuration management, financial reporting, product testing procedures & data entry preferred Proven ability in decision making and organization, planning and problem-solving skills Ability to work under minimal supervision, with latitude for independent action and decision making Good people skills, ability to motivate teams to produce on-target and timely results Demonstrate project/program management via multiple priorities/projects Ability to plan and organize, demonstrate excellent time management, and support several projects at once FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req375248 Category: Engineering Location: 14520 Botts Road,Kansas City,Missouri,64147,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Sr. Cost Control Analyst will be responsible to provide cost analysis, process improvement, and metrics for UPT Equipment execution team. This role will partner with the Integrated program team to develop program plans, create cost baselines and monitoring/tracking system for large complex programs across multiple sites. This role will also recommend improvement actions for process and tool implementation and will interact with global program management Team, Business leaders and customers. Responsibilities (but Not Limited To) Provide support in project planning processes, define scopes, establishing Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) and budgets on allocated projects. Good analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to multi-task; cope with the demands of simultaneous activities. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Advanced Materials is a global supplier of fluorine products, fine chemicals, additives, metals, films and fibers for products including pharmaceuticals, refrigeration, semiconductors and military protection. Advanced Materials is making the world safer, cleaner and enabling the modernization of a growing middle class by enhancing our customer offerings through a differentiated portfolio of chemistries, materials, value-added solutions and superior customer service. Our mission is to attract, retain and develop diverse and highly motivated, entrepreneurial employees striving to flawlessly deliver superior value to our customers every day. Reporting to the Honeywell PMT Advanced Materials (AM) Pricing Director, the Sr. Pricing Manager will be part of the global AM Pricing Team, with special focus on one of the three AM Business Units. You will work closely with product management, finance, sales, marketing and the senior management team, to maximize the profitability of the assigned Business Unit by systematically employing key pricing levers (Value, Pass-through, Transactional) You will deliver financial impact by deploying best-in-class pricing tools and frameworks to help decision making You will provide direction and assistance to the assigned Business Unit regarding all the pricing related activities You will leverage business and pricing acumen to identify and execute pricing opportunities and to support world class pricing operations You will lead pricing strategy for a $500M+ P&L Key Responsibilities Partner with business leaders to drive strong financial results Identify pricing opportunities and provide pricing insights Upgrade and optimize pricing models, dashboards, databases and tools Manage pricing workstreams and projects Cascade and tailor corporate initiatives into the assigned Business Unit YOU MUST HAVE Graduate degree in Finance or Engineering, or Business from an accredited university of college. Post-Graduate preferred 5+ years of experience in Pricing Strategy, Execution or Analysis; Product Management; Finance or Marketing WE VALUE B2B environment experience with channel pricing (distributors vs end-customers) Global Project Experience Process industries experience with price strongly influenced by commodity-type direct materials Demonstrated results in large, international, complex, matrix organizations working with cross-functional teams in multiple sites/time zones Executive presence to engage with AM and the assigned Business Unit leadership Hands-on experience with ERPs (SAP, Business Objects, Business Intelligence), pricing tools (PROS, Vendavo) and other tools (Tableau, Salesforce) Medium understanding of financial analysis and business strategy Superior problem solving and analytical skills, with a results- and detail-oriented mindset Ability to manage and derive insights from large amounts of data, complemented with expert knowledge of MS-Excel and visualization techniques Excellent project management skills, balancing theoretical thought with practical execution Self-starter mentality with ability to manage and prioritize tasks with little guidance Ability to convey information with clarity and directness AM202020 Additional Information JOB ID: req379042 Category: Marketing Location: 115 Tabor Road,Morris Plains,New Jersey,07950,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. The Honeywell Senior Product Management Specialist responsible for developing and optimizing an offering portfolio strategy based on customer insights, competitive and market intelligence, and executing that strategy to optimize the offerings, market position, organic growth, and financial return of the product portfolio across the product lifecycle. Offering Managers work closely with cross-functional departments, such as engineering/R&D, manufacturing/sourcing or software development, internal sales and field sales, marketing, as well as Honeywell senior executives to maximize the growth, development and return on investment of the organization’s product portfolio today and in the future. The Senior Product Management Specialist is a senior professional role that supports the Business Line Offering Manager in successfully managing the Business Line’s offerings. They will actively manage a well-defined, highly complex offering or set of offerings within “Hand protection” portfolio. They should have intermediate skill levels across all of the below competencies and will be expected to perform primary responsibilities working across functions to deliver results. Primary Responsibilities Market Research & Competitive Landscape. Understand big-picture market drivers, challenges, competitors, and overall business environment. Identify critical gaps and execute primary/secondary research to address or leverage the Strategic Marketing Team to do so. Calculate the maximum potential market size (Total Addressable Market – TAM) with help of the Strategic Marketing Team, evaluate the solution for commercial viability, and calculate Share of Demand (SOD). Continually assess market traction and competitiveness to re-evaluate New Product Introductions (NPI), pricing, or end-of-life (EOL) actions. Voice of Customer & Segmentation. Able to conduct both VOC and Observational VOC (OVOC) by spending time with customers. Perform continuous discovery to identify and articulate the high value problems customers have, and the linkage of those problems to how customers make money. Connect key customer stakeholders and what our offerings do for them, and which needs drive purchase decisions. Evaluate sources of disruption and understand the customer decision journey and how to utilize key personas to transition to each step. Perform customer market segmentation analysis. Value Proposition & Competitive Positioning. Identify and state the target segment and problem to be solved in value propositions. Understand the value drivers and quantify them relative to the Next Best Alternative in value propositions. Perform competitive analysis of Honeywell products and services vs. the Next Best Alternatives. Work with Customer Marketing (CM) & Commercial Excellence Teams (CE) (i.e. Sales and Service) to communicate value propositions and their monetary values to the customer. New Offering Management. Translate customer and business needs into actionable product requirements. Provide customer marketing with appropriate information on offering, target segments and value propositions for effective sales collateral and campaigns. Ensure requirements of each participating function are accurately represented in the product plan and launch timeline. Business Models & Pricing. Define the appropriate value capture model (one-time sale, subscription, service, outcome-based, etc.) and pricing strategy based on appropriate value share relative to Next Best Alterative, and ensure implementation by the commercial excellence team. Develop financial models for new and current offering, quantifying and balancing expected revenue against investment and ongoing fixed and variable costs to estimate projected margin, operating income, revenue, and return on investment. Develop a negotiation walk to close a sale for/with sales. Utilize a management operating system (MOS) to track pricing – PVA (price-volume analysis), etc. Demonstrate variable margin understanding and the linkage pricing has to margin performance. Portfolio Lifecycle Management. Understand, articulate, and own the financial impact for portfolio decisions (both P&L & balance sheet) and ensure alignment with business strategy. Build and maintain a multi-year roadmap which includes a detailed 1-year plan and take action relative to changing market conditions, competitor actions, and new entrants. Effectively manage products across their lifecycle from demand planning of new offerings through SIOP on ongoing basis through including managing End of Life (EoL). Apply 80/20 analysis to portfolio to define offerings that should be sunset and appropriate pricing during sun setting and address sourcing factory utilization impacts. YOU MUST HAVE BS / BA degree preferably in Engineering Senior Professional with 3+ years of experience in product management, with a track record of demonstrated, recognizable results. WE VALUE Experience in Product Management, Marketing, Sales, R&D/Engineering, and Domain-specific, complemented by formal training. An MBA is not required but is highly preferred. Demonstrated Honeywell 9 Behaviors. Industry experience in a related field is a plus. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD184416 Category: Business Management Location: 855 S Mint St,Charlotte,North Carolina,28202,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Honeywell Forge is a family of SaaS Enterprise Performance Management (EPM) products built on the shared Honeywell Forge Cloud architecture to unite data from assets, people, and processes into truly Intelligent Operations that help customers make smarter, more accurate business decisions. These products tie disparate operational data silos into a single system of record for intelligent operations. Data is moved from edge to the cloud, where domain-specific AI/ML models provide insights, enable remote operations, and foster automation. Honeywell Forge spans asset, process, site, worker, and energy/emissions software categories to help businesses drive better decision-making, achieve operational targets, and meet regulations. As a Sr Product Management Verticals EPM Applications, you will develop and implement a Warehouse vertical application business strategy to grow the business at or greater than market rates by ensuring horizonal apps have the necessary domain functionality, commercial model, and a great user and customer experience. You will also lead and execute daily product and operations of your verticals, aligned to the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) goals and objectives. This will be done through collaboration with cross-functional teams. Key Responsibilities Manage and drive the Connected Warehouse Asset and Worker Performance Management product suite, designed to give Maintenance Managers and Operations Managers the tools they need to ensure their equipment is running optimally, avoiding predictive downtime, and streamline work orders to their technicians. Create a multi-modal SaaS application for maintenance managers across desktop, tablet and 10ft experience so they have the tools to view real time asset performance, analyze historical asset trends, and predict potential failures in the future. Own the strategic direction for the Connected Warehouse Asset Performance Management suite, including product market fit, pricing, and partnerships. Drive both execution and design teams to build the Connected Warehouse Asset Performance Management suite. Own the edge-to-cloud solution to ingest data on premise up to the cloud, including working with internal teams, vendors, and partner solutions Own the model/content roadmap for Connected Warehouse virtual models, including pricing, timelines, and market impact. Maintain responsibility for the overall success of the vertical applications! YOU MUST HAVE 6+ years’ experience with customer-facing products either B2B or B2C - working with both engineering and UX to design and build a product 4+ years of proven PM experience taking a cloud native SaaS product from cradle to grave (inception & strategy, execution, scale, sustaining) Experience working on IoT B2B or B2C solutions Domain knowledge of Warehouse/Distribution Center vertical Technical Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university; MBA preferred. WE VALUE Experience with the supply chain or distribution center domain, including physical equipment within the distribution center Solid experience in a related role in another enterprise software company or enterprise systems integration company Experience implementing and/or building complex processes, specifically in the software product development areas Strong acumen to build processes, and drive continuous improvement with agile methodology Proactive and logical at thoroughly evaluating issues Ability to quickly identify patterns among problems & issues, and influence stakeholders Comfortable messaging both up to leadership, down to execution and across the sister teams Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182813 Category: Business Management Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Exempt Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Honeywell Intelligrated is a leading, single-source provider of automated material handling solutions and intelligent software that drive fulfillment productivity for retailers, manufacturers and logistics providers around the world. Through a broad portfolio of automation equipment, warehouse execution system software, services and support, our solutions give businesses a competitive edge in increasingly complex commerce and fulfillment environments This position will be responsible for implementing, monitoring, and controlling project controls scheduling tools and Earned Value Management processes used to measure, forecast, and track variances on projects and programs. The successful candidate will be assigned to multiple projects and project teams within the organization. This position reports to the DAA – Army Team Leader and will have responsibility for ensuring execution and compliance of contract requirements as well as supporting strategic business initiatives across related programs. This position will focus on executing existing contract requirements focused on AGT 1500 new engine build program, integrating data, improving existing processes, and implementing new systems for the growing program requirements. Supporting tasks will include championing change based on VOC, driving actions to address non-compliance situations, incorporating Honeywell technology into TIGER, new opportunity development, proposal generation, baseline management, and internal team leadership and customer communications at multiple levels. The successful applicant is accountable for developing and deploying cost effective management operating system, program management processes and methods to achieve improved technical, schedule and cost performance. Key Responsibilities Directly responsible for AGT1500 new engine build program performance – including satisfaction of the contract SOW, on-time delivery of all schedule milestones and on-budget cost performance. Other primary performance metrics are the VOC results of the DAA CBT and outside customer. Establish and maintain appropriate business relationships with assigned customer and program participants and act as management focal point for program related activities. Facilitate team meetings, working groups, governance teams, and other meetings with key stakeholders. Provide technical expertise in planning, execution, and leadership of program, projects, and initiatives across all non-development program logistics and technical support requirements. Identify and assess new project requirements against existing priorities and workload to prioritize and shape new improvement projects. Control program scope, baseline changes, and compliance during execution of services and support of assigned projects. Maintain excellent relationships with all levels of the matrix organization to manage inter-and cross-program dependencies and conflicts. Ensure appropriate resolution of VOC issues, including customer service requests and customer quality/reliability issues in conjunction with Customer Quality. Support the successful integration of technology road map for future related contract requirements. Drive compliance to the AGT1500 new engine build program requirements and metrics for data collection & integration, inventory management, kitting and CDRL milestones. Apply best practices for operational excellence across all contract requirements and initiatives. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Business 8+ years of Engineering, Sales or Business/ Program Management experience WE VALUE Masters Degree or MBA preferred Experience leading complex engineering development projects Demonstrated experience and success in a matrix environment Strong customer relationship skills Ability to think strategically while tactically setting goals and tasks scope Ability to execute to plans while effectively managing risks and opportunities Solid knowledge of Earned Value Management Scheduling including resource-loading and critical path analysis Strong communication (oral and written) and executive presentation skills The ability to grow, mentor and lead a team of program managers as the business grows Lead cross functional collaboration, communicate & influence Additional Information JOB ID: req373832 Category: Business Management Location: 11100 North Oracle Road,Tucson,Arizona,85737-9588,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. UOP, a Honeywell company headquartered in Des Plaines, Illinois, is a leading international licensor of processing technology and supplier of engineering services, catalysts and adsorbents, equipment, specialty materials and digital solutions for the global refining, gas processing and petrochemical industries. With more than a century of leadership in hydrocarbon processing technologies, UOP has led six revolutions in technology that transformed our industry. For more information visit www.uop.com. Join a team of highly skilled Engineers that promotes a great culture for learning and technical growth... as a Sr Program Specialist, join a rapidly growing company and develop your career! Honeywell International is a $40 billion diversified Fortune 100 leader with more than 131,000 employees in 100 countries around the world. We invent and manufacture technologies that address some of the world’s toughest challenges linked to global macro trends like energy efficiency, clean energy generation, safety and security, globalization and customer productivity. We are building a world that’s safer and more secure, more comfortable and energy efficient, more innovative and productive. For more information, please visit Honeywell.com or follow us @HoneywellNow.com. UOP is the recognized leader in developing and licensing process technology used by refiners and petrochemicals producers to make gasoline, diesel, jet fuel and the building blocks for plastic and other products. It also develops and sells catalysts, adsorbents, equipment, process plants and technical services. Honeywell is also a leader in natural gas treating technologies, and develops and manufactures catalysts, adsorbents, equipment and process plants and provides technical and consultative services to the oil and gas industry. UOP is pioneering technology to get plastics from coal and natural gas, and to get more valuable products out of every barrel of oil. UOP has also developed technology to produce real fuels, including Honeywell Green Diesel™ and Honeywell Green Jet Fuel™, from renewable energy sources. We have a current opening for a Sr Program Specialist. It is the responsibility of a program specialist to execute projects by planning, organizing and controlling all elements of the project from sales turnover to plant start up. The program specialist has to effectively work in collaboration with all functional groups within UOP, vendors and customer representatives to ensure that all project requirements are met as laid out in the contract. A program specialist is responsible for managing customer relationship as well as coaching and guiding project execution team. Flexibility in 10% domestic and international travel when required The accountabilities of the project manager include, but is not limited to: Review project deliverables internally and coordinate issuance to customer Verify the fulfillment of contract requirements Communicate and ensure the incorporation of customer specifications Develop & manage project schedules based on equipment deliveries and manpower allocations Obtain an as-sold budget from contract/sales and manage project financials in detail Prepare and issue budget updates based on contract changes & manage change with customer Ensure communication of project changes to the project team Review and approve vendor invoices for payment & manage vendor deliverables Ensure distribution of vendor drawings and customer site information. Ensure that all structure, piping, equipment, valves, and instrumentation are procured based on schedule and specification. Ensure all equipment is reviewed, approved and distributed by or to the project team. Coordinate communication with customer throughout the project life-cycle Provide monthly progress reports and financial updates on assigned projects Meet project schedule, budget and quality requirements as defined in performance metrics. Coordinate project activities w/in SAP working closely with Project Controls and Finance YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor of Science in Chemical, Civil, Mechanical Engineering or Electrical Engineering or an equivalent of 10 years of experience Minimum 5 years’ experience in a project or design engineering role focused on mechanical equipment or equipment systems. WE VALUE Experience in petroleum refining, petrochemical and/or gas processing industries preferred PMP Certification and/or PE preferred Proficiency with MS Office applications is required. Familiarity and experience with site construction management. Experience with gas processing packaged plants is a plus. Strong oral and written communications skills. Ability to work effectively within a team based environment. Project Engineering experience with an EPC contractor/ Strong multi-tasking skills, analytical skills, project delivery & financial skills Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181723 Category: Business Management Location: 7130 S. Lewis, Suite 500,Tulsa,Oklahoma,74136-5427,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Honeywell Process Solutions is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. A leader in digitization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. Use your project and organizational skills to be responsible for management of various business projects that drive revenue, increase productivity and improve processes. These projects span across multiple areas and businesses. You will be in a visible position and will require direct interaction with peers and leaders across all these groups. Your projects will vary depending on the organization being supported and therefore requires a vast knowledge across various business practices. Key Responsibilities Ensure projects are on or ahead of schedule Review all job contract documents Implement and monitor project schedules Maintain project meeting minutes and distribution Report project progress to the Project Manager Evaluate subcontractor performance Assemble project closeout documents and warranties Facilitate flow of paperwork YOU MUST HAVE Associates degree in Engineering, Business, Finance WE VALUE 3+ years of project management or project engineering experience Expertise with Microsoft Office including Excel, Access and SharePoint. Knowledge of IT and financial systems preferred (Sales Force, SAP, etc.). Strong written and oral communication skills, particularly in cross-functional collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation Ability to work on multiple projects and effectively manage priorities Improving performance, meeting commitments, and getting result Exceeding internal and external customer expectation Project Management certification (PMP) preferred Effective communication skills Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182307 Category: Business Management Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. At Honeywell Aerospace Advanced Connected Sustainability Technologies (ACST), our outstanding team of scientists, engineers, and professionals develop groundbreaking technology by applying their expertise in complex hardware and software control systems, atomic physics, ultra-high vacuum environments, cryogenics, cyber security, and more. Honeywell’s ACST team is seeking a Sr. Project Management Specialist for our Golden Valley, MN, locations. Are you ready to help us make the future? Your Role Will Include Work with Program Management Office, Project Managers and Leadership Team to support program and team objectives Primary focus on internal cost, schedule and risk management of Program Management Office initiatives across multiple sites Motivate and support the team to drive positive culture. Lead by example Collaborate with other disciplines to resolve complex and unforeseen problems Accountable for Contract deliverables and performance Adapt working methods when unforeseen problems arise, or milestones change Report Project progress to the Senior Leadership Interfacing to Shared Services on issues relevant to the Projects Mitigate risks identified by Projects Lead or support proposal management and Project baseline control You Must Have Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business, or Finance 5+ years’ experience in project management U.S. Citizenship to obtain and maintain government security clearance WE VALUE Expertise with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel) and financial systems (Sales Force, SAP, etc.). Proactive and resourceful self-starter, with ability to multi-task Master’s degree and Project Management certification (PMP) preferred Ability to work in ambiguous situations Exceeding customer expectations ACST2022 Additional Information JOB ID: req377663 Category: Business Management Location: 1985 Douglas Drive North, Suite Corp ACST,Golden Valley,Minnesota,55422,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Honeywell Intelligrated (IGS) designs, manufactures, integrates and installs complete intelligent automated material handling solutions that drive fulfillment productivity for retailers, manufacturers and logistics providers around the world. By drawing on an ever-expanding portfolio and deep industry expertise, we provide best-fit, scalable solutions to give businesses a competitive edge and optimize and manage their entire fulfillment processes, from receiving to shipping — and everything in between. Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. Advanced Materials is a global supplier of fluorine products, fine chemicals, additives, metals, films and fibers for products including pharmaceuticals, refrigeration, semiconductors and military protection. Advanced Materials is making the world safer, cleaner and enabling the modernization of a growing middle class by enhancing our customer offerings through a differentiated portfolio of chemistries, materials, value-added solutions and superior customer service. Our mission is to attract, retain and develop diverse and highly motivated, entrepreneurial employees striving to flawlessly deliver superior value to our customers every day. This position leads the Geismar site Quality Team, including local manufacturing and all global manufacturing, tollers, support teams and distribution centers. Position ensures compliance to internal process/product specifications, customer specifications and Honeywell policies. This position defines, deploys, and assess effective implementation of ISO-9000:2015 and IATF16494:2016 Quality Management Systems. The ideal candidate is well-versed in all elements of Quality, such as: Problem Solving, Process & Product Controls, Measurement Systems, Lean Manufacturing, and varied quality concepts in industries. The candidate must make data-based decisions using industry experience. Key Responsibilities Responsibilities include but not limited to: Senior Quality Manager is responsible for the overall Quality of products of the Geismar plant and its associated support sites, and to support these requirements for other HON plants in other regions as required. Manages, improves, and expands the Quality Management Systems internally and externally with key suppliers/tollers per an established plan and schedule. Includes adherence to Automotive Customer Specific Requirements where applicable. Leads a group of engineers and technicians assigned to the Quality Organization. Develops and executes measurement systems and manages HON laboratory operations. Works closely with the AM/PMT Quality Organization, Site Operations, Site Engineering, and all associated support teams. Ensures follow up for the manager’s and direct reports standard work and the use of quality tools and systems “Plan, Do, Check, Act” to meet established Goals and Objectives. Monitors, complies, reports, communicates, and escalates requirements for the internal audit program and work close with key internal, Customer and Supplier stakeholders. Communicate and escalate key issues that are out of standard in a timely manner. Maintains Site Quality Management and Regulatory Certifications and increase customer achievements through clear objectives and follow up. Takes ownership for SCARs, Customer corrective actions via the 8D tool, and close open customer cases per agreed time schedules. Assists other departments in managing First Pass Quality and internal process rejections. Leads activities with department managers to eliminate internal and external quality defects. Improves quality management and data collection systems. Ensures the plant progresses to use more quality tools such as SPC, SQC and proactive tools to maintain process control. Manages continuous improvement via Kaizen Events, Six Sigma Projects, Honeywell Accelerator, Quality Improvement Teams, and Initiatives, PFMEA, Control Plans, and Work Instructions. Be an organizational leader championing Safety, Quality, Delivery, and Cost Management. Actively involved in Annual Operating Plan (AOP), Strategic Plan (STRAP), Monthly Operating Review (MOR), Sales, Inventory, and Operations Plan (SIOP), and Management Resource. Reviewing (MRR) activities for the Quality function. Support other tasks and assignments, as appropriate YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's Degree in a Science 6 years of Quality Management Experience with Customer Interface, Supplier Interface and Internal/External Auditors. Must have experience in ISO9001:2015 systems. WE VALUE Prior Quality Management experience in Chemical Processing. Experience with the IATF16949:2016 standard and managing Automotive customer relationships. Demonstrated leadership skills as a team player, driving value-added results and establishing credibility throughout the organization and with suppliers and customers required. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Global experience in an International/Global company preferred. AM202020 Additional Information JOB ID: HRD163995 Category: Integrated Supply Chain Location: 5525 Hwy 3115,Geismar,Louisiana,70734,United States Exempt Due to US export control laws, must be a US citizen, permanent resident or have protected status. Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Of Duties Participates or leads teams to provide quality input for the development, manufacture, procurement, and acceptance of a variety of products and assemblies Develops methods and writes detailed instructions for inspection processes Coordinates the design of product acceptance equipment and the ordering of testers, gages, and equipment to support product acceptance Provides technical assistance to inspection areas Develops and monitors quality metrics, levels, and trends Analyzes and makes recommendations regarding product discrepancies Evaluates opportunities for defect prevention and implements specific and preventative corrective actions Develops test procedures and performs evaluation tests, capability studies, quality audits, data reviews, and other engineering evaluations utilizing Six Sigma methodology Interacts with customers, suppliers, designers, and others to assist in resolving design, development, production, and acceptance issues Provides technical consultation to management and others and leads technical project teams Conducts activities in a safe and healthy manner and works in accordance with established ES&H requirements to ensure the protection of associates, the public, and the environment. Takes actions necessary to stop work when an unsafe condition or action is identified. Every associate has the right and responsibility to stop work when unsafe conditions or actions are identified Mentoring of other engineers and associated staff members You Must Have U.S. citizenship to obtain and maintain US Dept of Energy Q-level security clearance. Bachelor of Science degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineer, or related engineering discipline from an ABET accredited institution/program is required. At least six years’ experience in a manufacturing, production or quality engineering role We Value Existing DOE Q-Clearance desirable Ability to analyze engineering drawings and specifications to develop effective acceptance processes and improve existing processes. Demonstrated ability to lead quality improvement projects. Familiarity with Six Sigma tools and methodology; Six Sigma certification preferred. Effective verbal, written, and presentation skills. Ability to work effectively in a team environment and to influence others to accomplish complex tasks and solve complex technical problems. Ability and willingness to drive change and challenge / improve existing processes. Demonstrated project management/leadership skills; ability to evaluate situations, determine corrective measures, plan and lead other employees and suppliers to execute plans to meet customer deliverables FMT2021 Additional Information JOB ID: req382448 Category: Engineering Location: 14520 Botts Road,Kansas City,Missouri,64147,United States Exempt Must have or be eligible for a security clearance due to contractual requirements. Honeywell Process Solutions is a pioneer in automation control, instrumentation and services for the oil and gas; refining; energy; pulp and paper; industrial power generation; chemicals and petrochemicals; biofuels; life sciences; and metals, minerals, and mining industries. A leader in digitization, Honeywell delivers software and services that help customers overcome competitive pressures and uncertain market conditions to achieve game-changing business outcomes. Honeywell’s comprehensive portfolio in process control, monitoring, and safety systems and instrumentation provides optimized operations and maintenance efficiencies to meet diverse automation needs. You Will Be One Of Driving Forces For Honeywell Achieving Dominant Market Position In Life Sciences Markets, Encompassing We are recruiting for a Business Development Representative, who drives sales and business development, identifying and generating opportunities for customers in the Life Sciences markets. You will foster client satisfaction. You will champion the Honeywell value proposition in the both the external marketplace as well as the internal Honeywell organization. You will identify and articulate the “Why Honeywell”. Pharmaceutical Chemical API Fill/Finish Biologics Cell & Gene Therapy Medical Devices Nutraceuticals Food & Beverage Develop customer relationships through coordinating and/or attending trade shows, seminars, etc. You will facilitate the education of clients on Honeywell products through technical presentations. You will maintain, and provide reports and opportunity status using our customer relationship management system SFDC. You will analyze competitive intelligence and market trends. This specialist should have significant domain knowledge of batch automation and validation of automation systems in Life Sciences manufacturing facilities. You should also be able to communicate as sell the value of integrating other information systems into the automation infrastructure to leverage additional sales of MES systems, optimization, building management systems (BMS), quality management systems (QMS), cyber security, and reporting software. Drive business growth by discovering new opportunities, and customers Deliver value by forging new strategic relationships with new clients, EPC’s, System Integrators and OEM’s Grow opportunity pipeline and move opportunities through pipeline Expected overnight travel 25% monthly (additional travel may be required) YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor's degree 5+ years-experience in business/sales in preferred focus on biotech applications Solid understanding of regulatory compliance in the batch industry as it relates to the basics of computer validation and the operational aspect of 21CFR Part 11 Understanding of the validation V-model and the impact of project execution Experience with Business Development Excellent team and communication skills Self-starter, who thrives in an ever-evolving environment An ability to influence across a matrixed organization An ability to exercise independent judgment An ability to influence customers, while maintaining healthy relationships
