Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Honeywell is charging into the Industrial IoT revolution with the establishment of Honeywell Connected Enterprise (HCE), building on our heritage of invention and deep, on-the-ground industry expertise. HCE is the leading industrial disruptor, building and connecting software solutions to streamline and centralize the assets, people and processes that help our customers make smarter, more accurate business decisions. Moving at the speed of software, we are creating, innovating and delivering solutions fast, challenging the way things have always been done, piloting new ways for all of us to work, and expecting our successes to set new standards for our customers and for Honeywell. We are looking for an experienced Sr. Salesforce Administrator who will play a critical role in optimizing, supporting, and expanding our go-to-market initiatives and significant digital transformation programs. The incumbent will play significant role in executing Salesforce and other sales tech initiatives that span across multiple areas and businesses. You will be in a visible position and will require direct interaction with peers and leaders across all these groups. You will play key role in ensuring quality requirements are produced and program deliverables are met on time and within budget. The right person for the job will apply their project management skills with business understanding in solving real-world problems faced by our company and finding opportunities for improvement. This is a Techno-Functional position with both IT & Business aspects. Job Responsibilities Execute various digital transformation projects within the Sales & Commercial Excellence domains Partner with leadership and stakeholders across multiple functions to deploy new Salesforce functionality, and continuously improve business processes Provide day to day administrative support for Salesforce and 3rd party apps in the Salesforce ecosystem Create data visualization dashboards and effective reporting to gain insights and drive actions Lead cross-functional implementation teams, build project plans, establish communication cadences, and manage deployments through to completion Work with business contacts to understand, validate, and translate business requirements into technical specifications Perform impact analysis for change requests and recommend a technical solution to meet business requirements Identify and take action to mitigate potential risks and issues and make recommendations to management when escalation is required Conduct testing and training for new systems, processes, and features as they launch Develop and maintain a productive working relationship with project sponsors, customers, vendors and other key stakeholders YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s degree Salesforce Administration Certification 3+ years of experience in managing Salesforce CRM, and other Commercial and Sales technology 3+ years of experience designing, developing and deploying Salesforce solutions; experience with configuring Salesforce and integrating Salesforce with other apps (using validation rules, workflow, APIs, Apex coding, data loaders, and other technologies) WE VALUE Strong knowledge of Salesforce platform architecture, apps, and datasets Progressive project management experience in technology implementation and delivery Proven experience as a self-starter in an enterprise environment Able to handle multiple projects at a time and effectively manage priorities Highly effective and demonstrates analytical and problem-solving skills Strong organizational and presentation skills Understanding of key project management practices with strong business acumen and customer focus; Experience with a PPM tool is a plus Consistently makes timely decisions even in the face of complexity, balancing systematic analysis with decisiveness Conveys information with clarity and directness, ensuring the message is understood across diverse, global teams Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182018 Category: Sales Excellence and Support Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Exempt Sales (GLOBAL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

The future is what you make it! We are looking for a passionate, self-driven, ambitious, and skilled individual to join our Performance Materials and Technologies (PMT) Finance Analytics & Systems organization as a Sr. SAP Functional Analytics Professional in Houston, TX. or Des Plaines, IL As a critical member of this $10 Billion organization, you will gain tremendous visibility to leaders by playing a key role in the development and deployment of the PMT EDW Data platform. Gaining a solid technical understanding of the ERPs, BW Reporting, and peripheral systems (e.g., CRMs) of the organization will also give you the opportunity to lead impactful process improvement and change management projects. You will also be asked to participate in key strategic sessions to help shape the Digital Transformation roadmap: your proactiveness in helping us make the right strategic decisions will be expected. This position will directly partner with the Finance Digitization team, the IT Center of Expertise (CoE), PMT Finance and senior business leadership at the PMT level. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Proactively acquire an understanding, and knowledge, of the multiple systems utilized across the Honeywell enterprise, with focus on PMT. Objective is to become a well-known advisor, who can help customers, peers, and leaders when a trusted expert is needed. Works with communities and finance teams to increase efficiencies and lead special projects to assist in improving access to financial data. Analyzes the support needed by the users and determines if the issue can be resolved by the support or a technical team Perform finance data mining to support interdepartmental analytics and to improve operational efficiency Serves as a liaison between Finance and IT Proactively identify material reporting and processes that can be simplified, automated, optimized, decommissioned, or transformed. Identify and share data analysis strategies and anticipate future trends Understand business hierarchies and Master Data elements to work closely with and influence the Data Management team as new capabilities are developed. Participate in high visibility ad-hoc projects and requests involving Analytics, system consolidations, or financial reporting needs. Direct, compelling, and professional communication with clarity at all levels. Facilitates a system test prior to handover to business testing (UAT) Coordinate end user testing for each sprint deliverable as required (UAT) Ensures deliverables have been approved by business / leadership Communicates progress regularly to business stakeholders MUST HAVE • Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Business Administration, IT or Accounting • 4+ years of Hands on SAP Experience WE VALUE Experience gathering requirements and designing data systems/analytical solutions to meet stakeholder needs Advanced Microsoft Excel skills Good technical knowledge of finance systems Experience with large scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using Snowflake or HANA Exceptional analytical skills (linking results to drivers) Self-motivated, results-oriented, and assertive individual Good communication and influencing skills

The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell is not just about developing cool things. That is why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Avionics industry is entering into an exciting new age of Urban Air Mobility (UAM) and Autonomous Flight. Be part of a team that will lead the way in this market by developing new compact and lightweight Next Generation Traffic and Surveillance avionics that will be used on a wide variety of aircraft platforms, from Air Transport and Business Jets to Urban Air Mobility (UAM)/Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS). You will help create breakthrough innovations that will ensure Honeywell’s leadership position. You will be responsible for the design, development and integration of highly complex software functions and contribute to developing the software that handles the Input/output processing and/or Air Traffic surveillance functions. You will be involved with the complete Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) including initial requirements, coding, integration, testing and certification. This position will be based at our Phoenix, Arizona facility- Relocation available for the right candidate! KEY RESPONSIBILITIES • Designing, developing, and integrating software for new product development. • Providing support for the software on legacy airborne surveillance products. • Requirements and design. • Software architecture and coding. • Integration, Testing, Certification. • Customer Support. • Analytical skills & software development skills. YOU MUST HAVE • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Science. • 5+ years of embedded software engineering experience. • Must be a U.S. citizen due to export control regulations. WE VALUE • 2+ years of experience working with a Traffic Collision Avoidance System (TCAS), Transponder or Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast (ADS-B) systems. • Experience with Input/output processing for A429 and Ethernet interfaces. • Experience and knowledge of airborne surveillance functions: TCAS, Transponder, ADS-B, Distance Measuring Equipment (DME), Universal Access Transceiver (UAT). • Experience with the Embedded Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) per DO-178C. • Knowledge of software configuration and change management practices with IBM Rational Dynamic Object-Oriented Requirements System (DOORS) and Atlassian tools. • Embedded software engineering experience in avionics. • Experience with Agile development processes. • Experience with SOC and multi-core processors. • Diverse and global teaming and collaboration. • Effective communicator. • Wide degree of creativity and latitude. • Business oriented approach to software development. • Ability to code in multiple languages.

You will be responsible for the design, development and integration of highly complex software functions and contribute to developing the software that handles the Input/output processing and/or Air Traffic surveillance functions. You will be involved with the complete Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) including initial requirements, coding, integration, testing and certification. This position will be based at our Phoenix, Arizona facility- Relocation available for the right candidate! KEY RESPONSIBILITIES • Designing, developing, and integrating software for new product development. • Providing support for the software on legacy airborne surveillance products. • Requirements and design. • Software architecture and coding. • Integration, Testing, Certification. • Customer Support. • Analytical skills & software development skills. YOU MUST HAVE • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or Computer Science. • 5+ years of embedded software engineering experience. • Must be a U.S. citizen due to export control regulations. WE VALUE • 2+ years of experience working with a Traffic Collision Avoidance System (TCAS), Transponder or Automatic Dependent Surveillance-Broadcast (ADS-B) systems. • Experience with Input/Output processing for A429 and Ethernet interfaces. • Experience and knowledge of airborne surveillance functions: TCAS, Transponder, ADS-B, Distance Measuring Equipment (DME), Universal Access Transceiver (UAT). • Experience with the Embedded Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) per DO-178C. • Knowledge of software configuration and change management practices with IBM Rational Dynamic Object-Oriented Requirements System (DOORS) and Atlassian tools. • Embedded software engineering experience in avionics. • Experience with Agile development processes. • Experience with SOC and multi-core processors. • Diverse and global teaming and collaboration. • Effective communicator. • Wide degree of creativity and latitude. • Business oriented approach to software development. • Ability to code in multiple languages.

The Working Capital Leader supports the $4B HPS P&L and will be responsible for leading efforts to maximize Working Capital efficiency across Honeywell Process Solutions (HPS). These responsibilities include but are not limited to development of monthly and quarterly financial forecasts, variance analysis, process improvement, creation of standard work, and best practice sharing. In addition, this position will play a critical role in the day-to-day execution of the Management Operating System (MOS) and provide the HPS leadership team with meaningful performance analysis, insights, and recommendations. This position will report directly to the VP & CFO of HPS and will be based out of the Houston, TX– with frequent exposure to both HPS and Performance Materials and Technologies (PMT) leadership teams. Key Responsibilities Business Unit Level Global Working Capital leadership, capital efficiency strategies and influence and oversight - driving improvement initiatives and robust analysis in Customer to Cash Cycles (Account Receivables), Past Dues, Inventory, Unbilled, Payables, and Advances. Cross-functional coordination and project management that includes developing both long-term and daily execution timelines, driving outstanding actions / deliverables and managing effective communication and executive influence on business unit leadership. Enhance cash flow forecasting process and reporting mechanisms to improve accuracy. Lead cash digitization efforts and implementing supporting tools to drive accountability. Lead efforts to identify, quantify and validate opportunities to improve business unit level working capital processes and results. Develop and innovate sustainable solutions and action plans to ensure realization of identified working capital opportunities. Conceptualize and deploy value-added reporting and metrics for all components of Working Capital. Driving sustained and continuous improvement in business unit Working Capital Turns metric. YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree in Business / Finance. 4+ years of finance/business experience. WE VALUE Solution-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving and skills Passion for excellence and drive to meet commitments/deadlines Strong understanding of Supply Chain, Accounts Receivable, and Accounts Payable “Hands on” working knowledge of data analytics using business warehouse, Excel, etc Executive communication and cross organizational influencing skills useful in transformational initiatives Prior Lean Six Sigma experience and a continuous improvement mindset Demonstrated track record of successful project management execution Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal) Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181541 Category: Finance Location: 2101 CityWest Blvd,Houston,Texas,77042,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Of Duties Supports the Development and Execution Sourcing Strategies: Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Of Duties Supports the Development and Execution Sourcing Strategies: Assist in the development and implementation of commodity strategies for various production materials such as Machine Parts, Cables, Connectors, Plastics, and various other production commodities Analyzes key Sourcing KPI’s, spend data, and vendor performance scores Documents and prepares internal sourcing requirements for commodities and programs Provides the evaluation of vendor quotations utilizing appropriate negotiation and sourcing analysis techniques and implementation of proper contracts with emphasis on quality, delivery, total cost, and service necessary to meet requirements Leads the development of part number grouping and sub-commodity strategy analysis Manages, nurtures, and supports supplier relationships; designs and implements supplier improvement initiatives and resolves critical supplier issues Develops RFI's/RFP's and Actively Negotiates and Maintains Contracts: Leads or supports negotiations and management of long-term agreements to leverage buying position, for effect cost management in accordance with the KCNSC prime contract executive orders, public law, NNSA approved procedures, FAR/DEAR, and appropriate supply chain management principles Tracks, monitors, and documents and contractual changes Supports use of strategic sourcing tools such as Spend Analysis and Supplier Performance Management (SPM) Evaluate data and assist management team in identifying and managing key suppliers Works with Sourcing Leaders to identify, qualify, and maintain optimum supply base capability and capacity Develops and conducts RFQ’s, RFP’s using both traditional and web-based platforms Actively identifies new sources of supply Transitional leader from Sourcing to Procurement Responsible for the hand-off of contracts, vendors, and commodities from Sourcing to Procurement Ensures sourcing personnel are up to speed on new contractual requirements You Must Have US citizenship to obtain and maintain US Dept of Energy security clearance Bachelor’s degree from an accredited program Five or more year’s progressive experience in a strategic sourcing, procurement or manufacturing environment with consistent achievement of high-quality results on assigned responsibilities or equivalent related experience We Value Demonstrated capacity to run advanced negotiations and RFP's Knowledge or experience in sourcing fundamentals Highly proficient technical skills in MS Office Suite and knowledge of E-Procurement Applications desired Knowledge of government contracting requirements including a working understanding of the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) Advanced degree, ISM, CPSM certification, or Six Sigma Green Belt certification Superior computer skills specifically in Excel, PowerPoint, MicroStrategy, Power BI, etc FMT2021 Remote roles can be located in any of the states where Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies, LLC is authorized to do business. ** Some roles, however, may have to be co-located with their teams in certain locations. Honeywell Federal Manufacturing is authorized to do business in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies is registered, you will not be eligible for employment. Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. This state-of-the-art engineering, manufacturing and sourcing facility produces a wide array of intricate components to deliver trusted national security products and government services primarily for the NNSA. Honeywell FM&T’s culture of integrity, commitment and continuous improvement enables them to deliver responsive, collaborative, and innovative management and technology services and products that translate into cutting edge solutions to complex national security issues. ***This position will be in Kansas City, MO*** Summary Of Duties Supports the Development and Execution Sourcing Strategies: Assist in the development and implementation of commodity strategies for various production materials such as Machine Parts, Cables, Connectors, Plastics, and various other production commodities Analyzes key Sourcing KPI’s, spend data, and vendor performance scores Documents and prepares internal sourcing requirements for commodities and programs Provides the evaluation of vendor quotations utilizing appropriate negotiation and sourcing analysis techniques and implementation of proper contracts with emphasis on quality, delivery, total cost, and service necessary to meet requirements Leads the development of part number grouping and sub-commodity strategy analysis Manages, nurtures, and supports supplier relationships; designs and implements supplier improvement initiatives and resolves critical supplier issues Develops RFI's/RFP's and Actively Negotiates and Maintains Contracts: Leads or supports negotiations and management of long-term agreements to leverage buying position, for effect cost management in accordance with the KCNSC prime contract executive orders, public law, NNSA approved procedures, FAR/DEAR, and appropriate supply chain management principles Tracks, monitors, and documents and contractual changes Supports use of strategic sourcing tools such as Spend Analysis and Supplier Performance Management (SPM) Evaluate data and assist management team in identifying and managing key suppliers Works with Sourcing Leaders to identify, qualify, and maintain optimum supply base capability and capacity Develops and conducts RFQ’s, RFP’s using both traditional and web-based platforms Actively identifies new sources of supply Transitional leader from Sourcing to Procurement Responsible for the hand-off of contracts, vendors, and commodities from Sourcing to Procurement Ensures sourcing personnel are up to speed on new contractual requirements You Must Have US citizenship to obtain and maintain US Dept of Energy security clearance Bachelor’s degree from an accredited program Five or more year’s progressive experience in a strategic sourcing, procurement or manufacturing environment with consistent achievement of high-quality results on assigned responsibilities or equivalent related experience We Value Demonstrated capacity to run advanced negotiations and RFP's Knowledge or experience in sourcing fundamentals Highly proficient technical skills in MS Office Suite and knowledge of E-Procurement Applications desired Knowledge of government contracting requirements including a working understanding of the Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR) Advanced degree, ISM, CPSM certification, or Six Sigma Green Belt certification Superior computer skills specifically in Excel, PowerPoint, MicroStrategy, Power BI, etc FMT2021 Remote roles can be located in any of the states where Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies, LLC is authorized to do business. ** Some roles, however, may have to be co-located with their teams in certain locations. Honeywell Federal Manufacturing is authorized to do business in many, but not all, states. If you are not located in or able to work from a state where Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies is registered, you will not be eligible for employment. Honeywell Building Technologies HBL Strategy & M&A Manager Intern The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Honeywell has an outstanding track record of innovation and financial success. In the last 15 years, we consistently outperformed our peers and the broader market by a significant margin and are proud to be both a Fortune 100 company and listed on the NASDAQ 100 index. Honeywell Building Technologies (HBT) is fast growing, highly profitable and one of Honeywell’s four Strategic Business Groups (SBG) with revenues of ~$5.5B. HBT develops and markets Connected Smart Building solutions using Industrial IOT technologies and business models that deliver compelling outcomes for commercial building owners, occupiers and managers, from reducing operating costs and improving sustainability, to increasing employee and business productivity, and enabling more efficient and effective safety and security. Your time working within the HBT team could be spent in one or more of the following ways: - Adjacent market analysis supporting inorganic business development (M&A Track) Strategy development for an outcome-based breakthrough growth initiative (BTI Track) New product business case & customer needs analysis (Offering Management track) We live by the ‘teach and learn’ mantra. We value our more seasoned team members because they bring additional value using their years of experience to guide the next generation. We also value you, our young talent. We'll assign you a mentor on day one so you can take full advantage of this amazing learning opportunity. We want you to finish your internship with a much greater understanding of both strategy, execution and Honeywell. We know you'll be a better strategist by the time this internship ends! This internship is part of the Honeywell Business Leadership (HBL) program within HBT that offers career acceleration for select candidates. It is based in Atlanta, GA and reports to the Chief Strategy Officer, HBT. Must Have Qualifications & Experience Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, economics, or engineering Currently studying for an MBA at a top tier institution 3-4 years of experience in an engineering, marketing or operations role within a technology company, ideally software. Alternatively, 3-4 years within a top tier consultancy (pre-MBA) Track record of successful strategy development and execution within role (pre-MBA) Demonstrable role progression with at least one significant promotion (pre-MBA) Attributes We Value Excellent analytical, strategic thinking & synthesis skills Outstanding “people skills” and ability to influence stakeholders and drive alignment Experience with and ability to understand new technologies, particularly software enabled services, and how to leverage technology to drive innovative strategies and business models Proven experience working on multiple, complex projects with changing priorities Outstanding communication skills with ability to communicate and facilitate effectively across regional & organizational boundaries International experience and proven ability to work effectively across different cultures Additional Information JOB ID: HRD902170 Category: Business Development Location: 715 Peachtree Street, N.E.,Atlanta,Georgia,30308,United States Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? The Mechanical Structures and Components (MS&C) division of Honeywell Aerospace is responsible for a wide variety of product lines including environmental controls, valves, and actuators. This position would be a part of the Tempe Analysis team who supports these various product lines using state of the art software tools. This team applies its expertise and knowledge to technical projects, finding innovative, cost-effective means to improve products, techniques, procedures, and technologies. Key Responsibilities Structural stress analysis using Ansys and hand calculations Support execution of vibration testing Mechanical component selection and sizing including bearings and seals Creation of technical documentation such as stress reports or part specifications Collaborating with project and design engineering teams Create and present analysis results in Critical Design Reviews Provide cost and workload estimation. Maintain schedule adherence to meet key milestones ENG0830 YOU MUST HAVE 1+ years of demonstrated experience in structural, dynamic, and/or thermal analysis using FEA software (Ansys preferred) 1+ years of experience understanding mechanical engineering principals and the capability to apply sound engineering judgement when presented with incomplete or evolving problem statements or specifications. Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical or Aerospace Engineering Must be a U.S. Citizen due to contractual requirements WE VALUE Self-motivated individuals who consistently take the initiative to get things done, do things before being asked by others or forced to by events Strong technical communication skills. Ability to communicate complex technical ideas in a clear and concise manner Knowledge of bearings and seals is a plus Experience with aerospace mechanical components is a plus MSC2022 Additional Information JOB ID: req369384 Category: Engineering Location: 1300 W Warner Rd.,Tempe,Arizona,85284,United States Exempt Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements. Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.

Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers, who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Intelligrated is a ~$2.5B global business and part of the ~$8B Safety and Productivity Solutions (SPS) Strategic Business Group of Honeywell. Honeywell Intelligrated (IGS) designs, manufactures, integrates and installs complete material handling automation solutions, including conveyor, IntelliSort® sortation, Alvey® palletizers, Honeywell Robotics, automated storage and retrieval systems, and voice- and light-directed picking technologies — all managed by advanced machine controls and our best-in-class Momentum™ warehouse execution system. By drawing on an ever-expanding portfolio and deep industry expertise, we provide best-fit, scalable solutions to help businesses optimize and manage their entire fulfillment processes, from receiving to shipping — and everything in between. Be part of a team that applies its expertise and knowledge to technical projects, finding innovative, cost-effective means to improve products, techniques, procedures, and technologies. You will design and develop new ideas and solutions for new product development as well as current products modification and improvements based on in-service issues and market strategy. You are responsible for design and implementation of mechanical parts, subassemblies and product improvements Key Responsibilities Technical documentation Part definition and support Drawing Component and system analysis Engineering assistance Write specifications Cost estimation 3D modeling YOU MUST HAVE Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or Mechanical Engineering WE VALUE Ability and willingness to obtain EIT Steel design – AISI and AISC specs and standards Bolted and welded connections Anchor bolt design to existing concrete Concrete slab on grade and elevated slabs (1 way, 2 way and composite) International Building Code / ASCE 7-16 Seismic Lateral force Frame and Truss Analysis (classic or computer methods) 2D and 3D structural analysis 3D AutoCAD, StaadPro, Tekla Creating and maintaining computational spreadsheet Additional Information JOB ID: HRD181423 Category: Engineering Location: 7901 Innovation Way,Mason,Ohio,45040,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future? Intelligrated is a ~$2.5B global business and part of the ~$8B Safety and Productivity Solutions (SPS) Strategic Business Group of Honeywell. Honeywell Intelligrated (IGS) designs, manufactures, integrates and installs complete material handling automation solutions, including conveyor, IntelliSort® sortation, Alvey® palletizers, Honeywell Robotics, automated storage and retrieval systems, and voice- and light-directed picking technologies — all managed by advanced machine controls and our best-in-class Momentum™ warehouse execution system. By drawing on an ever-expanding portfolio and deep industry expertise, we provide best-fit, scalable solutions to help businesses optimize and manage their entire fulfillment processes, from receiving to shipping — and everything in between. The Connected Distribution Center from Honeywell Intelligrated is designed to help companies make the digital transformation from manual to automated processes and keep up with the rapidly escalating pace of modern commerce demands. Through the seamless integration of sensors, controls, automation and labor, we’re providing the real-time business intelligence to help our customers make informed business decisions, ensure worker safety, and maximize equipment uptime and lifecycles. From concept and integration to industry-leading lifecycle support services, Honeywell Intelligrated is committed to our customers’ successes — delivering sustained distribution and fulfillment productivity and continual performance improvements through increased flexibility, efficiency and accuracy. We back every project with 24X7 multilingual technical support and access to lifecycle support services through a network of national, regional and local service centers. Honeywell Intelligrated has a Structural/Civil Engineering position available - this position can be located at either Roseville, CA, Mason, OH, St. Louis, MO, or Frederick, MD offices. Intelligrated offers a rewarding career path, competitive compensation and excellent benefits. Our structural engineers perform a variety of vital engineering design and analysis tasks involving the planning, configuring and execution of conveyor system projects for large distribution centers. The Structural Engineering team is responsible for design and analysis of standard and custom equipment supports, load path analysis and coordination with roof designers, connections to buildings and preparation of building permit submittals. You will manage Supplier Performance to support your commodity/category and/or region and ensure supply continuity. You will be managing several projects in dynamic environment. You will ensure compliance with company business policies and procedures, Export /Import regulations. The Sustainable Finance Manager is part of a team of commercial finance professionals that support financial decisions for the newly created Sustainable Technology Solutions (STS) business within UOP. The STS business unit is expected to become the leading sustainability solutions provider via focus on providing sustainable energy, renewable fuels and plastic waste conversion solutions and expects significant growth in the next 2-5 years ($700m+). You will play a part to drive finance initiatives and decision support through budgeting, forecasting, financial analysis and reporting. You will also play important part helping drive STS at UOP through support of identify trends, new technology development, and M&A activities. Make an impact on management reporting, budgeting, forecasting and financial analysis. Make an impact on financial performance of the business. Execute strategies to achieve committed performance. The position reports directly to the CFO of the STS business and matrix reports to the Renewable Fuels Business Leader. The position will be located in Des Plaines, Illinois with a hybrid work arrangement (on-site and remote). Key Responsibilities Perform finance functions to support the business - including broader financial reporting, budget reporting and management, and cost savings actions tracking Be a valued finance leader actively working with the leadership team to achieve desired financial metrics across the organization. Prepare and present Annual Operating Plan (AOP) and 5-Year Strategic Plan (STRAP) summary; operationalize targets into an action-oriented plan Financial modeling of proposed new offers, business models, and go-to-market strategies Develop various financial reporting and analysis, forecasts, budgets, and variance analysis Lead month end close and forecasting processes Ensure proper controls and compliance with GAAP Develop and provide key business metrics, indicators, and financial interpretations Identify pricing opportunities and work with business to execute You Must Have Bachelors degree in Accounting or Finance. 5+ years’ Commercial business experience (i.e. business analysis, financial planning & analysis) We Value Experience in commercial, manufacturing and/or construction finance Financial systems and reporting experience Experience developing forecasts and operating plans Exceptional analytical skills (linking results to drivers) Direct communication with clarity at all levels Demonstrated leadership and influencing skills Self-motivated, results-oriented and assertive individual The ability to make consistent and timely decisions The ability to quickly identify subtle patterns among issues Highly proficient in information technology financial applications particularly SAP, Hyperion. Tableau and Excel financial models and Power-point is highly desired Additional Information JOB ID: HRD182078 Category: Finance Location: 50 E Algonquin Rd,Des Plaines,Illinois,60017-5016,United States Exempt Global (ALL) Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. The Honeywell Enhanced Ground Proximity Warning System (EGPWS) reduces the risk of controlled flight into terrain (CFIT) by providing flight crews with timely, accurate information about terrain and obstacles in the area. The system uses various aircraft inputs and an internal database to predict and warn flight crews of potential conflicts with obstacles or terrain. Additional features include SmartRunway and SmartLanding systems, developed to help flight crews avoid potential runway incursions and excursions As an Systems Engineer for the Multi-Platform EGPWS Enhanced Ground Proximity Warning System (EGPWS) Systems Core Development program within Honeywell’s Aero business, you will contribute to the team as a Systems Engineer and grow and expand your skills on exciting new projects. You will contribute to proposals to address future business opportunities, provide your ideas for problem solving and be part of a product and team that has a positive impact on aviation safety. This position supports long term development programs and breakthrough innovations that are penetrating into all aerospace fields including the burgeoning UAM/UAS markets and Next Gen ATR-BGA-UAM/UAS EGPWS products. Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity THE BUSINESS Honeywell (www.honeywell.com) is a Fortune 100 technology company that delivers industry-specific solutions that include aerospace products and services; control technologies for buildings and industry; and performance materials globally. Our technologies help aircraft, buildings, manufacturing plants, supply chains, and workers become more connected to make our world smarter, safer, and more sustainable. Honeywell Aerospace products and services are found on virtually every commercial, defense and space aircraft in the world. With an unmatched heritage of innovation that spans more than a century, our aim is to solve the greatest challenges CEOs, pilots, operators, passengers, finance, maintenance and cabin crews face -- and transform the way we all fly. We deliver improved fuel-efficiency, more direct and on-time flights, safer and more comfortable travel and better flight planning and traffic management. We do this through one of the industry’s broadest and most advanced portfolios including world-class engines, cockpits, cabin design, wireless connectivity and enterprise performance management services – even for emerging market segments like flying taxies, while providing world-class customer service, repairs and technical support. At Honeywell Aerospace Advanced Connected Sustainability Technologies (ACST), our outstanding team of scientists, engineers, and professionals develop groundbreaking technology by applying their expertise in complex hardware and software control systems, atomic physics, ultra-high vacuum environments, cryogenics, cyber security, and more. THE POSITION Honeywell’s ACST team is seeking a Talent Acquisition Manager for our Broomfield, CO or Golden Valley, MN location. In this role, you will be responsible for partnering with key stakeholders to identify current and future workforce needs, understand upcoming talent gaps and talent needs to develop and implement effective talent acquisition strategy roadmaps to support business goals across multiple locations and states. Key Responsibilities Partnering with HR and business leaders to coordinate with Honeywell’s Recruitment Process Outsourced (RPO) recruiters and talent acquisition COE points of contact to ensure strong pipelining of qualified and diverse candidates for highly technical positions Developing and implementing talent acquisition strategies, tactics, and approaches to ensure niche skillset requisitions are filled in a timely manner Identifying and coordinating partnerships with national laboratories, universities, conferences, and trade organizations Managing short and long cycle talent acquisition approaches and hiring plans Leveraging data and analytics to provide strategic expertise by monitoring and staying abreast of competitive landscape, industry trends, best practices, legal developments, benchmark comparisons, functions as subject matter expert on all business unit recruitment activities Acting as ACST focal with corporate initiatives with University Relations, diversity conferences/initiatives, and other talent demand planning cycles Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree 5+ years of experience in corporate talent acquisition and/or human resources U.S. Citizenship to obtain and maintain government security clearance Preferred Master’s degree in human resources or a business-related field 3+ years of technical and cyber security recruiter or recruitment experience Ability to influence at varying levels across the organization Ability to handle multiple priorities and navigate in a highly matrixed environment Individuals who are self-motivated and able to work with little supervision, who consistently take the initiative to get things done, do things before being asked by others or forced to by events. Join the industry leader to design the next generation of breakthroughs Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges Honeywell is a Fortune 100 company that invents and manufactures technologies to address critical challenges linked to global macrotrends such as safety, security, productivity, global urbanization and energy. With approximately 129,000 employees worldwide, including more than 19,000 engineers and scientists, Honeywell has an unrelenting focus on quality, delivery, value, and technology in everything they make and do. Honeywell has been named a Top 100 Global Innovator for seven years in a row, recognizing the company’s global reach of portfolio and invention influence. In Kansas City, Honeywell Federal Manufacturing & Technologies (FM&T) manages and operates the U.S. Department of Energy/National Nuclear Security Administration’s (NNSA) Kansas City National Security Campus. jobTitle: Test Engineer – Mechanical Design and Structural Analysis
jobDescription: Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization The future is what you make it! When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Are you ready to help us make the future? The incumbent is required to define, coordinate, and perform mechanical design and structural analysis to enable integration/installation of test components and modifications to any of the experimental test aircraft. The candidate is also responsible for the preparation of engineering drawings. Work closely with flight test engineers and technicians to ensure timely completion of flight test projects. Assist instrumentation engineer(s) and technicians in support of flight test activities generally. Drive the development of flight test procedures for numerous test programs. Assist flight operations maintenance staff with tasks. Key Responsibilities Structural design of experimental test systems. Coordination with maintenance and technicians for installation of structural designs. Work closely with Project Engineering to understand design requirements and implement structural designs for experimental test systems. Structural analysis of experimental designs to ensure they meet the load criteria. You Must Have Bachelors or higher degree in Engineering 5+ years of experience in aerospace structural design. (structures DER with DTA would be a plus) Proficiency in structural analysis with both classical methods and finite element analysis (ANSYS or equivalent) Familiarity with airworthiness standards of CFR 14 (specifically Part 23) Proficiency in 3D CAD, (Solidworks, Creo, NX) Must be a US Citizen due to contractual requirements We Value Familiarity with metallic and composite aerospace materials, fasteners, and fabrication methods Experience creating assembly and part drawings, generating work instructions, and writing technical reports Knowledge of aircraft structural/mechanical systems. Flight Test Experience a plus. Strong written and oral communications skills - able to transcend level and functions Strong problem solving skills including leadership experience Ability to adapt rapidly to change and to help lead change efforts Strict adherence to sound engineering standards Technical proficiency with Microsoft Office software Demonstrates work safety with attention to safety of flight issues. Demonstrates an understanding of the impact of tasks/processes on assignments and utilizes schedules to meet commitments. Develops & demonstrates a positive & effective working relationship with all discipline levels. Show respects and listens to input from co-workers &internal/external customers. Demonstrates commitment to providing quality data to customers and keeps all customers well informed of their job status, following through to ensure all aspects of the assignment are met. Willingly shares knowledge and best practices with co-workers. The primary responsibilities will be preparing, coordinating, and executing test facility solutions and tests on actuation systems, start systems, or pneumatic test requests – quality data being the key deliverable to our customers. Additionally, the candidate will support facility and test equipment design and maintenance for a wide variety of MSC/ISC/R&O component and systems test programs/projects. Test Engineers work with a wide variety of stakeholders in all aspects of test facility design and maintenance, test equipment design, configuration and upkeep, test planning, and test execution. The person, under moderate supervision, will leverage their knowledge of engineering processes, discipline, and tools to plan and execute tasks and projects related to the development and certification of Honeywell Mechanical systems and components. Position Responsibilities Design, procure, fabricate and maintain test equipment and facilities in support of repair and overhaul, production and development, qualification test solutions, and the subsequent test execution. Workflow management via the Work Request System (WRS) – includes coordination with all Test Services functions, other Honeywell partners, and outside suppliers. Being a steward of MT facilities and equipment – including developing and executing initiatives designed to maximize the value that Mechanical test offers customers. Support estimates for new tests/programs and new test solutions. Build and leverage a strong network. Have a bias for following, improving, and developing standard processes. Demonstrate a strong mechanical aptitude and a working knowledge of pneumatic controls, actuation and start systems and applications, as well as control and data systems. Communicate effectively with peers, customers, suppliers, and leadership. Demonstrate strong project management skills (plan – execute – escalate). Willing to occasionally work non-standard hours and be on call to support off-shift operations You Must Have Must be US Citizen. As a Honeywell Test Pilot, you will operate a very diverse fleet of highly technical flight test aircraft including: (TurboJet): B757, G550, F900EX, E170, (Turboprop): BE200, PC-12NG, (Pistons): BE36, PA46, SR22T, (Rotorcraft): AW139. Key Responsibilities: • Perform Pilot-in-Command (PIC), duties in one or more assigned aircraft and safely conduct flight test, customer demonstration, and certification flights. • Maintain currency, proficiency, and technical expertise in multiple aircraft types. • Participate in the planning, coordination, and scheduling of tests to be performed on assigned test aircraft and coordinate with engineering teams, flight test engineers and aircraft maintenance personnel, to ensure that the aircraft is properly configured, to perform all test objectives. • Maintain the highest level of safety while developing, leading, and conducting flight test. • Design and supervise avionics and/or propulsion systems flight test, supervise technical staff, and ensure compliance with Federal Aviation Regulations. • Evaluate combined aircraft and product technologies, through analysis, inspection, performance measures, and flight characteristics. • Create, review, and implement strategies and plans, to achieve departmental goals and ensure world-class flight testing and customer support. Must Have: • Bachelor's Degree • FAA Class I Medical Certificate • Airline Transport Pilot Certificate (fixed-wing and/or rotorcraft) • Multi-Engine Land (AMEL), with appropriate Type Rating(s) • Minimum of 2,500 hours total time, 1,000 hours (turbine), 500 hours PIC (turbine time) • Flight Test experience We Value: • Comprehensive knowledge of flight test techniques and test procedures, in a wide range of qualitative and quantitative methods, for the planning, evaluation, and assessment of operational tests for complex test objectives. • Comprehensive knowledge and demonstrated ability to operate and maintain qualification in each assigned aircraft. jobTitle: Working Capital & Fixed Cost Finance Manager
jobDescription: Driving Infinite Possibilities Within A Diversified, Global Organization Working Capital & Fixed Cost Finance Manager The Working Capital Leader supports the $2B SST P&L and will be responsible for leading efforts to maximize Working Capital efficiency across Sensing and Safety Technologies (SST). These responsibilities include but are not limited to the development of monthly and quarterly financial forecasts, variance analysis, process improvement, creation of standard work, and best practice sharing. In addition, this position will play a critical role in the day-to-day execution of the Management Operating System (MOS) and provide the SST leadership team with meaningful performance analysis, insights, and recommendations. Apart from Working Capital, he is also responsible to manage Total Fixed costs for SST. Key Responsibilities Business Unit Level Global Working Capital leadership, capital efficiency strategies, and influence and oversight - driving improvement initiatives and robust analysis in Customer to Cash Cycles (Account Receivables), Past Dues, Inventory, Unbilled, Payables, and Advances. Cross-functional coordination and project management that includes developing both long-term and daily execution timelines, driving outstanding actions/deliverables, and managing effective communication and executive influence on business unit leadership. Enhance cash flow forecasting process and reporting mechanisms to improve accuracy. Drive Fixed cost forecast weekly/Monthly/Quarterly/Yearly and work with cross-functional leaders. Standardize the Fixed MOS. Lead efforts to identify, quantify and validate opportunities to improve business unit-level Fixed cost processes and results. Develop and innovate sustainable solutions and action plans to ensure the realization of identified working capital opportunities & Fixed costs. You Must Have Bachelor’s Degree in Business / Finance. 4+ years of finance/business experience. We Value Solution-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong understanding of Supply Chain, Accounts Receivable, and Accounts Payable Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (both written and verbal) Knowledge of SAP/Oracle, BI data warehouse, Tableau and HFM applications, Hyperion and Excel Ability to understand accounting and financial processes related to the business The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?
